text: 31 - What has been narrated that Islam began as something strange and will return to being strange contains two Hadiths: The First: The Hadith of Ibn Mas'ud (may Allah be pleased with him), and it has two paths: The First Path: Al-A'mash, from Abu Ishaq, from Abu Al-Ahwas, from Abdullah bin Mas'ud (may Allah be pleased with him): 'Indeed, Islam began as something strange and will return to being strange as it began, so glad tidings to the strangers.' It was said: 'And who are the strangers?' He said: 'The ones who displace themselves from the tribes' (1). Imam Ahmad said: This Hadith is Munkar (2). He said another time: Al-A'mash erred in it (3). The Second Path: Muhammad bin Mu'awiyah, from Abu Al-Ahwas, from Abu Ishaq, from Abu Al-Ahwas, from Abdullah bin Mas'ud, similar to it (4). Imam Ahmad said: This is only what they claimed Hafs narrated from Al-A'mash, from Abu Ishaq, and I view that Al-A'mash erred in it. And Abu Al-Ahwas is only a written source from Abu Ishaq; from where does it bear something like this? (5). The Second: The Hadith of Anas (may Allah be pleased with him) similar to it (6).

text: Book of Knowledge 32 - What has been narrated regarding the virtue of becoming learned in the religion contains two Hadiths: The First: The Hadith of Abu Hurayrah (may Allah be pleased with him): 'Two traits do not combine in a hypocrite: Good conduct and understanding (Fiqh) in the religion' (1). Imam Ahmad said: It is not established (2). The Second: The Hadith of Mu'awiyah (may Allah be pleased with him): 'Whomever Allah intends good for, He gives him understanding in the religion' (3). Imam Ahmad said: Yahya bin Sa'id used to say regarding it: Ibn Ajlan. Ibn Ajlan said: Muhammad bin Ka'b told me. Ahmad said: And some of them insert Yazid bin Ziyad between Ibn Ajlan and Muhammad bin Ka'b (4).
foot_note:
1. (1) Narrated by Al-Tirmidhi (2689), he said: Abu Kurayb told us, Khalaf bin Ayyub Al-Amiri told us, from Awf, from Ibn Sirin, from Abu Hurayrah, raised [to the Prophet].
2. 'Al-Du'afa' by Al-Uqayli 2/24, 'Tahdhib Al-Kamal' 8/274.
3. Narrated by Ahmad in 'Al-Musnad' 4/98, he said: Yahya bin Sa'id told us, from Ibn Ajlan, he said: Muhammad bin Ka'b Al-Qurazi told me, he said: I heard Mu'awiyah giving a sermon on this pulpit saying... the Hadith.
4. 'Masa'il Abi Dawud' from Imam Ahmad (2038). I say: However, the text of the Hadith is established; Al-Bukhari narrated it (71) from the Hadith of Mu'awiyah, who said: I heard the Prophet (peace be upon him) say: 'Whomever Allah intends good for, He gives him understanding in the religion.'

text: 33 - What has been narrated regarding the bequest concerning students of knowledge. The Hadith of Abu Sa'id Al-Khudri (may Allah be pleased with him): 'Welcome to the bequest of the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him)' (1). Imam Ahmad said: Allah did not create anything of this; this is the Hadith of Abu Harun from Abu Sa'id (2). 34 - What has been narrated regarding the obligation of seeking knowledge contains two paths from Anas: The First: From Muhammad bin Sirin from him: 'Seeking knowledge is obligatory upon every Muslim' (3). Imam Ahmad said: Nothing is established with us in this chapter (4). He said another time: This Hadith is a lie (5).

Imam Ahmad was amazed by this (4).

text: 36 - Chapter: What has been narrated regarding the description of the bearers of knowledge. The Hadith of Ibrahim bin Abd Al-Rahman Al-Udhri (may Allah be pleased with him): 'This knowledge will be carried by the trustworthy of every generation, expelling from it the distortion of the extremists, the plagiarism of the falsifiers, and the interpretation of the ignorant' (1). It was said to Imam Ahmad: It seems like fabricated speech. He said: No, it is authentic (Sahih). So it was said to him: From whom did you hear it? He said: From more than one person. It was said to him: Who are they? He said: Miskin narrated it to me, except that he says: Ma'an from Al-Qasim bin Abd Al-Rahman. Ahmad said: There is no harm in Ma'an bin Rifa'ah (2).
foot_note:
1. = He said: Nawf lied. Ubayy bin Ka'b told us, he said: I heard the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) say: 'While Moses (peace be upon him) was among his people reminding them of the Days of Allah—and the Days of Allah are His blessings and His trials—he said: I do not know a man on earth better or more knowledgeable than me. He said: So Allah revealed to him: I know best about the good—or with whom it is—indeed, there is a man on earth who is more knowledgeable than you. He said: O Lord, guide me to him. He said: So it was said to him: Take with you a salted fish. For wherever you lose the fish [he will be]. He said: So he and his young man set out until they reached the rock, and it was hidden from him, so he set out and left his young man. The fish writhed in the water and made its way, and the water did not close over it; it became like a tunnel. He said: So his young man said: Should I not catch up with the Prophet of Allah and inform him? He said: But he forgot. {So when they had passed beyond it, he said to his boy, "Bring us our morning meal. We have certainly suffered in this, our journey, much fatigue"} He said: And they did not suffer fatigue until they had passed beyond...' the Hadith.
1. 2. 'Sharaf Ashab Al-Hadith' (29)

text:
37 - What has been reported regarding Testing Trustworthy Narrators
The Hadith of Ibn Abbas, may Allah be pleased with them both: "Do not take knowledge except from one whose testimony you would accept" (1).
Imam Ahmad said: It is not authentic. This Hadith is fabricated (Mawdu') due to Salih bin Hassan. This is a Madani man, abandoned in Hadith (Matruk Al-Hadith) (2).
foot_note:
1. = I say: The priority is to interpret Imam Ahmad's authentication as affirming the correctness of the meaning, or that it is known from the narration of Mu'an; because Mu'an bin Rifa'ah was weakened by more than one scholar; and because Ibrahim bin Abdul-Rahman is a Tabi'i and did not hear from the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace. Al-Suyuti quoted in "Al-Tadrib" 1/303 from Ibn Al-Qattan that he said: What others knew of his condition was hidden from Ahmad. Al-Uqayli said in 4/256 after mentioning the weakening of Mu'an, then mentioned this Hadith and said: He is not known except by it, and a group narrated it in a Marfu' form from a source that is not established. And Al-Sakhawi quoted in "Fath Al-Mughith" from Ibn Abd Al-Barr that he said: All its chains are disordered and not upright. Al-Daraqutni said: It is not authentic as Marfu'. Ibn Kathir said: Its authenticity is very questionable, and the most likely is its lack of authenticity, and if it were authentic, what he went to would be strong. Al-Iraqi said: This Hadith has been reported as connected from the narration of Ali, Ibn Omar, Ibn Amr, Jabir bin Samura, Abu Umamah, and Abu Huraira, and all of them are weak, none of them is established, and there is nothing in them to strengthen the Mursal.
1. Ibn Adi in "Al-Kamil" 5/77 said: Ahmad bin Muhammad bin Mansur Al-Hasib told us, Muhammad bin Bakkar told us, Hafs bin Omar the Qadi of Aleppo told us, from Salih bin Hassan, from Muhammad bin Ka'b Al-Qurazi, from Ibn Abbas in a Marfu' form.
2. "Al-Muntakhab" by Ibn Qudamah (73).

38 - What has been reported regarding the Scholar of Medina
The Hadith of Abu Huraira, may Allah be pleased with him: "Soon people will strike the livers of camels seeking knowledge, and they will not find a scholar more knowledgeable than the Scholar of Medina" (1).
Imam Ahmad said: Sufyan stopped it (made it Mawquf) once, and did not pass it beyond Abu Huraira (2).

39 - What has been reported regarding the ruling of writing knowledge
The Hadith of Abdullah bin Amr bin Al-Aas, may Allah be pleased with them both: I said: O Messenger of Allah, shall I write from you what I hear from you? He said: "Yes." I said: O Messenger of Allah, in contentment and in anger? He said: "Yes, for it does not befit me to say anything except the truth" (3).
Ismail bin Ayyash said: I seek refuge in Allah from lying and its people, I seek refuge in Allah from lying and its people (4).
Imam Ahmad said: Ismail only denied the story of Amr bin Shu'ayb because of the Hadith (5) of Hammam (6).
foot_note:
1. (1) Narrated by Ahmad 2/299, he said: Sufyan told us, Ibn Jurayj told us, from Abu Al-Zubayr, from Abu Salih, from Abu Huraira - if Allah wills - from the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace... and he mentioned it.
2. "Al-Muntakhab" by Ibn Qudamah (67).
3. Narrated by Ahmad 2/207, he said: Yazid bin Harun and Muhammad bin Yazid told us, they said: Muhammad Ibn Ishaq informed us, from Amr bin Shu'ayb, from his father, from his grandfather, I said: O Messenger of Allah... and he mentioned it.
4. "Ilal Al-Marudhi" (263).
5. Narrated by "Muslim" (3004), he said: Haddab bin Khalid Al-Azdi told us, Hammam told us, from Zaid bin Aslam, from Ata bin Yasar, from Abu Sa'id Al-Khudri that the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said: "Do not write from me, and whoever wrote from me other than the Quran, let him erase it."
6. "Masa'il Salih li-Al-Imam Ahmad" (809).

And he said once: Ismail Ibn Ulayyah used to follow the methodology of the Basrans (1).

40 - What has been reported regarding the punishment of one who does not act upon knowledge and the severity concerning it
The Hadith of Anas, may Allah be pleased with him: "Verily Allah pardons the illiterate on the Day of Resurrection what He does not pardon the scholars" (2).
Imam Ahmad said: This is a Munkar (denounced) Hadith. And in a narration from him, he said: The mistake is from Ja'far; this is not from Sayyar (3).
What has been reported regarding one who is asked about knowledge and conceals it
The Hadith of Abu Huraira, may Allah be pleased with him: "Whoever conceals knowledge that he knows will come on the Day of Resurrection bridled with a bridle of fire" (4).
Imam Ahmad said: Nothing is authentic regarding this (5).

41 - What has been reported regarding weighing the ink of scholars against the blood of martyrs
The Hadith of Abdullah bin Amr, may Allah be pleased with them both: "If the ink of the scholars were weighed against the blood of the martyrs, the ink of the scholars would outweigh the blood of the martyrs" (1).
Imam Ahmad said: Muhammad bin Yazid Al-Wasiti narrates nothing from Abdul-Rahman Ibn Ziyad (2).

42 - What has been reported regarding lying against the Messenger, may Allah bless him and grant him peace - It contains three Hadiths:
The First: The Hadith of Anas, may Allah be pleased with him: "Whoever lies against me intentionally, let him take his seat in the Fire" (3).
Imam Ahmad said: This Hadith is Munkar (denounced) (4). And he said once when asked: Is it Mahfuz (preserved)? He said: I hope so (5).

4. Al-Uqayli in "Al-Du'afa" 1/270, "Mizan Al-I'tidal" 1/474, "Tahdhib Al-Tahdhib" 1/463.
5. "Masa'il Abi Dawood" (1990). And the text of the Hadith is established as is known.

The Second: The Hadith of Abu Umamah, may Allah be pleased with him, similar to it (1).
Imam Ahmad said: It is nothing; this was fabricated by someone whose intention was lying (2).
The Third: Anas, may Allah be pleased with him, similar to it (3).
Imam Ahmad said: Thus he said to us, he erred in it. It is actually Abdul-Aziz bin Suhaib. Meaning Abdul-Aziz bin Rafi' (4).

43 - What has been reported regarding narrating from the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace
The Hadith of Imran bin Husain, may Allah be pleased with him: "By Allah, I indeed see that if I wished, I could narrate from the Prophet of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, for two consecutive days" (5).

4. "Musnad Ahmad" 3/209.

44 - What has been reported regarding putting dust on the writing
The Hadith of Jabir, may Allah be pleased with him: "Dust your pages, for it is more successful for them; because dust is blessed" (2).
Imam Ahmad said: This is a Munkar (denounced) Hadith, and what Baqiyyah narrated from unknown narrators is not written. (3)

And I indeed know that they do not intend other than good, so I fear that I might be confused as they were confused. 45 - What has been reported regarding sealing the letter
The Hadith of Ibn Mas'ud, may Allah be pleased with him, stopped at him (Mawquf), he said: And sealing is better than suspicion (1).
Imam Ahmad said: This Hadith is Munkar - as if he denounced it from the Hadith of Layth (2).

46 - What has been reported regarding the virtue of storytelling
The Hadith of Abu Umamah, may Allah be pleased with him: "Tell stories, for indeed, sitting from early morning until the sun rises is more beloved to me than freeing four slaves, and after Asr until the sun sets is more beloved to me than freeing four slaves" (3).
Imam Ahmad said: I do not know who this Abu Al-Ja'd is (4).

47 - Sunan of Fitrah (Nature)
The Hadith of Aisha, may Allah be pleased with her: "Ten are from the Sunan of Fitrah" (1).
Imam Ahmad said: That is a Munkar Hadith narrated by Mus'ab bin Shaybah; his Hadiths are Manakir (pl. Munkar) (2).

What has been reported regarding the purity of waters
The Hadith of Abu Umamah Al-Bahili, may Allah be pleased with him: "Water is pure (Tahur), nothing makes it impure except what overcomes its smell, its taste, and its color" (3).
foot_note:
1. (1) Narrated by Muslim (261), he said: Qutaybah bin Sa'id, Abu Bakr bin Abi Shaybah, and Zuhair bin Harb told us, they said: Waki' told us, from Zakariya bin Abi Za'idah, from Mus'ab bin Shaybah, from Talq bin Habib, from Abdullah bin Al-Zubayr, from Aisha, she said: The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said: "Ten are from the Fitrah: trimming the mustache, letting the beard grow, using the Siwak, snuffing up water, cutting the nails, washing the knuckles, plucking the armpit hair, shaving the pubic hair, and using water for cleaning private parts (Intiqas al-Ma')."
2. "Al-Du'afa" by Al-Uqayli 4/196, 197. I say: What suffices instead of this Hadith is what Al-Bukhari (5889) and Muslim (257) narrated via the path of Sufyan, from Al-Zuhri, from Sa'id bin Al-Musayyib, from Abu Huraira, from the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, who said: "The Fitrah is five - or five are from the Fitrah: Circumcision, shaving the pubic hair, plucking the armpit hair, clipping the nails, and trimming the mustache."
3. Narrated by Ibn Majah number (521), he said: Mahmud bin Khalid and Al-Abbas bin Al-Walid told us, they said: Marwan told us, Rishdin told us, Mu'awiyah bin Salih informed us, from Rashid bin Sa'd, from Abu Umamah, with it.

Imam Ahmad said: There is no [authentic] Hadith in it (1).

48 - What has been reported regarding the Well of Buda'ah
The Hadith of Abu Sa'id Al-Khudri, may Allah be pleased with him: "Water is pure (Tahur), nothing makes it impure" (2).
Imam Ahmad said: Authentic (Sahih) (3).

49 - What has been reported regarding sternness concerning urine
The Hadith of Abu Huraira, may Allah be pleased with him: "Most of the punishment of the grave is from urine" (4).
foot_note:
1. (1) Quoted by Ibn Qudamah in "Al-Mughni" 1/38, and he also quoted from Al-Khallal who said: Ahmad only said: There is no Hadith in it; because the Hadith narrated by Sulayman bin Omar and Rishdin bin Sa'd are both weak. Issue: Ibn Al-Mundhir said: The scholars have agreed that a small or large amount of water, if impurity falls into it and changes its taste, color, or smell, becomes impure. So the consensus (Ijma') is the proof for the impurity of what has changed in one of its qualities, not this addition.
2. The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said: "Water is pure, nothing makes it impure."
3. "Al-Tahqiq" by Ibn Al-Jawzi 1/42, Ibn Qudamah in "Al-Mughni" 1/40, Ibn Taymiyyah in "Al-Fatawa" 21/33, 60, "Tahdhib Al-Kamal" 19/84, Al-Hafiz in "Al-Talkhis" 1/13, "Tanqih Al-Tahqiq" by Ibn Abd Al-Hadi 1/28.

50 - What has been reported regarding urinating in a burrow
The Hadith of Abdullah bin Sarjis, may Allah be pleased with him: "Let no one of you urinate in a burrow."
Ahmad did not consider Qatada's hearing from Abdullah bin Sarjis [to be established] (2).

51 - What has been reported regarding urinating in stagnant water
The Hadith of Abu Huraira, may Allah be pleased with him: He forbade urinating in stagnant water then bathing from it (3).
Imam Ahmad said: Ibn Ulayyah had the Hadith of Yahya bin Atiq, it was not authentic for him, and he did not use to narrate it. And Ahmad said: I did not meet anyone narrating from Yahya bin

And when you sleep, extinguish the lamp, for the mouse takes the wick and burns the people of the house. And tie up the waterskins, cover the drink, and close the doors." It was said to Qatada: What is disliked about urinating in the burrow? He said: They are the dwellings of the Jinn. Benefit: Abdullah bin Ahmad quoted in the book "Al-Ilal" (5264) from his father: It was said: Did Qatada hear from Abdullah bin Sarjis? He said: Yes, Hisham narrated from him - meaning from Qatada - from Abdullah bin Sarjis one Hadith, and Asim Al-Ahwal has narrated from him.

52 - What has been reported regarding urinating while standing
The Hadith of Al-Mughira bin Shu'ba, may Allah be pleased with him, that the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, came to the dumpsite of a people; so he spread his legs and urinated while standing (5).
Imam Ahmad said: Mansur (6) and Al-A'mash are more established than Hammad and Asim (7).

53 - What has been reported regarding cleaning oneself with water (Istinja')
It contains two Hadiths:
The First: The Hadith of Aisha, may Allah be pleased with her: "Order your husbands to wash away from themselves the traces of defecation and urine" (1).
Imam Ahmad said: No Hadith regarding Istinja' with water is authentic. It was said to him: Then the Hadith of Aisha? He said: It is not authentic; because no one other than Qatada elevates it [to the Prophet] (2). And he said once: Cleaning with stones (Istitaba) is more established than water (3).
foot_note:
1. (1) Narrated by Imam Ahmad in "Al-Musnad" 6/95, he said: Bahz told us, he said: Hammam told us, he said: Qatada told us, from Mu'adha, from Aisha, she said... And in it: For we are shy to forbid them from that, and the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, used to do it.
2. "Al-Farusiyyah" by Ibn Al-Qayyim p. 191, "Bada'i' Al-Fawa'id" 4/90.
3. "Tarikh Abi Zur'ah" p. 216. I say: Ibn Abi Hatim said in "Al-Ilal" 1/171: I heard Abu Zur'ah say regarding a Hadith narrated by Sa'id, from Qatada, from Mu'adha, from Aisha... the Hadith. And I said to Abu Zur'ah that Shu'ba narrates from Yazid Al-Rishk, from Mu'adha, from Aisha as Mawquf, and Qatada attributed it [to the Prophet], so which is more correct? He said: The Hadith of Qatada as Marfu' is more correct, and Qatada has better memory, and there is no harm in Yazid Al-Rishk. Al-Bayhaqi said in "Al-Sunan" 1/106: Abu Qilaba and others narrated it from Mu'adha but did not attribute it to the action of the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, and Qatada is a Hafiz. Al-Bukhari said in "Al-Tarikh" 4/300: Abu Qilaba and Yazid Al-Rishk narrated it as Mawquf, and Qatada elevated it. Ibn Qudamah said in "Al-Mughni" 1/208-209: Ahmad said: If he combines both, it is more beloved to me because Aisha said: Order your husbands to follow up stones with water for the traces of feces and urine, for I am shy of them; the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, used to do it. I say: Imam Ahmad's methodology and acting upon weak Hadith was mentioned in the introduction. Issue: Al-Tirmidhi (19) said: And this is the practice according to the people of knowledge; they choose Istinja' with water =

54 - What has been reported regarding a man rubbing his hand on the ground when performing Istinja'
The Hadith of Abu Huraira, may Allah be pleased with him: The Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, when he entered the toilet, I brought him water, so he performed Istinja', then wiped his hand on the ground, then performed ablution (3).
Imam Ahmad said: This is a Munkar Hadith; it is only from Abu Al-Ahwas from Abdullah, and he did not elevate it (4).

2. Narrated by Abdullah in "Al-Ilal" (4817), he said: I read to my father: Yahya bin Abdul-Malik Ibn Abi Ghaniyah said: Sufyan told us, from Nafi', from Ibn Omar, with it.
3. Narrated by Abu Dawood (45), he said: Ibrahim bin Khalid told us, Aswad bin Amir told us, Sharik told us - and this is his wording - (H) and Muhammad bin Abdullah - meaning Al-Makhrami - told us, Waki' told us, from Sharik, from Ibrahim bin Jarir, from Al-Mughira, from Abu Zur'ah, from Abu Huraira, he said... and he mentioned it.
4. "Bada'i' Al-Fawa'id" by Ibn Al-Qayyim 3/168.

text:
55 - What has been reported regarding dislike of materials used for Istinja'
The Hadith of Ibn Mas'ud, may Allah be pleased with him: "Do not perform Istinja' with bones nor with dung, for it is the provision of your brothers from the Jinn" (1).
Imam Ahmad said, when asked about this Hadith whether it is from the saying of Alqama from Abdullah, or from the saying of Al-Sha'bi? He said: As for Ismail (2) bin Ibrahim and Yahya bin Zakariya bin Abi Za'idah, both of them said: Al-Sha'bi said—and it is not in the Hadith of Alqama: They asked him for provision, and they were from the Jinn of Al-Jazirah... the Hadith. Then Imam Ahmad said: And it reached me that Hafs (3) bin Ghiyath narrated it and placed it within the Hadith of Alqama from Abdullah, so we think he was mistaken, and this is more established (4).
foot_note:
1. (1) Narrated by Muslim (450), he said: Muhammad bin Al-Muthanna told us, Abdul-A'la told us, from Dawood Ibn Abi Hind, from Al-Sha'bi, from Alqama, from Abdullah, he said: The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said: "Do not perform Istinja'..." The Hadith.
2. Narrated by Muslim (450), he said: And Ali bin Hajar Al-Sa'di told it to me, Ismail bin Ibrahim told us, from Dawood, from Amir, he said: I asked Alqama: Was Ibn Mas'ud present with the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, on the night of the Jinn? He said: So Alqama said: I asked Ibn Mas'ud saying: Was anyone of you present with the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, on the night of the Jinn... The Hadith, and in it Al-Sha'bi said: And they asked him for provision, and they were from the Jinn of Al-Jazirah... to the end of the Hadith from the saying of Al-Sha'bi, separated from the Hadith of Abdullah.
3. Narrated by Al-Tirmidhi (18), he said: Hannad told us, Hafs bin Ghiyath told us, from Dawood bin Abi Hind, from Al-Sha'bi, from Alqama, from Ibn Mas'ud, he said: The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said: "Do not perform Istinja'..." The Hadith.
4. "Masa'il Salih" (690).

It was said to Imam Ahmad: Is it authentic according to you that Abdullah accompanied the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, on the night of the Jinn? He said: I do not know (1).

56 - What has been reported regarding purifying the place by digging and water
The Hadith of Ibn Mas'ud, may Allah be pleased with him: A Bedouin came and urinated in the mosque, so the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, ordered regarding his place, so it was dug up, then a bucket of water was poured over it (2).
Imam Ahmad said: It is a Munkar Hadith (3).
foot_note:
1. (1) "Su'alat Al-Athram" (56). I say: What attests to this is what Muslim narrated (152), he said: Yahya bin Yahya told us, Khalid bin Abdullah informed us, from Khalid, from Abu Ma'shar, from Ibrahim, from Alqama, from Ibn Mas'ud, he said: I was not with the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, on the night of the Jinn, but I wished I had been with him. Benefit: There is more discussion on this Hadith in "Ilal Ali bin Al-Madini" 125, so refer to it.
2. Narrated by Al-Daraqutni 1/131-132, he said: Abdul-Wahhab bin Isa bin Abi Hayyah told us, from Abu Hisham Al-Rifa'i, Abu Bakr bin Ayyash told us, Sim'an bin Malik told us, from Abu Wa'il, from Abdullah, he said: A Bedouin came and urinated in the mosque, so the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, ordered regarding his place, so it was dug up, then a bucket of water was poured over it. So the Bedouin said... The Hadith.
3. "Al-Talkhis Al-Habir" 1/37, "Al-Mughni" 1/738, "Al-Tahqiq" by Ibn Al-Jawzi 1/78, "Tanqih Al-Tahqiq" 1/57, but regarding the Hadith of Abdullah bin Ma'qil with the same text. I did not find this statement of Imam Ahmad regarding this Hadith [of Ibn Mas'ud], so perhaps it is a delusion, and the correct [attribution] is to the Hadith of Ibn Mas'ud [being Munkar], and Allah knows best.

text:
57 - What has been reported regarding Madhiy (Prostatic fluid)
The Hadith of Sahl bin Hunaif, may Allah be pleased with him: "Ablution (Wudu) suffices you for that" (1).
Imam Ahmad said: The Hadith of Muhammad bin Ishaq, I do not know it from anyone else, and I do not rule based on Muhammad bin Ishaq. Washing Mani (semen) from the garment is safer and more established, and scraping (Fark) has also been reported (2).
And he said once: No one narrated it except Ibn Ishaq, and I am wary of it. And he said once: If it is established, sprinkling suffices him. And he said once: I do not know anything contradicting it; nothing refutes it, even if it is a single Hadith (3).

58 - What has been reported regarding washing the testicles
The Hadith of Ali bin Abi Talib, may Allah be pleased with him (4): "Let him wash his penis and his testicles."
foot_note:
1. (1) Narrated by Al-Tirmidhi (115), he said: Hannad told us, Abdah told us, from Muhammad bin Ishaq, from Sa'id bin Ubayd—he is Ibn Al-Sabbaq—from his father, from Sahl bin Hunaif, he said: I used to suffer severity and hardship from Madhiy and I used to perform Ghusl frequently because of it. So I mentioned that to the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, and asked him about it. He said: "Ablution (Wudu) suffices you for that." I said: O Messenger of Allah, what about what gets on my garment from it? He said: "It is sufficient for you to take a handful of water and sprinkle your garment with it where you see it has affected it."
2. "Masa'il Salih" (1034).
3. "Sharh Al-Bukhari" by Ibn Rajab 1/306 - "Al-Mughni" 2/491.
4. Narrated by Abu Dawood (208), he said: Ahmad bin Yunus told us, he said: Zuhair told us, from Hisham Ibn Urwa, from Urwa that Ali bin Abi Talib said: I said to Al-Miqdad: When a man is intimate with his wife and emits Madhiy but does not have intercourse, ask the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, about that; for I am shy to ask him about that because his daughter is with me [as my wife]. So he asked him, and he said: "Let him wash his penis and his testicles."

Imam Ahmad said: No one said washing the testicles except Hisham bin Urwa; as for all other Hadiths, this is not in them (1).

59 - What has been reported regarding Mani (Semen)
The Hadith of Aisha, may Allah be pleased with her: "I used to scrape it from the garment of the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace" (2).
Abdullah bin Ahmad said: I read to my father: Muhammad bin Abi Adi, from Sa'id, from Abu Ma'shar, from Al-Nakha'i, from Al-Aswad, from Aisha... The Hadith.
Imam Ahmad said: And Abdul-A'la said: From Sa'id, from Abu Ma'shar, from Al-Nakha'i, from Al-Aswad or Abdul-Rahman bin Yazid. And Gundar said: From Al-Aswad. And Al-A'mash, Mansur, and Al-Hakam narrated it from Ibrahim, from Hammam (3).
I said: Ibrahim—meaning the narration of the companions from Ibrahim, from Hammam—is the preserved one (Mahfuzah).
foot_note:
1. (1) "Masa'il Abi Dawood" for Imam Ahmad (156).
2. Narrated by Muslim (288), he said: Qutaybah bin Sa'id told us, Hammad bin Zaid told us, from Hisham bin Hassan, (H). And Ishaq bin Ibrahim told us, Abdah bin Sulayman informed us, Ibn Abi Aruba told us both, from Abu Ma'shar, (H). And Abu Bakr bin Abi Shaybah told us, Hushaym told us, from Mughira, (H). And Muhammad bin Hatim told me, and Abdul-Rahman bin Mahdi told us, from Mahdi bin Maymun, from Wasil Al-Ahdab, (H). And Ibn Hatim told me, Ishaq bin Mansur told us, Isra'il told us, from Mansur and Mughira, all of these from Ibrahim, from Al-Aswad, from Aisha regarding scraping semen from the garment of the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace.
3. "Al-Ilal" narration of Abdullah (2886).

text:
60 - What has been reported regarding praying in the garment in which intercourse occurred
The Hadith of Jabir bin Samura, may Allah be pleased with him: A man asked the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace: Can I pray in the garment in which I approach my wife? He said: "Yes, unless you see something in it, then wash it" (1).
Imam Ahmad said: This Hadith is not elevated (Marfu') from Abdul-Malik bin Umayr (2).

61 - Angels not entering a house in which there is urine or an image
The Hadith of Ali, may Allah be pleased with him: "Gabriel, peace be upon him, came to me but did not enter upon me" (3).
Abu Abdul-Rahman said: My father used not to narrate from Amr bin Khalid. Meaning: His Hadith was worth nothing to him (4).
foot_note:
1. (1) Narrated by Ahmad 5/89, he said: Abdullah bin Maymun Abu Abdul-Rahman - meaning Al-Raqqi - told us, Ubaydullah bin Amr told us, from Abdul-Malik bin Umayr, from Jabir bin Samura in a Marfu' form.
2. "Musnad Ahmad" 5/89.
3. Narrated by Ahmad 1/146, he said: Abdullah told us, Shayban Abu Muhammad told us, Abdul-Warith Ibn Sa'id told us, Al-Hasan bin Dhakwan told us, from Amr bin Khalid, from Habib Ibn Abi Thabit, from Asim bin Damrah, from Ali, from the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, he said: "Gabriel, peace be upon him, came to me but did not enter upon me." So the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said to him: "What prevented you from entering?" He said: "We do not enter a house in which there is an image or urine."
4. "Musnad Ahmad" 1/146.

62 - What has been reported regarding facing the Qiblah while urinating or defecating
It contains two Hadiths:
The First: The Hadith of Aisha, may Allah be pleased with her: "I see they have done it; face the Qiblah with my toilet seat" (1).
Imam Ahmad said: The Hadith of Aisha is the best of what has been narrated regarding the concession, even if it is Mursal, its exit (source) is good. And he said: Arak did not hear from Aisha (2). And he said once: Mursal. It was said to him: Arak said: 'I heard Aisha, may Allah be pleased with her,' so he denounced it and said: Arak bin Malik, from where did he hear Aisha?! What does he have to do with Aisha? He only narrates from Urwa; this is a mistake. Then Imam Ahmad said to Al-Athram: Who narrated this? Al-Athram said: Hammad bin Salama, from Khalid Al-Hadhdha. He said: More than one narrated it from Khalid Al-Hadhdha without 'I heard.' And more than one also said: From Hammad bin Salama without 'I heard' (3).
foot_note:
1. (1) Narrated by Ibn Majah (324), he said: Abu Bakr bin Abi Shaybah and Ali bin Muhammad told us, they said: Waki' told us, from Hammad bin Salama, from Khalid Al-Hadhdha, from Khalid bin Abi Al-Salt, from Arak Ibn Malik, from Aisha, she said: It was mentioned in the presence of the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, that some people dislike facing the Qiblah with their private parts, so he said... The Hadith.
2. "Al-Tamhid" 1/359, "Al-Mughni" 1/221, "Sharh Ilal Al-Tirmidhi" by Ibn Rajab p. 312, "Nasb Al-Rayah" 2/156, "Zad Al-Ma'ad" 2/385, "Al-Farusiyyah" by Ibn Al-Qayyim p. 191, "Tahdhib Al-Tahdhib" 1/522, "Tanqih Al-Tahqiq" by Ibn Abd Al-Hadi 1/91.
3. "Marasil Ibn Abi Hatim" 162, "Jami' Al-Tahsil" 236.

And he said once: Khalid bin Abi Al-Salt was alone in narrating it from Arak, from Aisha (1).
The Second: The Hadith of Jabir bin Abdullah, may Allah be pleased with them both: The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, forbade us from facing the Qiblah while urinating, but I saw him a year before he died facing it (2).
Imam Ahmad said: Weak (3).

1. (1) "Al-Tamhid" 1/359.
2. Narrated by Ibn Majah (325), he said: Muhammad bin Bashar told us, Wahb bin Jarir told us, my father told us, he said: I heard Muhammad bin Ishaq, from Aban, from Mujahid, from Jabir that the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace... The Hadith.
3. "Al-Tamhid" 1/309. Issue: The majority, other than the Hanafis, said: It is not disliked to face the Qiblah or turn one's back to it inside a building with one's private parts while relieving oneself, but it is forbidden to face it or turn one's back to it in a building not prepared for relieving oneself and in the open desert without a screen.

63 - What has been reported regarding the purification of the skins of dead animals by tanning
It contains four Hadiths:
The First: The Hadith of Ibn Abbas, may Allah be pleased with them both: "If the hide is tanned, it becomes pure."
Imam Ahmad said: Ibn Wa'lah (1) says: I heard the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace. And Ikrimah says: From Ibn Abbas, from Sawdah. And Ubaydullah bin Abdullah says: From Ibn Abbas, from Maymunah. And Ibn Uyaynah (2) says: From Ibn Abbas, from Maymunah, and it is a mistake that contradicts the people; it does not mention its tanning. Yunus, Ma'mar, and Malik do not mention its tanning (3).
And he said once: They differed in it; Ibn Wa'lah says: I heard the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace. As for Al-Zuhri, he narrated from Ubaydullah, from Ibn Abbas, from Sawdah. So they differed in it. And it was narrated from Ata: once 'tanned', and once he did not say 'tanned', so they differed (4).
And he said once: The Hadith of Ibn Wa'lah from Ibn Abbas is weak (5).
foot_note:
1. (1) Narrated by "Muslim" (366), he said: Yahya bin Yahya told us, Sulayman bin Bilal informed us, from Zaid bin Aslam, that Abdul-Rahman bin Wa'lah informed him from Abdullah bin Abbas, he said: I heard the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, saying... The Hadith.
2. Narrated by Muslim (363), he said: Yahya bin Yahya, Abu Bakr bin Abi Shaybah, Amr Al-Naqid, and Ibn Abi Umar told us, all of them from Ibn Uyaynah. Yahya said: Sufyan bin Uyaynah informed us, from Al-Zuhri, from Ubaydullah bin Abdullah, from Ibn Abbas, he said: A sheep was given in charity to a freed slave girl of Maymunah, and it died. The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, passed by it and said: "Why did you not take its hide, tan it, and benefit from it?" They said: It is dead meat (Maytah). He said: "Only eating it is forbidden."
3. "Masa'il Abdullah" (39), "Masa'il Salih" (1119), "Tabaqat Al-Hanabila" 1/350, "Al-Fatawa" 21/101, "Al-Manhaj Al-Ahmad" 1/190.
4. "Masa'il Ibn Hani" (109).
5. "Tahdhib Al-Tahdhib" 3/434.

The Second: The Hadith of Aisha, may Allah be pleased with her, similar to it (1).
Imam Ahmad said: This Hadith contains 'his mother'. As if he denounced it because of his mother (2).
The Third: The Hadith of Abu Umamah, similar to it (3).
Imam Ahmad said: Munkar (denounced). And he attributed it to Al-Qasim, and said: He narrates amazing things from Ali bin Yazid. And he spoke about it, and said: I do not see this except from Al-Qasim (4).
The Fourth: The Hadith of Salama bin Al-Muhabbiq: Similar to it (5).
Imam Ahmad said: I do not know who Al-Jawn bin Qatada is (6).
And he said once: I do not circulate it (7).
And he said once: I do not have a Sahih Hadith regarding the tanning of dead animals (8).

6. "Mizan Al-I'tidal" 1/427, "Al-Tahqiq" by Ibn Al-Jawzi 1/127, "Tahdhib Al-Kamal" 5/165, "Al-Kamil" by Ibn Adi 2/439, "Tanqih Al-Tahqiq" 1/69.

64 - What has been reported regarding not benefiting from the skins of dead animals even if tanned
The Hadith of Abdullah bin Ukaym, may Allah be pleased with him: "Do not benefit from the dead animal, neither its hide nor its sinew" (1).
Imam Ahmad said: It is the most correct of them; I hope it is authentic (Sahih) (2).
And he said once: Its chain is good (Jayyid), how good its chain is (3).
And once: Imam Ahmad used to follow it, then he abandoned it when they became inconsistent in its chain (4).
And once: Imam Ahmad paused regarding the Hadith of Ibn Ukaym when he saw the wavering of the narrators in it, and it was said: He retracted from it (5).
And he said once, when it was said to him: Khalid Al-Hadhdha narrated it from one who heard Abdullah bin Ukaym. He said: Shu'ba has narrated it from Al-Hakam, from Ibn Abi Layla, from Abdullah Ibn Ukaym, [which is] more correct than this. And Abbad narrated it, and Shu'ba narrated it from Al-Hakam. As if he authenticated it from other than the Hadith of Khalid (6).
foot_note:
1. (1) Narrated by Al-Tirmidhi (1729), he said: Muhammad bin Tarif Al-Kufi told us, Muhammad bin Fudayl told us, from Al-A'mash and Al-Shaibani, from Al-Hakam, from Abdul-Rahman bin Abi Layla, from Abdullah bin Ukaym in a Marfu' form.
2. "Masa'il Salih" (1119).
3. "Al-Mughni" by Ibn Qudamah 1/91, "Al-Fatawa" by Ibn Taymiyyah 21/93, "Tanqih Al-Tahqiq" 1/64.
4. "Sunan Al-Tirmidhi" 4/222, "Nasb Al-Rayah" 1/120, "Al-Talkhis Al-Habir" 1/47, "Al-Fatawa" 21/91, "Tanqih Al-Tahqiq" 1/64.
5. "Nasb Al-Rayah" 1/122.
6. "Bada'i' Al-Fawa'id" 4/73.

65 - What has been reported regarding the purity of dead animals
The Hadith of Ibn Omar, may Allah be pleased with them both: "Two dead animals and two bloods have been made lawful for us" (1).
Imam Ahmad said: This is a Munkar Hadith (2).
foot_note:
1. = Issue: The people of knowledge differed regarding the purity of the skin if it is tanned. The Malikis and Hanbalis, according to the well-known view, held that impure skin does not become pure by tanning. The Hanbalis have two narrations, one of them permitting it. The Shafi'is and Hanafis held that tanning is purifying, and this is the more correct view, and Allah knows best.
1. Narrated by Ahmad 2/97, he said: Shuraih told us, Abdul-Rahman bin Zaid bin Aslam told us, from Ibn Omar, he said: The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said... The Hadith.
2. Book "Al-Ilal" by Abdullah bin Ahmad bin Hanbal (1795), (5204), "Al-Du'afa by Al-Uqayli" 2/331, "Al-Talkhis Al-Habir" 1/26, "Tahdhib Al-Tahdhib" 3/363, "Tahdhib Al-Kamal" 17/117. I say: Imam Ahmad mentioned the disagreement, so he said: Ishaq bin Isa Al-Tabba' told us, he said: I heard Abdul-Rahman bin Zaid bin Aslam narrating from his brother Usama bin Zaid, from his father, from Ibn Omar: "Two dead animals have been made lawful for us." Then I heard him narrating it from his father, from Ibn Omar, from the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace. See "Ilal Abdullah" (1099).

66 - What has been reported regarding women being twin halves of men
The Hadith of Aisha, may Allah be pleased with her: "Women are but twin halves of men" (1).
Imam Ahmad said: Munkar. And he said once: I go with it [act upon it] (2).
The First: The Hadith of Ali bin Abi Talib, may Allah be pleased with him: "If blood is stirred in one of you, let him shed it even with a broad arrowhead (Mushqamas)" (3).
Imam Ahmad said when asked about this Hadith: It contains Muhammad bin Al-Qasim who lies; his Hadiths are fabricated Hadiths, he is nothing (4).
foot_note:
1. (1) Narrated by Ahmad in "Al-Musnad" 6/256, he said: Hammad bin Khalid told us, from Abdullah, from his brother Ubaydullah, from Al-Qasim, from Aisha, she said: The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, was asked about a man who finds wetness but does not remember a wet dream. He said: "He performs Ghusl." And about a man who sees that he has had a wet dream but does not see wetness. He said: "There is no Ghusl upon him." So Umm Sulaym said: Is there anything upon a woman if she sees that? He said: "Yes, women are but twin halves of men."
2. Ibn Rajab in "Sharh Al-Bukhari" 1/343.
3. Narrated by Ibn Adi in "Al-Kamil" 7/491, he said: Al-Husain bin Ahmad bin Mansur and Abu Ya'la both told us, from Abu Ma'mar Al-Qati'i Ismail bin Ibrahim bin Ma'mar, from Muhammad bin Al-Qasim Al-Asadi, he said: Sa'id bin Ubayd Al-Ta'i told us, from Ali bin Rabi'ah Al-Walibi, from Ali, he said: And I do not know it except from the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace... The Hadith.
4. Book "Al-Ilal" by Abdullah bin Ahmad bin Hanbal (1899), Ibn Adi in "Al-Kamil" 7/491, "Al-Du'afa by Al-Uqayli" 4/126, "Tahdhib Al-Tahdhib" 3/678, "Mizan Al-I'tidal" 5/136.

text:
67 - What has been reported regarding a mouse falling into ghee (clarified butter)
It contains two Hadiths:
The First: The Hadith of Maymunah, may Allah be pleased with her: "Throw it and what is around it away, and eat your ghee" (1).
The Second: The Hadith of Abu Huraira, may Allah be pleased with him: "If it is solid, throw it and what is around it away; and if it is liquid, do not approach it" (2).
Imam Ahmad said: Both are Sahih (authentic) (3).
foot_note:
1. (1) Narrated by Al-Bukhari 1/409, he said: Ismail told us, he said: Malik told us, from Ibn Shihab, from Ubaydullah bin Abdullah bin Utbah bin Mas'ud, from Ibn Abbas, from Maymunah that the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, was asked about a mouse that fell into ghee. He said: "Throw it and what is around it away, and eat your ghee."
2. Narrated by Abdul-Razzaq 1/84 (278): From Ma'mar, from Al-Zuhri, from Sa'id bin Al-Musayyib, from Abu Huraira in a Marfu' form.
3. Ibn Rajab in "Sharh Ilal Al-Tirmidhi" 376-377. And he said: Some of the Hafizs authenticated both sayings, among them Imam Ahmad and Muhammad bin Yahya Al-Dhuhli and others. And some of them judged Ma'mar to be mistaken for being alone with this chain, among them Al-Bukhari, Al-Tirmidhi, Abu Hatim, and others. Al-Dhuhli mentioned that Sa'id bin Abi Hilal followed Ma'mar in his narration from Al-Zuhri, from Sa'id bin Al-Musayyib, except that he sent it (Mursal) and did not mention Abu Huraira. What indicates the correctness of Ma'mar's narration is that he narrated it with both chains. As for the wording of the Hadith distinguishing between solid and liquid, Ma'mar mentioned it from Al-Zuhri with both chains together, and Al-Awza'i followed him from Al-Zuhri, narrating it from Ubaydullah, from Ibn Abbas. Likewise, Ishaq bin Rahwayh narrated it from Sufyan bin Uyaynah, from Al-Zuhri, but he attributed the Hadith of Ibn Uyaynah to the Hadith of Ma'mar. I say: What Al-Bukhari, Al-Tirmidhi, and Abu Hatim said is more likely correct, and perhaps - and Allah knows best - Imam Ahmad's statement here is based on legal practice.

Chapters on Ablution (Wudu)

68 - What has been reported regarding the virtue of Wudu
It contains two Hadiths:
The First: The Hadith of Abu Sa'id Al-Khudri, may Allah be pleased with him: "Shall I not guide you to that by which Allah erases sins and increases good deeds? Performing Wudu thoroughly despite difficulties" (1).
Imam Ahmad said: This is Batil (false) - meaning the Hadith of Abdullah bin Abi Bakr (2) - it is actually the Hadith of Ibn Uqayl. And he denounced it most severely and said it is nothing (3).
The Second: The Hadith of Thawban, may Allah be pleased with him: "Be upright, though you will not be able to do so completely, and know that the best of your deeds is prayer, and no one preserves Wudu except a believer" (4).
foot_note:
1. (1) Narrated by Ibn Khuzayma in his "Sahih" (177), he said: Abu Musa told us, Al-Dahhak bin Makhlad told me, Sufyan informed us, Abdullah bin Abi Bakr told me, from Sa'id bin Al-Musayyib, from Abu Sa'id Al-Khudri, he said: The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said: "Shall I not guide you to that by which Allah erases sins and increases good deeds?" He said: Yes, O Messenger of Allah. He said: "Performing Wudu thoroughly despite difficulties, and waiting for prayer after prayer."
2. Narrated by Ahmad 3/3, he said: Abu Amir Abdul-Malik bin Amr told us, Zuhair bin Muhammad told us, from Abdullah bin Muhammad bin Uqayl, from Sa'id bin Al-Musayyib, from Abu Sa'id Al-Khudri, he said: The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, used to say: "Shall I not guide you to something that erases sins and increases good deeds?" They said: Yes, O Messenger of Allah. He said: "Performing Wudu thoroughly despite difficulties..." The Hadith.
3. Book "Al-Ilal" by Abdullah bin Ahmad bin Hanbal (3633), "Al-Du'afa" by Al-Uqayli 2/223. I say: This Hadith has a Sahih origin in "Sahih Muslim" (251) from the Hadith of Abu Huraira, may Allah be pleased with him.
4. Narrated by Ahmad 5/276, he said: Abu Mu'awiyah told us, Al-A'mash told us, from Salim, from Thawban, he said: The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said... The Hadith.

Imam Ahmad said: Abu Kabsha Al-Saluli, Salma bin Sumayr, and Abdul-Rahman bin Al-Husain have narrated it from Thawban, and it is a Sahih Hadith (1).

69 - What has been reported regarding the virtue of Wudu upon purity
The Hadith of Ibn Omar, may Allah be pleased with them both, regarding "Whoever performs Wudu upon purity has ten rewards" (2).
Imam Ahmad said: There is no virtue in it (3).

70 - What has been reported regarding the obligation of purification for prayer
The Hadith of Abu Huraira, may Allah be pleased with him: "Allah does not accept a prayer without purification, nor charity from ghulul (stolen spoils)" (4).
Imam Ahmad denounced it (5).

3. "Al-Mughni" 1/198.
4. Narrated by Abu Awana 1/200 (642), he said: Muhammad bin Ismail Al-Makki told us, he said: Abu Hudhayfah told us, he said: Ikrimah bin Ammar told us, from Yahya bin Abi Kathir, from Abu Salama, from Abu Huraira in a Marfu' form.
5. "Sharh Ilal Al-Tirmidhi" (345). I say: I do not know if the denouncement here is from the saying of Imam Ahmad or from Ibn Rajab, and the copy of Harb that we relied on was from the beginning of the Book of Marriage, and Allah knows best.

71 - What has been reported regarding Basmalah (saying Bismillah) over Wudu
The Hadith of Basmalah over Wudu, the Hadith of Abu Huraira, may Allah be pleased with him: "There is no Wudu for the one who does not mention the name of Allah over it" (1).
Imam Ahmad said: I do not know a Hadith in this chapter that has a good chain (2).
And he said once: It is not established according to me; its chain is weak (3).
And he said once: I do not know a Hadith in this chapter that is established; the strongest thing in it is the Hadith of Kathir bin Zaid from Rabih, and Rabih is not known (4).
And he said once: There is no Hadith in this that is established, and the best of them is the Hadith of Kathir bin Zaid. And he weakened the Hadith of Ibn Harmala and said: I do not order him to repeat [the prayer], and I hope that the Wudu suffices him, because there is no Hadith in this by which I can judge (5).
foot_note:
1. = And the text of the Hadith is established, for Muslim narrated it (224) from the Hadith of Ibn Omar, may Allah be pleased with them both.

I say: The Hadith of Basmalah has been narrated from several Companions such as Abu Huraira, Aisha, Abu Sa'id Al-Khudri, Sa'id bin Zaid, Sahl bin Sa'd, Abu Sabra, Umm Sabra, Ali, and Anas, all of them with the wording: "There is no Wudu for the one who does not mention the name of Allah over it."
2. "Sunan Al-Tirmidhi" 1/38, "Masa'il Abi Dawood" (p. 6), "Nasb Al-Rayah" 1/4, "Al-Mughni" 1/145, "Ilal Al-Tirmidhi Al-Kabir" 32, "Tanqih Al-Tahqiq" 1/105.
3. "Masa'il Salih" (302), "Ibn Hani" (16), (17), "Al-Talkhis Al-Habir" 1/73.

"Al-Kamil fi Al-Du'afa" 4/110 - 7/204, "Al-Du'afa" by Al-Uqayli 1/177, Al-Bayhaqi in "Al-Sunan" 1/43, "Al-Mughni" by Ibn Qudamah 1/145, "Al-Talkhis Al-Habir" 1/74, "Masa'il Ishaq Al-Kawsaj" 1/99, "Al-Ilal Al-Mutanahiyah" 1/337, "Al-Manar Al-Munif" 116, "Al-Tahqiq" by Ibn Al-Jawzi 1/211, "Al-Farusiyyah" by Ibn Al-Qayyim 190, "Tahdhib Al-Kamal" 9/60, "Tahdhib Al-Tahdhib" 3/458, "Tanqih Al-Tahqiq" 1/104-105.

And once: There are Hadiths in it that are not up to that standard. And He, Blessed and Exalted, said: {O you who have believed, when you rise to [perform] prayer, wash your faces and your hands to the elbows} [Al-Ma'idah: 6], so I do not make it obligatory upon him. 72 - What has been reported regarding performing Wudu thoroughly (Isbagh)
The Hadith of Aisha, may Allah be pleased with her: The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, used to rise for Wudu, mention the name of Allah when pouring the vessel onto his hands, then perform Wudu and perfect the Wudu (1).
Imam Ahmad said: This Hadith is very Munkar (2).
foot_note:
1. (1) Narrated by Ibn Adi in "Al-Kamil" 2/471, he said: Abdullah bin Muhammad bin Muslim told us, Al-Husain bin Al-Hasan Al-Maruzi told us, Ibn Abi Za'idah told us, from Haritha bin Muhammad, from Amrah, from Aisha, she said: The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, used to rise for Wudu, mention the name of Allah when pouring the vessel onto his hands, then perform Wudu and perfect the Wudu.
2. "Al-Kamil fi Al-Du'afa" 2/471. I say: The Hadiths regarding perfecting Wudu are many and authentic, and the most famous of them is what Muslim narrated in his "Sahih" (246) via the path of Nu'aym bin Abdullah Al-Mujmir, he said: I saw Abu Huraira performing Wudu, so he washed his face and perfected the Wudu, then washed his right hand until he reached the upper arm, then his left hand until he reached the upper arm, then wiped his head, then washed his right foot until he reached the shank, then washed his left foot until he reached the shank, then said: Thus I saw the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, performing Wudu.

73 - What has been reported regarding performing Wudu three times
The Hadith of Abu Huraira, may Allah be pleased with him, that the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, performed Wudu, so he rinsed his mouth three times, sniffed water three times, washed his face three times, washed his hands three times, wiped his head, and washed his feet (1).
Imam Ahmad said: Amir Al-Ahwal is a Sheikh whom people tolerated, but his Hadith is not up to that standard. He narrated the Hadith of Ata, from Abu Huraira, that the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, performed Wudu three times each. But Ata only narrates it (2) from Uthman (3).

74 - What has been reported regarding performing Wudu once each
The Hadith of Ibn Abbas, may Allah be pleased with them both: The Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, performed Wudu once each (4).
Imam Ahmad said: The Hadiths regarding it are weak (5).
foot_note:
1. (1) "Musnad Ahmad" 2/348, he said: Affan told us, Hammam told us, Amir Al-Ahwal told us, from Ata, from Abu Huraira in a Marfu' form.

The Hadith of Ibn Mas'ud, may Allah be pleased with him: "A good date and pure water" (1).
Imam Ahmad said: Abu Fazara in the Hadith of Ibn Mas'ud is an unknown man (2).
And he said once: It has no Isnad (chain) (3).
And once Imam Ahmad was asked: Is it authentic according to him that Abdullah accompanied the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, on the night of the Jinn? He said: I do not know (4).

76 - What has been reported regarding the rebuke for not running fingers through fingers (Takhlil)
The Hadith of Ibn Mas'ud, may Allah be pleased with him: "Let a man run water through his fingers during purification, or the Fire will surely run through them" (5).
Imam Ahmad said: They claimed that Huzayl and Za'idah differed in a letter in the Hadith of Ibn Mas'ud, so the other began swearing that he did not say 'or' (6).

He said: No, except some Nabidh in a vessel. Then he mentioned it.

77 - Rinsing the mouth and sniffing water from one handful
The Hadith of Ali bin Abi Talib, may Allah be pleased with him: Then he put his right hand in, filled his mouth, rinsed it and sniffed water, and blew it out with his left hand; he did this three times, then said: Whoever is pleased to see the purification of the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, then this is his purification (1).
Imam Ahmad said: Za'idah narrated it excellently (Jawwadahu) (2).

78 - What has been reported regarding wiping the head up to the nape
The Hadith of Talha bin Musarrif, from his father, from his grandfather: I saw the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, wiping his head once until he reached the back of the head (Qadhal), which is the beginning of the nape (3).
Imam Ahmad denounced it (4).
And he said once: I do not know what this is (5).
And he said once: Ibn Uyaynah used to denounce it, and say: What is this Talha, from his father,

He said: The boy brought him a vessel containing water and a basin. Abd Khayr said: And we were sitting, so he looked at him and put his hand in... The Hadith.

The Hadith of Abu Huraira, may Allah be pleased with him: I saw the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, perform Wudu and wipe his head once (2).
Imam Ahmad said: Amir Al-Ahwal is weak. He narrated the Hadith of Uthman and said: From Abu Huraira, whereas it is only from Ata from Uthman (3).

It contains three Hadiths:
The First: The Hadith of Anas, and it has two paths.
The First Path: Yazid bin Aban from Anas that the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said: "Gabriel came to me and said: When you perform Wudu, run your fingers through your beard" (4).

Imam Ahmad said: I do not think he heard anything from Anas. Meaning: Muhammad bin Khalid (3).
The Second: The Hadith of Jabir bin Abdullah: I saw the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, perform Wudu and run his fingers through his beard like the teeth of a comb (4).

The Third: The Hadith of Uthman, may Allah be pleased with him: That the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, used to run his fingers through his beard (6).

And he said once: Hadiths have been narrated regarding it, but no Hadith is established in it (2).

81 - Whoever leaves something untouched by water must repeat Wudu
It contains two Hadiths:
The First: The Hadith of Anas, may Allah be pleased with him, that a man came to the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, having performed Wudu but left on his feet [a dry spot] like the size of a fingernail. So the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said to him: "Go back and perform your Wudu well" (3).
Imam Ahmad said: Munkar (4).
The Second: The Hadith of Khalid bin Ma'dan from some of the Companions of the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, that he, peace and blessings be upon him, saw a man praying and on his foot was a shiny spot that water had not touched, so he ordered him to
foot_note:
1. (1) "Masa'il Abi Dawood" (1965).
2. "Masa'il Abi Dawood" (40), "Al-Talkhis Al-Habir" 1/87. Issue: Al-Shawkani said in "Al-Nayl": People differed regarding running fingers through the beard. The 'Itrah (Family of the Prophet), Al-Hasan bin Salih, Abu Thawr, and the Zahiris held it to be obligatory in Wudu and Ghusl. Malik, Al-Shafi'i, Al-Thawri, and Al-Awza'i held that running fingers through the beard is not obligatory in Wudu. Al-Shafi'i, Abu Hanifa and their companions, Al-Thawri, Al-Awza'i, Al-Layth, Ahmad, Ishaq, Dawood, Al-Tabari, and most scholars said: Running fingers through is obligatory in Ghusl for Janabah but not obligatory in Wudu.

Imam Ahmad said: It is not established (4).
And he said once: Weak (5).
And once: That, he did not authenticate it (6).

83 - Wudu with the leftover purification water of a woman
The Hadith of Ibn Abbas, may Allah be pleased with them both: "Water does not become Junub (impure)" (1).
Imam Ahmad said: I reject it due to the condition of Simak; no one narrates it other than him. And he said: There is severe disagreement in this; some of them elevate it [to the Prophet] and some of them do not elevate it (2).
And once: Imam Ahmad found a defect in it because it was narrated from Ikrimah as Mursal (3).
And he said once: Waki' narrated it to us in "Al-Musannaf" from Sufyan, from Simak, from Ikrimah, then later he attributed it to Ibn Abbas (4).

84 - What has been reported regarding the dislike of the leftover Wudu water of a woman
The Hadith of Al-Hakam bin Amr, may Allah be pleased with him, that the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, forbade that a man perform Wudu with the leftover purification water of a woman (5).
Imam Ahmad said: They are inconsistent in it from Shu'ba. It is not in the book of Gundar. Some of them say: 'From the leftover water (Su'r) of a woman,' and some of them say: 'Leftover Wudu water of a woman.' So they do not agree on it (6).

(1) Narrated by Al-Tirmidhi (65), he said: Qutaybah told us, Abu Al-Ahwas told us, from Simak, from Ikrimah, from Ibn Abbas, he said: Some of the wives of the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, performed Ghusl from a large bowl, then the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, wanted to perform Wudu [from it]. She said: O Messenger of Allah, I was Junub. He said: "Water does not become Junub."

6. "Tanqih Al-Tahqiq" by Ibn Abd Al-Hadi 1/33.

85 - What has been reported regarding Wudu due to laughter in prayer
It contains two Hadiths:
The First: The Hadith of Abu Al-Aliyah, may Allah be pleased with him: "Whoever laughs should repeat the Wudu and the prayer" (1).
Imam Ahmad said: There is no authentic Hadith regarding laughter (2). And he said once: Weak (3). And once he rejected it as Mursal (4).
The Second: The Hadith of Ibrahim Al-Nakha'i, similar to it (5).
Imam Ahmad said: Waki' said: Al-A'mash said: I think Ibrahim mentioned it. And Ibn Mahdi said: Sufyan said: Al-A'mash did not hear the Hadith of Ibrahim regarding laughter.

2. "Masa'il Salih" (1142), "Masa'il Abi Dawood" (90), (91), "Al-Talkhis Al-Habir" 1/115, "Al-Mughni" 1/240, "Al-Tahqiq" by Ibn Al-Jawzi 2/50, "Tanqih Al-Tahqiq" 1/174.
3. "Masa'il Salih" (924), "Al-Mughni" 1/240.
4. "Masa'il Salih" (1322), "Sharh Ilal Al-Tirmidhi" 187.
5. Narrated by Al-Daraqutni 1/171, he said: Abu Bakr Al-Naysaburi told us, Ali bin Harb told us, Abu Mu'awiyah told us, Al-A'mash told us, from Ibrahim, he said: A blind man came while the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, was in prayer, and he stumbled and fell into a well, so they laughed. The Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, ordered whoever laughed to repeat the Wudu and the prayer.

Ahmad said: We heard that Ibrahim heard it from Abu Hashim Al-Rummani. And he said: Ibn Abi Dhi'b narrated it from Al-Zuhri, from the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, as Mursal (1).

86 - What has been reported regarding drying [with a towel] after Wudu
The Hadith of Aisha, may Allah be pleased with her: The Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, had a cloth with which he dried himself after Wudu (2).
Imam Ahmad said: This Hadith is Munkar Munkar (very denounced) (3).

text:
87 - What one says when finishing his Wudu
The Hadith of Abu Sa'id Al-Khudri, may Allah be pleased with him: "Whoever performs Wudu and says: Glory be to You, O Allah, and with Your praise; I bear witness that there is no god but You; I seek Your forgiveness and repent to You" (1).
Imam Ahmad said: Hushaym did not hear it from Abu Hashim (2).
foot_note:
1. (1) Narrated by Al-Nasa'i in "Amal al-Yawm wa al-Laylah" p. 173 (81), he said: Yahya bin Muhammad bin Al-Sakan informed us, he said: Yahya bin Kathir Abu Ghassan told us, he said: Shu'ba told us, he said: Abu Hashim told us, from Abu Mijlaz, from Qais bin Abbad, from Abu Sa'id in a Marfu' form. I say: Al-Darimi narrated it 2/546 via the path of Hushaym, he said: Abu Hashim told us, but without the specific citation [the Dua].
2. "Al-Ilal" narration of Abdullah (2153). I say: A supplication following Wudu has been established in Muslim (234) from the Hadith of Omar, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said: "There is no one among you who performs Wudu and perfects the Wudu, then says: 'I bear witness that there is no god but Allah, and that Muhammad is the servant of Allah and His Messenger,' except that the eight gates of Paradise are opened for him, to enter from whichever he wills." I say: Some scholars have criticized this Hadith, including Al-Tirmidhi and Ibn Al-Qayyim in "Al-Manar Al-Munif", and they said: Nothing regarding the supplication following Wudu is authentic.

88 - What has been reported regarding Wudu from camel meat
The Hadith of Wudu from camel meat contains two narrations: The narration of Al-Bara bin Azib (1), and the narration of Jabir bin Samura, may Allah be pleased with them both (2).
Imam Ahmad said: Both are Sahih (authentic) (3). And he said: This chapter is more authentic than the chapter of touching the penis (4).
foot_note:
1. (1) Narrated by Ibn Majah (494), he said: Abu Bakr bin Abi Shaybah told us, Abdullah bin Idris and Abu Mu'awiyah told us, they said: Al-A'mash told us, from Abdullah bin Abdullah, from Abdul-Rahman bin Abi Layla, from Al-Bara bin Azib, he said: The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, was asked about Wudu from camel meat, so he said: "Perform Wudu from it."
2. Narrated by Muslim (360), he said: Abu Kamil Fudayl bin Al-Husain told us, Abu Awana told us, from Uthman bin Abdullah bin Mawhab, from Ja'far bin Abi Thawr, from Jabir bin Samura, he said: The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, ordered us to perform Wudu from camel meat and not to perform Wudu from sheep meat.
3. "Masa'il Abdullah" from Imam Ahmad (59), "Al-Tamhid" 3/349, "Al-Talkhis Al-Habir" 1/116, "Al-Fatawa" 21/260, "Al-Mughni" 1/251-252, "Tabaqat Al-Hanabila" 1/289. Benefit: Ibn Taymiyyah said in "Al-Fatawa" 21/15: Ahmad, may Allah have mercy on him, used to wonder at the one who abandons the Hadith of Wudu from camel meat despite its authenticity which has no doubt and lack of opposing evidence, yet performs Wudu from touching the penis despite the conflicting Hadiths regarding it, even though its chains are not like the Hadiths of Wudu from camel meat.
4. "Masa'il Abi Dawood" (1890).

89 - What has been reported regarding Wudu from what fire has changed
The Hadith of Zaid bin Thabit, may Allah be pleased with him: "Wudu is from what fire has changed."
Imam Ahmad recounted the disagreement regarding Ma'mar, where he said: Abdul-A'la told us, from Ma'mar, from Al-Zuhri, from Kharijah bin Zaid bin Thabit, from Zaid bin Thabit (1) in a Marfu' form.
Then he said (2): Abdul-Razzaq told us. He said: I read in the book of Ma'mar, from Al-Zuhri, from Abdul-Malik bin Abi Bakr, from Kharijah, from Zaid in a Marfu' form (3).
And he said once: Al-Zuhri narrated five Sahih Hadiths with trustworthy men regarding it (4).
And from Abdullah bin Ahmad, from his father: No report is established according to me regarding this (5).
foot_note:
1. (1) Narrated by Ahmad 5/190, he said: Abdul-A'la told us from Ma'mar, with it.
2. Narrated by Ahmad 5/189 (21647), he said: Abdul-Razzaq told us, with it.
3. "Al-Ilal narration of Abdullah" (5282). I say: In the second narration, he added Abdul-Malik bin Abi Bakr. So the narration of Abdul-Razzaq is preferred over the narration of Abdul-A'la; because the presence of an intermediary is an indication of lack of direct hearing, and Ma'mar's narration from the people of Iraq contains errors, and Abdul-A'la is one of them. Also, Ma'mar was corroborated by Uqayl regarding the addition of: Abdul-Malik, in Muslim.
4. "Masa'il Ibn Hani" (44). I say: Muslim narrated in his "Sahih" several Hadiths via the path of Al-Zuhri (351) and following.
5. "Dhayl Tabaqat Al-Hanabila" 1/299 Al-Obeikan edition. I say: All Hadiths that came regarding Wudu from what fire touched are abrogated; because the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, ate sheep meat then prayed and did not perform Wudu, and it is in the two Sahihs. Al-Hafiz said in "Al-Fath" 1/311: The consensus settled that there is no Wudu from what fire touched.

text:
90 - What has been reported regarding leaving Wudu from what fire has changed
The Hadith of Jabir, may Allah be pleased with him: Bread and meat were presented to the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, so he ate, then called for Wudu water and performed Wudu with it, then prayed Zuhr. Then he called for the leftovers of his food and ate, then stood for prayer and did not perform Wudu (1).
Imam Ahmad said: Muhammad bin Al-Munkadir did not hear it from Jabir. It is actually the Hadith of Muhammad bin Uqayl (2) from Jabir; Ibn Al-Munkadir narrated it from Ibn Uqayl from Jabir (3).
foot_note:
1. (1) Narrated by Abu Dawood in his "Sunan" (191), he said: Ibrahim bin Al-Hasan Al-Khath'ami told us, Hajjaj told us, Ibn Jurayj said: Muhammad bin Al-Munkadir informed me, he said: I heard Jabir bin Abdullah saying: I presented to the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace... The Hadith.
2. Narrated by Al-Tirmidhi (80), he said: Ibn Abi Umar told us, Sufyan bin Uyaynah told us, he said: Abdullah bin Muhammad bin Uqayl told us, he heard Jabir, in a Marfu' form with it.
3. "Masa'il Ibn Hani" (2195). I say: And the text is established and authentic, for Al-Bukhari narrated (5404) from the Hadith of Ibn Abbas, may Allah be pleased with them both, who said: The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, ate meat from a shoulder blade then stood and prayed and did not perform Wudu.

91 - What has been reported regarding Wudu for the one who vomits
It contains two Hadiths:
The First: The Hadith of Aisha, may Allah be pleased with her: "Whoever vomits, has a nosebleed, or passes gas in his prayer should perform Wudu" (1).
Imam Ahmad said: This is how Ibn Ayyash narrated it. Ibn Jurayj only narrated it saying: From his father, and he did not hear from his father, and it does not contain Aisha nor the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace (2).
And he said once: The correct version is from Ibn Jurayj, from his father, from the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, as Mursal (3).
The Second: The Hadith of Abu Al-Darda, may Allah be pleased with him, that he [the Prophet], may Allah bless him and grant him peace, vomited and broke his fast, then performed Wudu (4).
It was said to Imam Ahmad: They were inconsistent regarding this Hadith. He said: Husain Al-Mu'allim narrated it excellently (5).

"Fragment from Sunan Al-Athram" (79).
5. "Nasb Al-Rayah" 1/97, "Al-Fatawa" 25/222, "Al-Tahqiq" by Ibn Al-Jawzi 2/11, "Tanqih Al-Tahqiq" 1/160. "Sunan Al-Athram" (p. 262) (105).

It contains four Hadiths:
The First: The Hadith of Busra, may Allah be pleased with her (1): "Whoever touches his penis, let him perform Wudu."
Imam Ahmad said: Authentic (Sahih) (2). And once: He used to go with it and choose it (3).
The Second: The Hadith of Umm Habiba, may Allah be pleased with her (4), similar to it.
Imam Ahmad said: Authentic (Sahih) (5). And once: It has a good (Hasan) chain (6). And once: It is the most authentic Hadith regarding touching the penis (7).
The Third: The Hadith of Jabir, may Allah be pleased with him (8), similar to it.

And he said once: The Hadith of Ali (3) is more established than the Hadith of Mu'awiyah in this chapter (4).

The Hadith of Ibn Abbas "Wudu is upon the one who sleeps while reclining" (5).
Imam Ahmad said: Why does Yazid Al-Dalani enter upon the companions of Qatada? And I saw him pay no attention to this Hadith (6).
And he said once: Weak (7).

text:
97 - What has been reported regarding the amount of sleep that does not invalidate Wudu
The Hadith of Anas, may Allah be pleased with him: The Companions of the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, used to wait for the late Isha prayer until their heads would nod, then they would pray and not perform Wudu (1).
Imam Ahmad said: Shu'ba, Sa'id, and Hisham differed regarding the Hadith of Anas, and all of them are trustworthy (2).
And he said once: Shu'ba never said: 'They used to lie down.' And Hisham said: 'They used to doze off.' Al-Khallal said: I said to Ahmad: The Hadith of Shu'ba 'they used to put their sides'? So he smiled and said: This is [unique] at once 'putting their sides' (3).
And he said once: There is nothing better than the Hadith of Anas, he said: The Companions of the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, used to sleep then pray and not perform Wudu (4).
And once: Thus Shu'ba said. And Hisham said: The Companions of the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, used to nod their heads. And Ibn Abi Aruba said: They put their sides. And he smiled and said: This is the one acted upon (5).
foot_note:
1. (1) Narrated by Abu Dawood (200), he said: Shadh bin Fayyad told us, Hisham Al-Dastuwa'i told us, from Qatada, from Anas... The Hadith. Shu'ba added in it from Qatada: We used to nod during the time of the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace. And in the wording of Muslim (125) from Shu'ba, from Qatada with the wording: They used to sleep then pray and not perform Wudu.
2. "Masa'il Abi Dawood" for Imam Ahmad (2014).
3. "Al-Talkhis Al-Habir" 1/119.
4. "Sunan Al-Athram" (p. 274) (142).
5. "Sunan Al-Athram" (p. 275) (142).

text:
98 - What has been reported regarding leaving Wudu from kissing
The Hadith of Aisha, may Allah be pleased with her: That the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, kissed his wives then went out to prayer and did not perform Wudu (1).
Imam Ahmad said: Munkar (2). And he said once: We see that it is a mistake, for Urwa mentioned in the Hadith is Urwa Al-Muzani, and he did not meet Aisha. And Ibrahim Al-Taimi also narrated it from Aisha, and his hearing from Aisha is not authentic (3).
foot_note:
1. (1) Narrated by Al-Tirmidhi (86), he said: Qutaybah, Hannad, Abu Kurayb, Ahmad bin Mani', Mahmud Ibn Ghaylan, and Abu Ammar told us, they said: Waki' told us, from Al-A'mash, from Habib bin Abi Thabit, from Urwa, from Aisha: That the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, kissed his wives then went out to prayer and did not perform Wudu.
2. Ibn Rajab in "Sharh Ilal Al-Tirmidhi" 2/651.
3. "Al-Mughni" 1/258.

text:
99 - Wudu for the Junub if he wants to sleep
The Hadith of Aisha: If he wanted to sleep while he was Junub, he would perform Wudu like his Wudu for prayer, then sleep (1).
Imam Ahmad said: Munkar (2).

100 - Regarding Wudu for the Junub if he wants to sleep or eat
The Hadith of Aisha, may Allah be pleased with her: The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, when he was Junub and wanted to eat or sleep, would perform Wudu like his Wudu for prayer (3).
Imam Ahmad said: Yahya bin Sa'id said: Shu'ba retracted his saying: 'Eat'. Ahmad said: And that is because no one else says it; it is only regarding sleeping (4).
foot_note:
1. (1) Narrated by Baqi bin Makhlad via the path of Abu Ishaq, from Abdul-Rahman bin Al-Aswad, from his father, he said: I asked Aisha how the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, used to do if he wanted to sleep while he was Junub? She said: He would perform Wudu like his Wudu for prayer then sleep.
2. Ibn Rajab in "Sharh Al-Bukhari" 1/362. I say: And the text is authentic, supported by many Hadiths in the two Sahihs, among them what Al-Bukhari narrated (288) from the Hadith of Aisha, may Allah be pleased with her, she said: The Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, when he wanted to sleep while he was Junub, would wash his private part and perform Wudu for prayer.
3. Narrated by "Muslim" (305), he said: Abu Bakr bin Abi Shaybah told us, Ibn Ulayyah, Waki', and Gundar told us, from Shu'ba, from Al-Hakam, from Ibrahim, from Al-Aswad, from Aisha, she said: The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, when he was Junub and wanted to eat or sleep, would perform Wudu like his Wudu for prayer.
4. Ibn Rajab in "Sharh Al-Bukhari" 1/350.

book_title: The Comprehensive Collection of Imam Ahmad's Sciences - Defects of Hadith

text:
101 - The Junub, if he wants to eat or drink, washing his hands
The Hadith of Aisha, may Allah be pleased with her: And if he wanted to eat or drink, he would wash his hands (1).
Imam Ahmad said: Weak (2).

102 - Wudu from the place trodden upon (Mawti')
The Hadith of Ibn Mas'ud, may Allah be pleased with him: We used not to perform Wudu from a place trodden upon (3).
Imam Ahmad said: Hushaym did not hear this from Al-A'mash, nor did Al-A'mash from Abu Wa'il (4).
And he said once: Al-A'mash used to practice Tadlis (concealment), he did not hear this Hadith from Abu Wa'il. Muhanna said: I said to him: From whom is it? He said: Al-A'mash used to narrate it from Al-Hasan bin Amr Al-Fuqaimi from Abu Wa'il, so he dropped Al-Hasan bin Amr and made it from Abu Wa'il, and he did not hear it from him (5).
foot_note:
1. (1) Narrated by Ahmad in "Al-Musnad" 6/102, he said: Sakan bin Nafi' told us, he said: Salih bin Abi Al-Akhdar told us, from Al-Zuhri, he said: Abu Salama bin Abdul-Rahman informed me that Aisha said: The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, when he wanted to sleep while he was Junub, would perform Wudu like his Wudu for prayer, and if he wanted to eat or drink, he would wash his hands then eat or drink if he wished.
2. Ibn Rajab in "Sharh Al-Bukhari" 1/352.
3. Narrated by Abu Dawood (204), he said: Hannad bin Al-Sari and others told us, from Abu Mu'awiyah, from Al-A'mash, from Abu Wa'il, from Ibn Mas'ud, with it.
4. "Jami' Al-Tahsil" 294, "Al-Ilal" by Abdullah (2155).
5. "Jami' Al-Tahsil" 294.

text:
Chapter of Wiping over the Khuffs (Leather Socks)

103 - What has been reported regarding wiping over the Khuffs
It contains three Hadiths:
The First: The Hadith of Omar, may Allah be pleased with him: We used to wipe while we were with our Prophet (1).
Imam Ahmad said regarding this Hadith: I ask Allah for safety. And he said: Shu'aib bin Ishaq heard this Hadith from Sa'id bin Abi Aruba at the very last breath (2).
The Second: The Hadith of Al-Mughira bin Shu'ba, may Allah be pleased with him, containing: And he wiped his head, and wiped over his Khuffs (3).
Imam Ahmad said: I heard Yahya bin Sa'id, and the Hadith of Al-A'mash from Muslim, from Masruq, from Al-Mughira bin Shu'ba was mentioned in his presence twice or three times, and Yahya denounced it most severely.
foot_note:
1. (1) Narrated by Ibn Majah (546), he said: Imran bin Musa Al-Laythi told us, Muhammad bin Sawa' told us, Sa'id bin Abi Aruba told us, from Ayyub, from Nafi', from Ibn Omar that he saw Sa'd bin Malik wiping over the Khuffs, so he said: Do you do this? So we gathered at Omar's, and Sa'd said to Omar: Give a verdict to my nephew regarding wiping over the Khuffs. Omar said: We used to [wipe] while we were with the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace... and he mentioned the Hadith.
2. "Su'alat Abi Dawood" (2), "Masa'il Abi Dawood" (1844).
3. Narrated by Muslim (274), he said: Abu Bakr bin Abi Shaybah and Abu Kurayb told us, Abu Bakr said: Abu Mu'awiyah told us, from Al-A'mash, from Muslim, from Masruq, from Al-Mughira bin Shu'ba, he said: I was with the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, on a journey, so he said: "O Mughira, take the water vessel." So I took it, then I went out with him. The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, went until he disappeared from me, so he relieved himself. Then he came wearing a tight-sleeved Syrian cloak. He tried to bring his hand out of its sleeve but it was too tight for him, so he brought his hand out from under it. I poured water for him, so he performed Wudu like his Wudu for prayer, then he wiped over his Khuffs then prayed.

text:
Abdullah bin Ahmad said to his father: Who corroborated him? He said: More than one, I think among them are Abdul-Wahid (1) bin Ziyad and Abu Ziyad Al-Khalqani. Meaning: Ismail bin Zakariya. Imam Ahmad said: Ibn Al-Sabbah narrated it to us from him. Abdullah said: My father told me, he said: Abdul-Razzaq told us, he said: Sufyan told us, from Al-A'mash, from Muslim as Mursal (2). My father said: So I wondered at Yahya and his denouncement of it (3).
The Third: The Hadith of Jarir bin Abdullah, may Allah be pleased with him, Jarir urinated then performed Wudu and wiped over the Khuffs (4). Then he said: I saw the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, do like this.
Imam Ahmad said: This is not from the Hadith of Mughira; this is the Hadith of Al-A'mash (5). This Sheikh erred regarding Abu Awana (6).
foot_note:
1. (1) Narrated by Al-Bukhari (5798), he said: Qais bin Hafs told us, Abdul-Wahid told us, Al-A'mash told us, he said: Abu Al-Duha told me, he said: Masruq told me, he said: Al-Mughira told me, in a Marfu' form with it.
2. "Musnad Ahmad" 4/247, he said: Abdul-Razzaq told us, Sufyan informed us, from Al-A'mash, from Abu Al-Duha, from Al-Mughira, in a Marfu' form with it.
3. "Al-Ilal" narration of Abdullah (4523).
4. Narrated by Al-Khatib in his "Tarikh" 5/327, he said: Al-Hasan bin Abi Bakr informed us, Abdullah bin Ishaq Al-Baghawi informed us, Abdullah bin Ahmad bin Hanbal told us, they said: Muhammad bin Salam Al-Jumahi told us, Abu Awana told us, from Mughira, from Ibrahim, from Hammam, he said: Jarir urinated... The Hadith.
5. Narrated by Al-Bukhari (387), he said: Adam told us, he said: Shu'ba told us from Al-A'mash, he said: I heard Ibrahim narrating from Hammam bin Al-Harith, he said: I saw Jarir... The Hadith.
6. "Tarikh Baghdad" 6/327.

text:
104 - What has been reported regarding purification before wearing the Khuff
The Hadith of Abu Huraira, may Allah be pleased with him, in: "I put them in while they were pure" (1).
Imam Ahmad said: Weak (2).

105 - What has been reported regarding wiping the top of the Khuffs and their bottom
The Hadith of Al-Mughira bin Shu'ba, may Allah be pleased with him: That the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, wiped the top of the Khuff and its bottom (3).
Imam Ahmad said: It is not a Hadith that is established according to us (4).
And he said once: This Hadith is weak (5).
And he said once: As for Al-Walid, he added in it (Al-Mughira) and made it: Thawr from Raja', and Thawr did not hear from Raja'; because Ibn Al-Mubarak said in it: From Thawr, I was told from Raja'. This corrupts this Hadith due to what was mentioned of the defect in its chain (6).
foot_note:
1. (1) Narrated by Ahmad 2/358, he said: Muhammad bin Abdullah bin Al-Zubayr told us, Aban bin Abdullah Al-Bajali told us, a Mawla of Abu Huraira told us, from Abu Huraira, he said: The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said: "Perform Wudu for me." So I brought him Wudu water and he performed Istinja', then put his hand in the soil and wiped it, then washed it, then performed Wudu and wiped over his Khuffs. I said: O Messenger of Allah, you did not wash your feet. He said: "I put them in while they were pure."
2. Ibn Rajab in "Sharh Ilal Al-Tirmidhi" 2/796. I say: But the basis of the condition of purity is established as in Al-Bukhari (206).
3. Narrated by Al-Tirmidhi (97), he said: Abu Al-Walid told us, Al-Walid told us, Thawr told us, from Raja' bin Haywah, from the scribe of Al-Mughira, from Al-Mughira bin Shu'ba that the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, wiped the top of the Khuff and its bottom.
4. "Masa'il Salih for Ahmad" (271), (544), "Tarikh Baghdad" 2/135.
5. "Nasb Al-Rayah" 1/181, "Al-Talkhis Al-Habir" 1/159.
6. "Al-Tamhid" 1/14, 11/147.
