text:
And he said once: This is from a weak aspect; narrated by Raja' bin Haywah from Rawad the scribe of Al-Mughira, and he did not meet him (1).

106 - Wiping over the Khuffs for the traveler and the resident
It contains five Hadiths:
The First: The Hadith of Awf bin Malik, may Allah be pleased with him: The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, ordered us to wipe for three days and their nights for the traveler and a day and a night for the resident (2).
Imam Ahmad said: This Hadith is the best Hadith on wiping over the Khuffs; because it was in the Battle of Tabuk, which was the last battle the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, fought, and it was his last action (3).
And he said once: Timing is what I affirmed regarding wiping over the Khuffs. It was said: Do you hold this view? He said: Yes (4).
foot_note:
1. (1) "Al-Mughni" 1/377, "Jami' Al-Tahsil" p. 175, "Tanqih Al-Tahqiq" 1/194. Issue: Al-Tirmidhi said regarding wiping the top of the Khuff and its bottom: This is the saying of more than one of his Companions, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, the Tabi'in, and the jurists after them. This is the view of Malik, Al-Shafi'i, and Ishaq. Ibn Abd Al-Barr said in "Al-Istidhkar": Malik's opinion did not vary that wiping over the Khuffs involves putting one hand under the Khuff and the other on top of it, except that he does not see repetition for the one who limited himself to the tops of the Khuffs except within the time. As for Al-Shafi'i, he stated that wiping the bottom of the Khuff does not suffice, and wiping its top only suffices. Abu Hanifa said: One wipes only the top.
2. Narrated by Ahmad 6/27, he said: Hushaym told us, he said: Dawood bin Amr informed us, from Busr bin Ubaydullah, from Abu Idris, from Awf bin Malik: The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, ordered us to wipe... The Hadith.
3. "Nasb Al-Rayah" 1/163, "Tanqih Al-Tahqiq" 1/187.
4. "Al-Mughni" 1/365.

text: The Second: The Hadith of Ibn Umar, similar to it (1). Imam Ahmad denounced it and said: Ibn Umar criticized Sa'd for wiping, so how could he have a narration regarding it (2). The Third: The Hadith of Khuzaimah bin Thabit (may Allah be pleased with him), similar to it. Imam Ahmad said: Wakie' narrated it from Sufyan, from Mansur and Hammad, from Ibrahim, from Abu Abdullah Al-Jadali, from Khuzaimah bin Thabit (3). No one said 'Mansur' except Wakie', and Ahmad did not consider Wakie' to be precise in this. Ahmad said: When Shu'bah said: 'Al-Hakam (4) and Hammad', it became known that the Hadith is the Hadith of Al-Hakam (5). And once: It was said to Imam Ahmad: Is Abu Abdullah Al-Jadali known? He said: Yes, a known man, and he declared him trustworthy (Thiqah) (6). And once: Ibrahim Al-Nakha'i did not hear from Abu Abdullah Al-Jadali regarding wiping (7).
foot_note:
1. (1) Narrated by Al-Tabarani in 'Al-Awsat' 5/11 (4530), he said: Abdan bin Muhammad Al-Marwazi told us, he said: Qutaibah bin Sa'id told us, he said: Humaid bin Abdur-Rahman Al-Ru'asi told us, from Al-Hasan Al-Qassab, from Nafi', from Ibn Umar, raised [to the Prophet].
2. Ibn Rajab in 'Sharh Ilal Al-Tirmidhi' 2/797.
3. Narrated by Ahmad 5/214, he said: Wakie' told us, from Sufyan, from Hammad and Mansur, from Ibrahim, from Abu Abdullah Al-Jadali, from Khuzaimah bin Thabit, raised [to the Prophet].
4. Narrated by Abu Dawood (157), he said: Hafs bin Umar told us, Shu'bah told us, from Al-Hakam and Hammad, from Ibrahim, from Abu Abdullah Al-Jadali, from Khuzaimah bin Thabit, raised [to the Prophet].
5. 'Masa'il Harb' p. 452.
6. Previous source.
7. 'Marasil Ibn Abi Hatim' (8).

publisher: Dar Al-Falah for Scientific Research and Heritage Verification, Faiyum - Arab Republic of Egypt
text: The Fourth: The Hadith of Ali bin Abi Talib (may Allah be pleased with him): The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) set three days and their nights for the traveler, and a day and a night for the resident (1). Imam Ahmad said, when asked about this Hadith: Is it authentic as Marfu' (traceable to the Prophet)? He said: Yes, it is Marfu' (2). And he said once: The best of Hadiths regarding wiping is the Hadith of Shuraih from Aisha (3). The Fifth: The Hadith of Abu Hurayrah (may Allah be pleased with him): Similar to it (4). Imam Ahmad said: It is weak. And he said: Abu Hurayrah denies wiping over the Khuff (leather socks), so a narration regarding it is not authentic from him (5).
foot_note:
1. (1) Narrated by Muslim (276), he said: Ishaq bin Ibrahim Al-Hanzali told us, Abdur-Razzaq informed us, Al-Thawri informed us, from Amr bin Qais Al-Mula'i, from Al-Hakam bin Utaibah, from Al-Qasim bin Mukhaymirah, from Shuraih bin Hani', who said: I came to Aisha asking her about wiping over the Khuff. She said: Go to Ibn Abi Talib and ask him, for he used to travel with the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him). So we asked him, and he said: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) set three days... and he mentioned it.
2. 'Min Su'alat Abi Bakr Al-Athram li-Ahmad' (7).
3. 'Tanqih Al-Tahqiq' by Ibn Abd Al-Hadi 1/186. I say: There is disagreement over whether this Hadith is Marfu' (raised to the Prophet) or Mawquf (stopped at the Companion), and Ahmad preferred it to be Marfu'.
4. Narrated by Ibn Majah (555), he said: Abu Bakr bin Abi Shaybah and Abu Kuraib told us, they said: Zaid bin Al-Hubab told us, he said: Umar bin Abdullah bin Abi Khath'am Al-Thamali told us, he said: Yahya bin Abi Kathir told us, from Abu Salamah, from Abu Hurayrah. He said: They said: O Messenger of Allah, what is the purification regarding the Khuff? He said: 'For the traveler three days and their nights, and for the resident a day and a night.'
5. 'Sharh Ilal Al-Tirmidhi' 2/797.

text: 107 - What has been narrated regarding wiping over socks (Jawrabayn) and sandals (Na'layn). It contains two Hadiths: The First: The Hadith of Al-Mughirah bin Shu'bah (may Allah be pleased with him) that the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) performed ablution and wiped over the socks and sandals (1). Imam Ahmad said: This Hadith is weak (2). He said once: This is not narrated except from the Hadith of Abu Qais. And he said: Abdur-Rahman bin Mahdi refused to narrate it, saying it is Munkar (denounced); only Abu Qais narrates it (3). And he said once: What is known from the Prophet (peace be upon him) is that he wiped over the Khuff (leather socks); this is only from Abu Qais, and he has Munkar items (4). The Second: The Hadith of Aws bin Abi Aws (may Allah be pleased with him): He performed ablution and wiped over his sandals and feet (5). Imam Ahmad said: Hushaym did not hear this from Ya'la (6).
foot_note:
1. (1) Narrated by Abu Dawood (159), he said: Uthman bin Abi Shaybah told us, from Wakie', from Sufyan, from Abu Qais Al-Awdi, from Huzail, from Al-Mughirah bin Shu'bah that the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) performed ablution and wiped over the socks and the sandals.
2. 'Nasb Al-Rayah' 1/184, 'Tanqih Al-Tahqiq' 1/196.
3. 'Al-Ilal' by Abdullah bin Ahmad bin Hanbal (5612), 'Sunan Al-Bayhaqi' 1/283-284.
4. 'Ilal Al-Marwazi wa Ghayrihi' (417).
5. Narrated by Abu Dawood (161), he said: Musaddad and Abbad bin Musa told us, they said: Hushaym told us, from Ya'la bin Ata, from his father. Abbad said: He said: Aws bin Abi Aws Al-Thaqafi informed me that the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him)... And Abbad said: I saw the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) come to the waste disposal area (Kizamah) of a people—meaning the ablution place—and Musaddad did not mention the ablution place or the waste disposal area, then they agreed: so he performed ablution... the Hadith.
6. 'Al-Tahqiq' by Ibn Al-Jawzi 1/271, 'Tanqih Al-Tahqiq' 1/271.

publisher: Dar Al-Falah for Scientific Research and Heritage Verification, Faiyum - Arab Republic of Egypt
text: 108 - What has been narrated regarding wiping over turbans ('Asa'ib) and foot warmers (Tasakhin). The Hadith of Thawban (may Allah be pleased with him): The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) sent a detachment and they encountered cold, so the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) commanded them to wipe over the turbans and foot warmers (1). Imam Ahmad said: It is not appropriate that Rashid heard from Thawban, because he [Thawban] died a long time ago (2). And he said once: Wiping over the turban has been narrated from five paths from the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him). It was said to him: Do you adopt it? He said: Yes (3).
foot_note:
1. (1) Narrated by Ahmad 5/277, he said: Yahya bin Sa'id told us, from Thawr, from Rashid bin Sa'd, from Thawban, raised [to the Prophet].
2. 'Nasb Al-Rayah' 1/165, 'Jami' Al-Tahsil' (181).
3. 'Tanqih Al-Tahqiq' 1/262-263.

book_title: The Comprehensive Collection of the Sciences of Imam Ahmad - Defects of Hadith
publisher: Dar Al-Falah for Scientific Research and Heritage Verification, Faiyum - Arab Republic of Egypt
text: 109 - What has been narrated regarding wiping over splints (Jaba'ir). There are two paths from Ali bin Abi Talib (may Allah be pleased with him): The First: The path of Asim bin Damrah from him that he (peace be upon him) wiped over the splints (1). Imam Ahmad said regarding it: False (Batil), there is nothing of this; who narrated this? Meaning Al-Marwazi said: They mentioned it from the companion of Al-Zuhri, and he spoke about it with harsh words (2). The Second: The path of Al-Husain from him, similar to it. Imam Ahmad said: Amr bin Khalid, who narrates the Hadith of the two forearm bones (Zandain) (3), is a liar and narrates fabricated Hadiths from Zaid bin Ali (4).
foot_note:
1. (1) Mentioned by Al-Marwazi in 'Al-Ilal' (270) from the path of Abdur-Razzaq from Ma'mar, from Abu Ishaq, from Asim bin Damrah, from Ali, from the Prophet (peace be upon him) that he wiped over splints.
2. 'Ilal Al-Marwazi' (270), 'Al-Talkhis Al-Habir' 1/146.
3. Narrated by Ibn Majah (657), he said: Muhammad bin Aban told us, Abdur-Razzaq told us, Isra'il informed us, from Amr bin Khalid, from Zaid bin Ali, from his father, from his grandfather, from Ali who said: One of my forearm bones broke, so I asked the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) and he commanded me to wipe over the splint. Benefit: Abdullah mentioned in 'Al-Ilal' (3944) that he asked Yahya bin Ma'in about this Hadith, and he said: False (Batil), Ma'mar never narrated it. I heard Yahya say: A garlanded, covered sacrificial camel is upon him if Ma'mar ever narrated this; this is false. If Abdur-Razzaq had narrated this he would have been lawful to kill. Who narrated this from Abdur-Razzaq? They said to him: So-and-so. He said: No, by Allah, Ma'mar did not narrate it, and there is a pilgrimage upon him from here—meaning the mosque—to Mecca if Ma'mar narrated this. Then Abdullah said: And they narrate this Hadith from Isra'il, from Amr bin Khalid, from Zaid bin Ali, from his fathers, from Ali, and he mentioned it. He said: And Amr bin Khalid's Hadith is worth nothing. I say: Meaning the path of Asim bin Damrah returns to the path of Amr bin Khalid, and regarding the Hadith of Amr bin Khalid, Abu Hatim said in 'Al-Ilal': False, it has no basis.
4. 'Al-Du'afa lil-Uqayli' 3/269, 'Tahdhib Al-Kamal' 21/605, 'Tahdhib Al-Tahdhib' 4/334, 'Bahr Al-Dam' (758).

book_title: The Comprehensive Collection of the Sciences of Imam Ahmad - Defects of Hadith
publisher: Dar Al-Falah for Scientific Research and Heritage Verification, Faiyum - Arab Republic of Egypt
text: 110 - What has been narrated regarding the lack of a time limit in wiping over the Khuff. The First: The Hadith of Ubayy bin Umarah (may Allah be pleased with him): O Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him), may I wipe over the Khuff? He said: "Yes, for a day, or two days, and three" (1). Imam Ahmad said: The Hadith of Ubayy bin Umarah is not of known chain (2). And he said once: His narrators are not known (3). The Second: The Hadith of Maimunah (may Allah be pleased with her), she said: I said: O Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him), does a person wipe over the Khuff every hour and not remove them? He said: "Yes" (4). Imam Ahmad said: That is from a book (5).
foot_note:
1. text: Chapters on Tayammum (Dry Ablution) 111 - What has been narrated regarding Tayammum with a single strike. The Hadith of Ammar (may Allah be pleased with him): "It is sufficient for you to do like this," so he struck the palm of his hand once (1). Imam Ahmad said: Authentic (Sahih) (2). And he said once: There is nothing in my heart against it (3). And he said once: If what Abu Mu'awiyah narrated is true—he narrated from Al-A'mash from Shaqiq regarding the story, saying: a strike for the face and the hands. And Abdul-Wahid and Ya'la followed him in that, so the objection of singularity regarding this phrasing is removed (4).
foot_note:
1. (1) Narrated by Al-Bukhari (347), he said: Muhammad bin Salam told us, he said: Abu Mu'awiyah informed us, from Al-A'mash, from Shaqiq, who said: I was sitting with Abdullah and Abu Musa. Abu Musa said to him: If a man becomes Junub (impure) and does not find water for a month, does he not perform Tayammum and pray? So how do you deal with this verse in Surah Al-Ma'idah {And if you do not find water, then seek clean earth}? Abdullah said: If a concession were made for them in this, they would soon, if the water became cold for them, perform Tayammum with earth. I said: Indeed, you disliked this for this reason? He said: Yes. Abu Musa said: Did you not hear the statement of Ammar to Umar: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) sent me for a need and I became Junub and did not find water, so I rolled in the earth as an animal rolls. I mentioned that to the Prophet (peace be upon him) and he said: "It is sufficient for you to do like this," and he struck his palm once, then shook it off, then wiped the back of his hand with his left or the back of his left with his palm, then wiped his face with them... the Hadith.
2. Ibn Rajab in 'Sharh Al-Bukhari' 2/61.
3. Ibn Rajab in 'Sharh Al-Bukhari' 2/291, 'Masa'il Ibn Hani' (61).
4. Ibn Rajab in 'Sharh Al-Bukhari' 2/290.

text: And he said once: The narration of Abu Mu'awiyah from Al-A'mash regarding prioritizing the wiping of the hands over the face is a mistake (1). 112 - What has been narrated regarding Tayammum with two strikes. The Hadith of Ibn Umar (may Allah be pleased with them both): He struck the wall with his hands and wiped his face with them, then he struck another strike and wiped his forearms (2). Imam Ahmad said: This Hadith is Munkar (denounced); it is not Marfu' (traceable to the Prophet), and Muhammad bin Thabit Al-Abdi was not followed in it (3). And he said once: It is not authentic; it is only from Ibn Umar, and it is Munkar according to them (4). And he said once: The Hadiths of the two strikes are very weak (5).
foot_note:
1. (1) Ibn Rajab in 'Sharh Al-Bukhari' 2/292.
2. Narrated by Abu Dawood (330), he said: Ahmad bin Ibrahim Al-Mawsili Abu Ali informed us, Muhammad bin Thabit Al-Abdi informed us, Nafi' informed us, he said: I set out with Ibn Umar for a need to Ibn Abbas. Ibn Umar finished his need, and from his speech that day was that he said: A man passed by the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) in one of the alleyways while he had come out from defecation or urination. He greeted him, but he did not return the greeting until the man was about to disappear in the alley. He struck the wall with his hands and wiped his face with them, then he struck another strike and wiped his forearms, then he returned the greeting to the man and said: "Indeed, nothing prevented me from returning the greeting to you except that I was not upon purification."
3. 'Sunan Abu Dawood' (330), 'Su'alat Abi Dawood' (504), Ibn Rajab in 'Sharh Al-Bukhari' 2/41, 'Al-Talkhis Al-Habir' 1/151, 'Masa'il Ibn Hani' (110), 'Tanqih Al-Tahqiq' 1/219.
4. 'Al-Mughni' by Ibn Qudamah 1/246.

text: 113 - What has been narrated regarding Tayammum up to the armpits, shoulders, and elbows. The Hadith of Ammar (may Allah be pleased with him): Regarding Tayammum up to the armpits and shoulders (1). Imam Ahmad said: It is nothing; they differed in its chain, and Al-Zuhri used to be apprehensive about it, and I do not see the practice being based upon it (2). And he said once: Whoever says that Tayammum is up to the elbows, it is only something he added from himself (3). And he said once: How excellent it is! He marveled at it, and said: How excellent it is (4).
foot_note:
1. (1) Narrated by Imam Ahmad in 'Al-Musnad' 4/263-264, he said: Ya'qub told us, my father told us, from Salih, from Ibn Shihab, who said: Ubaidullah bin Utbah told me, from Ibn Abbas, from Ammar who said: The concession of purification with clean earth was revealed, so the Muslims stood with the Prophet (peace be upon him) and struck the earth with their hands, then raised their hands and did not clasp anything of the dust. They wiped their faces and their hands with them up to the shoulders, and from the palms of their hands to the armpits.
2. 'Sharh Al-Bukhari' by Ibn Rajab 2/57.
3. 'Zad Al-Ma'ad' 1/200.
4. 'Sunan Al-Bayhaqi' 1/210. I say: Abu Dawood narrated it, number (328), he said: Musa bin Ismail told us, Aban told us, he said: Qatadah was asked about Tayammum in travel, so he said: A narrator told me, from Al-Sha'bi, from Abdur-Rahman bin Abza, from Ammar bin Yasir that the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: "To the elbows."

text: 114 - What has been narrated regarding Tayammum for the Funeral (Janazah). The Hadith of Ibn Abbas (may Allah be pleased with them both): "If the funeral takes you by surprise and you are without ablution, perform Tayammum" (1). Imam Ahmad said: This Hadith is Munkar; every Hadith raised by Mughirah is Munkar. He said once: This was narrated by Ibn Juraij and Abdullah (2) from Ata as his saying; Ibn Abbas is not in it, and these are more reliable than him (3). 115 - What has been narrated regarding Tayammum for the menstruating woman and the woman in post-natal bleeding. The Hadith of Abdullah bin Umar (may Allah be pleased with them both) (4): A man cannot find water; can he have intercourse with his wife? He said: "Yes." Imam Ahmad said: This is the Hadith of Muthanna bin Al-Sabah (5); it is as if he denounced it from the

text: Hadith of Hajjaj (1). 116 - What has been narrated regarding Tayammum for the Junub (person in major impurity). The Hadith of Abdullah bin Amr (may Allah be pleased with them both): "O Amr, you prayed with your companions while you were Junub" (2). Imam Ahmad said: Its chain is not connected (3).
foot_note:
1. = Hawd told us, from Sufyan Al-Thawri, from Al-Muthanna bin Al-Sabah, from Amr bin Shu'aib, from Sa'id bin Al-Musayyib, from Abu Hurayrah who said: A Bedouin came to the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) and said: We are in the sands and among us are the menstruating woman, the Junub, and the woman in post-natal bleeding, and four months pass over us where we do not find water. He said: "Use the earth," meaning: Tayammum.
1. 'Ilal Ahmad' narration of Abdullah (1724).
2. 'Musnad Ahmad' 4/203, he said: Hasan bin Musa told us, Ibn Lahi'ah told us, Yazid bin Abi Habib told us from Imran bin Abi Anas, from Abdur-Rahman bin Jubair, from Amr bin Al-Aas who said: I had a wet dream on a cold night in the campaign of Dhat Al-Salasil, and I feared that if I bathed I would perish, so I performed Tayammum and then prayed the Morning Prayer with my companions. They mentioned that to the Prophet (peace be upon him), so he said: "O Amr, you prayed with your companions while you were Junub?" So I informed him of what prevented me from bathing and I said: I heard Allah say: {And do not kill yourselves. Indeed, Allah is to you ever Merciful} [An-Nisa: 29]. So I performed Tayammum then prayed. The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) laughed.
3. Ibn Rajab in 'Sharh Al-Bukhari' 2/79.

text: Chapters on Menstruation 117 - What has been narrated regarding undoing the hair of the menstruating woman. The Hadith of Aisha (may Allah be pleased with her): "Undo your hair and bathe" (1). Imam Ahmad said: This is false (Batil) (2). And he said once: Munkar (denounced) (3). And he said once: Whoever narrated it as (Undo your Umrah) has erred, and he narrated it according to the meaning he understood (4).
foot_note:
1. (1) Narrated by Ibn Majah (641), he said: Abu Bakr bin Abi Shaybah and Ali bin Muhammad told us, they said: Wakie' told us, from Hisham bin Urwah, from his father, from Aisha that the Prophet (peace be upon him) said to her while she was menstruating: "Undo your hair and bathe." Ali said in his narration: "Undo your head."
2. 'Masa'il Ibn Hani' (2331).
3. Ibn Rajab in 'Sharh Al-Bukhari' 1/476, 'Sharh Ilal' (109) and added: Abu Bakr Al-Khallal said: Ahmad only denounced such abbreviation which disturbs the meaning, not the principle of abbreviating Hadith.
4. 'Fath Al-Bari' by Ibn Rajab 1/478. The origin of the Hadith is established; Al-Bukhari narrated it (319) via Ibn Shihab, from Urwah, from Aisha, who said: We went out with the Prophet (peace be upon him) in the Farewell Pilgrimage. Some of us assumed Ihram for Umrah and some of us assumed Ihram for Hajj. We arrived at Mecca, and the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: "Whoever assumed Ihram for Umrah and did not bring a sacrificial animal, let him dissolve it. And whoever assumed Ihram for Umrah and brought a sacrificial animal, let him not dissolve it until he slaughters his animal. Whoever assumed Ihram for Hajj, let him complete his Hajj." She said: So I menstruated and remained menstruating until the Day of Arafah, and I had not assumed Ihram except for Umrah. So the Prophet (peace be upon him) commanded me to undo my head, comb my hair, assume Ihram for Hajj, and leave the Umrah. So I did that until I completed my Hajj, then he sent Abdur-Rahman bin Abi Bakr with me and commanded me to perform Umrah in place of my [previous] Umrah from Al-Tan'im.

text: 118 - What has been narrated regarding what is permitted with a menstruating woman. The Hadith of Anas bin Malik (may Allah be pleased with him): "Do everything except intercourse" (1). Imam Ahmad said: Hammad bin Salamah used to not praise or commend anything from his Hadith except this Hadith due to its excellence (2).
foot_note:
1. (1) Narrated by Muslim (302), he said: Zuhair bin Harb told me, Abdur-Rahman bin Mahdi told us, Hammad bin Salamah told us, Thabit told us, from Anas that the Jews, when a woman among them menstruated, would not eat with her or associate with them in their houses. So the companions of the Prophet (peace be upon him) asked the Prophet (peace be upon him), and Allah Almighty revealed {And they ask you about menstruation. Say, "It is harm, so keep away from wives during menstruation..."} to the end of the verse. So the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: "Do everything except intercourse." This reached the Jews, so they said: This man does not want to leave anything of our affairs except that he opposes us in it. Usayd bin Hudair and Abbad bin Bishr came and said: O Messenger of Allah, indeed the Jews say such and such; should we not have intercourse with them? The face of the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) changed until we thought that he was angry with them. So they left and were met by a gift of milk for the Prophet (peace be upon him), so he sent after them and gave them drink. So they knew that he was not angry with them.
2. 'Musnad Ahmad' 3/132.

text: 119 - What has been narrated regarding the expiation for approaching a menstruating woman. The Hadith of Ibn Abbas (may Allah be pleased with them both) regarding the one who approaches his wife while she is menstruating: he should give a dinar or half a dinar in charity (1). Imam Ahmad said: Abdur-Rahman did not raise it [to the Prophet], nor did Bahz (2). He said once: How excellent constitutes the Hadith of Abdul-Hamid regarding it. I said: Do you adopt it? He said: Yes (3). And he said once: If the Hadith were authentic, we would see an expiation in it. It was said to him: Do you have some reservation about it? He said: Yes, because it is from the Hadith of so-and-so—I think he said: Abdul-Hamid (4). And he said once: There is no harm in it; people have narrated from him (5). And once: He narrated it in 'Al-Musnad' as Mursal (hurried/disconnected) via the path of Sufyan, then said: And Sharik said from Ibn Abbas.
foot_note:
1. (1) Narrated by Ahmad 1/229-230, he said: Yahya told us, from Shu'bah. And Muhammad bin Ja'far, Shu'bah told us, from Al-Hakam, from Abdul-Hamid bin Abdur-Rahman, from Miqsam, from Ibn Abbas, from the Prophet (peace be upon him) regarding the one who approaches his wife while she is menstruating, he said: "He gives a dinar or half a dinar in charity."
2. 'Musnad Ahmad' 1/230, 'Al-Tahqiq' by Ibn Al-Jawzi 2/178, 'Tanqih Al-Tahqiq' 1/232.
3. 'Masa'il Abi Dawood' (177), 'Al-Tamhid' 3/175, 'Tanqih Al-Tahqiq' 1/233.
4. 'Sunan Al-Bayhaqi Hashiyat Ibn Al-Turkumani' 1/318-319, 'Al-Mughni' by Ibn Qudamah 1/351, 'Bada'i Al-Fawa'id' by Ibn Al-Qayyim 4/94.
5. 'Al-Mughni' by Ibn Qudamah 1/351.

text: 120 - What has been narrated regarding the Junub and the menstruating woman reciting the Quran. There are two Hadiths in it: The First: The Hadith of Ali bin Abi Talib (may Allah be pleased with him): The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) used to come out from the toilet and recite the Quran and eat meat with us, and nothing blocked him from the Quran except Janabah (sexual impurity) (1). Imam Ahmad weakened this Hadith (2). And he said once: No one narrated 'the Junub does not read' except Shu'bah, from Amr bin Murrah, from Abdullah bin Salamah, from Ali (3). The Second: The Hadith of Ibn Umar (may Allah be pleased with them both): "The menstruating woman and the Junub do not read anything of the Quran" (4). Imam Ahmad said: This is false (Batil), and he denounced it against Ismail bin Ayyash (5). And he said once: The Hadiths of prohibition of the Quran for the Junub and the menstruating woman are not strong (6).

2. 'Al-Talkhis Al-Habir' 1/139, 'Tanqih Al-Tahqiq' 1/137.

5. 'Al-Ilal' narration of Abdullah (5675), 'Du'afa Al-Uqayli' 1/90, 'Nasb Al-Rayah' 1/278, 279, 'Al-Talkhis Al-Habir' 1/138, 'Siyar A'lam Al-Nubala' 8/322, 'Tahdhib Al-Tahdhib' 1/206, 'Al-Mizan' 1/242, 'Tanqih Al-Tahqiq' 1/35.

text: 121 - What has been narrated regarding the pregnant woman seeing blood. The Hadith of Aisha (may Allah be pleased with her): "If the pregnant woman sees blood, she refrains from prayer" (1). Imam Ahmad said: Yahya did not hear it from Amrah (2). 122 - What has been narrated regarding the minimum and maximum of menstruation. The Hadith of Abu Umamah (may Allah be pleased with him): "The minimum menstruation is three and the maximum is ten" (3). Imam Ahmad said: The raised (Marfu') Hadiths regarding this are false (Batil), and likewise those stopped (Mawquf) at the Companions (4).

1. (1) Narrated by Al-Bayhaqi in 'Al-Sunan' 7/423 via the path of Zakariya bin Adi, from Abdullah bin Umar, from Yahya bin Sa'id, from Amrah, from Aisha with it.
2. I say: Many Hadiths have been reported in this chapter, including the Hadith of Ibn Mas'ud, Wathilah bin Al-Asqa', Mu'adh bin Jabal, Abu Sa'id Al-Khudri, and others.
3. Narrated by Al-Tabarani in 'Al-Kabir' 8/129, he said: Ahmad bin Bashir Al-Tayalisi told us, Al-Fadl bin Ghanim told us, Hassan bin Ibrahim told us, from Abdul-Malik, from Al-Ala' bin Al-Harith, from Makhul, from Abu Umamah, raised [to the Prophet].

text: 123 - What has been narrated regarding the Mustahadah (woman with irregular bleeding), her bath, and her prayer. The Hadith of Fatimah bint Qais (may Allah be pleased with her): "She counts the days of her cycles, then she bathes every day at every purification and prays" (1). Imam Ahmad said: It is not authentic, or it has no basis. Meaning the Hadith of Ja'far bin Sulaiman from Ibn Juraij (2). And he said once: This is nothing (3).
foot_note:
1. (1) Narrated by Al-Daraqutni 1/219, he said: Abdullah bin Muhammad bin Abdul-Aziz told us, Qatan bin Nusair Al-Ghubari told us, Ja'far bin Sulaiman told us, Ibn Juraij told us, from Abu Al-Zubair, from Jabir bin Abdullah: That Fatimah bint Qais asked the Prophet (peace be upon him) about the Mustahadah woman, what should she do? He said: "She counts the days of her cycles, then she bathes every day at every purification and prays." Al-Daraqutni said: He erred in it; it is only Fatimah bint Abi Hubaish. I say: And it has been said: The name of Abu Hubaish is Qais. As for the Hadith of Fatimah bint Hubaish, Al-Bukhari narrated it (306) and Muslim narrated it (333), saying: Abu Bakr bin Abi Shaybah and Abu Kuraib told us, they said: Wakie' told us, from Hisham bin Urwah, from his father, from Aisha who said: Fatimah bint Abi Hubaish came to the Prophet (peace be upon him) and said: O Messenger of Allah, I am a woman who experiences Istihadah (irregular bleeding) and I do not become pure; should I leave the prayer? He said: "No, that is only a vein and not the menstruation. When the menstruation comes, leave the prayer, and when it goes, wash the blood from yourself and pray."
2. 'Al-Ilal' by Abdullah (4122).
3. 'Masa'il Salih' (507).

text: 124 - What has been narrated regarding the Mustahadah performing ablution for every prayer. The Hadith of Fatimah bint Abi Hubaish (may Allah be pleased with them both): "That is only a vein and not the menstruation. Avoid prayer during the days of your menstruation, then bathe and perform ablution for every prayer, even if blood drips onto the mat" (1). Imam Ahmad said: Munkar (denounced) (2). 125 - The Mustahadah combining prayers with one bath. The Hadith of Hamnah bint Jahsh (may Allah be pleased with her): "It is only a kick from Satan, so menstruate for six days or seven days, in the knowledge of Allah, then bathe" (3). Imam Ahmad said: It is a Good Authentic (Hasan Sahih) Hadith (4).
foot_note:
1. (1) Narrated by Ibn Majah (624), he said: Ali bin Muhammad and Abu Bakr bin Abi Shaybah told us, they said: Wakie' told us, from Al-A'mash, from Habib bin Abi Thabit, from Urwah bin Al-Zubair, from Aisha who said: Fatimah bint Abi Hubaish came to the Prophet (peace be upon him) and said: O Messenger of Allah, I am a woman who experiences Istihadah and I do not become pure; should I leave the prayer? He said: "No, that is only a vein and not the menstruation. Avoid prayer during the days of your menstruation, then bathe and perform ablution for every prayer, even if blood drips onto the mat."
2. Ibn Rajab in 'Sharh Ilal Al-Tirmidhi' 348. I say: The Hadith has a witness in 'Sahih Al-Bukhari' (309) from the Hadith of Aisha (may Allah be pleased with her) that some of his wives performed I'tikaf with the Prophet (peace be upon him) while she was Mustahadah seeing blood, and perhaps she put a basin under her for the blood.
3. Narrated by Al-Tirmidhi (128), he said: Muhammad bin Bashar told us, Abu Amir Al-Aqadi told us, Zuhair bin Muhammad told us, from Abdullah bin Muhammad bin Aqil, from Ibrahim bin Muhammad bin Talhah, from his paternal uncle Imran bin Talhah, from his mother Hamnah bint Jahsh, who said: I used to have a very severe menstruation... the Hadith.

text: And he said once: The Hadith of Ibn Aqil, there is something in my soul regarding it (1). And he said once: According to me, it is not at that level; the Hadith of Fatimah is stronger to me and more authentic in chain than it (2). And he said once: It is nothing. And most of his companions reported from him that he weakened it. Al-Khallal said: He returned to strengthening it and adopting it (3). And he said once: We adopt it; how excellent it is (4). And he said once: Ibn Juraij narrates it saying: 'I was told by Ibn Aqil' without hearing it, and he says: 'From Muhammad bin Abdullah bin Aqil', flipping his name. He said: They say Al-Nu'man bin Rashid agreed with him. He said: Ibn Juraij narrates from Al-Nu'man bin Rashid, and I do not see but that he heard it from him, and Al-Nu'man bin Rashid is not strong in Hadith; weakness is known in him (5). And he said once: Ibn Juraij said: 'I was told by Ibn Aqil Muhammad bin Abdullah bin Aqil', which is a mistake. He said: It is only Abdullah bin Muhammad bin Aqil. And he said: 'From Habibah bint Jahsh', contradicting the people (6).

text: 126 - What has been narrated regarding leaving prayer during the days of Istihadah. The Hadith of Umm Habibah (may Allah be pleased with her), and it contains the phrase: "When the menstruation comes, leave the prayer, and when it goes, bathe and pray" (1). Imam Ahmad said: This is a delusion from Al-Awza'i and Ibn Uyainah from Al-Zuhri (2). 127 - What has been narrated regarding when the menstruating woman bathes. The Hadith of Ibn Abbas (may Allah be pleased with them both): If she sees the heavy (Bahrani) blood, she does not pray, and if she sees purity for an hour, she should bathe and pray (3). Ahmad said: How excellent it is (4).
foot_note:
1. (1) Narrated by Abu Dawood (285), he said: Ibn Abi Aqil and Muhammad bin Salamah the Egyptians told us, they said: Ibn Wahb told us, from Amr bin Al-Harith, from Ibn Shihab, from Urwah bin Al-Zubair and Amrah, from Aisha that Umm Habibah bint Jahsh, the sister-in-law of the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) and the wife of Abdur-Rahman bin Awf, experienced Istihadah for seven years. She asked the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) for a ruling, so the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: "Indeed, this is not the menstruation, but this is a vein, so bathe and pray." Abu Dawood said: Al-Awza'i added in the Hadith from Al-Zuhri from Urwah and Amrah, from Aisha who said: Umm Habibah bint Jahsh experienced Istihadah for seven years, so the Prophet (peace be upon him) commanded her, saying: "When the menstruation comes, leave the prayer, and when it goes, bathe and pray."
2. Ibn Rajab in 'Sharh Al-Bukhari' 1/532.
3. Narrated by Al-Darimi 1/224 (800), he said: Muhammad bin Isa informed us, Ibn Ulayyah told us, Khalid informed us, from Anas bin Sirin who said: A woman from the family of Anas experienced Istihadah, so they ordered me, and I asked Ibn Abbas. He said: As for when she sees the heavy (Bahrani) blood, she does not pray. But if she sees purity, even for an hour of the day, she should bathe and pray.
4. 'Fath Al-Bari' by Ibn Rajab 2/176.

book_title: The Comprehensive Collection of Imam Ahmad's Sciences - Defects of Hadith

text:
128 - What has been reported regarding yellowish and brownish discharge outside of the days of menstruation
The Hadith of Aisha, may Allah be pleased with her: "We used not to count the yellowish and brownish discharge after purity (Tuhr) as anything" (1).
Imam Ahmad said: It is actually Qatada from Hafsa (2) from Umm Atiyyah (3).

129 - What has been reported regarding the Quru' (menstrual periods/purity periods) and menstruation
The Hadith of Aisha, may Allah be pleased with her: "Leave prayer during the days of your Quru'" (4).
Imam Ahmad said: Everyone who narrated this from Aisha has erred; because Aisha says the Quru' are the periods of purity (Athar), not menstruation (5).
foot_note:
1. (1) Narrated by Ahmad in "Al-Ilal" narration of Abdullah (1697), he said: Abdul-Rahman bin Mahdi told us, from Hammad bin Salama, from Qatada, from Umm Al-Huzayl, from Aisha, and he mentioned it.
2. Narrated by Abu Dawood (307), he said: Musa bin Ismail told us, Hammad informed us, from Qatada, from Umm Al-Huzayl, from Umm Atiyyah... The Hadith.
3. "Ilal Ahmad" narration of Abdullah (1697), and see "Masa'il Ibn Hani" (2091). I say: And the text is established and authentic, for Al-Bukhari narrated it (326) from the Hadith of Umm Atiyyah, she said: We used not to count brownish and yellowish discharge as anything.
4. Narrated by Al-Nasa'i 1/183, he said: Musa informed us, he said: Sufyan told us from Al-Zuhri, from Amra, from Aisha that the daughter of Jahsh had Istihadah (irregular bleeding) for seven years, so she asked the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, and he said: "It is not menstruation, rather it is a vein." So he ordered her to leave prayer for the duration of her Quru' and menstruation, and then to perform Ghusl and pray, so she used to perform Ghusl for every prayer.
5. Ibn Rajab in "Sharh Al-Bukhari" 1/530, "Sharh Ilal Al-Tirmidhi" (410).

book_title: The Comprehensive Collection of Imam Ahmad's Sciences - Defects of Hadith

text:
130 - What has been reported regarding the menstruating woman entering the mosque
The Hadith of Aisha, may Allah be pleased with her: "Hand me the Khumrah (small prayer mat)" (1).
Imam Ahmad was asked about Abdullah Al-Bahi's hearing from Aisha. He said: I do not see anything in this; he only narrated from Urwa. And he said regarding the Hadith of the Khumrah: Abdul-Rahman had heard it from Za'idah, so he used to omit 'Aisha told me' from it and denounce it (2).

131 - What has been reported regarding the menstruating woman avoiding the mosque
The Hadith of Aisha, may Allah be pleased with her: "I do not make the mosque lawful for a menstruating woman nor a Junub (person in state of major impurity)" (3).
Imam Ahmad said: Weak (4).
foot_note:
1. (1) Narrated by "Al-Darimi" 1/264, he said: Abu Al-Walid Al-Tayalisi informed us, Za'idah told us, Ismail Al-Suddi told us, from Abdullah Al-Bahi, he said: Aisha told me that the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, was in the mosque and said to the maidservant: "Hand me the Khumrah." She said: He wanted to spread it and pray on it. She said: She is menstruating. He said: "Verily, her menstruation is not in her hand."
2. "Marasil Ibn Abi Hatim" p. 115. I say: The text has an authentic corroboration, for Muslim narrated it (298) from the Hadith of Aisha, may Allah be pleased with her.
3. Narrated by Abu Dawood (232), he said: Musaddad told us, Abdul-Wahid bin Ziyad told us, Al-Aflat bin Khalifa told us, he said: Jasrah bint Dajajah told me, she said: I heard Aisha, may Allah be pleased with her, saying: The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, came while the doors of the houses of his companions opened into the mosque, so he said: "Turn these houses away from the mosque." Then the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, entered, and the people did nothing hoping that a concession would be revealed regarding them. Then he came out to them later and said: "Turn these houses away from the mosque, for I..." The Hadith.
4. "Tahdhib Al-Tahdhib" 1/232.

text:
Chapters on Ghusl (Ritual Bathing)

132 - What has been reported regarding covering oneself during Ghusl
The Hadith of Ya'la bin Ubayd, may Allah be pleased with him: "Verily Allah is Modest and Concealing, so if one of you wants to perform Ghusl, let him cover himself with something."
Imam Ahmad denied its continuity (Wasl) (1).

133 - What has been reported regarding not entering the water except with a waist wrapper (Mi'zar)
The Hadith of Jabir, may Allah be pleased with him: The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, forbade entering the water except with a waist wrapper (2).
Imam Ahmad said: Munkar (3).
foot_note:
1. (1) Ibn Rajab in "Sharh Al-Bukhari" 1/336. I say: And the Hadith is what Al-Nasa'i narrated 1/200, he said: Ibrahim bin Ya'qub informed me, he said: Al-Nufayli told us, he said: Zuhair told us, from Abdul-Malik bin Abi Sulayman, from Ata, from Safwan, from Ya'la bin Ubayd, from the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, that he saw a man performing Ghusl in the open, so he ascended the pulpit and praised Allah and extolled Him and said... The Hadith. I say: And it has an authentic corroboration in "Al-Bukhari" (280) from the Hadith of Umm Hani, she said: I went to the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, in the Year of the Conquest and found him performing Ghusl while Fatimah was screening him. He said: "Who is this?" I said: I am Umm Hani.
2. Narrated by Abu Ya'la 3/343, he said: Abdul-A'la told us, Hammad bin Shu'aib told us, from Abu Al-Zubayr, from Jabir in a Marfu' form with it.
3. Ibn Rajab in "Sharh Al-Bukhari" 1/39.

book_title: The Comprehensive Collection of Imam Ahmad's Sciences - Defects of Hadith
publisher: Dar Al-Falah for Scientific Research and Heritage Verification, Fayoum - Arab Republic of Egypt
text:
134 - What has been reported regarding the amount of water for Ghusl
The Hadith of Aisha, may Allah be pleased with her: The Sunnah from the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, regarding Ghusl from Janabah is a Sa' of eight Ratls, and regarding Wudu is two Ratls (1).
Imam Ahmad said: Batil (false) (2).

135 - What has been reported regarding the description of Ghusl and the addition of washing hands three times
The Hadith of Aisha, may Allah be pleased with her, that the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, performed Ghusl from Janabah, so he began by washing his hands three times (3).
Imam Ahmad said: This is a good (hasan) addition (4), meaning: (three times).
foot_note:
1. (1) Narrated by Al-Tabarani in "Al-Awsat" (339), he said: Ahmad bin Rishdin told us, he said: Yahya bin Sulayman Al-Ju'fi told us, he said: Salih bin Musa Al-Talhi told us, from Mansur bin Al-Mu'tamir, from Ibrahim, from Al-Aswad bin Yazid, from Aisha, with it. And Al-Daraqutni in "Al-Sunan" 2/128, 153, he said: Muhammad bin Al-Hasan Al-Naqqash told us, Ahmad bin Rishdin told us, with it.
2. "Masa'il Ibn Hani" (2161).
3. Narrated by Muslim (316), he said: Abu Bakr bin Abi Shaybah told us, Waki' told us, Hisham told us, from his father, from Aisha that the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, performed Ghusl from Janabah, so he began by washing his hands three times... The Hadith.
4. Ibn Rajab in "Sharh Al-Bukhari" 1/233. I say: And Abu Al-Fadl bin Ammar said: It is not preserved according to us. Ibn Rajab said: Mubarak bin Fadalah followed him - meaning Waki' - in mentioning the three times in washing the hands from Hisham. And Mubarak is not a Hafiz. Likewise, Ibn Lahi'ah narrated it, and he has poor memory, and also in the Hadith of Aisha, there is criticism.

book_title: The Comprehensive Collection of Imam Ahmad's Sciences - Defects of Hadith

text:
136 - What has been reported regarding Ghusl for the one who washes a dead body
The Hadith of Abu Huraira, may Allah be pleased with him: "Whoever washes a dead body, let him perform Ghusl" (1).
Imam Ahmad said: There is no established Hadith in it (2).
And he said once: The Hadith regarding it is not authentic, but he should perform Wudu (3).
And he said once: Nothing is authentic in this chapter (4).
And he said once: The correct view is that it is Mawquf (stopped) on Abu Huraira (5).
It was narrated from Aisha, and Imam Ahmad also weakened it (6).
foot_note:
1. (1) The Hadith is what Abu Dawood narrated (3161), he said: Ahmad bin Salih told us, Ibn Abi Fudayk told us, Ibn Abi Dhi'b told me, from Al-Qasim bin Abbas, from Amr bin Umair, from Abu Huraira in a Marfu' form with it.
2. "Masa'il Al-Imam Ahmad" narration of Abdullah (75-78), "Masa'il Abi Dawood" (1964).
3. "Masa'il Ahmad" narration of Salih (393), "Sunan Abi Dawood" 3/197 and he said: Wudu suffices him.
4. "Sunan Al-Bayhaqi" 1/301, "Al-Talkhis Al-Habir" 1/136, "Nasb Al-Rayah" 3/334, "Ilal Al-Tirmidhi Al-Kabir" 143, "Tanqih Al-Tahqiq" 1/180.
5. "Al-Mughni" by Ibn Qudamah 1/186, 210, "Tanqih Al-Tahqiq" 1/180.
6. Al-Hafiz in "Al-Talkhis" 1/137.

text:
137 - What has been reported regarding Ghusl from Cupping
The Hadith of Aisha, may Allah be pleased with her, that he used to order Ghusl for Janabah, Cupping, washing the dead, and on Friday (1).
Imam Ahmad said: That is a Munkar Hadith narrated by Mus'ab bin Shaybah; his Hadiths are Manakir (2).
And he said once: No Hadith is established in this (3).
And he said once: Weak (4).

138 - Going round to [all] wives with one Ghusl
The Hadith of Anas, may Allah be pleased with him, that the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, used to go round to his wives with one Ghusl (5).
Imam Ahmad said: From where did Miskin preserve from Shu'ba? (6).
foot_note:
1. (1) Narrated by Abu Dawood (3160), he said: Uthman bin Abi Shaybah told us, Muhammad bin Bishr told us, Zakariya told us, Mus'ab bin Shaybah told us, from Talq bin Habib, from Abdullah bin Al-Zubayr, from Aisha in a Marfu' form with it.
2. "Al-Du'afa" by Al-Uqayli 4/197, "Mukhtasar min Sunan Al-Athram" (82).
3. "Al-Ilal Al-Mutanahiyah" 1/377.
4. "Al-Talkhis Al-Habir" 1/137.
5. Narrated by Muslim (309), he said: Al-Hasan bin Ahmad bin Abi Shu'aib Al-Harrani told us, Miskin bin Bukayr told us, from Shu'ba, from Hisham bin Zaid, from Anas in a Marfu' form with it.
6. Ibn Rajab in "Sharh Al-Bukhari" 1/301, "Bahr Al-Dam" (979), "Al-Jarh Al-Ta'dil" 8/329. I say: And the text is established in Al-Bukhari (5215) from the Hadith of Anas, may Allah be pleased with him, he said: The Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, used to go round to his wives in one night, and he had nine wives at that time.

text:
139 - What has been reported regarding the Junub sleeping as he is without touching water
The Hadith of Aisha, may Allah be pleased with her, that the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, if he had a need with his family, he would fulfill it then sleep as he was without touching water (1).
Imam Ahmad said: Not authentic (2).
And he said once: Abu Ishaq narrated from Al-Aswad a Hadith in which he contradicted the people; no one said from Al-Aswad the like of what he said. If only he had attributed it to other than Al-Aswad (3).
foot_note:
1. (1) Narrated by Ibn Majah (582), he said: Abu Bakr bin Abi Shaybah told us, Abu Al-Ahwas told us, from Abu Ishaq, from Al-Aswad, from Aisha, she said about the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace: If he had a need with his family, he would fulfill it then sleep as he was without touching water.
2. "Al-Talkhis Al-Habir" 1/140.
3. "Al-Mughni" 1/229.

text:
140 - What has been reported regarding the meeting of the two circumcised parts
It has four paths from Aisha with the wording: "If he sits between her four parts and the circumcised part touches the circumcised part, then Ghusl becomes obligatory" or similar.
The First: From the path of Humayd bin Hilal from her (1).
The Second: From the path of Abdul-Aziz bin Al-Nu'man from her (2).
The Third: From the path of Al-Awza'i from Abdul-Rahman bin Al-Qasim, from his father, from her (3).
The Fourth: From the path of Abdullah bin Rabah from her (4).
The First: Imam Ahmad wondered at this Hadith and that Humayd bin Hilal narrated it with this chain (5).
foot_note:
1. (1) Narrated by Muslim (349), he said: Muhammad bin Al-Muthanna told us, Muhammad bin Abdullah Al-Ansari told us, Hisham bin Hassan told us, Humayd bin Hilal told us, from Abu Burdah and Abu Musa, from Aisha in a Marfu' form with it.
2. Narrated by Ahmad 6/123, he said: Affan told us, he said: Hammad bin Salama told us, he said: Thabit told us, from Abdullah bin Rabah, from Abdul-Aziz bin Al-Nu'man, from Aisha in a Marfu' form with it.
3. Narrated by Al-Tirmidhi (108), he said: Abu Musa Muhammad bin Al-Muthanna told us, Al-Walid bin Muslim told us, from Al-Awza'i, from Abdul-Rahman bin Al-Qasim, from his father, from Aisha, she said: In a Marfu' form with it.
4. Narrated by Ahmad 6/265, he said: Abdul-Wahhab told us, from Sa'id, from Qatada, from Abdullah bin Rabah that he entered upon Aisha and said: I want to ask you about something and I am shy of you. She said: Ask whatever appears to you, for I am only your mother. I said: O Mother of the Believers, what makes Ghusl obligatory? She said: If the two circumcised parts differ [meet], Janabah becomes obligatory.
5. Ibn Rajab in "Sharh Al-Bukhari" 1/368.

book_title: The Comprehensive Collection of Imam Ahmad's Sciences - Defects of Hadith

text:
As for the Second: Imam Ahmad denied its elevation [to the Prophet] and said: Abdul-Aziz bin Al-Nu'man is not known (1).
As for the Third: Imam Ahmad found a defect in it because it was narrated from Al-Awza'i as Mawquf, and the Marfu' part at the end of the Hadith was what Al-Awza'i used to narrate from Yahya bin Abi Kathir that it reached him from Aisha. Likewise, Ayyub narrated it from Abdul-Rahman bin Al-Qasim, from his father, from Aisha as Mawquf and did not elevate it (2).
As for the Fourth: He said: I do not know if there is anything in this Hadith or if Qatada used to say it (3).
foot_note:
1. (1) Ibn Rajab in "Sharh Al-Bukhari" 1/369.
2. Ibn Rajab in "Sharh Al-Bukhari" 1/370. I say: And the Hadith is established and authentic in the two Sahihs from other than the path of Aisha, may Allah be pleased with her. For Al-Bukhari narrated it (291) from the Hadith of Abu Huraira, may Allah be pleased with him, from the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, he said: "If he sits between her four parts and exerts himself, then Ghusl becomes obligatory."
3. "Musnad Ahmad" 6/265.

book_title: The Comprehensive Collection of Imam Ahmad's Sciences - Defects of Hadith
publisher: Dar Al-Falah for Scientific Research and Heritage Verification, Fayoum - Arab Republic of Egypt
text:
141 - What has been reported regarding 'Water is from water'
The Hadith of Ubayy bin Ka'b, may Allah be pleased with him: 'Water is from water' was only a concession in the beginning of Islam, then he forbade it.
Al-Zuhri narrated it from Sahl from Ubayy (1).
And Al-Zuhri narrated it saying: Some of those whom I approve told me, from Sahl, from Ubayy (2).
And Ahmad preferred this last narration (3).
foot_note:
1. (1) Narrated by Al-Tirmidhi (110), he said: Ahmad bin Mani' told us, Abdullah bin Al-Mubarak told us, Yunus bin Yazid informed us, from Al-Zuhri, from Sahl bin Sa'd, from Ubayy bin Ka'b... The Hadith.
2. Narrated by Abu Dawood (214), he said: Ahmad bin Salih told us, Ibn Wahb told us, Amr bin Al-Harith informed me, from Ibn Shihab, some of those whom I approve told me that Sahl bin Sa'd Al-Sa'idi informed him that Ubayy bin Ka'b informed him that the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, only made that a concession in the beginning of Islam due to scarcity of clothes, then he ordered Ghusl and forbade that.
3. Ibn Rajab in "Sharh Al-Bukhari" 1/380. I say: Ibn Abd Al-Barr mentioned in "Al-Tamhid" 23/111 from Al-Athram, he said: I said to Ahmad bin Hanbal: The Hadith of Husain Al-Mu'allim, from Yahya bin Abi Kathir, from Abu Salama, from Ata bin Yasar, from Zaid bin Khalid, he said: I asked five of the Companions of the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, Uthman bin Affan, Ali bin Abi Talib, Talha, Al-Zubayr, and Ubayy bin Ka'b, so they said: Is there a reason to reject 'water is from water'? He said: Yes, because the opposite is narrated from them. I said: From Uthman, Ali, and Ubayy bin Ka'b? He said: Yes. Ahmad bin Hanbal said: What I see is that if the circumcised part passes the circumcised part, then Ghusl becomes obligatory. It was said to him: You used to say other than this. He said: I do not know that I ever said other than this. It was said to him: That has reached us from you. He said: Allah is the One whose help is sought.

text:
Book of Prayer
Chapters on Prayer Times

142 - What has been reported regarding the virtue of the first time
The Hadith of Ibn Omar, may Allah be pleased with them both: "The first time of prayer is the pleasure of Allah, and the last time is the pardon of Allah" (1).
Imam Ahmad said: I do not know anything established in it. Meaning in this chapter (2).
foot_note:
1. (1) Narrated by Al-Tirmidhi (172), he said: Ahmad bin Mani' told us, Ya'qub bin Al-Walid Al-Madani told us, from Abdullah bin Omar, from Nafi', from Ibn Omar, he said: The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said... The Hadith.
2. "Al-Mughni" 1/404, "Nasb Al-Rayah" 1/344, "Al-Talkhis Al-Habir" 1/180, "Al-Tahqiq" by Ibn Al-Jawzi 2/244, "Tanqih Al-Tahqiq" 1/258. I say: Regarding the virtue of prayer at the first time, there is the Hadith of Ibn Mas'ud, may Allah be pleased with him, in Al-Bukhari (527) and in Muslim (139). Al-Bukhari, may Allah have mercy on him, said: Abu Al-Walid Hisham bin Abdul-Malik told us, he said: Shu'ba told us, he said: Al-Walid bin Al-Ayzur informed me, he said: I heard Abu Amr Al-Shaibani say: The owner of this house told us - and he pointed to the house of Abdullah - he said: I asked the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace: Which deed is most beloved to Allah? He said: "Prayer at its time." He said: Then which? He said: "Then dutifulness to parents." He said: Then which? He said: "Jihad in the cause of Allah." He said: He told me these, and if I had asked him for more, he would have increased me.

book_title: The Comprehensive Collection of Imam Ahmad's Sciences - Defects of Hadith
publisher: Dar Al-Falah for Scientific Research and Heritage Verification, Fayoum - Arab Republic of Egypt
text:
143 - What has been reported regarding the times of prayer
It contains two Hadiths:
First: The Hadith of Buraydah bin Al-Husaib, may Allah be pleased with him, in: "The time of your prayer is between what you have seen" (1).
Imam Ahmad said: I abandoned Abdul-Aziz bin Aban when he narrated the Hadith of the times (2).
Second: The Hadith of Jabir bin Abdullah: O Muhammad, this is the time of the Prophets before you,
foot_note:
1. (1) Narrated by Al-Uqayli in "Al-Du'afa" 3/16, he said: Muhammad bin Ismail told us, he said: Abdul-Aziz bin Aban Al-Qurashi Abu Khalid told us, he said: Sufyan told us, from Alqama bin Marthad, from Sulayman bin Buraydah, from his father that a man asked the Prophet, peace be upon him, about the times of prayer. He said to him: "Pray with us these two days." When the sun slipped [from its zenith], he ordered Bilal and he called the Adhan, then he ordered him and he established the Zuhr prayer. Then he ordered him and he established the Asr prayer while the sun was high, white and pure. Then he ordered him and he established the Maghrib prayer when the sun set. Then he ordered him and he established the Isha prayer when the twilight disappeared. Then he ordered him and he established the Fajr prayer when dawn appeared. Then on the second day, he ordered him so he delayed the Zuhr prayer and cooled it well. And he prayed Asr while the sun was high, delaying it beyond what it was. And he prayed Maghrib before the twilight disappeared. And he prayed Isha after a third of the night had passed. And he prayed Fajr when it became very bright. Then he said: "Where is the questioner about the time of prayer?" The man said: It is me, O Messenger of Allah. He said: "The time of your prayer is between what you have seen."
2. "Kitab Al-Ilal" by Abdullah bin Ahmad bin Hanbal (1519), (5326), "Al-Du'afa" by Al-Uqayli 3/16, "Al-Kamil" by Ibn Adi 5/288, "Bahr Al-Dam" (626), "Tarikh Baghdad" 10/445, "Al-Jarh wa Al-Ta'dil" by Ibn Abi Hatim 5/377, "Tahdhib Al-Tahdhib" 3/456, "Tahdhib Al-Kamal" 18/109. I say: And the Hadith is established and authentic in "Sahih Muslim" (613), he said: Zuhair bin Harb and Ubaydullah bin Sa'id told me, both of them from Al-Azraq. Zuhair said: Ishaq bin Yusuf Al-Azraq told us, Sufyan told us, from Alqama bin Marthad, from Sulayman bin Buraydah, from his father, from the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, that a man... The Hadith.

book_title: The Comprehensive Collection of Imam Ahmad's Sciences - Defects of Hadith
publisher: Dar Al-Falah for Scientific Research and Heritage Verification, Fayoum - Arab Republic of Egypt
text:
and the time is what is between these two times (1).
Imam Ahmad said: This Hadith is not Munkar, because Al-Husain bin Ali who narrated it was agreed with by others regarding some of its descriptions (2).

144 - What has been reported regarding delaying Fajr until it is bright (Isfar)
The Hadith of Hawwa' Al-Ansariyyah, may Allah be pleased with him [her]: "Perform Fajr when it is bright, for it is greater in reward" (3).
Imam Ahmad said: This is a Mursal Hadith (4).
foot_note:
1. (1) Narrated by Al-Tirmidhi (150), he said: Ahmad bin Muhammad bin Musa informed me, Abdullah bin Al-Mubarak informed us, Husain bin Ali bin Husain informed us, Wahb bin Kaysan informed me, from Jabir bin Abdullah, may Allah be pleased with him, from the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, he said: "Gabriel led me in prayer at the House twice. He prayed Zuhr the first time when the shadow was like the strap of a sandal. Then he prayed Asr when everything was like its shadow. Then he prayed Maghrib when the sun set and the fasting person broke his fast. Then he prayed Isha when the twilight disappeared. Then he prayed Fajr when dawn broke and food became forbidden for the fasting person. And he prayed the second time Zuhr when the shadow of everything was like it..." The Hadith.
2. "Masa'il Abdullah" for Imam Ahmad (179), "Sharh Ilal Al-Tirmidhi" 1/281, "Fath Al-Bari" by Ibn Rajab 3/15. Benefit: Ibn Rajab said: The rule of Imam Ahmad is that what a trustworthy person narrates alone, he pauses regarding it until he is corroborated. If he is corroborated, its Nakarah (being denounced) is removed. This is the rule of Yahya Al-Qattan, Ibn Al-Madini, and others.

145 - What has been reported regarding cooling (delaying) the Zuhr prayer
It contains four Hadiths:
The First: The Hadith of Al-Mughira bin Shu'ba, may Allah be pleased with him: "Cool the prayer, for the severity of heat is from the rage of Hell" (1).
Imam Ahmad said: This Hadith is Gharib (strange) (2). And it was said to Imam Ahmad: Ibn Al-Himmani narrated this Hadith from you. He said: A liar, I did not narrate it to him. And he said: Strike out the Hadith of Al-Himmani (3). And once: Ahmad denied it, and said: I did not narrate it to him. And he said: There is nothing of this. It was said: He claimed that this was during a discussion (Mudhakara). So he said: And I knew in the days of Ismail that this was with me. Meaning: I only brought it out later. And he said: Tell Harun Al-Hammal to strike out the Hadiths of Al-Himmani (4).
foot_note:
1. (1) Narrated by Imam Ahmad in his "Musnad" 4/250, he said: Ishaq bin Yusuf Al-Azraq told us, from Sharik, from Bayan bin Bishr, from Qais bin Abi Hazim, from Al-Mughira bin Shu'ba, he said: We were praying with the Prophet of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, the Zuhr prayer at midday heat, so the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said to us: "Cool the prayer, for the severity of heat is from the rage of Hell."
2. "Al-Ilal" by Abdullah (4577), "Al-Du'afa" by Al-Uqayli 4/413, "Al-Jarh wa Al-Ta'dil" 9/169.
3. "Al-Ilal" by Abdullah (4077), "Al-Kamil fi Al-Du'afa" 4/20, 7/238, "Al-Du'afa" by Al-Uqayli 4/413, "Su'alat Abi Ubaid Al-Ajurri li Abi Dawood" (1967), "Tabaqat Al-Hanabila" 1/41, "Tarikh Baghdad" 14/172, "Al-Jarh wa Al-Ta'dil" 9/169.
4. "Tarikh Baghdad" 14/171-173, "Tahdhib Al-Tahdhib" 6/155-156, "Tahdhib Al-Kamal" 31/22-25, "Al-Siyar" 10/521, "Ilal Al-Marudhi" (234).

And Al-Maimuni mentioned from Ahmad that he preferred its authenticity (1).
Second: The Hadith of Abu Huraira: "The Fire complained to its Lord" (2).
Imam Ahmad said: Ibn Uyaynah erred in this Hadith; it is only from Abu Salama (3).
foot_note:
1. (1) Sheikh Al-Albani, may Allah have mercy on him, mentioned in "Al-Da'ifah" Hadith number (949) quoting from Al-Hafiz Al-Iraqi in "Tarh al-Tathrib" 2/154 in the narration of Al-Maimuni that they discussed with Ahmad bin Hanbal the Hadith of Al-Mughira bin Shu'ba, so he said: Good chains (Asanid Jiyad), and Allah knows best. I say: The text of the Hadith is established and authentic in the two Sahihs from the Hadith of Abu Huraira, may Allah be pleased with him, in Al-Bukhari (536), and in Muslim (615). Important Benefit: The attribution of strangeness (Gharaba) here is not directed at the narration of Al-Himmani, for Imam Ahmad narrated it without mentioning Al-Himmani. Ibn Adi mentioned in "Al-Kamil" quoting from Ibn Sa'id that Ishaq Al-Azraq used to narrate strange things from Sharik. Issue: Al-Hafiz said in "Al-Fath" 2/21: The majority of people of knowledge recommend delaying Zuhr in severe heat until the time cools down and the glare breaks, and some of them restricted it to the congregation. As for the individual, hastening is better in his right, and this is the saying of most Malikis and Al-Shafi'i as well, but he restricted it to hot lands and restricted the congregation to when they come to a mosque from a distance. So if they were gathered or were walking in shade, then hastening is better in their right. The famous view from Ahmad is equality without specification or restriction, and it is the saying of Ishaq, the Kufans, and Ibn Al-Mundhir.
2. Narrated by Al-Bukhari (536), he said: Ali bin Abdullah told us, he said: Sufyan told us, he said: We memorized it from Al-Zuhri, from Sa'id bin Al-Musayyib, from Abu Huraira, from the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, he said: "If the heat becomes severe, then cool the prayer, for the severity of heat is from the rage of Hell. And the Fire complained to its Lord saying: O Lord, parts of me have consumed other parts. So He permitted it two breaths: a breath in winter and a breath in summer. That is the most severe heat you find and the most severe cold (Zamharir) you find."
3. "Al-Muntakhab min Ilal Al-Khallal" by Ibn Qudamah (186). Benefit: Al-Hafiz said in "Al-Fath" 2/24 (adapted): Thus narrated by most of the companions of Sufyan =

text: Third: The Hadith of Jabir bin Abdullah, may Allah be pleased with him: We used to pray with the Messenger of Allah, and I would take a handful of pebbles in my hand and put it in my other hand until it cooled down, then prostrate on it due to the intense heat (1).
foot_note:
1. = from him - i.e., from Sa'id bin Al-Musayyib - and both paths are preserved. Al-Layth and Amr Ibn Al-Harith narrated it in Muslim, and Ma'mar and Ibn Jurayj in Ahmad, and Ibn Akhi Al-Zuhri and Usama Ibn Zaid in Al-Sarraj, all six of them from Al-Zuhri from Sa'id and Abu Salama, both from Abu Huraira. Al-Daraqutni said in "Al-Ilal" 9/390-294: Both sayings are preserved from Al-Zuhri. Sheikh Tariq bin Awadullah, may Allah preserve him, said in the commentary on "Al-Muntakhab" by Ibn Qudamah that Imam Ahmad's faulting of Ibn Uyaynah has a valid basis. That is because Ibn Uyaynah narrated from Al-Zuhri, from Sa'id, from Abu Huraira two texts both in one context. First: "If the heat becomes severe, then cool the prayer, for the severity of heat is from the rage of Hell." Second: "The Fire complained to its Lord saying: O Lord, parts of me have consumed other parts..." The Hadith. And the generality of Al-Zuhri's companions do not narrate the Hadith from Al-Zuhri like this; rather, they narrate the first text only from Sa'id and Abu Salama both from Abu Huraira. As for the second text, none of Al-Zuhri's companions narrated it from Sa'id; rather, Shu'aib bin Abi Hamza and Yunus bin Yazid narrated it from Al-Zuhri, from Abu Salama, from Abu Huraira. Except what is narrated from Ja'far bin Burqan where he followed Ibn Uyaynah in narrating the second text from Al-Zuhri from Sa'id, but Ja'far bin Burqan is nothing regarding Al-Zuhri. Thus, Ibn Uyaynah's contradiction to Al-Zuhri's companions becomes apparent, as he carried the second text on the chain of the first text from the Hadith of Sa'id and Abu Salama together, while the second is from the Hadith of Abu Salama only. With this, the piercing insight of Imam Ahmad, may Allah Almighty have mercy on him, becomes apparent. I say: And the Hadith: "The Fire complained" is established in Al-Bukhari number (3260) via the path of Abu Salama, from Abu Huraira, may Allah be pleased with him, in a Marfu' form with it.

147 - What has been reported regarding the time of Asr
The Hadith of Anas, may Allah be pleased with him: The Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, used to pray Asr while the sun was white and high (1).
Imam Ahmad said after mentioning this Hadith: I do not know this Abu Al-Abyad, nor do I know that anyone narrated from him except Rib'i bin Hirash (2).

148 - What has been reported regarding the Middle Prayer (Al-Salat Al-Wusta)
The Hadith of Abu Huraira, may Allah be pleased with him: "The Middle Prayer is the Asr prayer" (3).
Imam Ahmad said: It is not Abu Salih Al-Samman nor Badham. This is a Basran, I think he is Mizan. Meaning his name is Mizan Abu Salih (4). Meaning: The narrator mentioned in the Hadith.

149 - What has been reported regarding the sin of the one who leaves the Asr prayer
The Hadith of Buraydah Al-Aslami: "Whoever misses the Asr prayer, his deed has become null" (5).

151 - What has been reported regarding the time of Maghrib prayer
It contains two Hadiths:
The First: The Hadith of Al-Abbas bin Abdul-Muttalib: "My Ummah will not cease to be upon the Fitrah as long as they do not delay Maghrib until the stars are intertwined" (1).
Imam Ahmad said: Munkar (2).
The Second: The Hadith of Al-Sa'ib bin Yazid, similar to it (3).
Imam Ahmad said: This is a Gharib (strange) Hadith from the Hadith of Yazid bin Khusayfah Al-Madani. I do not know anyone who narrated it from him except Abdullah bin Al-Aswad, nor from Abdullah except Ibn Wahb (4).
foot_note:
1. (1) Narrated by Ibn Majah (689), he said: Muhammad bin Yahya told us, Ibrahim bin Musa told us, Abbad bin Al-Awwam informed us, from Omar bin Ibrahim, from Qatada, from Al-Hasan, from Al-Ahnaf bin Qais, from Al-Abbas bin Abdul-Muttalib, he said: The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said: "My Ummah will not cease to be upon the Fitrah..." The Hadith.
2. "Sharh Ilal Al-Tirmidhi" by Ibn Rajab p. 352, "Du'afa Al-Uqayli" 3/147, "Tahdhib Al-Kamal" 21/270, "Tahdhib Al-Tahdhib" 4/267. I say: The Hadith of Rafi' bin Khadij, which Al-Bukhari narrated (559), suffices regarding the time of Maghrib. He says: We used to pray Maghrib with the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, and one of us would leave and could see the spots where his arrows fell.
3. Narrated by Al-Tabarani in Al-Kabir 7/154, he said: Yahya bin Uthman bin Salih told us, Asbagh Ibn Al-Faraj told us, Ibn Wahb told us, Abdullah bin Al-Aswad Al-Qurashi told me, from Yazid bin Khusayfah, from Al-Sa'ib bin Yazid in a Marfu' form with it.

text: 152 - What has been narrated regarding the time of the last 'Isha prayer contains two Hadiths: The First: The Hadith of Al-Nu'man bin Bashir (may Allah be pleased with him): The time of the 'Isha prayer; he [the Prophet] (peace be upon him) (1) used to pray it at the time the moon sets on the third or fourth night. Imam Ahmad said: There is a Wahm (error/illusion) in it. Meaning in the mention of the fourth. Ibn Rajab said: This doubt is from Shu'bah; no one else mentioned the fourth (2). The Second: The Hadith of Ibn Umar (may Allah be pleased with them both): "The Shafaq (twilight) is the redness" (3). Ahmad said: Hushaym did not hear anything from Abdullah Al-Umari (4).
foot_note:
1. (1) Narrated by Ahmad in "Al-Musnad" 4/272, he said: Yazid told us, Shu'bah informed us, from Abu Bishr, from Bashir bin Thabit, from Habib bin Salim, from Al-Nu'man bin Bashir, raised [to the Prophet].
2. "Fath Al-Bari" by Ibn Rajab 3/256. Issue: Regarding the time of 'Isha, it begins with the disappearance of the red twilight until the rising of the true dawn; due to the Hadith of Abu Qatadah in Muslim: "There is no negligence in sleep; negligence is only upon the one who does not pray a prayer until the time of the other prayer comes." This is apparent in the extension of the time of every prayer until the entry of the time of the other prayer, except for the Fajr prayer, for it is excluded from this generality by consensus. As for the preferred time (Mukhtar) for 'Isha, it is until a third of the night or its half, due to the Hadith of Abu Hurayrah: "Were it not that I would impose hardship on my nation, I would have commanded them to delay 'Isha until a third of the night or its half." And the Hadith of Anas: The Prophet (peace be upon him) delayed 'Isha until half the night, then prayed. And the Hadith of Ibn Amr: The time of 'Isha prayer is until half the night. Among those who held the view of delaying 'Isha: Abu Hanifah and his companions, Al-Shafi'i in one of his two sayings, Ahmad, and Ishaq.
3. Narrated by Abd Al-Razzaq in his "Musannaf" 1/559. From the path of Abdullah bin Nafi', from his father, from Ibn Umar. I did not find it via the path of Hushaym.
4. "Ilal Abdullah" (2255), "Marasil Ibn Abi Hatim" 232.

text: 153 - What has been narrated regarding delaying the prayer beyond its time. The Hadith of Ubadah bin Al-Samit (may Allah be pleased with him): "Indeed, there will be leaders over you who will be occupied by things away from the prayer until they delay it beyond its time; so pray it at its time." He said: A man asked: O Messenger of Allah! If I catch it with them, should I pray? He said: "If you wish" (1). Imam Ahmad said: From Abu Ubayy the son of the wife of Ubadah bin Samit is the correct [chain] (2).

1. (1) Narrated by Ahmad in "Al-Musnad" 5/315, he said: Wakie' told us, Sufyan told us, from Mansur, from Hilal bin Yasaf, from Abu Al-Muthanna Al-Himsi, from Abu Ubayy the son of the wife of Ubadah bin Al-Samit, from Ubadah bin Al-Samit, raised [to the Prophet].
2. "Musnad Ahmad" 5/315. I say: Meaning it is Mursal (hurried/disconnected), and it contains some change in wording: O Messenger of Allah, shall we pray with them? He said: "Yes."

The Hadith of Malik bin Huwayrith (may Allah be pleased with him): "When you two set out, make the Adhan then the Iqamah, then let the oldest of you lead you in prayer" (1). Imam Ahmad said: I do not know of anyone who brought it except Khalid. Ibn Rajab said: Meaning regarding the Adhan and Iqamah during travel. And he said once: This is severe/difficult upon the people (2).

The Hadith of Abu Juhayfah (may Allah be pleased with him): I saw Bilal making Adhan while his two fingers were in his ears (1). Imam Ahmad said, when asked about inserting the two fingers into the ear: This is not in the Hadith. Ibn Rajab said: This indicates that the Hadith of Abu Juhayfah is not Mahfuz (preserved) [with this specific detail] (2). 158 - What has been narrated regarding Adhan before the time enters. The Hadith of Ibn Umar (may Allah be pleased with them both): "Verily the slave has slept" (3).
