publisher: Dar Al-Falah for Scientific Research and Heritage Verification, Fayoum - Arab Republic of Egypt
text: 406 - What came regarding the prohibition of singling out Saturday for fasting, the Hadith of As-Samma (may Allah be pleased with her): "Do not fast on Saturday except in what has been obligated upon you, and if one of you does not find anything but the bark of a grape or the stick of a tree, let him chew it" (1). Imam Ahmad said: Yahya bin Sa'id used to avoid it, meaning: narrating it to me, and I heard it from Abu Asim (2).
foot_note:
1. = At-Tirmidhi, Ibn Hibban, Al-Hakim, At-Tahawi, and Ibn Abd al-Barr, but those who are greater than them and more knowledgeable spoke about it, and they said: This is a Munkar Hadith. Among them are Ibn Mahdi, Imam Ahmad, Abu Zur'ah, and Al-Athram. Al-Athram said: All the Hadiths contradict it. He refers to the Hadiths of the Prophet (peace be upon him) fasting Sha'ban entirely and connecting it to Ramadan and his prohibition of anticipating Ramadan by two days, so the Hadith becomes anomalous (Shadh), contradicting the authentic Hadiths. At-Tahawi said: It is abrogated. And he narrated the consensus on abandoning acting upon it, and most scholars are of the view that it is not acted upon.
1. Reported by Abu Dawud (2423), he said: Humaid bin Mas'adah narrated to us, Sufyan bin Habib narrated to us, H. And Yazid bin Qubais from the people of Jablah narrated to us, Al-Walid narrated to us, all of them from Thawr bin Yazid, from Khalid bin Ma'dan, from Abdullah bin Busr As-Sulami, from his sister, and Yazid said: (As-Samma)... The Hadith.
2. "Al-Mughni" 4/428. I say: An-Nasa'i said: This Hadith is Muztarib (disordered). Malik said: This Hadith is a lie. Al-Awza'i said: I continued to conceal it until I saw it had become famous. Al-Hakim narrated from Az-Zuhri that when the Hadith was mentioned to him, he said: This is a Homsi Hadith. Abu Dawud said: This Hadith is abrogated. Refer to "At-Talkhis Al-Habir" 2/216.

book_title: The Collection of Imam Ahmad's Sciences - Ills of Hadith
publisher: Dar Al-Falah for Scientific Research and Heritage Verification, Fayoum - Arab Republic of Egypt
text: 407 - What came regarding being generous to the family on the day of Ashura, the Hadith of Ibn Mas'ud (may Allah be pleased with him): "Whoever is generous to his family on the day of Ashura, Allah will be generous to him for his year" (1). Imam Ahmad said: This Hadith is not authentic (2). And he said once: Something narrated by Sufyan, from Ja'far Al-Ahmar, from Ibrahim bin Muhammad bin Al-Muntashir, and in its chain is weakness (3). And once he did not see it as anything (4). And he said once: It has no basis, and it has no chain that is established except what Sufyan bin Uyainah narrated, from Ibrahim bin Muhammad bin Al-Muntashir, from his father (5).
foot_note:
1. (1) Reported by Al-Uqayli in "Ad-Du'afa" 3/252, he said: Abdul-Warith bin Ibrahim Al-Askari narrated to us, he said: Ali bin Muhajir Al-Absi narrated to us, he said: Haysam bin Ash-Shaddakh narrated to us, he said: Al-A'mash narrated to us, from Yahya bin Wathab, from Alqamah, from Abdullah, he said: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said... The Hadith.
2. "Al-Manar Al-Munif" p. 112.
3. "Masa'il Ibn Hani" (674), "Lata'if al-Ma'arif" p. 52.
4. "Al-Fatawa" by Ibn Taymiyyah 25/313, "Lata'if al-Ma'arif" p. 52. Benefit: Ibn Rajab said in "Lata'if al-Ma'arif" p. 52: Ahmad's saying that he did not see it as anything, he only meant the Hadith which is narrated as raised (Marfu') to the Prophet (peace be upon him), for its chain is not authentic, and it has been narrated from multiple modes, none of which are authentic. Also, Al-Uqayli said: Nothing is established in this from the Prophet (peace be upon him) except something narrated from Ibrahim bin Muhammad bin Al-Muntashir as Mursal (disconnected) with it.
5. "Minhaj as-Sunnah" 4/555, 7/39.

book_title: The Collection of Imam Ahmad's Sciences - Ills of Hadith
publisher: Dar Al-Falah for Scientific Research and Heritage Verification, Fayoum - Arab Republic of Egypt
text: 408 - What came regarding the virtue of I'tikaf (seclusion in the mosque), the Hadith of Ibn Abbas (may Allah be pleased with them both): That the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said regarding the one performing I'tikaf: "He restrains sins, and it runs for him from good deeds like the doer of all good deeds" (1). Ahmad was asked: Do you know anything regarding the virtue of I'tikaf? He said: No, except something weak (2). 409 - What came regarding I'tikaf for the traveler, the Hadith of Anas (may Allah be pleased with him): The Prophet (peace be upon him) used to perform I'tikaf for the last ten of Ramadan when he was resident, and if he traveled, he would perform I'tikaf the following year for twenty [days] (3). Imam Ahmad said: I did not hear this Hadith except from Ibn Abi Adi, from Humaid, from Anas (4).
foot_note:
1. (1) Reported by Ibn Majah (1781), he said: Ubaidullah bin Abdul-Karim narrated to us, Muhammad bin Umayyah narrated to us, Isa bin Musa Al-Bukhari narrated to us, from Ubaidah Al-Ammi, from Farqad As-Sabakhi, from Sa'id bin Jubayr, from Ibn Abbas, raised (Marfu').
2. "Masa'il Abi Dawud" (663), "Al-Mughni" 4/455-456.
3. "Musnad Al-Imam Ahmad" 3/104, he said: Ibn Abi Adi narrated to us, from Humaid, from Anas, raised (Marfu') with it.
4. "Musnad Ahmad" 3/104.

book_title: The Collection of Imam Ahmad's Sciences - Ills of Hadith
publisher: Dar Al-Falah for Scientific Research and Heritage Verification, Fayoum - Arab Republic of Egypt
text: 410 - Seeking Laylat al-Qadr (The Night of Decree) on the twenty-seventh, the Hadith of Mu'awiyah bin Abi Sufyan (may Allah be pleased with them both): "Laylat al-Qadr is the night of the twenty-seventh" (1). Imam Ahmad corrected its stopping (Waqf) upon Mu'awiyah (2). And he said once: As for in the book of Ghundar and others from the companions of Shu'bah, it is not raised (Marfu'); and it has reached us that Mu'adh bin Mu'adh raised it. It was said to him: Mu'adh has raised it, he wrote from his son from the original copy of his book, so it was as if he did not deny it (3).
foot_note:
1. (1) Reported by Abu Dawud (1386), he said: Ubaidullah bin Mu'adh narrated to us, my father narrated to us, Shu'bah informed us, from Qatadah that he heard Mutarrif, from Mu'awiyah bin Abi Sufyan, from the Prophet (peace be upon him) regarding Laylat al-Qadr... so he mentioned it.
2. "Lata'if al-Ma'arif" p. 213.
3. "Masa'il Harb" p. 465. I say: And the text has an authentic witness, for Muslim reported it in his "Sahih" (762) from the path of Zirr bin Hubaish, he said: I asked Ubayy bin Ka'b (may Allah be pleased with him), so I said: Indeed your brother Ibn Mas'ud says: Whoever stands [in prayer] the whole year will hit Laylat al-Qadr. So he said: May Allah have mercy on him; he intended that the people not rely [on a specific night]. However, indeed he knew that it is in Ramadan, and that it is in the last ten, and that it is the night of the twenty-seventh. Then he swore - without making an exception - that it is the night of the twenty-seventh. So I said: By what do you say that, O Abu Al-Mundhir? He said: By the sign or by the token which the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) informed us, that it rises having no rays.

book_title: The Collection of Imam Ahmad's Sciences - Ills of Hadith
publisher: Dar Al-Falah for Scientific Research and Heritage Verification, Fayoum - Arab Republic of Egypt
text: The Book of Hajj 411 - What came regarding hastening to Hajj, there are two Hadiths in it: The First: The Hadith of Ibn Abbas from Al-Fadl or one of them from the other: "Whoever intends Hajj, let him hasten, for indeed the sick person may get sick, the riding animal may get lost, and the need may arise" (1). Imam Ahmad said: When asked about Abu Isra'il Al-Mula'i? He said: He is so-so. I said: What is his matter? He said: He opposed the people in Hadiths. Then Imam Ahmad mentioned this Hadith (2). The Second: The Hadith of Abu Sa'id Al-Khudri (may Allah be pleased with him): "Indeed a man upon whom I have expanded in provision, and five years pass upon him and he does not come to Me as a delegate, is deprived" (3). Imam Ahmad mentioned the difference, so he said: From Waki', from Sufyan, from Al-A'la bin Al-Musayyib, from a man, from Abu Sa'id Al-Khudri. And Abdur-Razzaq said: From Sufyan, from Al-A'la, from his father (4).
foot_note:
1. (1) Reported by Ahmad 1/214, he said: Waki' narrated to us, Abu Isra'il Al-Absi narrated to us, from Fudail bin Amr, from Sa'id bin Jubayr, from Ibn Abbas, raised (Marfu') with it.
2. "Ilal Abdullah" (2539), "Ad-Du'afa" by Al-Uqayli 1/76, "Tahdhib al-Tahdhib" 1/148.
3. Reported by Al-Fakihi in "Akhbar Makkah" 1/437, he said: Muhammad bin Abi Umar narrated to us, he said: Abdur-Razzaq narrated to us, from Ath-Thawri, from Al-A'la bin Al-Musayyib, from his father, from Abu Sa'id, raised (Marfu') with it.
4. "Al-Ilal" narration of Abdullah (1427).

book_title: The Collection of Imam Ahmad's Sciences - Ills of Hadith
publisher: Dar Al-Falah for Scientific Research and Heritage Verification, Fayoum - Arab Republic of Egypt
text: 412 - What came regarding a man performing Hajj on behalf of another, there are four Hadiths in it: The First: The Hadith of Ibn Abbas (may Allah be pleased with them both): "Perform Hajj on behalf of yourself, then perform Hajj on behalf of Shubrumah" (1). Imam Ahmad said: Raising it (to the Prophet) is a mistake (2). The Second: The Hadith of Abu Razin (may Allah be pleased with him): "Perform Hajj on behalf of your father and perform Umrah" (3)
foot_note:
1. (1) Reported by Abu Dawud (1811), he said: Ishaq bin Isma'il At-Taliqani and Hannad bin As-Sari narrated to us - and the meaning is one - Ishaq said: Abdah bin Sulayman narrated to us, from Ibn Abi Arubah, from Qatadah, from Azrah, from Sa'id bin Jubayr, from Ibn Abbas that the Prophet (peace be upon him) heard a man saying: Labbayk on behalf of Shubrumah. He said: "Who is Shubrumah?" He said: A brother of mine, or a relative of mine. He said: "Have you performed Hajj on behalf of yourself?" He said: No... The Hadith.
2. "At-Talkhis Al-Habir" 2/223. Benefit: Az-Zayla'i said in "An-Nasb" 3/155: Ibn Al-Qattan said in his book: And the Hadith of Shubrumah was defected by some of them because it has been narrated as Mawquf (stopped), but the one who connected it is trustworthy, so it does not harm him; and that is because Sa'id bin Abi Arubah narrates it from Qatadah, from Azrah bin Abdur-Rahman, from Sa'id bin Jubayr, from Ibn Abbas, and the companions of Ibn Abi Arubah differ regarding him. So a group raise it, among them Abdah bin Sulayman and Muhammad bin Bishr, and a group stop it, among them Ghundar and Hasan bin Salih. The ones raising it are trustworthy, so the stopping of the ones stopping it does not harm them, either because they memorized what those ones did not memorize, or because the ones stopping it narrated from Ibn Abbas his opinion. And Al-Bayhaqi said in "Al-Sunan" 4/336: This is an authentic chain, and Ghundar narrated it from Sa'id bin Abi Arubah as Mawquf on Ibn Abbas, and whoever narrated it as raised is a trustworthy memorizer, so the disagreement of his opponent does not harm him. And this Azrah is Azrah bin Yahya. Al-Hafiz said in "At-Talkhis": At-Tahawi and Ibn Al-Mundhir said: The correct version regarding it is Mawquf.
3. Reported by At-Tirmidhi (930), he said: Yusuf bin Isa narrated to us, Waki' narrated to us, from Shu'bah, from An-Nu'man bin Salim, from Umar bin Aws, from Abu Razin Al-Uqayli that he came to the Prophet (peace be upon him) and said: O Messenger of Allah, indeed my father is an old man who cannot perform Hajj nor Umrah nor travel. He said... The Hadith.

book_title: Al-Jami' li 'Ulum al-Imam Ahmad - 'Ilal al-Hadith
publisher: Dar Al-Falah for Scientific Research and Heritage Verification, Fayoum - Arab Republic of Egypt
text: Imam Ahmad said: I do not know of any Hadith regarding the obligation of Umrah that is better than this, nor more authentic than it, and no one perfected its chain like Shu'bah did (1). Third: The Hadith of Sawdah bint Zam'ah, may Allah be pleased with her: "Allah is Most Merciful, perform Hajj on behalf of your father" (2). It was said to Imam Ahmad: Does anyone connect its chain (Musnad) other than Abdul Aziz bin Abdul Samad? He said: No. Sufyan (3) says: From Ibn Al-Zubayr (4). Fourth: The Hadith of Aisha, may Allah be pleased with her: "Perform Hajj for yourself, then perform Hajj for Shubrumah" (5).
foot_note:
1. (1) "Al-Bayhaqi" 4/350, "Nasb al-Rayah" 3/148, "Mukhtasar Khilafiyyat al-Bayhaqi" 3/137, "Tanqih al-Tahqiq" 2/404. 
2. Narrated by Ahmad 6/429, he said: Narrated to us Abdul Aziz bin Abdul Samad Abu Abdul Samad, narrated to us Mansur, from Mujahid, from a freed slave of Ibn Al-Zubayr called Yusuf bin Al-Zubayr bin Yusuf, from Ibn Al-Zubayr, from Sawdah bint Zam'ah, she said: A man came to the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, and said: My father is an old man who cannot perform Hajj. He said: "What do you think, if your father had a debt and you paid it off for him, would it be accepted from you?" He said: Yes. The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, said... The Hadith. 
3. Narrated by Ahmad 4/3, he said: Narrated to us Abdul Rahman, from Sufyan, from Mansur, from Mujahid, from Yusuf, from Ibn Al-Zubayr that the Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, said... The Hadith. 
4. "Masa'il Abu Dawood" (2026). I say: Meaning Mursal. The text has a authentic witness; Al-Bukhari narrated it (854) from the Hadith of Ibn Abbas, may Allah be pleased with them both, who said: A woman from Khath'am came during the Farewell Hajj and said: O Messenger of Allah, indeed the obligation of Allah upon His servants regarding Hajj has overtaken my father as an old man who cannot sit upright on the riding mount, so can I perform Hajj on his behalf? He said: "Yes". 
5. Narrated by Al-Daraqutni 2/270, he said: Narrated to us Ibn Sa'id, he said: Narrated to us Yaqub bin Ibrahim, narrated to us Hushaym, he said: Narrated to us Ibn Abi Layla, from Ata, from Aisha that the Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, heard a man reciting Talbiyah on behalf of Shubrumah. He said: "Have you performed Hajj for yourself?" He said: No. He said: "Perform Hajj for yourself, then perform Hajj for Shubrumah."

book_title: Al-Jami' li 'Ulum al-Imam Ahmad - 'Ilal al-Hadith
publisher: Dar Al-Falah for Scientific Research and Heritage Verification, Fayoum - Arab Republic of Egypt
text: Imam Ahmad was asked about this Hadith, and he said: Ibn Abi Layla is weak, and regarding Ata, there are many mistakes (1). 413 - What has been related regarding Hajj on behalf of a child. There are two Hadiths regarding it: First: The Hadith of Ibn Abbas, may Allah be pleased with them both: A woman lifted a child and said: Does this one have a Hajj? He said: "Yes, and for you is a reward" (2). Imam Ahmad was asked about what is authentic in this Hadith, is it the Hadith of Kuraib as Mursal, or from Ibn Abbas? He said: It is authentic from Ibn Abbas. It was said to Ahmad: Al-Thawri (3) and Malik narrate it as Mursal. He said: Ma'mar, Ibn Uyainah, and others have connected its chain (4).
foot_note:
1. (1) "Al-Kamil" by Ibn Adi 7/388 - 389, "Tahdhib al-Kamal" 25/624. 
2. Narrated by Muslim (1336), he said: Narrated to us Abu Bakr bin Abi Shaybah, Zuhair bin Harb, and Ibn Abi Umar, all of them from Ibn Uyainah. Abu Bakr said: Narrated to us Sufyan bin Uyainah, from Ibrahim bin Uqbah, from Kuraib the freed slave of Ibn Abbas, from Ibn Abbas, from the Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, that he met a caravan at Al-Rawha'. He said: "Who are the people?" They said: Muslims. They said: Who are you? He said: "The Messenger of Allah..." The Hadith. 
3. Narrated by "Muslim" (1336), he said: Narrated to me Muhammad bin Al-Muthanna, narrated to us Abdul Rahman, narrated to us Sufyan, from Ibrahim bin Uqbah, from Kuraib that a woman lifted a child... The Hadith. 
4. "Al-Tamhid" 1/102. I say: Al-Daraqutni found a defect in this Hadith in "Al-Ilzamat wa Al-Tatabbu'" (169) due to it being Mursal. Ibn Abd al-Barr said in "Al-Tamhid" 1/99 - 100 (paraphrased): A group of Hafiz Imams narrated this Hadith from Ibrahim bin Uqbah, and most of them narrated it as Musnad (connected). Among those who narrated it as Musnad are Ma'mar, Muhammad bin Ishaq, Sufyan bin Uyainah, and Musa bin Uqbah. There was disagreement regarding it upon

book_title: Al-Jami' li 'Ulum al-Imam Ahmad - 'Ilal al-Hadith
publisher: Dar Al-Falah for Scientific Research and Heritage Verification, Fayoum - Arab Republic of Egypt
text: Second: The Hadith of Al-Sa'ib bin Yazid, may Allah be pleased with them both: My father performed Hajj with me with the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, during the Farewell Hajj while I was seven years old. Imam Ahmad said: From Qutaybah (1): My father performed Hajj. And Muhammad bin Abbad (2) said: He performed Hajj with me (3).
foot_note:
1. = Al-Thawri, just as there was disagreement regarding it upon Malik. Whoever connected this Hadith and made it Musnad, his statement takes precedence. The Hadith is authentic, Musnad, with established connection; the shortcoming of those who fell short does not harm it, because those who connected it are trustworthy Hafizs. Issue: Abu Isa Al-Tirmidhi said after (926): The people of knowledge have agreed that if a child performs Hajj before reaching puberty, he must perform Hajj (again) when he reaches puberty; that Hajj does not suffice for the Hajj of Islam. Similarly, the slave, if he performs Hajj in his slavery and is then freed, he must perform Hajj if he finds a way to do so, and what he performed during his slavery does not suffice. This is the view of Sufyan Al-Thawri, Al-Shafi'i, Ahmad, and Ishaq. 
1. Narrated by Al-Tirmidhi (925), he said: Narrated to us Qutaybah, narrated to us Hatim bin Ismail, from Muhammad bin Yusuf, from Al-Sa'ib bin Yazid, he said: My father performed Hajj with me with the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him... The Hadith. I say: Ahmad mentioned the narration of Qutaybah saying: 'My father performed Hajj', while in Tirmidhi it is: 'My father performed Hajj with me'. So Allah knows best. 
2. Narrated by Al-Bayhaqi 5/156, he said: Informed us Abu Amr, informed us Abu Bakr, narrated to us Abu Ya'la, narrated to us Muhammad bin Abbad Al-Makki, narrated to us Hatim bin Ismail, narrated to us Muhammad bin Yusuf, from Al-Sa'ib bin Yazid, he said: He performed Hajj with me with the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him. 
3. "Al-Ilal" narration of Abdullah (5277). I say: In Bukhari (1858) from the same source: Abdul Rahman bin Yunus, narrated to us Hatim bin Ismail with it. With the wording: He performed Hajj with me.

book_title: Al-Jami' li 'Ulum al-Imam Ahmad - 'Ilal al-Hadith
publisher: Dar Al-Falah for Scientific Research and Heritage Verification, Fayoum - Arab Republic of Egypt
text: 414 - What has been related regarding entering Ihram in rose-colored (dyed) garments. The Hadith of Ibrahim: That the Companions of the Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, entered Ihram in rose-colored garments (1). Imam Ahmad said: There is nothing to this (2). He said once: Salamah Al-Ahmar is nothing (3). And he said once: Salamah from Hammad is confused (Mukhtalit), and he mentioned this Hadith. He said: He narrated from Hammad, from Ibrahim, from the Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, and his Companions, that they entered Ihram in rose-colored garments. Ahmad said: They disapproved of it from him (4).
foot_note:
1. (1) Narrated by Al-Uqayli in "Al-Du'afa" 2/148 from the path of Salamah Al-Ahmar, from Hammad, from Ibrahim... The Hadith. 
2. "Al-Ilal" narration of Al-Marwazi (175). 
3. "Al-Ilal" narration of Abdullah (1532), (3487), "Al-Kamil" by Ibn Adi 4/353. 
4. "Tarikh Baghdad" 9/131 - 132, "Al-Kamil" by Ibn Adi 4/353.

book_title: Al-Jami' li 'Ulum al-Imam Ahmad - 'Ilal al-Hadith
publisher: Dar Al-Falah for Scientific Research and Heritage Verification, Fayoum - Arab Republic of Egypt
text: 415 - What has been related regarding the Mawaqit (Miqats). The Hadith of Aisha, may Allah be pleased with her: He set the time (location) for the people of Medina at Dhu Al-Hulayfah, and for the people of Al-Sham and Egypt at Al-Juhfah, and for the people of Iraq at Dhat Irq, and for the people of Yemen at Yalamlam (1). Imam Ahmad said: Aflah bin Humaid narrated a Munkar (denounced) Hadith regarding the Mawaqit. It was said to him: And is that authentic according to you? Did anyone other than Al-Mu'afa narrate it? He said: Al-Mu'afa is trustworthy (2).
foot_note:
1. (1) Narrated by Al-Nasa'i 3/123, he said: Informed us Amr bin Mansur, he said: Narrated to us Hisham bin Bahram, he said: Narrated to us Al-Mu'afa, from Aflah bin Humaid, from Al-Qasim, from Aisha that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him... The Hadith. 
2. "Masa'il Abu Dawood" (1934), "Al-Kamil" by Ibn Adi 2/123, "Nasb al-Rayah" 3/13, "Tahdhib al-Kamal" 3/322, "Tahdhib al-Tahdhib" 1/186. Benefit: Ibn Adi said in "Al-Kamil" 2/123 that Ahmad's objection to Aflah in this Hadith is his saying: And for the people of Iraq, Dhat Irq. I say: The text has a witness, for Muslim narrated it (1183) from the path of Jabir bin Abdullah... and in it: And the place of Ihram for the people of Iraq is from Dhat Irq. Important Benefit: Imam Muslim said in "Al-Tamyiz" 214 - 215: The Hadiths that the Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, set the time for the people of Iraq at Dhat Irq, none of them are established. As for the narration of Al-Mu'afa, from Aflah, from Al-Qasim, from Aisha, it is not well-known from Al-Mu'afa; only Hisham bin Bahram narrated it, and he is a Sheikh among Sheikhs, and a Hadith is not affirmed by the likes of him if he is solitary in it. I say: The statement of Imam Muslim does not contradict the inclusion of the Hadith in his book, for he included it in the corroborating evidences (Shawahid), and he mentioned in the introduction of his book that he would bring faulty Hadiths, and many of the predecessors and successors have stated that Muslim brings a Hadith to point out its defect.

book_title: Al-Jami' li 'Ulum al-Imam Ahmad - 'Ilal al-Hadith
publisher: Dar Al-Falah for Scientific Research and Heritage Verification, Fayoum - Arab Republic of Egypt
text: 416 - Wearing leather socks (Khuffs) for the Muhrim if he does not find sandals. There are two Hadiths in it: First: The Hadith of Jabir, may Allah be pleased with him: "Whoever does not find sandals, let him wear Khuffs, and whoever does not find an Izar (lower garment), let him wear trousers" (1). Imam Ahmad said: Perhaps we will not find anyone who raises it (to the Prophet) other than Zuhair, meaning regarding the Muhrim if he does not find sandals. And Zuhair was one of the mines of knowledge (2). Second: The Hadith of Ibn Umar, may Allah be pleased with them both, and in it: "Except for one who does not find sandals, let him wear Khuffs and cut them below the ankles" (3). Imam Ahmad said: The Hadith of Ibn Abbas (4) is more established to me - meaning: than the Hadith of Ibn Umar, and that is because cutting is a form of waste, and Allah does not like waste (5). And he said once: When it was said to him: Is not the chain of Ibn Umar good? He said: The Hadith of Ibn
foot_note:
1. (1) Narrated by Muslim (1179), he said: Narrated to us Ahmad bin Abdullah bin Yunus, narrated to us Zuhair, narrated to us Abu Al-Zubayr, from Jabir, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, said... The Hadith. 
2. "Ilal Ahmad" narration of Al-Marwazi (484). 
3. Narrated by Al-Bukhari (580), he said: Narrated to us Ali bin Abdullah, narrated to us Sufyan, he said: I heard Al-Zuhri say: Salim informed me, from his father, from the Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, who said: "The Muhrim does not wear a shirt, nor a turban, nor trousers, nor a hooded cloak, nor a garment touched by saffron or wars, nor leather socks, except for one who does not find sandals, then if he does not find them, let him cut them below the ankles." 
4. Narrated by Al-Bukhari (5804), he said: Narrated to us Abu Nu'aym, narrated to us Sufyan, from Amr, from Jabir, from Zaid, from Ibn Abbas, from the Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, who said: "Whoever does not find an Izar, let him wear trousers, and whoever does not find sandals, let him wear Khuffs." 
5. "Masa'il Ibn Hani" (806).

book_title: Al-Jami' li 'Ulum al-Imam Ahmad - 'Ilal al-Hadith
publisher: Dar Al-Falah for Scientific Research and Heritage Verification, Fayoum - Arab Republic of Egypt
text: Abbas is clearer (1). And he said once: The Hadith of Ibn Abbas does not contain cutting (2). 417 - What has been related regarding the money belt (Himyan) for the Muhrim. The Hadith of Ibn Abbas, may Allah be pleased with them both: That the Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, granted permission for the money belt for the Muhrim (3). Imam Ahmad said when asked about this Hadith: Ibrahim bin Abi Yahya, people abandoned his Hadith. His brother was trustworthy, and his uncle was trustworthy, but he was a Qadari and a Mu'tazili, and he used to narrate Munkar Hadiths that have no basis (4).
foot_note:
1. (1) Previous source. 
2. "Masa'il Abu Dawood" (680), (681). Issue: Abu Isa Al-Tirmidhi said (834): The practice is upon this according to some of the people of knowledge. They said: If the Muhrim does not find an Izar, he wears trousers, and if he does not find sandals, he wears Khuffs. This is the saying of Ahmad. And others said: Based on the Hadith of Ibn Umar from the Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, "If he does not find sandals, let him wear Khuffs and cut them below the ankles." This is the saying of Sufyan Al-Thawri and Al-Shafi'i, and Malik says it. 
3. Narrated by Ibn Adi in "Al-Kamil" 1/354 from the path of Shuraih, from Ibrahim bin Muhammad, from Salih, freed slave of Al-Taw'amah, from Ibn Abbas, raised to the Prophet. And narrated by Ibn Adi 1/273, from the path of Ahmad bin Maysarah, narrated to us Ziyad bin Sa'd, from Salih, freed slave of Al-Taw'amah, from Ibn Abbas, raised to the Prophet. And narrated by Al-Tabarani in "Al-Kabir" 10/327 from the path of Yusuf bin Khalid Al-Samti, narrated to us Ziyad bin Sa'd, from Salih, freed slave of Al-Taw'amah, from Ibn Abbas, raised to the Prophet. 
4. "Al-Kamil" by Ibn Adi 1/197, 1/354.

text: And he said once when asked about Ahmad bin Maysarah in this Hadith, he said: I do not know him. Meaning the path of Ziyad bin Sa'd from Salih, freed slave of Al-Taw'amah (1). 418 - What has been related regarding reciting poetry for the Muhrim. The Hadith of Anas, may Allah be pleased with him: That the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, entered Mecca during the Umrah of Fulfillment (Umrat al-Qada'), and Ibn Rawahah was holding his stirrup and saying: Clear the way of the disbelievers for his path... The Most Merciful has revealed in His Revelation... That the best killing is in His path (2). Imam Ahmad said: If I were to say it is false (Batil)... And he rejected it strongly. Abu Zur'ah said: Imam Ahmad denounced it (3).
foot_note:
1. (1) Previous source. 
2. Narrated by Abu Ya'la 6/273, he said: Narrated to us Abu Bakr bin Zanjuyah, narrated to us Abdul Razzaq, informed us Ma'mar, from Al-Zuhri, informed me Anas bin Malik... so he mentioned it. 
3. "Tarikh Abi Zur'ah" (214).

text: 419 - What has been related regarding Talbiyah. There are three Hadiths in it: First: The Hadith of Abdullah bin Mas'ud, may Allah be pleased with him: "Labbayk Allahumma Labbayk, Labbayka la sharika laka Labbayk, inna al-hamda wan-ni'mata lak" (1). Imam Ahmad said: I see this is from Hammad. Meaning: He raised it to the Prophet, peace be upon him, because the Hadith is Mawquf (2) on Abdullah (3). Second: The Hadith of Aisha similar to the Hadith of Ibn Mas'ud, and added in it: "Wal-mulk lak la sharika lak" (4). Imam Ahmad said: Ibn Fudayl erred in this addition, and this is not known from Aisha; it is only known from Ibn Umar (5).
foot_note:
1. (1) Narrated by Al-Nasa'i 5/161, he said: Informed us Ahmad bin Abdah, he said: Narrated to us Hammad bin Zaid, from Aban bin Taghlib, from Abu Ishaq, from Abdul Rahman bin Yazid, from Abdullah bin Mas'ud, he said: Among the Talbiyah of the Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, was... The Hadith. 
2. Narrated by Abu Nu'aym in "Al-Hilyah" 6/266, he said: Narrated to us Abu Bakr, narrated to us Muhammad bin Ghalib bin Harb, narrated to us Muhammad bin Al-Fadl, narrated to us Hazim, Ali bin Al-Madini, and Ubaydullah bin Umar, they said: Narrated to us Hammad bin Zaid from Aban bin Tha'lab, from Abu Ishaq, from Abdul Rahman bin Yazid, from Abdullah bin Mas'ud, as Mawquf. 
3. "Masa'il Abu Dawood" (2009). Abu Hatim said in "Al-Ilal" 1/293: The Mawquf is more authentic. 
4. Narrated by Ahmad 6/32, he said: Narrated to us Muhammad bin Fudayl, he said: Narrated to us Al-A'mash, from Umarah bin Umair, from Abu Atiyah, he said: Aisha said, raised to the Prophet. 
5. Narrated by Al-Bukhari (1549), he said: Narrated to us Abdullah bin Yusuf, informed us Malik, from Nafi', from Abdullah bin Umar, may Allah be pleased with them both, that the Talbiyah of the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, was: "Labbayk Allahumma Labbayk, Labbayka la sharika laka Labbayk, inna al-hamda wan-ni'mata laka wal-mulk, la sharika lak".

text: And he mentioned that Abu Mu'awiyah (1) narrated the Hadith from Al-A'mash without it (2). Third: The Hadith of Anas, may Allah be pleased with him, regarding Talbiyah (3). Imam Ahmad was asked about Sulaiman bin Arqam, from Al-Zuhri, from Anas regarding Talbiyah, and he said: We do not care if he narrated or did not narrate (4). Meaning: Sulaiman.
foot_note:

(1) Narrated by Al-Bukhari (1550), he said: Narrated to us Muhammad bin Yusuf, narrated to us Sufyan, from Al-A'mash, from Umarah, from Abu Atiyah, from Aisha, may Allah be pleased with her, she said: I know how the Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, used to recite Talbiyah: "Labbayk Allahumma Labbayk, Labbayka la sharika laka Labbayk, inna al-hamda wan-ni'mata lak". Abu Mu'awiyah followed him (narrated it similarly) from Al-A'mash.

publisher: Dar Al-Falah for Scientific Research and Heritage Verification, Fayoum - Arab Republic of Egypt
text: 420 - What has been related regarding Tamattu', Qiran, and Ifrad in Hajj, the permissibility of introducing Hajj onto Umrah, and when the Qarin exits his rituals. The Hadith of Aisha, may Allah be pleased with her: We went out with the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, and some of us assumed Ihram for Hajj... and in it: As for those who assumed Ihram for Umrah, they exited Ihram when they circumambulated the House and Safa and Marwa, and as for those who assumed Ihram for Hajj and Umrah, they did not exit Ihram until the Day of Nahr (Sacrifice) (1). Imam Ahmad said: What is strange about this Hadith? This is a mistake. It was said to him: Al-Zuhri from Urwah (2) from Aisha contradicts it? He said: Yes. And Hisham bin Urwah (3).
foot_note:
1. (1) Narrated by Al-Bukhari (1562) and Muslim (1211), both from the path of Malik, from Abu Al-Aswad Muhammad bin Abdul Rahman bin Nawfal, from Urwah, from Aisha, may Allah be pleased with her, she said: We went out with the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, during the Farewell Hajj. Some of us assumed Ihram for Umrah, some of us assumed Ihram for Hajj and Umrah, and some of us assumed Ihram for Hajj. The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, assumed Ihram for Hajj. As for those who assumed Ihram for Hajj or combined Hajj and Umrah, they did not exit Ihram until it was the Day of Nahr. 
2. Narrated by Al-Bukhari (1556) and Muslim (1211), both from the path of Malik, from Al-Zuhri, from Urwah, from Aisha, may Allah be pleased with her, the wife of the Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, she said: We went out with the Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, in the Farewell Hajj and we assumed Ihram for Umrah. Then the Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, said: "Whoever has a sacrificial animal with him, let him assume Ihram for Hajj with the Umrah, then he does not exit until he exits from both of them together." I arrived in Mecca while menstruating, and I did not circumambulate the House nor go between Safa and Marwa. I complained about that to the Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, and he said: "Undo your hair, comb it, assume Ihram for Hajj, and leave the Umrah." So I did. When we completed the Hajj, the Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, sent me with Abdul Rahman bin Abu Bakr to Al-Tan'im, so I performed Umrah. He said: "This is in place of your Umrah." She said: Those who had assumed Ihram for Umrah circumambulated the House and between Safa and Marwa, then exited Ihram, then circumambulated another Tawaf after they returned from Mina. As for those who combined Hajj and Umrah, they only circumambulated one Tawaf. 
3. "Zad al-Ma'ad" 2/202.

book_title: Al-Jami' li 'Ulum al-Imam Ahmad - 'Ilal al-Hadith
publisher: Dar Al-Falah for Scientific Research and Heritage Verification, Fayoum - Arab Republic of Egypt
text: 421 - What has been related regarding raising the voice in Talbiyah. The Hadith of Abu Bakr Al-Siddiq, may Allah be pleased with him: That the Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, was asked: Which Hajj is best? He said: "Al-Ajj (raising the voice) and Al-Thajj (sacrificing)" (1). Imam Ahmad said: Whoever says in this Hadith: 'From Muhammad bin Al-Munkadir, from Ibn Abdul Rahman bin Yarbu', from his father' has erred (2).
foot_note:
1. = I say: Ibn Hazm and Ibn Al-Qayyim in "Al-Zad" discussed this Hadith at length, so let whoever wishes refer to them. Benefit: Ahmad mentioned in "Masa'il Abdullah" (821) the Hadith: "Whoever assumes Ihram for Hajj may add Umrah to it." Imam Ahmad said: I have not heard anything regarding this except something weak. 
1. Narrated by Al-Tirmidhi (827), he said: From Abu Nu'aym Al-Tahhan Dirar bin Surad, from Ibn Abi Fudaik, from Al-Dahhak, from Uthman, from Muhammad bin Al-Munkadir, from Sa'id bin Abdul Rahman bin Yarbu', from his father, from Abu Bakr... The Hadith. 
2. "Sunan Al-Tirmidhi" (827), "Sunan Al-Bayhaqi" 5/43, "Nasb al-Rayah" 3/34, "Al-Talkhis Al-Kabir" 2/239. I say: The defect of this Hadith becomes clear in what Al-Bayhaqi quoted in his "Sunan" 5/43. Abu Isa said: I asked Al-Bukhari about it - meaning this Hadith - and he said: It is Mursal to me; Muhammad bin Al-Munkadir did not hear from Abdul Rahman bin Yarbu'. I said: So whoever mentioned Sa'id in it? He said: It is a mistake; there is no mention of Sa'id in it. I said to him: Dirar bin Surad and others narrated this Hadith from Ibn Abi Fudaik and said: From Sa'id bin Abdul Rahman from his father. He said: It is nothing. Al-Bayhaqi said: And Ahmad bin Hanbal said the same according to what reached us from him. Benefit: Al-Tirmidhi said: Al-Ajj is raising the voice in Talbiyah, and Al-Thajj is slaughtering the sacrificial camels.

book_title: Al-Jami' li 'Ulum al-Imam Ahmad - 'Ilal al-Hadith
publisher: Dar Al-Falah for Scientific Research and Heritage Verification, Fayoum - Arab Republic of Egypt
text: 422 - What has been related regarding combining Hajj and Umrah. There is a Hadith from Anas and it has two paths: First: From Al-Hasan from him that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, and his Companions arrived in Mecca, and they had recited Talbiyah for Hajj and Umrah (1). Imam Ahmad said: How strange is this! He made it for Hajj and Umrah! (2). Second: From Bakr bin Abdullah Al-Muzani from him, similar to it (3). Imam Ahmad said: He did not mention exiting Ihram (Ihlal) in it, while Ibn Abi Adi and Hammad bin Salamah mention exiting Ihram (4).
foot_note:
1. (1) Narrated by Al-Nasa'i 3/127, he said: Informed us Ishaq bin Ibrahim, he said: Narrated to us Al-Nadr bin Shumail, he said: Narrated to us Ash'ath bin Abdul Malik, from Al-Hasan, from Anas that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, prayed Dhuhr at Al-Baida', then mounted and ascended the mountain of Al-Baida', and assumed Ihram for Hajj and Umrah when he prayed Dhuhr. 
2. "Su'alat Abu Bakr Al-Athram" (26). 
3. Narrated by Muslim number (1232), he said: Narrated to us Suraij bin Yunus, narrated to us Hushaym, narrated to us Humaid from Bakr, from Anas, may Allah be pleased with him, he said: I heard the Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, reciting Talbiyah for Hajj and Umrah together. Bakr said: So I narrated that to Ibn Umar, and he said: He recited Talbiyah for Hajj alone. So I met Anas and told him the saying of Ibn Umar, and Anas said: You do not consider us but children; I heard the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, say: "Labbayk Umrah and Hajj." 
4. "Su'alat Abu Bakr Al-Athram" (28). Issue: Al-Nawawi said in "Sharh Muslim" 8/216 - 217 (paraphrased): Most narrations from the Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, state that he assumed Ihram for Hajj solely (Ifrad), and that has been reported from Aisha, Jabir, Ibn Abbas, Ibn Umar, and others. As for the Hadith of Anas, it is used as proof by those who argue for Qiran, and the correct chosen view regarding the Hajj of the Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, is that he was Mufrid (Hajj only) in the beginning of his Ihram, then he introduced Umrah onto Hajj and became Qarin. We combined

book_title: Al-Jami' li 'Ulum al-Imam Ahmad - 'Ilal al-Hadith
publisher: Dar Al-Falah for Scientific Research and Heritage Verification, Fayoum - Arab Republic of Egypt
text: 423 - What has been related regarding introducing Hajj onto Umrah. There is a Hadith from Aisha and it has two paths: First: Urwah from her, and in it: "Assume Ihram for Hajj and leave your Umrah" (1). Second: From the path of Al-Qasim from her, and in it: We went out with the Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, seeing nothing but Hajj (2). Imam Ahmad said: The narration of Urwah is more authentic (3).
foot_note:
1. = the Hadiths in the best manner of combination. Thus, the Hadith of Ibn Umar and others is interpreted as referring to the beginning of his Ihram, peace be upon him, and the Hadith of Anas is interpreted as referring to its later stages and during it, as if he did not hear him at first. This interpretation or something similar is necessary so that the narration of Anas aligns with the narration of the majority as previously mentioned. 
1. Narrated by Muslim (1211), he said: Narrated to us Yahya bin Yahya Al-Tamimi, he said: I read to Malik, from Ibn Shihab, from Urwah, from Aisha, may Allah be pleased with her, that she said: We went out with the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, in the year of the Farewell Hajj, and we assumed Ihram for Umrah. Then the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, said: "Whoever has a sacrificial animal with him, let him assume Ihram for Hajj with the Umrah, then he does not exit until he exits from both of them together..." The Hadith. 
2. Narrated by Muslim (1211), he said: Narrated to us Abu Bakr bin Abi Shaybah, Amr Al-Naqid, and Zuhair bin Harb, all of them from Ibn Uyainah. Amr said: Narrated to us Sufyan bin Uyainah, from Abdul Rahman bin Al-Qasim, from his father, from Aisha, she said: ... The Hadith. 
3. "Fath al-Bari" by Ibn Rajab 3/106.

book_title: Al-Jami' li 'Ulum al-Imam Ahmad - 'Ilal al-Hadith
publisher: Dar Al-Falah for Scientific Research and Heritage Verification, Fayoum - Arab Republic of Egypt
text: 424 - What has been related regarding applying oil for the Muhrim. The Hadith of Ibn Umar, may Allah be pleased with them both: That the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, applied oil while he was Muhrim with oil that was not scented (Muqattat) (1). Imam Ahmad did not pay attention to it (2). 425 - What has been related regarding the prohibition of hunting for the Muhrim. The Hadith of Aisha, may Allah be pleased with her: Dried meat (Washiqah) was gifted to the Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, while he was Muhrim, and he did not eat it (3). Imam Ahmad denied it strongly. And he said: This is Meccan hearing (4).
foot_note:
1. (1) Narrated by Al-Tirmidhi (962), he said: Narrated to us Hannad, narrated to us Waki', from Hammad bin Salamah, from Farqad Al-Sabakhi, from Sa'id bin Jubayr, from Ibn Umar raised to the Prophet. 
2. "Masa'il Abu Dawood" (835), "Su'alat Al-Ajurri" 2/131. I say: And in Bukhari (1537) there is a narration from the path of Sa'id bin Jubayr, from Ibn Umar that he used to apply oil, so I mentioned that to Ibrahim and he said: What do you make of his saying? 
3. "Musannaf Abdul Razzaq" (8324). He said: From Al-Thawri, from Qais, from Al-Hasan bin Muhammad, from Aisha, she said... The Hadith. 
4. "Sharh Ilal Al-Tirmidhi" 2/607. I say: The text has a authentic witness, for Muslim narrated it (1193) from the Hadith of Al-Sa'b bin Jaththamah Al-Laythi that he gifted a wild donkey to the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, while he was at Al-Abwa', and the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, returned it to him. He said: When the Messenger of Allah saw what was on my face, he said: "We did not return it to you except that we are in a state of Ihram." Benefit: Ibn Rajab said in "Sharh Ilal Al-Tirmidhi" 2/606: Ahmad said in the narration of Al-Athram: Abdul Razzaq's hearing in Mecca from Sufyan is very disturbed.

book_title: Al-Jami' li 'Ulum al-Imam Ahmad - 'Ilal al-Hadith
publisher: Dar Al-Falah for Scientific Research and Heritage Verification, Fayoum - Arab Republic of Egypt
text: 426 - What has been related regarding the prohibition of hunting in Wajj and its thorny trees. The Hadith of Al-Zubair bin Al-Awwam, may Allah be pleased with him: "Indeed the game of Wajj and its thorny trees are forbidden, made sacred for Allah" (1). Imam Ahmad said: Weak (2). 427 - What has been related regarding the ostrich egg if the Muhrim hits it. The Hadith of Abu Hurairah, may Allah be pleased with him: "For every egg, fasting a day or feeding a poor person" (3). Imam Ahmad said: Ibn Jurayj did not hear it from Abu Al-Zinad; it is only narrated from Ziyad (4) bin Sa'd from Abu Al-Zinad (5).
foot_note:
1. (1) Narrated by Abu Dawood (2032), he said: Narrated to us Hamid bin Yahya, narrated to us Abdullah bin Al-Harith, from Muhammad bin Abdullah bin Insan Al-Ta'ifi, from his father, from Urwah bin Al-Zubayr, he said: When we approached with the Messenger of Allah from Layyah until we were at the Sidrah tree, the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, stopped at the edge of Qarn Al-Aswad facing it, and faced Nakhb with his gaze - and he said once: its valley - and stopped until all the people gathered, then he said... The Hadith. And that was before his descent to Ta'if and his siege of Thaqif. 
2. "Al-Mughni" 5/194, "Al-Fatawa" 27/15, "Al-Talkhis Al-Habir" 2/28. Benefit: Wajj: Land in Ta'if, and it is said: A valley in it, and it is said: All of Ta'if. 
3. Narrated by Al-Bayhaqi 5/207, he said: Informed us Ali bin Ahmad bin Abdan, informed us Ahmad bin Ubaid Al-Saffar, narrated to us Ahmad bin Ali Al-Khazzaz, narrated to us Abdul Rahman bin Ibrahim Al-Dimashqi, narrated to us Al-Walid bin Muslim, narrated to us Ibn Jurayj, from Abu Al-Zinad, from Al-A'raj, from Abu Hurairah, raised to the Prophet. 
4. Narrated by Al-Bayhaqi 5/207, he said: Informed us Abu Abdul Rahman Al-Sulami and Abu Bakr bin Al-Harith Al-Faqih, they said: Informed us Ali bin Umar Al-Hafiz, narrated to us Abdullah bin Muhammad bin Hibban Al-Naysaburi, narrated to us Muhammad bin Ismail Al-Ismaili, narrated to us Muhammad bin Yusuf, narrated to us Abu Qurrah, from Ibn Jurayj, informed me Ziyad bin Sa'd, from Abu Al-Zinad, from Urwah, from Aisha that the Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, ruled regarding ostrich eggs broken by a Muhrim man: fasting a day for every egg. 
5. "Al-Talkhis Al-Habir" 2/273. I say: Thus Abu Hatim found a defect in it in "Al-Ilal" 1/270.

book_title: Al-Jami' li 'Ulum al-Imam Ahmad - 'Ilal al-Hadith
publisher: Dar Al-Falah for Scientific Research and Heritage Verification, Fayoum - Arab Republic of Egypt
text: 428 - What has been related regarding the marriage of a Muhrim. There are two Hadiths in it: First: The Hadith of Ibn Abbas, may Allah be pleased with them both: That the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, married Maymunah while he was Muhrim (1). Imam Ahmad said: It is said that a boy belonging to Al-Ansari introduced this Hadith to Al-Ansari (2). Second: The Hadith of Abdullah bin Mas'ud, may Allah be pleased with him, that he did not see any harm in the marriage of a Muhrim (3).
foot_note:
1. (1) Mentioned by Ibn Abi Hatim in "Al-Ilal" 1/280 (832), he said: Muhammad bin Abdullah Al-Ansari narrated it from Habib bin Al-Shahid, from Maymun bin Mihran, from Ibn Abbas raised to the Prophet. Important Benefit: Al-Dhahabi said in "Al-Mizan" 5/47: The Hadith of Cupping. I say: Ibrahim who preceded in the Book of Fasting from the same source, the correct version is the narration of Sufyan bin Habib, from Habib bin Al-Shahid, from Maymun bin Mihran, from Yazid bin Al-Asam that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, married Maymunah while he was Muhrim. Although Al-Ansari has narrated from Habib something like this. Al-Khatib said: It is said that a boy of Al-Ansari introduced the Hadith of Ibn Abbas to him. Ibn Al-Madini said about it: There is nothing to this; he only intended the Hadith of Maymun from Yazid bin Al-Asam regarding the marriage of Maymunah. 
2. "Ilal Ibn Abi Hatim" 1/280 number (832), "Siyar A'lam Al-Nubala" 9/535. I say: The text of this Hadith is established and authentic, for Al-Bukhari narrated it (1837) from the Hadith of Ibn Abbas, may Allah be pleased with them both: That the Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, married Maymunah while he was Muhrim. Benefit: Abu Ya'la said in "Tabaqat Al-Hanabilah" 1/409: They mentioned the story of Maymunah and the saying of Abu Rafi', so Abu Abdullah - meaning Ahmad bin Hanbal - said: Yazid bin Al-Asam, she is his aunt. He said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, married her while Halal (not in Ihram) and consummated the marriage with her while Halal. This was confusing to them, and she is his aunt. 
3. Narrated by Ibn Abi Shaybah 3/151, he said: Narrated to us Waki', from Jarir bin Hazim, from Al-A'mash, from Ibrahim, from Abdullah bin Mas'ud, his saying.

book_title: Al-Jami' li 'Ulum al-Imam Ahmad - 'Ilal al-Hadith
publisher: Dar Al-Falah for Scientific Research and Heritage Verification, Fayoum - Arab Republic of Egypt
text: Imam Ahmad said: People narrate it from Al-A'mash, from Ibrahim, as Mawquf. And he said: I only think it is from the Sheikh. It was said to him: From Jarir? He said: Yes (1). 429 - What has been related regarding the Muhrim being cupped. The Hadith of Anas, may Allah be pleased with him: He was cupped while Muhrim on the top of his foot due to pain he had (2). Imam Ahmad said: Ibn Abi Arubah narrated it as Mursal. Meaning: From Qatadah (3).
foot_note:
1. (1) "Al-Du'afa" by Al-Uqayli 1/199. 
2. Narrated by Abu Dawood (1837), he said: Narrated to us Ahmad bin Hanbal, narrated to us Abdul Razzaq, informed us Ma'mar, from Qatadah, from Anas that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him... so he mentioned it. 
3. "Sunan Abu Dawood" (1837). I say: The text of this Hadith is established and authentic, for Al-Bukhari narrated it (571) from Ibn Abbas that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, was cupped while he was Muhrim on his head due to a migraine he had. Benefit: It is known that the most established of Qatadah's companions is Sa'id bin Abi Arubah, and Ma'mar makes mistakes in Qatadah; therefore Imam Ahmad preferred the Mursal narration, and Allah knows best.

book_title: Al-Jami' li 'Ulum al-Imam Ahmad - 'Ilal al-Hadith
publisher: Dar Al-Falah for Scientific Research and Heritage Verification, Fayoum - Arab Republic of Egypt
text: 430 - What has been related regarding making a stipulation (Ishtirat) in Hajj. The Hadith of Duba'ah, may Allah be pleased with her: "Perform Hajj, and stipulate that my place of release is where You detain me". Imam Ahmad said: This Hadith is authentic (1). He said once: Abdul Razzaq narrates it from Ma'mar, from Al-Zuhri, from Urwah, from Aisha (2). And Ibn Umar (3) denied the condition that the Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, said to Duba'ah. And Abu Usamah narrates it from Hisham, from his father, from Aisha (4). And the Hadith of Abbad, from Hilal bin Khabbab, from Ikrimah, from Ibn Abbas, I heard (5) from Abbad. And the Hadith of Al-Bursani from Ibn Jurayj, from Abu Al-Zubayr,
foot_note:
1. (1) "Tarikh Abi Zur'ah" (216). 
2. Narrated by Muslim (1207), he said: Narrated to us Abd bin Humaid, informed us Abdul Razzaq, informed us Ma'mar, from Al-Zuhri, from Urwah, from Aisha, may Allah be pleased with her, she said: The Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, entered upon Duba'ah bint Al-Zubayr bin Abdul Muttalib, and she said: O Messenger of Allah, I want to perform Hajj but I am ill. So the Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, said... so he mentioned it. 
3. Narrated by Al-Bukhari (1810), he said: Narrated to us Ahmad bin Muhammad, informed us Abdullah, informed us Yunus, from Al-Zuhri, he said: Salim informed me, he said: Ibn Umar, may Allah be pleased with them both, used to say: Is not the Sunnah of the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, sufficient for you? If one of you is prevented from Hajj, he circumambulates the House and Safa and Marwa, then releases himself from everything until he performs Hajj the following year, then he offers a sacrifice or fasts if he does not find a sacrifice. 
4. Narrated by Al-Bukhari (5089), and narrated by Muslim (1207) from the path of Abu Usamah, from Hisham, from his father, from Aisha, may Allah be pleased with her, she said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, entered upon Duba'ah bint Al-Zubayr and said to her: "Did you want Hajj?" She said: By Allah! I do not feel anything but pain. So he said to her... The Hadith. 
5. Narrated by Al-Tirmidhi (941), he said: Narrated to us Ziyad bin Ayyub Al-Baghdadi, narrated to us Abbad bin Al-Awwam, from Hilal bin Khabbab, from Ikrimah, from Ibn Abbas that Duba'ah bint Al-Zubayr... so he mentioned it.

text: 431 - What came regarding the one who enters Ihram for Hajj then breaks [a bone] or becomes lame. The Hadith of Al-Hajjaj bin Amr (may Allah be pleased with him): "Whoever breaks or becomes lame has exited [Ihram]" (1). Imam Ahmad said: I do not know what its exit (origin) is, and some of them say: From Abdullah bin Rafi' (2).
foot_note:
1. = Al-Bayhaqi said in his "Sunan" 5/223: In my view, if the Hadith of Duba'ah bint Az-Zubayr had reached Abu Abdur-Rahman Abdullah bin Umar bin Al-Khattab (may Allah be pleased with him), he would have adopted it, and he would not have denied the conditionality [in Hajj intention], just as his father did not deny it, and with Allah is success. Issue: At-Tirmidhi said (941): The practice upon this is according to some of the people of knowledge; they see conditionality in Hajj and say: If he makes a condition and then an illness or excuse befalls him, he may exit [Ihram] and leave his Ihram. This is the saying of Ash-Shafi'i, Ahmad, and Ishaq. Some of the people of knowledge did not see conditionality in Hajj and said: If he makes a condition, he does not have the right to leave his Ihram, and they view him like the one who did not make a condition.
1. The Hadith.
2. "Masa'il Abi Dawud" (1882). I say: At-Tirmidhi mentioned (940) the difference regarding this Hadith, so he said: More than one narrated it from Al-Hajjaj As-Sawwaf, from Yahya bin Abi Kathir, from Ikrimah, from Al-Hajjaj bin Amr. And Ma'mar and Mu'awiyah bin Salam narrated this Hadith from Yahya bin Abi Kathir, from Ikrimah, from Abdullah bin Rafi'. Al-Hajjaj is a trustworthy Hafiz according to the people of Hadith, and I heard Muhammad say: The narration of Ma'mar and Mu'awiyah bin Salam is more correct.

text: 432 - What came regarding the annulment of Hajj (Faskh al-Hajj), there are two Hadiths in it: The First: The Hadith of Bilal bin Al-Harith (may Allah be pleased with them both): Is the annulment for us specifically or for those after us? He said: "Rather, for you specifically" (1). Imam Ahmad said: No Hadith is authentic regarding the annulment being for them specifically, and here is Abu Musa giving fatwa with it during the Caliphate of Abu Bakr and the beginning of the Caliphate of Umar (2). And he said once: When asked about the Hadith of Bilal bin Al-Harith, he said: And who is Bilal bin Al-Harith - or Al-Harith bin Bilal - and who narrated from him?! As for his father, he is from the Companions of the Prophet (peace be upon him), but as for him [the son], he denied him. So it was said to him: He narrated a Hadith. He said: Who narrated it? And he denied it. It was said to him: Do you hold the view of the annulment of Hajj? He said: Yes, if he wishes, it is annulment. I go to the Hadith of Jabir (3) that they entered Ihram
foot_note:
1. (1) Reported by Abu Dawud (1808), he said: An-Nufaili narrated to us, Abdul-Aziz bin Muhammad narrated to us, Rabi'ah bin Abi Abdur-Rahman informed me, from Al-Harith bin Bilal, from his father, he said: I said, O Messenger of Allah... The Hadith.
2. "Masa'il Abi Dawud" (1918), "Nasb al-Rayah" 105, "Al-Tahqiq" by Ibn al-Jawzi 5/319, "Tanqih al-Tahqiq" 2/416.
3. Reported by Muslim (1218), he said: Abu Bakr bin Abi Shaybah and Ishaq bin Ibrahim narrated to us, both from Hatim. Abu Bakr said: Hatim bin Isma'il Al-Madani narrated to us, from Ja'far bin Muhammad, from his father, he said: We entered upon Jabir bin Abdullah... And in it: "Whoever among you does not have a sacrificial animal (Hady) with him, let him exit [Ihram] and make it an Umrah." So Suraqah bin Malik bin Ju'sham stood up and said: O Messenger of Allah! Is it for this year of ours or for forever? The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) intertwined his fingers one into the other and said: "Umrah has entered into Hajj - twice - no, rather for forever and ever."

text: for Hajj alone, so the Prophet (peace be upon him) commanded them to exit [Ihram] (1). And he said once when asked about this Hadith: I do not say [I agree] with it. And he said: We do not know this man - meaning he is unknown (Majhul) - and no one narrated it except Ad-Darawardi; these [other] Hadiths are more beloved to me (2). And he said once: This is a Hadith whose chain is not known; it is not a Hadith. Bilal, according to me, is established (3). And once: I have eighteen authentic, excellent Hadiths, all of them regarding the annulment of Hajj (4). The Second: The Hadith of Abu Dharr (may Allah be pleased with him): The annulment of Hajj from the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) was only for us specifically (5). And he said once: A man from the people of Kufa narrates it who did not meet Abu Dharr; furthermore, it is a conjecture from

text: Abu Dharr, which is indicated by the Hadith of Ibn Abbas that Umrah has entered into Hajj, and the Hadith of Jabir that Suraqah said: Is it for this year of ours or for forever? He said: "Rather, for forever." He meant that the ruling of annulment remains for eternity (1).
foot_note: 1. (1) "Al-Tahqiq" by Ibn al-Jawzi 5/319, "Tanqih al-Tahqiq" by Ibn Abd al-Hadi 2/415. Issue: Ibn Abd al-Barr said in "Al-Tamhid" 23/358-359: Among those who went to the view that the annulment of Hajj into Umrah is not permissible for anyone today and that it was not permissible for other than the Companions of the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) are: Malik, Ash-Shafi'i, Abu Hanifa and their companions, Ath-Thawri, Al-Awza'i, and Al-Layth bin Sa'd among a group of the Tabi'in in Hijaz, Iraq, Sham, and Egypt. And Abu Thawr, Ishaq bin Rahwayh, Abu Ubaid, and At-Tabari said the same, and it is the saying of the majority of the people of knowledge. Ahmad bin Hanbal and Dawud bin Ali went to the view that the annulment of Hajj into Umrah is permissible until today and established, and that whoever wishes to annul his Hajj into Umrah, if he is from those who did not drive the sacrificial animal (Hady), all of that is [permissible] for him, following the narrations reported from the Prophet (peace be upon him) regarding that. Ahmad bin Hanbal said: Regarding the annulment of Hajj, there are established Hadiths that cannot be abandoned for the likes of the Hadith of Abu Dharr and the Hadith of Bilal bin Al-Harith, and their weakness. And he said: Who is Al-Muraqqa' bin Sayfi who narrates it from Abu Dharr? He said: And the annulment was narrated from the Prophet (peace be upon him) from the Hadith of Jabir, Aisha, Asma bint Abi Bakr, Ibn Abbas, Abu Musa, Anas bin Malik, Sahl bin Hunaif, Abu Sa'id, Al-Bara' bin Azib, Ibn Umar, and Sabrah Al-Juhani. Ahmad said: Whoever enters Ihram for Hajj alone or combines Hajj with Umrah, if he wishes to make it an Umrah, he may exit [Ihram] and annul his Ihram into an Umrah; if he wishes he does so, and if he wishes he does not. Ahmad and those who followed his school also argued with his saying (peace be upon him): "If I had known previously about my affair what I know now, I would not have driven the sacrificial animal and I would have made it an Umrah," and with the saying of Suraqah bin Ju'sham: O Messenger of Allah, teach us the teaching of a people who accepted Islam today; is this Umrah of ours for this year of ours or for forever? He said: "Rather, for forever, rather for forever." Abu Umar [Ibn Abd al-Barr] said: There is no proof in this, because his saying (peace be upon him): "If I had known previously about my affair what I know now, I would have made it an Umrah"; its meaning is only 'I would have entered Ihram for Umrah and made my Ihram an Umrah to perform Tamattu' with it.' Indeed, in this is a proof for whoever prefers Tamattu'. As for the one who permits the annulment of Hajj into Umrah =

text: 433 - What came regarding raising the hands when seeing the House [Kaaba]. The Hadith of Jabir (may Allah be pleased with him): Jabir bin Abdullah was asked about the man who sees the House, should he raise his hands? He said: I did not see anyone doing this except the Jews, and we performed Hajj with the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) and he did not do it (1). Imam Ahmad said: Weak (2). And he said once: I do not know it, and this is not from Amr bin Dinar. When it was said to him: Shu'bah said: I asked Amr bin Dinar about raising the hands, he said: Abu Qaza'ah said (3). And it was said to him: Miskin and Ghundar from Shu'bah, from Abu Qaza'ah, he does not say: Amr bin Dinar? He said: It is nothing (4).

text: 434 - What came regarding the Tawaf of the Muqrin (one combining Hajj and Umrah). The Hadith of Aisha (may Allah be pleased with her), and in it: So those who had entered Ihram for Umrah performed Tawaf around the House and between Safa and Marwah, then they exited [Ihram], then they performed another Tawaf after they returned from Mina for their Hajj. As for those who had combined Hajj and Umrah, they only performed one Tawaf (1). Imam Ahmad said: No one said this except Malik. And he said: I do not think but that Malik erred in it, and no one other than him brought it (2). And he said once: No one narrated it except Malik; and Malik is trustworthy (3).
foot_note:
1. (1) Reported by Al-Bukhari (1556) and Muslim (1211), both from the path of Malik, from Az-Zuhri, from Urwah, from Aisha (may Allah be pleased with her), the wife of the Prophet (peace be upon him), she said: We went out with the Prophet (peace be upon him) in the Farewell Hajj, so we entered Ihram for Umrah. Then the Prophet (peace be upon him) said: "Whoever has a sacrificial animal (Hady) with him, let him enter Ihram for Hajj with the Umrah, then he does not exit [Ihram] until he exits from both of them together." I arrived in Mecca while I was menstruating, and I did not perform Tawaf around the House nor between Safa and Marwah. So I complained of that to the Prophet (peace be upon him), and he said: "Undo your hair and comb it, and enter Ihram for Hajj and leave the Umrah." So I did. When we finished the Hajj, the Prophet (peace be upon him) sent me with Abdur-Rahman bin Abi Bakr to At-Tan'im, so I performed Umrah. He said: "This is in place of your Umrah." She said: So those who... The Hadith.

3. "Masa'il Abi Dawud" (1989), "Sharh Ilal At-Tirmidhi" 253. Benefit: Ibn Rajab said in "Sharh Ilal At-Tirmidhi" 1/451: Perhaps Ahmad denounced it only due to its contradiction of the Hadiths that the Qarin performs one Tawaf.

text: 435 - What came regarding Tawaf while riding. The Hadith of Abdullah bin Hanzalah Ar-Rahib (may Allah be pleased with him): I saw the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) performing Tawaf around the House on a she-camel; no beating, no driving away, and no [saying] 'move away, move away' (1). Imam Ahmad said: As for the Sheikh, he is trustworthy - meaning: Al-Hassan bin Sawwar - but as for the Hadith, it is Munkar (denounced) (2). And he said once: The Hadith is Gharib (strange). Then he lowered his head listening, and said: Did you write it from a book? We said: Yes (3).
foot_note:
1. (1) Reported by Al-Uqayli 1/228, he said: Ahmad bin Dawud As-Sijzi narrated to us, he said: Al-Hassan bin Sawwar Al-Baghawi narrated to us, he said: Ikrimah bin Ammar Al-Yamami narrated to us, from Damdam bin Jaws, from Abdullah bin Hanzalah bin Ar-Rahib, raised (Marfu') with it.
2. "Ad-Du'afa" by Al-Uqayli 1/228, "Tahdhib al-Tahdhib" 1/491. I say: The text has a witness, for Al-Bukhari reported (1612) from the Hadith of Ibn Abbas (may Allah be pleased with them both), he said: The Prophet (peace be upon him) performed Tawaf around the House on a camel; whenever he came to the Corner, he pointed to it.
3. "Tarikh Baghdad" 7/318-319, "Tahdhib al-Kamal" 6/170, "Tahdhib al-Tahdhib" 1/491.

text: 436 - What came regarding speaking during Tawaf. The Hadith of Ibn Abbas (may Allah be pleased with them both): And it was said from a man who caught the Prophet (peace be upon him): "Tawaf is only prayer, so when you perform Tawaf, minimize speech" (1). Imam Ahmad said: Muhammad bin Bakr did not raise it [to the Prophet] (2). 437 - What came regarding Raml (jogging) in Tawaf. The Hadith of Ibn Umar (may Allah be pleased with them both) that Ibn Umar jogged from the Stone. Imam Ahmad said: He jogs from the Stone to the Stone. It was said to Ahmad: Doesn't Ayyub narrate from Nafi' (3), from Ibn Umar that he walked what is between the Corner and the Stone? He said: Yes (4), but Ayyub is opposed in it. And he mentioned that others narrated that he jogged from the Stone to the Stone. Meaning: Ibn Umar (5).

text: 438 - What came regarding the desirability of kissing the Black Stone during Tawaf. The Hadith of Ibn Umar (may Allah be pleased with them both) that Umar kissed the Stone and said: Indeed I kiss you and I know that you are a stone, but I saw the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) kissing you (1). Imam Ahmad said: Isma'il said, from Ayyub, he said: I was informed that Umar kissed the Stone (2).

2. "Al-Ilal" narration of Abdullah (1247). I say: And the text of the Hadith is established and authentic, for Muslim reported it (1270) from the path of Az-Zuhri from Salim, from Ibn Umar, from Umar, raised (Marfu') with it.

text: 439 - What came regarding the woman who menstruates after Tawaf. The Hadith of Anas (may Allah be pleased with him): From Umm Sulaym that she menstruated after she had performed Tawaf al-Ifadah on the Day of Sacrifice, so the Prophet (peace be upon him) commanded her to depart (1). Imam Ahmad said: Abbad erred in it; it is only from Qatada (2) from Ikrimah (3).
foot_note:
1. (1) Reported by At-Tahawi in "Sharh Ma'ani al-Athar" 2/233, he said: Ibn Abi Dawud narrated to us, he said: Sa'id bin Sulayman Al-Wasiti narrated to us, he said: Abbad bin Al-Awwam narrated to us, from Sa'id, from Qatada, from Anas, from Umm Sulaym... The Hadith.
2. Reported by Ahmad 6/431, he said: Muhammad bin Ja'far and Rawh Al-Ma'ni narrated to us, they said: Sa'id narrated to us, from Qatada, from Ikrimah that there was a discussion between Ibn Abbas and Zaid bin Thabit regarding the woman who menstruates after she performs Tawaf around the House on the Day of Sacrifice. Zaid said: She does not depart until her last time is with the House. And Ibn Abbas said: If she performs Tawaf on the Day of Sacrifice and becomes permissible for her husband, she departs if she wishes and does not wait. So the Ansar said: O Ibn Abbas, indeed when you oppose Zaid, we do not follow you. So Ibn Abbas said: Ask Umm Sulaym. So they asked her about that, and she informed that Safiyyah bint Huyai bin Akhtab was afflicted by that, so Aisha said: 'Loss be upon you [in a playful scolding manner], you have detained us.' So that was mentioned to the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him), and he commanded her to depart. And Umm Sulaym informed that she encountered that, so the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) commanded her to depart. I say: The text of the Hadith is established, for Muslim reported it (1211).
3. "Ilal Ahmad" narration of Al-Marudhi, "Masa'il Abi Dawud li-Imam Ahmad" (1893).

text: 440 - What came regarding the Talbiyah when going from Mina to Arafah. The Hadith of Anas (may Allah be pleased with him): The one making Talbiyah among us would make Talbiyah and it would not be denied upon him, and the one making Takbir among us would make Takbir and it would not be denied upon him (1). Imam Ahmad said: Waki' erred in it; it is only Muhammad (2) bin Abi Bakr Al-Thaqafi (3). And he said once: Waki' has delusions in Hadiths from Malik bin Anas, among them the Hadith of Muhammad bin Abi Bakr Al-Thaqafi: We went out with Anas. Waki' did not say: Muhammad bin Abi Bakr Al-Thaqafi, he said something other than Muhammad; Ibn Mahdi opposed him (4).

2. Reported by Al-Bukhari (1659), he said: Abdullah bin Yusuf narrated to us, Malik informed us, from Muhammad bin Abi Bakr Al-Thaqafi that he asked Anas bin Malik... The Hadith.

text: 441 - What came regarding standing at Arafah. The Hadith of Jubayr bin Mut'im (may Allah be pleased with him): I found the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) at Arafah (1). It was said to Imam Ahmad: Uthman bin Al-Aswad narrated it from 'Ata, from Jubayr bin Mut'im. He said: Who narrated it? It was said: Ubaidullah bin Musa. It was said to Imam Ahmad: Did 'Ata hear from Jubayr? He said: It does not look like it (2). 442 - What came regarding prayer at Arafah. The Hadith of Anas (may Allah be pleased with him): When the sun passed the meridian, he prayed the two prayers (3). Imam Ahmad said: It is not a thing [rejected] (4).

I did not find it from the path of Anas, and perhaps it is what Ibn Khuzaimah reported 4/247, he said: Yusuf bin Musa narrated to us, Jarir narrated to us, from Yahya, from Qasim bin Muhammad, from Ubaidullah bin Az-Zubayr, he said: From the Sunnah of Hajj is that the Imam prays Dhuhr, Asr, Maghrib, Isha, and Fajr in Mina, then he goes to Arafah, so he naps wherever it is decreed for him, until when the sun passes the meridian, he addresses the people, then prays Dhuhr and Asr together, then stands at Arafah until the sun sets, then he departs and prays at Muzdalifah or wherever Allah decreed, then stands at Jam' (Muzdalifah) until it becomes bright, then pushes on before the sun rises. So if he throws the Great Jamrah, everything that was forbidden to him becomes lawful except women and perfume until he visits the House.
4. "Masa'il Ibn Hani" (419).

text: 443 - What came regarding sending his heavy luggage ahead from Mina. The Hadith of Umar (may Allah be pleased with him): Whoever sends his heavy luggage ahead before the departure, there is no Hajj for him (1). Imam Ahmad said: That is not the chain. It was said to him: Ibrahim from Amr bin Shurahbil. He said: I do not think he heard from him (2). 444 - What came regarding combining the two prayers at Muzdalifah. The Hadith of Ibn Umar (may Allah be pleased with them both) that the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) prayed Maghrib and Isha at Muzdalifah together (3). Imam Ahmad said: It is contrary to what Sa'id bin Jubayr narrated (4) from Ibn Umar; this is Salim from Ibn Umar (5).
foot_note:
1. (1) Reported by Ibn Abi Shaybah in his "Musannaf" 3/387 (15384), he said: Waki' narrated to us from Shu'bah, from Ibrahim, from Amr bin Shurahbil, from Umar, his saying.
2. "Masa'il Al-Kawsuj" (1561).
3. Reported by Muslim (1287), he said: Yahya bin Yahya narrated to us, he said: I read to Malik, from Ibn Shihab, from Salim bin Abdullah, from Ibn Umar, raised (Marfu') with it.
4. Reported by Muslim (1288), he said: Abd bin Humaid narrated to us, Abdur-Razzaq informed us, Ath-Thawri informed us, from Salamah bin Kuhail, from Sa'id bin Jubayr, from Ibn Umar, he said: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) combined Maghrib and Isha at Jam', praying Maghrib three [Rak'ahs] and Isha two Rak'ahs with one Iqamah.
5. "Masa'il Al-Kawsuj" (1422).

text: 445 - What came regarding Sa'i between Safa and Marwah. The Hadith of Ibn Abbas (may Allah be pleased with them both) as Mawquf: Indeed the first to perform Sa'i between Safa and Marwah was the mother of Isma'il. He said: And indeed the first to introduce dragging the trails [of the garment] among the women of the Arabs was the mother of Isma'il. He said: When she fled from Sarah, she let down her trail to erase her tracks (1). Imam Ahmad said: Isma'il from Ayyub: 'I was informed' from Sa'id. And Ma'mar narrates it from Ayyub, from Sa'id, he did not say 'I was informed'. And Abu Awanah narrates it from Abu Bishr, from Sa'id bin Jubayr. Ahmad said: So I think that Ayyub carried it from Abu Bishr from Sa'id; because Ibn Ulayyah said: From Ayyub, 'I was informed' from Sa'id (2). 446 - Throwing Jamrat al-Aqabah before Fajr for women, there are two Hadiths in it: The First: The Hadith of Aisha (may Allah be pleased with her): The Prophet (peace be upon him) sent Umm Salamah on the night of Sacrifice, so she threw the Jamrah before Fajr, then she went on and performed Tawaf al-Ifadah. And that was the day on which the Messenger of Allah
foot_note:
1. (1) Reported by At-Tabari in his "Tarikh" 1/255, he said: Ya'qub bin Ibrahim and Al-Hassan bin Muhammad narrated to me, they said: Isma'il bin Ibrahim narrated to us, from Ayyub, he said: I was informed from Sa'id bin Jubayr that he narrated from Ibn Abbas... so he mentioned it.
2. "Al-Ilal narration of Abdullah" (2625). I say: It appears to me that the two Hadiths, the Hadith of Aisha and the Hadith of Umm Salamah (may Allah be pleased with them both), are one Hadith; due to the unity of the exit (source), Hisham bin Urwah, from his father. Ibn al-Qayyim stated that in "Al-Zad", and it is the apparent action of Al-Bayhaqi in his "Sunan", but Al-Hafiz in Al-Talkhis makes them two independent Hadiths. And them being one Hadith is more likely - and Allah knows best - but I mentioned the two Hadiths for extra detail.

text: (peace be upon him) was - meaning: with her (1). Imam Ahmad said: Munkar (2). The Second: The Hadith of Umm Salamah (may Allah be pleased with her): That the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) commanded her to attend the Fajr prayer on the Day of Sacrifice in Mecca (3). Imam Ahmad said: No one other than him gave it a chain, and it is a mistake. I said - meaning: Abu Mu'awiyah. And he said: Waki' from Hisham, from his father as Mursal: That the Prophet (peace be upon him) commanded her to attend the Fajr prayer with him on the Day of Sacrifice in Mecca, or something like this. And this is also more amazing, that the Prophet (peace be upon him) on the Day of Sacrifice and the time of Fajr, what would he be doing in Mecca? As if he denies that. He said: So I came to Yahya bin Sa'id and asked him, so he said: From Hisham from his father: He commanded her to attend (tuwafi), and it is not: to attend with him (tuwafiyahu). He said: And between that is a difference. Yahya said to me: Ask Abdur-Rahman about it. So I asked him, and he said: Thus Sufyan [narrated], from Hisham, from his father. Al-Khallal said: Al-Athram was inadvertent in his quotation: 'to attend with him'. Waki' only said: 'to attend Mina'. And he was correct in his saying: 'to attend' as his companions said, and he erred in his saying: 'Mina' (4). And once Ahmad bin Hanbal used to repel this Hadith of Umm Salamah and weaken it (5).
foot_note:
1. (1) Reported by Abu Dawud (1942), he said: Harun bin Abdullah narrated to us, Ibn Abi Fudaik narrated to us, from Ad-Dahhak bin Uthman, from Hisham bin Urwah, from his father, from Aisha... The Hadith.
2. "Zad al-Ma'ad" 2/249, "Al-Talkhis Al-Habir" 2/258.
3. Reported by Al-Bayhaqi 5/133, he said: Kamil bin Ahmad Al-Mustamli narrated to us, Bishr bin Ahmad Al-Mahrajani informed us, Dawud bin Al-Husain Al-Bayhaqi narrated to us, Yahya bin Yahya narrated to us, Abu Mu'awiyah informed us, from Hisham bin Urwah, from his father, from Zainab bint Abi Salamah, from Umm Salamah, with it.
4. "Zad al-Ma'ad" 2/249, "Al-Ilal" narration of Abdullah (2637), "Al-Frusiyyah" p. 199-200, "At-Tarikh Al-Kabir" by Al-Bukhari 1/75.
5. "Al-Tamhid" 7/270.

text: 447 - What came regarding the entire Haram being a place of slaughter and all the days of Mina being for slaughter, there are two Hadiths in it: The First: The Hadith of Jabir bin Abdullah (may Allah be pleased with them both): "All of Arafah is a standing place, all of Mina is a slaughtering place, all of Muzdalifah is a standing place, and all the pathways of Mecca are a road and a slaughtering place" (1). Imam Ahmad said: Yahya bin Sa'id abandoned Usama bin Zayd at the end, due to this Hadith (2). The Second: The Hadith of Jubayr bin Mut'im (may Allah be pleased with him): "All the pathways of Mecca are a slaughtering place, and all the Days of Tashriq are for slaughter" (3). Imam Ahmad said: The correct version in it is Mursal (4), and it has been narrated regarding the Adha being the Day of Sacrifice and two days after it from more than one of the Companions of the Prophet (peace be upon him) (5).
foot_note:
1. = Benefit: Al-Hafiz said in "Al-Talkhis" 2/258: Ahmad bin Hanbal denied it; because the Prophet (peace be upon him) prayed Fajr on that day at Muzdalifah, so how could he command her to attend the Fajr prayer with him at Mecca.
1. Reported by Abu Dawud (1937), he said: Al-Hasan bin Ali narrated to us, Abu Usama narrated to us, from Usama bin Zayd, from 'Ata, he said: Jabir bin Abdullah narrated to me that the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said... The Hadith.
2. "Al-Ilal" by Abdullah (4711), "Ad-Du'afa" by Al-Uqayli 1/18, "Al-Kamil" 1/394.
3. Reported by Al-Bayhaqi 5/239, he said: Abu Bakr bin Ziyad narrated to us, Ahmad bin Mansur narrated to us, Muhammad bin Bukair Al-Hadrami narrated to us, Suwaid bin Abdul-Aziz narrated to us, from Sa'id bin Abdul-Aziz, from Sulayman bin Musa, from Nafi' bin Jubayr bin Mut'im, from his father from the Prophet (peace be upon him).
4. Reported by Al-Bayhaqi 5/239, he said: Abu Hamid Ar-Razi the Hafiz informed us, Zahir bin Ahmad informed us, Abu Bakr bin Ziyad An-Naysaburi narrated to us, Abu Al-Azhar narrated to us, Abu Al-Mughirah narrated to us, Sa'id bin Abdul-Aziz narrated to us, Sulayman bin Musa narrated to me, from Jubayr bin Mut'im, from the Prophet (peace be upon him)... The Hadith.
5. "Al-Tamhid" 23/197. I say: The text is established, for Muslim reported it (149) from the path of Jabir without the phrase: "and all the pathways of Mecca are a road and a slaughtering place".

text: 448 - What came regarding marking (Ish'ar) the sacrificial animals (Budn). The Hadith of Aisha (may Allah be pleased with her): I twisted the garlands of the sacrificial animals of the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) with my own hand, then he marked them, then he sent them to the House and stayed in Medina, and nothing became forbidden to him that was lawful to him (1). Imam Ahmad said: Munkar (2). 449 - Whoever shaves before slaughtering or slaughters before throwing. The Hadith of Abdullah bin Amr (may Allah be pleased with them both): He said: A man came to the Prophet (peace be upon him) and said: I shaved before I slaughtered. He said: "Slaughter and no harm." He said: I slaughtered before I threw. He said: "Throw and no harm" (3). It was said to Imam Ahmad: Sufyan bin Uyainah does not say: I did not perceive (Lam Ash'ur). He said: Yes, but Malik and the people from Az-Zuhri [say]: I did not perceive (4).
foot_note:
1. (1) Reported by Al-Bukhari (1699), he said: Abdullah bin Maslamah narrated to us, Aflah bin Humaid narrated to us, from Al-Qasim, from Aisha... The Hadith.
2. "Tahdhib al-Tahdhib" 1/232.
3. Reported by Muslim (1306), he said: Abu Bakr bin Abi Shaybah and Zuhair bin Harb narrated to us. Abu Bakr said: Ibn Uyainah narrated to us from Az-Zuhri, from Isa bin Talhah, from Abdullah bin Amr, raised (Marfu') with it.
4. Reported by Al-Bukhari (1736), Muslim (1306), both from the path of Malik, from Az-Zuhri, from Isa bin Talhah, from Abdullah bin Amr bin Al-As, he said: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) stopped during the Farewell Hajj at Mina for the people who were asking him, so a man came and said: O Messenger of Allah: I did not perceive, so I shaved before I slaughtered. So he said: "Slaughter and no harm." Then another man came to him and said: O Messenger of Allah, I did not perceive, so I slaughtered before I threw. So he said: "Throw and no harm." He said: So the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) was not asked about anything [done] ahead or delayed except that he said: Do it and no harm. See: "Al-Mughni" 5/322. I say: Yunus, Salih bin Kaysan, Ibn Jurayj followed Malik =
