text: 450 - What is done with the Muhrim if he dies. The Hadith of Ibn Abbas (may Allah be pleased with them both): "For he will be resurrected on the Day of Resurrection with matted hair (Mulabbidan)" (1). Imam Ahmad said: Hushaim says: He will be resurrected on the Day of Resurrection with matted hair (Mulabbidan). And the people say: Reciting Talbiyah (Mulabbiyan) (2). 451 - What came regarding Umrah, is it obligatory or not? The Hadith of Jabir (may Allah be pleased with him): That the Prophet (peace be upon him) was asked about Umrah, is it obligatory? He said: "And if you perform Umrah it is better" (3). Imam Ahmad said: Weak, and Al-Hajjaj used to send the Hadith (make it Mursal) (4).
foot_note:
1. = and others, and Ma'mar, Muhammad bin Abi Hafsah and others followed Ibn Uyainah.
1. Reported by Muslim (1206), he said: Muhammad bin As-Sabah narrated to us, Hushaim narrated to us, Abu Bishr informed us, Sa'id bin Jubayr narrated to us, from Ibn Abbas (may Allah be pleased with them both), H. And Yahya bin Yahya narrated to us - and the wording is his - Hushaim informed us, from Abu Bishr, from Sa'id bin Jubayr, from Ibn Abbas that a man was with the Messenger of Allah in Ihram, so his she-camel broke his neck and he died. So the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: "Wash him with water and sidr, and shroud him in his two garments, and do not touch him with perfume, and do not cover his head; for he will be resurrected on the Day of Resurrection with matted hair (Mulabbidan)."
2. "Tahdhib al-Kamal" 30/286, "Tahdhib al-Tahdhib" 6/42. I say: There was a difference regarding it from Sa'id bin Jubayr. Ayyub, Amr bin Dinar, Mansur, and Abu Az-Zubayr narrated it from him with the wording: Mulabbiyan (reciting Talbiyah). And Abu Bishr narrated it from him with the wording: Mulabbidan (with matted hair). And Abu Awanah, Hushaim, and Shu'bah narrated it from Abu Bishr. And the narration of Abu Awanah is once: Mulabbiyan, and once: Mulabbidan. And the narrations of Al-Bukhari differed regarding it. Al-Hafiz said in "Al-Fath" 3/164 on the wording (Mulabbiyan): Thus it is for Al-Mustamli and for the rest it is Mulabbidan. So it becomes clear that the wording: Mulabbiyan is more likely; therefore Muslim presented it first in the chapter, and Allah knows best.
3. Reported by At-Tirmidhi (931), he said: Muhammad bin Abdul-A'la As-San'ani narrated to us, Amr bin Ali narrated to us, from Al-Hajjaj, from Muhammad bin Al-Munkadir, from Jabir that the Prophet (peace be upon him)... The Hadith.
4. "Masa'il Ibn Hani" (2216), "Tanqih al-Tahqiq" 2/407.

text: And he said once: Ibn Abbas said: By Allah, indeed it is its companion in the Book of Allah, and it is as if it is an obligation (1). 452 - Visiting the House every night of the nights of Mina. The Hadith of Ibn Abbas (may Allah be pleased with them both): That the Prophet of Allah (peace be upon him) used to visit the House every night as long as he was in Mina (2). Imam Ahmad said: They wrote it from the book of Mu'adh, and they did not hear it. It was said to him: There is a person here who claims that he heard it from Mu'adh. So he denied that. He said: Who is he? It was said to him: Ibrahim bin Ar'ara. So his face changed and he shook his hand and said: A lie and a forgery, Glory be to Allah! They did not hear it from him! So-and-so only said: We wrote it from his book, and he did not hear it. Glory be to Allah! And he considered that grave from him (3).

text: 453 - What came regarding the virtue of Medina, there are two Hadiths in it: The First: The Hadith of Aisha (may Allah be pleased with her): "The towns were conquered by the sword and Medina was conquered by the Quran" (1). Imam Ahmad said: This is Munkar (denounced); it was not heard from the Hadith of Malik nor Hisham. It is only the saying of Malik and he did not narrate it from anyone. And I saw this Sheikh - meaning Muhammad bin Al-Hasan - he was a liar (2). The Second: The Hadith of Ali bin Abi Talib (may Allah be pleased with him): We have nothing but the Book of Allah and this scroll from the Prophet (peace be upon him): Medina is a sanctuary from 'A'ir to such-and-such (3). Imam Ahmad said: Shu'bah opposed them, he said: From Al-Harith bin Suwayd, so he erred; it is only from Ibrahim At-Taimi from his father (4), and that is the correct version, if Allah wills (5).

text: Book of Sales and Trading 454 - What has been related regarding the virtue of selling and buying. Hadith of Kathir bin Murrah: "No two sellers ever met except that blessing overshadowed them" (1). Imam Ahmad said: There is nothing to this; Isa bin Ibrahim and Sa'id bin Sinan are nothing (2). 455 - What has been related regarding if the sellers clarify, do not conceal, and advise. Hadith of Wathilah, may Allah be pleased with him: "It is not lawful for anyone to sell something except that he clarifies what is in it, nor is it lawful for one who knows that except that he clarifies it" (3).
foot_note:
1. (1) Mentioned by Al-Marwazi in "Al-'Ilal" (276) from the path of Kathir bin Hisham, from Isa bin Ibrahim, from Sa'id bin Sinan, from Abu Al-Zahiriyah, from Kathir bin Murrah, raised (to the Prophet). 
2. "'Ilal Al-Marwazi" (276). 
3. Narrated by Ahmad in "Al-Musnad" 3/491, he said: Narrated to us Abu Al-Nadr, he said: Narrated to us Abu Ja'far Al-Razi from Yazid bin Abi Malik, he said: Narrated to us Abu Siba', he said: I bought a she-camel from the house of Wathilah bin Al-Asqa'. When I went out with it, Wathilah caught up with us dragging his cloak and said: O servant of Allah, did you buy? I said: Yes. He said: Did he clarify to you what is in it? I said: And what is in it? It is fat and apparently healthy! He said: So he said: Did you want it for travel or for meat? I said: Rather, I wanted it for Hajj. He said: Indeed, there is a hole in its hoof. He said: So its owner said: May Allah set you right, what do you want with this, spoiling my sale? He said: Indeed, I heard the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, say: "It is not lawful..." The Hadith. I say: The meaning has a authentic witness, for Al-Bukhari narrated (2079) from the Hadith of Hakim bin Hizam, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, said: "The two parties to a sale have the option (to cancel) as long as they have not separated - or he said: until they separate. If they are truthful and clarify, their sale will be blessed for them, and if they conceal and lie, the blessing of their sale will be wiped out."

text: Imam Ahmad said: Abu Ja'far Al-Razi did not hear from this one; he only narrated this from Muhammad bin Sa'id, and Allah knows best, so he left Muhammad bin Sa'id and said from Yazid (1). 456 - What has been related if the two sellers differ. Hadith of Ibn Mas'ud, may Allah be pleased with him: "If the two sellers differ and there is no proof between them, and the commodity stands as it is, then the saying is the saying of the seller or they return the sale" (2). Imam Ahmad said: No one said in it: "and the commodity stands" except Yazid bin Harun, and he erred. The allies narrated it from Al-Mas'udi and did not say this word, but it is in the Hadith of Ma'n (3). 457 - What has been related regarding caution in weighing and measuring. There are two Hadiths in it: First: Hadith of Ali, may Allah be pleased with him: A man bought trousers, and there was a weigher weighing for a wage (4).
foot_note:
1. (1) "'Ilal Al-Marwazi" (168). 
2. Narrated by Ibn Majah (2186), he said: Narrated to us Uthman bin Abi Shaybah and Muhammad bin Al-Sabah, they said: Narrated to us Hushaym, informed us Ibn Abi Layla, from Al-Qasim bin Abdul Rahman, from his father that Abdullah bin Mas'ud, raised (to the Prophet) with it. 
3. "Al-Mughni" by Ibn Qudamah 6/283. 
4. I did not find it from the path of Ali bin Abi Talib.

publisher: Dar Al-Falah for Scientific Research and Heritage Verification, Fayoum - Arab Republic of Egypt
text: Imam Ahmad said: I do not know what this is (1). Second: Hadith of Suwayd bin Qays, may Allah be pleased with him: "O weigher, weigh and give more" (2). Imam Ahmad narrated the difference regarding it from Simak bin Harb; Sufyan narrated it from him, from Suwayd bin Qays, and Shu'bah opposed him and narrated it from Simak, from Abu Safwan (3). 458 - What has been related regarding the sale of 'Urban (down payment). Hadith of Abdullah bin Amr, may Allah be pleased with them both: He forbade the sale of 'Urban (4). Imam Ahmad said: This is a weak Hadith (5). And he said once: It is nothing (6).
foot_note:
1. (1) "Masa'il Salih" (1152). 
2. Narrated by Ibn Majah (2220), he said: Narrated to us Abu Bakr bin Abi Shaybah, Ali bin Muhammad, and Muhammad bin Ismail, they said: Narrated to us Waki', narrated to us Sufyan, from Simak bin Harb, from Suwayd bin Qays, he said: I and Makhramah Al-Abdi imported cloth from Hajar, so the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, came to us and bargained for trousers, and we had a weigher weighing for a wage, so the Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, said to him... The Hadith. 
3. "Al-'Ilal" narration of Abdullah (5792), (5793). 
4. Narrated by Ibn Majah (2192), he said: Narrated to us Hisham bin Ammar, narrated to us Malik bin Anas, he said: It reached me from Amr bin Shu'aib, from his father, from his grandfather, raised (to the Prophet) with it. 
5. "Al-Mughni" by Ibn Qudamah 6/331. 
6. "Bada'i Al-Fawa'id" by Ibn Al-Qayyim 4/69.

text: 459 - What has been related regarding the condition. Hadith of Aisha, may Allah be pleased with her: "Muslims are bound by their conditions as long as it agrees with the truth" (1). Abdullah bin Ahmad said: I presented to my father Hadiths I heard from Ismail bin Abdullah bin Zurarah Al-Shakwa, from Abdul Aziz bin Abdul Rahman Al-Qurashi, so he said to me: This Abdul Aziz, strike out his Hadith, they are lies, or he said: fabricated. So I struck out his Hadiths (2). 460 - What has been related regarding the prohibition of the price of a cat. Hadith of Jabir, may Allah be pleased with him: The Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, forbade eating the cat and its price (3). Imam Ahmad said: I do not know anything in it that is established or authentic. He also said: The Hadiths regarding it are disturbed (Mudtarib) (4).
foot_note:
1. (1) Narrated by Al-Hakim in "Al-Mustadrak" 2/49-50, he said: Informed us Abu Abdullah Muhammad bin Abdullah Al-Saffar, narrated to us Abu Bakr bin Abi Al-Dunya, narrated to us Ismail bin Abdullah bin Zurarah, narrated to us Abdul Aziz bin Abdul Rahman Al-Jazari, from Khasif, from Urwah, from Aisha, may Allah be pleased with her, raised (to the Prophet) with it. 
2. "Tanqih Al-Tahqiq" by Ibn Abd Al-Hadi 2/535-536. 
3. Narrated by Al-Tirmidhi (1280), he said: Narrated to us Yahya bin Musa, narrated to us Abdul Razzaq, informed us Umar bin Qald Al-San'ani, from Abu Al-Zubayr, from Jabir, raised (to the Prophet) with it. 
4. "Jami' Al-Ulum wa Al-Hikam" p. 453. I say: In "Sahih Muslim" (1569) there is a witness regarding the price of a cat from the path of Ma'qal from Abu Al-Zubayr, who said: I asked Jabir about the price of a dog and a cat? He said: The Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, rebuked that.

publisher: Dar Al-Falah for Scientific Research and Heritage Verification, Fayoum - Arab Republic of Egypt
text: 461 - What has been related regarding the permission for the price of a hunting dog. Hadith of Jabir, may Allah be pleased with him: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, forbade the price of a dog and a cat except the trained dog (1). Imam Ahmad said when asked about this Hadith: This is from Al-Hasan bin Abi Ja'far, and he is weak (2). And he said once: No permission regarding the hunting dog is authentic from the Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him (3).
foot_note:
1. = I say: Ibn Rajab said in "Sharh 'Ilal Al-Tirmidhi" 344 and also "Jami' Al-Ulum wa Al-Hikam" p. 451: Imam Ahmad denounced the narrations of Ma'qal from Abu Al-Zubayr specifically and says: His Hadith resembles the Hadith of Ibn Lahi'ah. Issue: Ibn Rajab said in "Jami' Al-Ulum wa Al-Hikam" p. 453: Scholars differed regarding selling cats. Some of them disliked it; this was narrated from Abu Hurairah, Jabir, Ata, Tawus, Mujahid, Jabir bin Zaid, Al-Awza'i, and Ahmad in a narration from him, and he said: It is lighter than the skins of beasts of prey, and this is the choice of Abu Bakr from our companions. Others permitted selling cats, including Ibn Abbas, Ata in a narration, Al-Hasan, Ibn Sirin, Al-Hakam, and Hannad. This is the view of Al-Thawri, Abu Hanifa - may Allah have mercy on him -, Malik, Al-Shafi'i, and Ahmad in the famous narration from him. From Ishaq there are two narrations. It is reported from Al-Hasan that he disliked selling them but permitted buying them to benefit from them. 
1. Narrated by Al-Daraqutni 3/73, he said: Narrated to us Al-Hasan bin Ismail, narrated to us Yaqub bin Ibrahim Al-Dawraqi, narrated to us Abbad bin Al-Awwam, from Al-Hasan bin Abi Ja'far, from Abu Al-Zubayr, from Jabir, raised (to the Prophet) with it. 
2. "Zad Al-Ma'ad" 5/770, "Al-Mughni" by Ibn Qudamah 6/354. 
3. "Jami' Al-Ulum wa Al-Hikam" 453. Issue: Ibn Rajab said in "Jami' Al-Ulum wa Al-Hikam" p. 451-452 (paraphrased): Scholars differed regarding selling dogs. Most of them forbade it, including Al-Awza'i, Malik in the famous narration from him, Al-Shafi'i, Ahmad, Ishaq, and others. Abu Hurairah said: It is illegal earnings (Suht). Ibn Sirin said: It is the vilest earning. Abdul Rahman bin Abi Layla said: I do not care about the price of a dog or the price of a pig. These have their reasons.

text: 462 - What has been related regarding selling wine and pigs. Hadith of Al-Mughirah bin Shu'bah, may Allah be pleased with him: "Whoever sells wine, let him butcher pigs" (1). Imam Ahmad said when asked about Umar bin Bayan in this Hadith. He said: I do not know him (2). 463 - What has been related regarding the stud fee (Asb al-Fahl). Hadith of Ali bin Abi Talib: He forbade the earning of every owner of a stallion (3).
foot_note:
1. = A group permitted selling dogs that are lawful to acquire, like hunting dogs. This is the view of Ata, Al-Nakha'i, Abu Hanifa, and a narration from Malik. They said: He only forbade selling those which are forbidden to acquire. 
1. Narrated by Abu Dawood (3489), he said: Narrated to us Uthman bin Abi Shaybah, he said: Narrated to us Ibn Idris and Waki', from Tu'mah bin Amr Al-Ja'fari, from Umar bin Bayan Al-Taghlibi, from Urwah bin Al-Mughirah bin Shu'bah, from Al-Mughirah bin Shu'bah, raised (to the Prophet) with it. 
2. "'Ilal Abdullah" (1366). I say: In the chapter there is a Hadith that suffices for this, for Al-Bukhari narrated number (2236) from the path of Jabir bin Abdullah, may Allah be pleased with them both, that he heard the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, say while in Mecca during the year of the Conquest: "Indeed, Allah has forbidden the sale of wine, dead meat, pigs, and idols." It was said: O Messenger of Allah, what about the fat of dead meat, for ships are coated with it, skins are oiled with it, and people use it for lamps? He said: "No, it is Haram." Then the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, said at that time: "May Allah fight the Jews. Indeed, when Allah forbade its fat, they melted it, then sold it, and ate its price." 
3. Narrated by Al-Uqayli 1/224, he said: Narrated to us Muhammad bin Ismail, he said: Narrated to us Zuhair bin Harb, he said: Narrated to us Abdul Samad bin Abdul Warith, he said: Narrated to me my father, he said: Narrated to us Al-Hasan bin Dhakwan, from Habib bin Abi Thabit, from Asim bin Damrah, from Ali that the Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him: forbade eating every possessor of fangs from beasts of prey, and every possessor of talons from birds, and the price of dead meat, the price of wine and domestic donkeys, the earning of a cupper and a prostitute, and the earning of every owner of a stallion.

text: Imam Ahmad said when asked about Al-Hasan bin Dhakwan, he said: Al-Hasan bin Dhakwan, his Hadiths are false (Abatil), he narrates from Habib bin Abi Thabit. Then this Hadith was mentioned to him, so he said: He did not hear from Habib, rather these are Hadiths of Amr bin Khalid Al-Wasiti (1). 464 - What has been related regarding sales involving uncertainty (Gharar). Hadith of Abdullah bin Mas'ud: "Do not buy fish in the water, for it is uncertainty" (2).
foot_note:
1. (1) "Al-Du'afa" by Al-Uqayli 1/223, "Mizan Al-I'tidal" 3/13, "Tahdhib Al-Tahdhib" 1/394, 3/267. I say: In the chapter there is a Hadith that suffices for this Hadith, for Al-Bukhari narrated (2284) from the path of Ibn Umar, may Allah be pleased with them both, who said: The Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, forbade the stud fee (Asb al-Fahl). Issue: Al-Khattabi said in "Ma'alim Al-Sunan" 3/90: Asb al-Fahl is what the male is taken for due to its mating, and it is not lawful, and there is uncertainty in it; because the stallion might mount or not, and the female might conceive or not, so it is a matter of speculation, and uncertainty is present in it. Scholars differed regarding that. Its prohibition was narrated from a group of Companions, and it is the view of most jurists. Malik said: There is no harm in it if they hire it to mate for a known period, but it is invalid if they stipulate that it mates until the mare conceives. He likened it for some of his companions to the wages of wet-nursing and pollinating palm trees, claiming it is of benefit, and if we prevented it, offspring would cease. Al-Khattabi said: All of this is corrupt due to the Sunnah forbidding it. It is rather a matter of kindness, so people should not withhold it from each other. As for taking a wage for it, it is forbidden and contains ugliness and lack of chivalry. Al-Hasan and Ibn Sirin also permitted it. 
2. Narrated by Ahmad 1/388, he said: Narrated to us Muhammad bin Al-Simak, from Yazid bin Abi Ziyad, from Al-Musayyib bin Rafi', from Abdullah bin Mas'ud, raised (to the Prophet) with it.

text: Imam Ahmad said: Hushaym narrated it to us from Yazid, but he did not raise it (to the Prophet) (1). 465 - What has been related regarding the prohibition of selling animals for animals on credit. There are four Hadiths in it: First: Hadith of Ibn Umar, may Allah be pleased with them both: He forbade selling animals for animals on credit (2). Imam Ahmad said: Ibn Umar is not in it, it is from Ziyad bin Jubayr as Mawquf (stopped at companion) (3). He said once: Mursal (disconnected) (4). Second: Hadith of Samurah, may Allah be pleased with him (similar to it) (5). Imam Ahmad said: The hearing of Al-Hasan from Samurah is not authentic (6). Third: Hadith of Jabir, may Allah be pleased with him: "Two animals for one is not valid on credit, but there is no harm in it hand to hand" (7). Imam Ahmad said: This Hajjaj added in it: "Credit" (Nasa'), and Layth bin Sa'd heard it from
foot_note:
1. (1) "Tarikh Baghdad" 5/369, "Mizan Al-I'tidal" 5/30. 
2. Narrated by Al-Tahawi in "Sharh Ma'ani Al-Athar" 4/60, he said: Narrated to us Muhammad bin Ismail, narrated to us Muslim bin Ibrahim, narrated to us Muhammad bin Dinar, from Yunus bin Ubaid, from Ziyad bin Jubayr, from Ibn Umar, raised (to the Prophet) with it. 
3. "Su'alat Abu Dawood li Ahmad" (547), "Al-Du'afa" by Al-Uqayli 4/64. 
4. "Al-Mughni" by Ibn Qudamah 6/66. 
5. Narrated by Al-Tirmidhi (1237), he said: Narrated to us Abu Musa Muhammad bin Al-Muthanna, narrated to us Abdul Rahman bin Mahdi, from Hammad bin Salamah, from Qatadah, from Al-Hasan, from Samurah, raised (to the Prophet) with it. 
6. "Al-Mughni" by Ibn Qudamah 6/66. 
7. Narrated by Al-Tirmidhi (1238), he said: Narrated to us Abu Ammar Al-Hussein bin Harith, narrated to us Abdullah bin Numayr, from Al-Hajjaj bin Artat, from Abu Al-Zubayr, from Jabir, raised (to the Prophet) with it.

text: Abu Al-Zubayr, and he does not mention in it: "Credit" (1). Fourth: Hadith of Ibn Abbas, may Allah be pleased with them both, that he forbade selling animals for animals on credit (2). Imam Ahmad said: Mursal (3). 466 - What has been related regarding selling debt for debt (Al-Kali' bi Al-Kali'). Hadith of Ibn Umar, may Allah be pleased with them both, that the Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, forbade selling debt for debt (4). Imam Ahmad said: There is no authentic Hadith regarding this, but the consensus of the people is that selling debt for debt is not permissible (5).
foot_note:
1. (1) "Al-Mughni" 6/66. 
2. Narrated by Ibn Hibban 11/401, he said: Informed us Imran bin Musa bin Mujashi', he said: Narrated to us Ibn Abi Shaybah, he said: Narrated to us Abu Dawood Al-Hafari, from Sufyan, from Ma'mar, from Yahya bin Abi Kathir, from Ikrimah, from Ibn Abbas, raised (to the Prophet) with it. 
3. "Al-Mughni" by Ibn Qudamah 6/66. Issue: Abu Isa Al-Tirmidhi said after (1237): The practice upon this is according to most of the people of knowledge from the Companions of the Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, and others regarding selling animals for animals on credit. This is the view of Sufyan Al-Thawri and the people of Kufa, and Ahmad says it. Some of the people of knowledge from the Companions of the Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, permitted selling animals for animals on credit. This is the view of Al-Shafi'i and Ishaq. 
4. Narrated by Al-Baghawi in "Sharh Al-Sunnah" 8/113, he said: Informed us Muhammad bin Al-Hasan Al-Mirband Kasha'i, informed us Abu Al-Abbas Ahmad bin Muhammad bin Siraj Al-Tahhan, informed us Abu Ahmad Muhammad bin Quraysh bin Sulaiman, informed us Abu Al-Hasan Ali bin Abdul Aziz Al-Makki, informed us Abu Ubaid Al-Qasim bin Salam, narrated to me Zaid bin Al-Hubab Al-Ukli, from Musa bin Ubaidah, from Abdullah bin Dinar, from Ibn Umar, raised (to the Prophet) with it. 
5. "Al-Talkhis Al-Habir" 3/26, "Al-'Ilal Al-Mutanahiyah" 2/111-112, "Al-Mughni" 6/106.

text: And he said once: Narration from Musa bin Ubaidah is not lawful to me, and I do not know this Hadith from anyone else (1). And he said once after mentioning this Hadith: Musa bin Ubaidah is not to be busied with (2). And he said once: When asked about Abdullah bin Dinar from whom Musa bin Ubaidah narrated the prohibition of selling debt for debt, he said: He is not the one from whom Al-Thawri narrated. It was said: Then who is he? He said: I do not know. Al-Uqayli asserted that it is him (3). And he said once: This is a denounced [Munkar] Hadith (4). 467 - What has been related regarding selling fruit for dried dates. Hadith of Ibn Umar, may Allah be pleased with them both: "Do not sell fruit for dried dates" (5). Imam Ahmad said: Thus says Al-Zuhri, and this has no face (validity), rather
foot_note:
1. (1) "Al-Talkhis Al-Habir" 3/26. 
2. "Al-Jarh wa Al-Ta'dil" 8/152. Benefit: Ibn Al-Athir said in "Al-Nihayah" 4/194: It is when a man buys something for a deferred payment, then when the payment is due, he does not find what to pay with, so he says: Sell it to me for another term with an increase in something, so he sells it and no exchange takes place between them. Benefit: Imam Ahmad was asked about Al-Kali' bi Al-Kali', he said: Like a man having a debt on a man, and another having a debt on another, so this one refers this one to this one, and this one to this one.

4. "Tahdhib Al-Kamal" 29/109. 
5. Narrated by Al-Bukhari (2183), he said: Narrated to us Yahya bin Bukair, narrated to us Al-Layth, from Uqail, from Ibn Shihab, informed me Salim, from Abdullah bin Umar, may Allah be pleased with them both, that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, said: "Do not sell fruit until its ripeness appears, and do not sell fruit for dried dates."

text: people say: Fresh dates (Rutab) (1) for dried dates (Tamr) (2). 468 - What has been related regarding selling fruits before their ripeness appears. Hadith of Zaid bin Thabit, may Allah be pleased with him: "If not, then do not sell fruit until its ripeness appears" (3). The Imam admired it when Ahmad bin Salih narrated it to him and asked him for more of it, so I said: And from where is the like of him (4).
foot_note:
1. (1) Narrated by Ibn Abi Shaybah 6/182. Narrated to us Ibn Abi Za'idah, from Ubaydullah, from Umar, from Nafi', from Ibn Umar, he said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, forbade selling fresh dates for dried dates by measure, and selling grapes for raisins by measure, and selling grain for wheat by measure. 
2. "Masa'il Salih li Al-Imam Ahmad" (992). 
3. Narrated by Abu Dawood (3372), he said: Narrated to us Ahmad bin Salih, narrated to us Anbasah bin Khalid, narrated to me Yunus, he said: I asked Abu Al-Zinad about selling fruit before its ripeness appears and what was mentioned regarding that, so he said: Urwah bin Al-Zubayr used to narrate from Sahl bin Abi Hathmah, from Zaid bin Thabit, he said: People used to sell fruits before their ripeness appeared, so when people harvested and their payment was due, the buyer would say: The fruit has been affected by blight (Daman), affected by shriveling (Qasham), and affected by diseases (Mirad), defects they argued with. When their disputes increased before the Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, said as advice pointing to it: "If not, then do not..." so he mentioned it. 
4. "Siyar A'lam Al-Nubala" 21/173, "Tarikh Baghdad" 4/198, "Tarikh Abi Zur'ah Al-Dimashqi" (207). And the text is authentic established without this story, for Al-Bukhari narrated it 2194 from the Hadith of Ibn Umar, may Allah be pleased with them both.

text: 469 - What has been related regarding the prohibition of a sale and a condition. Hadith of Abdullah bin Amr bin Al-Aas, may Allah be pleased with him: He forbade a sale and a condition (1). Imam Ahmad said: Denounced [Munkar] (2). 470 - Invalid conditions in sharecropping (Muzara'ah) and irrigation (Musaqat). Hadith of Mujahid: So the Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, assigned the crops to the owner of the seed and annulled the owner of the land, and assigned to the worker a dirham every day, and to the owner of the ox something (3). Imam Ahmad said: It is not authentic, and the practice is upon other than it (4). And he said once: It is denounced; because the Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, assigned the crops to the owner of the land,
foot_note:
1. (1) Narrated by Al-Tabarani in Al-Awsat 4/530, he said: Narrated to us Abdullah bin Ayyub Al-Qurabi, he said: Narrated to us Muhammad bin Sulaiman Al-Dhuhli, he said: Narrated to us Abdul Warith bin Sa'id, he said: I came to Mecca and found in it Abu Hanifa, Ibn Abi Layla, and Ibn Shubrumah. So I asked Abu Hanifa, I said: What do you say regarding a man who sold a sale and stipulated a condition? He said: The sale is void and the condition is void. Then I came to Ibn Abi Layla and asked him, he said: The sale is valid and the condition is void. Then I came to Ibn Shubrumah and asked him, he said: The sale is valid and the condition is valid. I said: Glory be to Allah! Three of the jurists of Iraq differed upon me in a single issue. So I came to Abu Hanifa and informed him, he said: I do not know what they said, narrated to me Amr bin Shu'aib, from his father, from his grandfather that the Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, forbade a sale and a condition. The sale is void and the condition is void. 
2. "Al-Mughni" by Ibn Qudamah 6/323, "Al-Fatawa" by Ibn Taymiyyah 29/132. 
3. Narrated by Al-Daraqutni in "Al-Sunan" 3/76, he said: Narrated to us Da'laj bin Ahmad, narrated to us Muhammad bin Ali bin Zaid, narrated to us Sa'id bin Mansur, from Al-Walid bin Muslim, from Al-Awza'i, and from Wasil bin Abi Jamil, from Mujahid, he said: Four people shared a crop during the time of the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him. One of them said: The ox is on me. The other said: The land is from me. The other said: The seed is from me. And the other said: The work is from me. So the Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, assigned the crop... The Hadith. 
4. "Al-Mughni" by Ibn Qudamah 7/567-568.

text: and in this Hadith, he assigned the crops to the owner of the seed (1). And he said: I said to Abdul Rahman bin Mahdi: I asked Yahya bin Sa'id about this Hadith but he did not narrate it to me. Abdul Rahman said: Delay [this] Hadith, I will narrate it (2). And he said once: The Hadith is the Hadith of Abu Ja'far Al-Khatmi (3). 471 - What has been related regarding one who sold a slave. There are two paths from Ibn Umar, may Allah be pleased with them both: First: From the path of Salim from him: "Whoever buys palm trees after they have been pollinated, their fruit belongs to the seller, unless the buyer stipulates otherwise. And whoever sells a slave who has wealth, his wealth belongs to the seller unless the buyer stipulates otherwise" (4).

2. "Masa'il Abu Dawood" (1875). 
3. "Taqrir Al-Qawa'id wa Tahrir Al-Fawa'id" by Ibn Rajab 2/134-135. It is what Abu Dawood narrated (3399), he said: Narrated to us Muhammad bin Bashar, narrated to us Yahya Abu Ja'far Al-Khatmi, he said: My uncle sent me and a servant of his to Sa'id bin Al-Musayyib, he said: So we said to him: Something has reached us from you regarding sharecropping. He said: Ibn Umar did not see any harm in it until a Hadith reached him from Rafi' bin Khadij, so he went to him. Rafi' informed him that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, came to Banu Harithah and saw crops in the land of Dhuhayr, so he said: "How excellent is the crop of Dhuhayr!" They said: It is not for Dhuhayr. He said: "Is it not Dhuhayr's land?" They said: Yes, but it is the crop of so-and-so. He said: "Then take your crops and return the expenses to him." Rafi' said: So we took our crops and returned the expenses to him. Sa'id said: Lend to your brother, or rent for dirhams. 
4. Narrated by Al-Bukhari (2379) and Muslim (1543), both from the path of Al-Layth, he said: Narrated to me Ibn Shihab, from Salim bin Abdullah, from his father, raised (to the Prophet) with it.

text: Imam Ahmad said when the Hadith of Nafi' from Ibn Umar from Umar (1) was mentioned to him, he said: Salim contradicted him. This is how Al-Zuhri narrated it, from Salim, from Ibn Umar, from the Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him. It was said to him: So which one is established? He smiled and said: Allah knows best. It was said to him: Which one does your heart incline to? He said: I see - and Allah knows best - towards Nafi' (2). And once: Ahmad inclined towards the saying of Nafi' which he stopped (Waqf) (3).
foot_note:
1. (1) "Al-Muwatta" 280 narration of Al-Shaybani, he said: Informed us Malik, informed us Nafi', from Abdullah bin Umar that Umar bin Al-Khattab said: Whoever sells a slave... The Hadith is Mawquf without mentioning the story of the palm trees. 
2. "'Ilal Al-Marwazi" (274). 
3. "Sharh 'Ilal Al-Tirmidhi" by Ibn Rajab 2/473. Benefit: Al-Bayhaqi quoted in "Al-Sunan Al-Kubra" 5/324-325 (paraphrased), from Abu Hamid Ahmad bin Muhammad bin Al-Hasan saying: I asked Muslim bin Al-Hajjaj, may Allah have mercy on him, about the difference between Salim and Nafi' in the story of the slave. He said: The saying is what Nafi' said, even if Salim is more of a Hafiz than him. And so said Al-Nasa'i. Then he said: And I saw in the book "Al-'Ilal" by Abu Isa Al-Tirmidhi, he said: I asked Muhammad - meaning Al-Bukhari - about it, so he said: Indeed, Nafi' contradicts Salim in Hadiths, and this is one of those Hadiths. It was as if he saw both Hadiths as authentic and that it is possible from both of them. Al-Hafiz said in "Al-Fath" 4/469-475: There was disagreement upon Nafi' and Salim in raising (to the Prophet) what is other than the palm trees. Al-Zuhri narrated it from Salim from his father raised (to the Prophet) regarding the story of the palm trees and the slave together. This is how the Hafizs narrated it from Al-Zuhri. Sufyan bin Husain contradicted them and added Ibn Umar from Umar raised (to the Prophet) for all the Hadiths; Al-Nasa'i narrated it. Malik, Al-Layth, Ayyub, Ubaydullah bin Umar, and others narrated from Nafi' from Ibn Umar the story of the palm trees, and Ibn Umar from Umar the story of the slave as Mawquf. Abu Dawood also narrated it from the path of Malik with both chains. In Al-Bukhari in 'Ash-Shurb' from the path of Malik regarding the story of the slave as Mawquf. Muslim, Al-Nasa'i, and Al-Daraqutni in "Al-Tatabbu'" 435-436 asserted the preference for Nafi's detailed narration over Salim's narration. Ali bin Al-Madini, Al-Bukhari, and Ibn Abd Al-Barr inclined towards preferring Salim's narration. And it was narrated from =

text: Second: The Hadith of Ikrimah from Ibn Umar, like it. Imam Ahmad said: Sa'id narrated "Whoever sells a slave who has wealth" from Qatadah, from Ikrimah, from Ibn Umar (1), and Hisham and Hammam (2) narrated it from Ikrimah, who is Ibn Khalid, from Al-Zuhri (3).
foot_note:
1. = Nafi' raising both stories, Al-Nasa'i narrated it from the path of Abd Rabbih bin Sa'id, and it is a mistake (Wahm). Abdul Razzaq narrated from Ma'mar, from Ayyub, from Nafi', he said: The matter of the slave is only from Umar. This does not refute the statement of those who authenticated both paths, and allowed that the Hadith is from Nafi' from Ibn Umar in both ways. Also, Al-Hafiz said in "Al-Fath" 5/63: Abu Dawood and Ibn Abd Al-Barr said: This is one of the four Hadiths in which Salim and Nafi' differed. Abu Umar said: They agreed on raising the Hadith of palm trees, but as for the story of the slave, Salim raised it and Nafi' stopped it at Umar. Al-Bukhari preferred Salim's narration in raising the Hadith. Summary: Imam Ahmad, Al-Nasa'i, Muslim, and Al-Daraqutni went to preferring Nafi's Mawquf narration, while Ali bin Al-Madini, Al-Bukhari, and Ibn Abd Al-Barr went to Salim's narration as raised.

And informed us Abu Al-Hussein bin Bishran in Baghdad, informed us Abu Ja'far Muhammad bin Amr, they said: Narrated to us Ahmad bin Al-Walid Al-Fahham. Narrated to us Abdul Wahhab bin Ata, from Sa'id, from Qatadah, from Ikrimah bin Khalid, from Ibn Umar, raised (to the Prophet) with it.

text: 475 - What came regarding Sarf (Money Exchange), there are two Hadiths in it: The First: The Hadith of Ibn Umar (may Allah be pleased with them both): "There is no harm in taking them at the rate of that day as long as you do not separate while there is something between you [outstanding]" (1). Imam Ahmad said: Hammad bin Salamah wrote from Simak in Wasit, and he wrote from Hammad bin Abi Sulayman and Asim bin Bahdalah in Basra, and he came to them. Shu'bah said: How did Hammad hear this? Perhaps he only sat with Simak for two or three sessions; I have sat with Simak for more than one hundred sessions and I did not hear this. Ahmad said: Hammad used to be independent [relying on his own memory] and he began affirming it (2). The Second: The Hadith of Zaid bin Arqam and Al-Bara bin Azib (may Allah be pleased with them both): "If it is hand to hand, there is no harm, but if it is on credit, it is not valid" (3). Imam Ahmad said: Hasan bin Muslim did not hear it from Abu Al-Minhal (4).
foot_note:
1. (1) Reported by Abu Dawud (3354), he said: Musa bin Isma'il and Muhammad bin Mahbub - the meaning is one - narrated to us, saying: Hammad narrated to us from Simak bin Harb, from Sa'id bin Jubayr, from Ibn Umar, who said: I used to sell camels at Al-Baqi', so I would sell for Dinars and take Dirhams, and I would sell for Dirhams and take Dinars. I would take this from that, and give this from that. So I came to the Messenger of Allah while he was in Hafsah's house and said: O Messenger of Allah, take your time, I ask you: I sell camels at Al-Baqi', so I sell for Dinars and take Dirhams, and I sell for Dirhams and take Dinars, and I take this from that, and give this from that. The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: "There is no harm in taking them at the rate of that day as long as you do not separate while there is something between you."
2. "Al-Kamil" by Ibn Adi 3/38.
3. Reported by Ahmad 4/368, 373, he said: Rawh narrated to us, from Ibn Jurayj, Hasan bin Muslim informed us, from Abu Al-Minhal that he heard Zaid bin Arqam and Al-Bara bin Azib saying: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) was heard saying regarding Sarf... The Hadith.
4. "Musnad Ahmad" 4/368, 373.

text: 476 - What came regarding the prohibition of renting land. The Hadith of Rafi' bin Khadij (may Allah be pleased with him): "Do not do it; farm it yourselves, or let it be farmed [by others for free], or hold onto it" (1). Imam Ahmad said: The Hadith of Rafi' bin Khadij regarding the prohibition of renting farms is disordered (Mudtarib) in its wordings and is not authentic. The best of them is the Hadith of Ya'la bin Hakim from Sulayman bin Yasar (2) from Rafi' bin Khadij (3). And he said once: Different types have been narrated from Rafi' regarding this; it is a Hadith of many colors (4). And he said once: The Hadith of Rafi' is disputed; different colors are narrated from him. Sometimes
foot_note:
1. (1) Reported by Al-Bukhari (2339) and Muslim (1548), both from the path of Al-Awza'i, from Abu An-Najashi, the Mawla of Rafi' bin Khadij, from Rafi' bin Khadij, that Zuhair bin Rafi' - who is his uncle - said: Zuhair came to me and said: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) forbade a matter that was beneficial/easy for us. I said: What is that? Whatever the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said is truth. He said: He asked me, "How do you deal with your fields?" I said: We rent them out, O Messenger of Allah, for [the produce of] the stream banks (Rabi') or for Awsuq (measures) of dates or barley. He said: "Do not do it; farm it yourselves, or let it be farmed, or hold onto it."
2. Reported by Muslim (1548), he said: Ali bin Hajar As-Sa'di and Ya'qub bin Ibrahim narrated to me, saying: Isma'il bin Ulayyah narrated to us, from Ayyub, from Ya'la bin Hakim, from Sulayman bin Yasar, from Rafi' bin Khadij, who said: We used to practice Muhaqalah (sharecropping) with land during the time of the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him), renting it out for a third or a quarter or a named [amount of] food. One day, a man from my uncles came to us and said: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) forbade us from a matter that was beneficial to us, but obedience to Allah and His Messenger is more beneficial to us. He forbade us from practicing Muhaqalah with land, renting it for a third or a quarter or named food. And he ordered the owner of the land to farm it or let it be farmed, and he disliked renting it out and anything other than that.
3. "Al-Tamhid" by Ibn Abd al-Barr 3/38.
4. Al-Bayhaqi in "Al-Sunan" 6/135, "Al-Mughni" by Ibn Qudamah 7/558.

The Hadith of Aisha (may Allah be pleased with her): "Whoever buys pollinated palm trees, its fruit belongs to the seller unless the buyer stipulates [otherwise]" (1). Imam Ahmad said when asked about the Hadith of Abu Khalid Al-Ahmar, from Hajjaj, from Ibn Abi Mulaykah, from Aisha as raised (Marfu') with it, and from Hajjaj, from Ibn Abi Mulaykah and Ata and Makhul, from the Prophet (peace be upon him) (2), and from Hajjaj, from Nafi, from Ibn Umar. Imam Ahmad said: This which they narrate from Hajjaj, from Ibn Abi Mulaykah, is Mursal (disconnected). And this which Ubaidullah and Ayyub narrate, from Nafi, from Ibn Umar, from Umar, is Mursal (3). 478 - What came regarding the sale of real estate. The Hadith of Hudhayfah (may Allah be pleased with him): "Whoever sells a house and does not buy a house with its price, he will not be blessed in it" (4).

text: 482 - What came regarding acknowledging Kharaj (Land Tax). The Hadith of Anas (may Allah be pleased with him): "Whoever acknowledges the Kharaj while he is capable of not acknowledging it, upon him is the curse of Allah, the angels, and all people, and Allah will not accept from him any exchange or compensation" (1). Imam Ahmad said: This is a Munkar (denounced) Hadith. It has been narrated about Ibn Umar that he used to dislike entering into Kharaj, and he said: Kharaj was only during the time of Umar (2).
foot_note:
1. = And it is said of a slave - if his master has a levy on him - 'Makharij'. And the meaning of his saying: "The profit follows the responsibility" is: The sold item, if it has income and yield, then the owner of the neck (the asset) - who is the guarantor of the original asset - owns the profit by guaranteeing the asset. So if a man buys land and occupies it, or livestock and breeds it, or a beast and rides it, or a slave and uses him, then finds a defect in him, he has the right to return the asset (neck), and he owes nothing for what he benefited from; because if it had perished between the time of the contract and the annulment, it would have been under the guarantee of the buyer. Thus, it was necessary that the profit belongs to him by right. The people of knowledge differed on this. Ash-Shafi'i said: Whatever occurred in the ownership of the buyer from yield, livestock offspring, or slave's child, all of that is the same; he returns nothing of it, and he returns the sold item if it has not decreased from what he took. And the People of Opinion (Ashab al-Ra'y) said: If it was livestock and he milked it, or palm trees or trees and he ate their fruit, he does not have the right to return it due to defect, but he returns for the compensation of the defect (Arsh). And they said regarding the house, the beast, the slave, and the yield: It belongs to him, and he returns due to defect. And Malik said regarding the wool of livestock and their hair: It belongs to the buyer and he returns the livestock to the seller, but as for their offspring, he returns them with the mothers.
1. Narrated by Ibn Abi Hatim in "Al-Ilal" 2/441, from the path of Nusayr bin Muhammad Ar-Razi, the companion of Ibn Al-Mubarak, from Uthman bin Za'idah, from Az-Zubayr bin Adi, from Anas as Marfu' with it. I say: And Yahya bin Adam reported it in "Al-Kharaj" p. 54, he said: From Ubaidullah Al-Ashja'i, from Sufyan bin Sa'id, from Az-Zubayr bin Adi, from a man from Juhaynah, as Marfu' with it.
2. "Masa'il Salih" (174), "Bada'i al-Fawa'id" 4/75.

text: Imam Ahmad said: There is disagreement in this from Salamah bin Kuhail (1). 485 - What came regarding returning found property to its owner after a year. The Hadith of Zaid bin Khalid Al-Juhani (may Allah be pleased with him): "Announce it for a year, if it is not recognized, then know its container (Afas) and its strap (Wika), then eat it. If its owner comes, then return it to him" (2). Imam Ahmad said: This Hadith is the most authentic thing in this chapter (3). And he said once: I follow the Hadith of Ad-Dahhak bin Uthman; he perfected it, and no one narrated it like he did (4). And it was said to him: Among them are those who say: 'Aqasaha' (its locks/braids), meaning Dawud?
foot_note:
1. = a whip, so I took it. They said to me: Leave it. I said: No, but I will announce it, and if its owner comes [I will give it], otherwise I will use it. He said: So I refused them. When we returned from our campaign, it was decreed for me that I performed Hajj, so I came to Medina and met Ubay bin Ka'b, and informed him of the matter of the whip and their saying. He said: I found a purse containing one hundred Dinars during the time of the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him), so I brought it to the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him)... And in all their Hadiths [it mentions] three years, except Hammad bin Salamah, for in his Hadith it is two years or three. text: The Book of Shuf'ah (Pre-emption) 487 - What came regarding pre-emption by neighborliness. The Hadith of Anas (may Allah be pleased with him): "The neighbor of the house has more right to the house" (1). Imam Ahmad said: It is not a thing. So it was said to him: Both of them are according to him - meaning: according to Isa bin Yunus - from Sa'id, from Qatada, from Al-Hasan, from Samurah (2) regarding pre-emption. And the Hadith of Isa bin Yunus, from Sa'id, from Qatada, from Anas is like it. Imam Ahmad did not care for his combining the two Hadiths, and he denied the Hadith of Anas (3). And he said once: Isa bin Yunus erred in it (4). 488 - What came regarding pre-emption for the absent person. The Hadith of Jabir bin Abdullah (may Allah be pleased with them both): "The neighbor has more right to his pre-emption; he is waited for, even if he is absent, if their path is one" (5). Imam Ahmad said: This is a Munkar (denounced) Hadith (6). And he said once: It is not in the book of Ghundar (7). And he said once: Shu'bah said: Delay [this hadith] for the likes of this and destroy it (8). 489 - What came regarding pre-emption in what has not been divided. text: The Book of Manumission (Itq) 495 - What came regarding manumission. The Hadith of Aisha (may Allah be pleased with her): There were three rulings in Barirah (1). Imam Ahmad said: Between Al-Qasim and Hisham bin Urwah is Abdur-Rahman bin Al-Qasim (2). 496 - What came regarding the mention of the slave's striving (Si'ayah). The Hadith of Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him): "Whoever frees a share of his in a slave, then his complete freedom is upon him in his money if he has money; if he does not have money, the slave is made to work (Istis'a) without being overburdened" (3). Imam Ahmad said: Ibn Abi Arubah narrates it mentioning the striving (Istis'a), but as for Shu'bah (4) and Hammam, they did not mention it, and I do not hold the view of Istis'a (5).

But if he does not have wealth, a fair value is assessed for him, and he frees from him what he freed."
6. "Masa'il Abdullah" (1427). I say: The mention of Istis'a in this Hadith is disputed. Sa'id bin Abi Arubah, Jarir bin Hazim, Aban, Hajjaj bin Hajjaj, and Musa bin Khalaf narrated it from Qatada mentioning it. While Shu'bah, Hisham, and Hammam narrated it from Qatada without mentioning it. In Hammam's narration, he separated the Istis'a, making it from the speech of Qatada, not from the Hadith of Abu Hurairah from the Prophet (peace be upon him). It is known that the reliable companions of Qatada are Shu'bah, Sa'id bin Abi Arubah, Hisham, and Hammam, so the narration of the Companions is prioritized over those who oppose them. Al-Bardiji said in "Sharh Ilal At-Tirmidhi" by Ibn Rajab 2/504: If a Hadith of Sa'id bin Abi Arubah from Qatada from Anas as Marfu' is presented to you, and Hisham and Shu'bah oppose him, judgment is for Shu'bah and Hisham over Sa'id. I say: It is known that Al-Bukhari (may Allah have mercy on him) accepts the addition from the trustworthy Hafiz from the companions of the Sheikh even if he opposes the rest of the companions, provided that the number of opposers is not large. Based on this rule, he used this Hadith as proof. Benefit: Ad-Daraqutni criticized this Hadith, as did Ibn Abd al-Barr in Al-Tamhid, Abu Mas'ud Ad-Dimashqi, Al-Asili, Ibn Al-Qassar, Al-Hakim in Ma'rifat Ulum al-Hadith, and others, as previously explained like the speech of Imam Ahmad, and it is the truth, if Allah wills. Al-Hafiz defended the authenticity of the Hadith in "Al-Fath", as did Ibn Al-Mawwaq, and the former is more likely, and Allah knows best. I say: The meaning of Istis'a in this Hadith is: The slave is tasked with earning and seeking until the value of the other partner's share is obtained; if he pays it to him, he becomes free. This is how the majority of those who advocate Istis'a interpreted it. Some said: It is that he serves his master who did not free him according to the portion of slavery he still has in him; according to this, the Hadiths agree.

text: Book of Marriage 501 - What has been related regarding the virtue of marriage and encouragement of it. There are two Hadiths in it: First: Hadith of Uthman, may Allah be pleased with him: "Whoever among you can afford it, let him get married, for it is more lowering for the gaze and more guarding for the private parts" (1). Imam Ahmad said: I do not see it as anything but an error from Abu Ma'shar - meaning: from Uthman is an error; rather it is from Ibrahim, from Alqamah, from Abdullah (2) that he said to Uthman: The Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, said to us. And from Ibrahim from Abdul Rahman bin Yazid, from Abdullah (3) from the Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him (4). Second: Hadith of Abu Hurairah, may Allah be pleased with him: "O young men, whoever among you can afford marriage, let him get married" (5). Imam Ahmad said: This is from Al-Walid, we fear that it is not preserved from Al-Awza'i; because Al-Walid narrated it in Homs and it is not with the people of Damascus (6). 502 - What has been related regarding the consideration of compatibility (Kafa'ah) in marriage. There are three Hadiths in it: First: Hadith of Jabir bin Abdullah, may Allah be pleased with them both: "Do not marry women except to compatible men (Akfa'), and do not marry them off except through guardians (Awliya'), and no dowry (Mahr) is less than ten dirhams" (7).

text: 511 - What has been related regarding marriage upon a Surah from the Qur'an. Hadith of Sahl bin Sa'd Al-Sa'idi, may Allah be pleased with him, and in it: "Go and search, even if it is an iron ring." So he went and searched, then came back and said: I did not find anything, not even an iron ring. He said: Do you have anything of the Qur'an? He said: I have Surah so-and-so and Surah so-and-so. He said: "Go, for I have married her to you for what you have of the Qur'an" (1). Imam Ahmad said when asked about marriage upon a Surah from the Qur'an. He said: Leave this. It was said to him: Is it not authentic? He said: Leave it. If I forbid you from something, then desist (2).
foot_note:
1. (1) Narrated by Al-Bukhari (5149), he said: Narrated to us Ali bin Abdullah, narrated to us Sufyan, I heard Abu Hazim say: I heard Sahl bin Sa'd Al-Sa'idi say: I was among the people with the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, when a woman stood up and said: O Messenger of Allah, she has gifted herself to you, so see your opinion regarding her. He did not answer her anything. Then she stood up and said: O Messenger of Allah, she has gifted herself to you, so see your opinion regarding her. He did not answer her anything... The Hadith. 
2. "Al-Wara'" 119. Issue: Ibn Qudamah said in "Al-Mughni" 6/683 (paraphrased): As for teaching the Qur'an, the narration from Ahmad differed regarding making it a dowry. He said in one place: I dislike it. And he said in another place: There is no harm if he marries upon teaching a Surah from the Qur'an, or upon two sandals, and this is the school of Al-Shafi'i. Abu Bakr said: There are two sayings - meaning two narrations - in the issue. He said: And my choice is that it is not permissible, and this is the school of Malik, Al-Layth, Abu Hanifa, Makhul, and Ishaq. Those who permitted it argued with the Hadith of Sahl bin Sa'd Al-Sa'idi and in it... "I have married her to you for what you have of the Qur'an" agreed upon. The basis for the other narration: That private parts are not made permissible except with wealth; due to His saying, Exalted is He: {seek with your wealth}, and His saying: {And whoever among you cannot afford the means to marry free, believing women} and 'Al-Tawl' means wealth. And it has been narrated that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, married a man upon a Surah from the Qur'an, then said: "It shall not be a dowry for anyone after you," narrated by Al-Najjad with his chain. And because teaching the Qur'an is not permissible to occur except as an act of worship for its doer, so it is not valid to be a dowry like fasting, prayer, and teaching faith. And because teaching differs between teacher and learner and can hardly be regulated; so it resembled something unknown. As for the Hadith of gifting, it has been said: Its meaning is I married her to you for what you have of the Qur'an, meaning I married her to you; because you are of the people of the Qur'an, just as he married Abu Talha upon his Islam. Ibn Abd Al-Barr narrated with his chain from Anas that Abu Talha married Umm Sulaim upon his Islam. And there is no mention of teaching in the authentic Hadith. It is possible that it was specific to that man, evidenced by what Al-Najjad narrated, and there is no branching upon this narration. As for the other (view), it is necessary to specify what he teaches her, either a specific Surah or Surahs or specific verses because Surahs differ and likewise verses. I say: Perhaps Imam Ahmad intended the jurisprudential aspect in his comment on the Hadith, and Allah knows best.

Narrated by Al-Bayhaqi in "Al-Sunan" 7/117, he said: Informed us Abu Tahir Al-Faqih and Abu Sa'id bin Abi Amr, they said: Narrated to us Abu Al-Abbas Muhammad bin Yaqub, narrated to us Muhammad bin Ishaq Al-Saghani, informed us Al-Hakam bin Musa, narrated to us Shu'aib bin Ishaq, from Al-Awza'i, from Ata, from Jabir bin Abdullah, may Allah be pleased with them both... The Hadith.

text: Hadith of Anas, may Allah be pleased with him: "There is no Shighar in Islam" (1). Imam Ahmad said: This is a denounced [Munkar] Hadith from the narration of Thabit (2). And he said once: This is the work of Aban, meaning: it is the Hadith of Aban, and Ma'mar (narrated it). Meaning: He did Tadlis (concealed the narrator) (3). 516 - What has been related regarding the prohibition of Mut'ah marriage (temporary marriage). Hadith of Ali bin Abi Talib, may Allah be pleased with him: That the Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, forbade Mut'ah and the meat of domestic donkeys at the time of Khaybar (4). Imam Ahmad said: It is only Abdullah and Hasan, the two sons of Ali, from their father, but
foot_note:
1. (1) Narrated by Ibn Majah (1885), he said: Narrated to us Al-Hussein bin Mahdi, informed us Abdul Razzaq, informed us Ma'mar, from Thabit, from Anas bin Malik, he said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, said... The Hadith. 
2. "'Ilal Al-Marwazi" (266). 
3. "Sharh 'Ilal Al-Tirmidhi" 393. I say: The text of the Hadith is established, for Al-Bukhari narrated it (5112) from the Hadith of Nafi', from Ibn Umar: That the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, forbade Shighar. And Shighar is: That a man marries off his daughter on the condition that the other marries his daughter to him, with no dowry between them. Issue: Al-Khattabi said in "Ma'alim Al-Sunan" 3/164: The interpretation of Shighar is what Nafi' explained. He said: If the marriage occurs in this description, is it invalid? Because the Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, forbade it, and the origin of sexual relations is prohibition, and prohibition is not lifted by prohibition, but is lifted by permissibility. The jurists did not differ that the Prophet's prohibition of marrying a woman along with her paternal aunt or maternal aunt implies forbiddance, and likewise his prohibition of Mut'ah marriage, so likewise this. Among those who invalidated this marriage are Malik, Al-Shafi'i, Ahmad bin Hanbal, Ishaq bin Rahwayh, and Abu Ubaid. The scholars of opinion and Sufyan Al-Thawri said: The marriage is valid and for each of them is a dowry of her like, and the meaning of the prohibition in this according to them is making the private parts lawful without a dowry. 
4. Narrated by Al-Bukhari (5115), he said: Narrated to us Malik bin Ismail, narrated to us Ibn Uyainah that he heard Al-Zuhri say: Informed me Al-Hasan bin Muhammad bin Ali and his brother Abdullah from their father that Ali, may Allah be pleased with him, said to Ibn Abbas... The Hadith.

text: Ma'mar said it like this (1). 517 - What has been related regarding the prohibition of marrying a slave girl over a free woman. Hadith of Al-Hasan, may Allah be pleased with him: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, forbade that a slave girl be married over a free woman (2). Imam Ahmad said: The Hadith of Sufyan from Hisham bin Abi Abdullah is strange [Gharib]; it was only narrated by Amr bin Ubaid, and it is strange from the Hadith of Amir Al-Ahwal (3) (4).
foot_note:
1. (1) "Al-'Ilal" narration of Abdullah (3797) from the path of Ismail bin Ulayyah, he said: Narrated to us Ma'mar, from Al-Zuhri, from Abdullah bin Muhammad bin Ali, from Ali that the Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him... so he mentioned it. 
2. Narrated by Al-Tabarani 5/17, he said: Narrated to us Al-Muthanna, he said: Narrated to us Hibban bin Musa, he said: Informed us Ibn Al-Mubarak, he said: Informed us Sufyan, from Hisham, from Amir Al-Ahwal, from Al-Hasan, raised (to the Prophet) with it. 
3. Narrated by Abdul Razzaq in his "Musannaf" 7/264 from Al-Thawri, from Amr bin Ubaid, from Al-Hasan raised (to the Prophet) with it. 
4. "Al-'Ilal" narration of Abdullah (4326).

publisher: Dar Al-Falah for Scientific Research and Heritage Verification, Fayoum - Arab Republic of Egypt
text: 518 - What has been related regarding the prohibition of marriage for the Muhrim. Hadith of Uthman bin Affan, may Allah be pleased with him: "The Muhrim does not marry, nor get married (to another), nor propose" (1). Imam Ahmad was asked: Did Aban hear from his father? He said: No, from where would he hear from him (2)? 519 - What has been related regarding 'Azl (coitus interruptus) with a free woman. Hadith of Umar bin Al-Khattab, may Allah be pleased with him: "One does not practice 'Azl with a free woman except with her permission" (3). Imam Ahmad said: How Munkar (denounced) it is (4)!
foot_note:
1. (1) Narrated by Muslim (1409), he said: Narrated to us Yahya bin Yahya, he said: I read to Malik, from Nafi', from Nabih bin Wahb that Umar bin Ubaidullah wanted to marry Talhah bin Umar to the daughter of Shaibah bin Jubayr, so he sent for Aban bin Uthman to attend that, and he was the Amir of Hajj, so Aban said: I heard Uthman say: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, said: "He does not marry..." The Hadith. 
2. "Jami' Al-Tahsil" 139. 
3. Narrated by Ahmad 1/31, he said: Narrated to us Ishaq bin Isa, narrated to us Ibn Lahi'ah, from Ja'far bin Rabi'ah, from Al-Zuhri, from Muharrir bin Abi Hurairah, from his father, from Umar bin Al-Khattab, raised (to the Prophet) with it. 
4. "Masa'il Abu Dawood" (1869), "Zad Al-Ma'ad" 5/142. Issue: Al-Hafiz said in "Al-Fath" 9/218-219 (paraphrased): Ibn Abd Al-Barr said: There is no disagreement among scholars that one does not practice 'Azl with a free wife except with her permission; because intercourse is one of her rights, and she has the right to demand it, and the known intercourse is only that which is not followed by 'Azl. Ibn Hubayrah agreed with him on this consensus, but it was critiqued that what is known according to the Shafi'is is that the woman has no right to intercourse at all. However, the three schools agreed that the free woman is not practiced 'Azl with except with her permission, and the slave girl is practiced 'Azl with without her permission.

text: 520 - What came regarding the two polytheist spouses when one of them accepts Islam. There are three Hadiths in this: First: The Hadith of Ibn Abbas (may Allah be pleased with them both): The Prophet (peace be upon him) returned his daughter Zainab to Abu Al-Aas bin Ar-Rabi' after six years with the first marriage, and he did not initiate a [new] marriage (1). Imam Ahmad said: Authentic (Sahih) (2). And he said once: I do not think it is authentic; they differ concerning it (3). And he was asked about it once, and it was as if he did not affirm it (4). Second: The Hadith of Abdullah bin Amr bin Al-Aas (may Allah be pleased with them both): That the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) returned his daughter Zainab to Abu Al-Aas bin Ar-Rabi' with a new dowry (Mahr) and a new marriage (5). Imam Ahmad said: This is a weak Hadith. Or he said: Flimsy (Wah). Al-Hajjaj did not hear it from Amr bin Shu'aib; he only heard it from Muhammad bin Ubaidullah Al-Arzami, and Al-Arzami's Hadith is worth nothing (6).
foot_note:
1. (1) Reported by At-Tirmidhi (1143), he said: Hannad narrated to us, Yunus bin Bukair narrated to us, from Muhammad bin Ishaq, he said: Dawud bin Al-Husain narrated to me, from Ikrimah, from Ibn Abbas, who said: The Prophet (peace be upon him) returned... so he mentioned it.
2. "Musnad Ahmad" 2/208, "Zad al-Ma'ad" 5/264, "Ahkam Ahl al-Dhimma" by Ibn al-Qayyim 1/243, 247.
3. "Al-Jami' li-Ahkam Ahl al-Dhimma" by Al-Khallal 1/271-272.
4. "Masa'il Ibn Hani" (1059).
5. Reported by At-Tirmidhi (1142), he said: Ahmad bin Mani' and Hannad narrated to us, saying: Abu Mu'awiyah narrated to us, from Al-Hajjaj, from Amr bin Shu'aib, from his father, from his grandfather that the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him)... The Hadith.
6. "Musnad Ahmad" 2/208, "Al-Jami' li-Ahkam Ahl al-Dhimma" by Al-Khallal 1/261-262, "Ahkam Ahl al-Dhimma" by Ibn al-Qayyim 1/243.

text: And he said once: I read in some books, from Al-Hajjaj who said: Muhammad bin Ubaidullah Al-Arzami narrated to me, from Amr bin Shu'aib, from his father, from his grandfather, from the Prophet (peace be upon him). He said: And Muhammad bin Ubaidullah, people abandoned his Hadith (1). And he said once: There is no basis for that (2). And he said once: I do not know if he returned her with the first marriage or with a new marriage; because the Hadiths are disordered (Mudtarib) to me (3). Third: The Hadith of Ibn Abbas (may Allah be pleased with them both): A woman accepted Islam during the time of the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) and got married. Then her husband came to the Prophet (peace be upon him) and said: O Messenger of Allah, I had accepted Islam and she knew of my Islam. So the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) took her away from her second husband and returned her to her first husband (4). Imam Ahmad said: Not all people provide a chain (Isnad) for it (5).
foot_note:
1. (1) "Al-Ilal" narration of Abdullah (539).
2. "Al-Jami' li-Ahkam Ahl al-Dhimma" 1/260, "Al-Mughni" by Ibn Qudamah 7/536.
3. "Al-Jami' li-Ahkam Ahl al-Dhimma" by Al-Khallal 1/265.
4. Reported by Abu Dawud (2239), he said: Nasr bin Ali narrated to us, Abu Ahmad informed me, from Isra'il, from Simak, from Ikrimah, from Ibn Abbas... The Hadith.
5. "Al-Jami' li-Ahkam Ahl al-Dhimma" by Al-Khallal 1/264. Issue: Abu Isa At-Tirmidhi said 3/439: The practice upon this Hadith according to the people of knowledge is that if a woman accepts Islam before her husband, then her husband accepts Islam while she is in the waiting period (Iddah), her husband has more right to her as long as she is in the Iddah. This is the view of Malik, Al-Awza'i, Ash-Shafi'i, Ahmad, and Ishaq.

text: 521 - What came regarding the man who marries a woman and finds her pregnant. Hadith of Abu Musa (may Allah be pleased with him): "She gets the dowry (Sadaq) for what you have made lawful of her private part" (1). Imam Ahmad said: Weak (2). 522 - Istibra' (establishing non-pregnancy) of the virgin. Hadith of Ibn Umar (may Allah be pleased with them both) as Mawquf (stopped at the companion): The virgin is not tested for pregnancy (3). Imam Ahmad weakened this Hadith and said: Abdul-Wahhab only narrated it from Ayyub, from Muhammad. The known narration is from Nafi', from Ibn Umar: The female slave is tested for pregnancy with one menses (4).
foot_note:
1. (1) I did not find the path of Abu Musa, but it was reported by Abu Dawud (2131), he said: Makhlad bin Khalid, Al-Hasan bin Ali, and Muhammad bin Abi As-Sari - the meaning is one - narrated to us, saying: Abdur-Razzaq narrated to us, Ibn Jurayj informed us, from Safwan bin Sulaym, from Sa'id bin Al-Musayyib, from a man from the Ansar - Ibn Abi As-Sari said: from the Companions of the Prophet (peace be upon him) and did not say: from the Ansar, then they agreed he is called: Basrah - who said: I married a virgin woman while she was in her veil. I entered upon her, and behold, she was pregnant. The Prophet (peace be upon him) said: "She gets the dowry for what you made lawful of her private part, and the child is a slave to you. When she gives birth..." Al-Hasan said: "Flog her." And Ibn Abi As-Sari said: "Flog them (plural)" or said: "Apply the Hadd punishment on them."
2. "Masa'il Al-Kawsuj" (2688).
3. Reported by Abdur-Razzaq 7/227 number (12906) from Ma'mar, from Ayyub, from Nafi', from Ibn Umar, his saying.

text: 523 - What came regarding marriage to a Magian (Zoroastrian) woman. Hadith of Hudhayfah (may Allah be pleased with him) that he married a Magian woman (1). Imam Ahmad said: Ad-Danaj narrated this. And Abu Wa'il says: He actually married a Jewish woman, as if to invalidate that she was a Magian. He said: Ad-Danaj is Trustworthy (Thiqah), and Abu Wa'il is more trustworthy than him (2). 524 - What came regarding that a Jewish woman does not confer Ihsan (status of protection from adultery punishment) upon a Muslim. Hadith of Ka'b bin Malik (may Allah be pleased with him): "She does not confer Ihsan upon you" (3). Imam Ahmad said: It is not authentic. It is from the Hadith of Abu Bakr bin Abi Maryam. And he weakened his Hadith and said: He is weak in Hadith. It was said to him: Why did you write his Hadith if he is weak? He said: To recognize it (4).

1. Al-Bayhaqi said: This is not established, and what is preserved from Hudhayfah is that he married a Jewish woman.

The Hadith.

text: 525 - What came regarding beating women. Hadith of Iyas bin Abdullah (may Allah be pleased with him): "Do not beat the female servants of Allah" (1). Imam Ahmad said: It is Mursal (disconnected), and he does not have companionship (Suhba). He said: He is other than Iyas bin Abd (2). 526 - What came regarding: The Haram (forbidden) does not prohibit the Halal (lawful). Hadith of Ibn Umar (may Allah be pleased with them both): "The Haram does not prohibit the Halal" (3). Imam Ahmad said: It is only from the speech of Ibn Asw', one of the judges of Iraq (4).
foot_note:
1. (1) Reported by Abu Dawud (2146), he said: Ahmad bin Abi Khalaf and Ahmad bin Amr bin As-Sarh narrated to us, saying: Sufyan narrated to us, from Az-Zuhri, from Abdullah bin Abdullah - Ibn As-Sarh said: Ubaidullah bin Abdullah - from Iyas bin Abdullah bin Abi Dhubab, who said: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: "Do not beat the female servants of Allah." Then Umar came to the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) and said: Women have become emboldened against their husbands. So he granted a concession to beat them. Then many women circled the family of the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) complaining of their husbands. The Prophet (peace be upon him) said: "Many women have circled the family of Muhammad complaining of their husbands; those [men] are not the best of you."
2. "Jami' at-Tahsil" 147.
3. Reported by Ibn Majah (2015), he said: Yahya bin Mu'alla bin Mansur narrated to us, Ishaq bin Muhammad Al-Farawi narrated to us, Abdullah bin Umar narrated to us, from Nafi', from Ibn Umar, raised (Marfu') with it.

text: 527 - What came regarding coming unto women in their anuses. Hadith of Ibn Umar (may Allah be pleased with them both): It was only revealed to the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) {Your wives are a place of sowing of seed (tilth) for you} [Al-Baqarah: 223] as a concession regarding coming into the anus (1). Imam Ahmad said: I do not know what thing this is? The reports from the Prophet (peace be upon him) and his Companions contrary to this are many, and that is the Truth according to us. Allah the Exalted said: {So come to your place of cultivation however you wish}. Cultivation (Tilth) is only in the place of the child (womb) or similar to this (2).

The Hadith.

text: The Book of Divorce. 528 - What came regarding the metaphors of divorce. Hadith of Ka'b bin Malik (may Allah be pleased with him): "Join [your family], so you will be with them until Allah decrees in this matter" (1). Imam Ahmad said: I do not know if it is preserved (Mahfuz) or not. Meaning: When the Prophet (peace be upon him) commanded the three men who remained behind from the Battle of Tabuk to withdraw from their wives. Abu Dawud said: Ahmad meant by that that it is a proof regarding the man who says to his wife: "Join your family," and does not intend divorce, that it is nothing (2).
foot_note:
1. (1) Reported by Al-Bukhari (4418), he said: Yahya bin Bukair narrated to us, Al-Layth narrated to us, from Uqayl, from Ibn Shihab, from Abdur-Rahman bin Abdullah bin Ka'b bin Malik that Abdullah bin Ka'b bin Malik - who was the guide of Ka'b from among his sons when he became blind - said: I heard Ka'b bin Malik narrating when he remained behind from the story of Tabuk... The long Hadith, and in it: Indeed, the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) commands you to withdraw from your wife. So I said: Should I divorce her or what should I do? He said: No, rather withdraw from her and do not approach her. And he sent the same message to my two companions. So I said to my wife: "Join your family, so you will be with them until Allah decrees in this matter."
2. "Masa'il Abi Dawud" (1939). Issue: Ibn al-Qayyim said in "Al-Zad" 3/583-584: Ka'b's saying to his wife: "Join your family," is evidence that divorce does not occur by this wording and similar ones unless he intends it. The correct view is that the wording of divorce, emancipation, and freedom is likewise; if he intends by it something other than releasing the wife and removing the slave from his ownership, no divorce or emancipation occurs. This is the correct view by which we worship Allah.

text: 529 - What came regarding the triple divorce. Hadith of Ibn Abbas (may Allah be pleased with them both): Divorce during the time of the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him), Abu Bakr, and two years of the Caliphate of Umar, the triple divorce was [counted as] one. So Umar bin Al-Khattab said: The people have hastened in a matter in which they had respite. So if we were to enforce it upon them. So he enforced it upon them (1). Imam Ahmad said: This is anomalous (Shadh) and discarded (Matruh) (2). And he said once: When asked: With what do you repel it? He said: I repel it with the narration of the people from Ibn Abbas from paths contrary to it. Then he mentioned from a number of people from Ibn Abbas from paths that it is three (3). And he said once: All the companions of Ibn Abbas (may Allah be pleased with them both) narrated contrary to what Tawus said, and Sa'id bin Jubayr, Mujahid, and Nafi' narrated from Ibn Abbas contrary to that (4).
foot_note:
1. (1) Reported by Muslim (1472), he said: Ishaq bin Ibrahim and Muhammad bin Rafi' narrated to us - and the wording is Ibn Rafi's - Ishaq said: We were informed, and Ibn Rafi' said: Abdur-Razzaq narrated to us, Ma'mar informed us, from Ibn Tawus, from his father, from Ibn Abbas, who said... The Hadith.
2. "Sharh Ilal At-Tirmidhi" by Ibn Rajab 236.
3. "Al-Mughni" by Ibn Qudamah 8/243-244. An-Nawawi said in "Sharh Muslim" 10/70: The scholars differed regarding the one who says to his wife: "You are divorced thrice." Ash-Shafi'i, Malik, Abu Hanifa, Ahmad, and the majority of scholars from the predecessors and successors said: The three occur. Tawus and some of the literalists (Ahl al-Zahir) said: Only one occurs by that. This is a narration from Al-Hajjaj bin Artah and Muhammad bin Ishaq. The famous view from Al-Hajjaj bin Artah is that nothing occurs by it, which is the view of Ibn Muqatil and a narration from Muhammad bin Ishaq.
4. "Masa'il Ishaq bin Mansur Al-Kawsuj" 1/414.

text: 530 - What came regarding divorce before marriage. Hadith of Abdullah bin Amr bin Al-Aas (may Allah be pleased with them both): "No divorce except in what you own" (1). Imam Ahmad said: Authentic (Sahih) (2). 531 - What came regarding the man who divorces his wife irrevocably (Al-Battah). Hadith of Rukanah (may Allah be pleased with him): He said: I came to the Prophet (peace be upon him) and said: O Messenger of Allah, I divorced my wife irrevocably (Al-Battah). He said: "What did you intend by it?" I said: One. He said: "By Allah?" I said: By Allah. He said: "Then it is what you intended" (3). Imam Ahmad was asked about the Hadith of Rukanah: Do you not affirm that he said: 'My wife Al-Battah'? He said: No, because Ibn Ishaq narrates it from Dawud bin Al-Husain, from Ikrimah, from Ibn Abbas (4) (may Allah be pleased with them both) that Rukanah divorced his wife three times, and the people of Medina call

4. "Al-Fatawa" by Ibn Taymiyyah 33/15, 67, 73, 85, 86. I say: Ibn Taymiyyah said in "Al-Fatawa" 33/86: Ahmad used this other Hadith, which states he divorced her three times, as evidence for the invalidity of the Hadith of "Al-Battah", and he clarified that the people of Medina call whoever divorced thrice as divorced Al-Battah. This indicates the Hadith is established according to him. I say: There is a consideration and extreme remoteness in this direction; because Imam Ahmad's action does not indicate authenticating the contradictory narration, and it has been narrated from him that he weakened the entire Hadith, and Al-Bukhari defected it due to disorder (Idtirab). Issue: Abu Isa At-Tirmidhi said 3/471-472: The people of knowledge from the Companions of the Prophet (peace be upon him) and others differed regarding the divorce of Al-Battah. It was narrated from Umar bin Al-Khattab that he made Al-Battah one, and it was narrated from Ali that he made it three.

text: 532 - What came regarding the man who divorces his wife three times, so she marries [another], then he divorces her before entering upon her; does she return to the first? Hadith of Abdullah bin Umar (may Allah be pleased with them both): "No, until he tastes the little honey (sexual intercourse)" (1). Imam Ahmad said: Mistake (Khata') (2).
foot_note:

This is the saying of Ath-Thawri and the people of Kufa. Malik said regarding Al-Battah: If he had consummated the marriage with her, it is three divorces. Ash-Shafi'i said: If he intended one, it is one, and he possesses the right of return; if he intended two, it is two; and if he intended three, it is three.

Does she return to the first? He said: "No, until he tastes the little honey."

The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: "Perhaps you want to return to Rifa'ah? No, until he tastes your little honey and you taste his little honey."

text: 533 - What came regarding the divorce of Sunnah. Hadith of Ibn Mas'ud (may Allah be pleased with him): The divorce of Sunnah is one divorce while she is pure without intercourse (1). Imam Ahmad said: That is differed upon (2). 534 - What came regarding the Quru' (menstrual cycles), is it purity or menstruation? Imam Ahmad said: I saw the Hadiths from those who said: The Quru' is menstruation, differ. And the Hadiths from those who said: He has more right to her until she enters into the third menstruation, are authentic strong Hadiths (3).
foot_note:

I say: Those who said that Al-Aqra' are the periods of purity used as evidence the Hadith of Ibn Umar "Then she becomes pure, then if he wishes he keeps her and if he wishes he divorces; that is the Iddah (waiting period) regarding which Allah commanded that women be divorced for it." And in the Hadith of Ibn Umar, when he divorced his wife while she was menstruating, the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: "When she becomes pure, let him divorce or keep." Those who said the intended meaning of Al-Aqra' is menstruation used as evidence a Hadith reported by An-Nasa'i 1/183 from the path of Sufyan, from Az-Zuhri, from Aisha that the daughter of Jahsh had Istihadah (irregular bleeding) for seven years, so she asked the Prophet (peace be upon him), and he said: "It is not menstruation, it is only a vein." So he commanded her to leave prayer during the days of her Aqra' (cycles), and no one said that the intended meaning there was purity. And due to his saying in what Ahmad reported regarding the captives of Awtas: "A pregnant woman is not to be had intercourse with until she gives birth, nor a non-pregnant one until she menstruates one menses." text: 535 - What came regarding the man who accepts Islam while having more than four wives. Hadith of Ibn Umar (may Allah be pleased with them both): Ghailan bin Salamah accepted Islam and under him were ten wives, so the Prophet (peace be upon him) said to him: "Take four of them" (1). Imam Ahmad said: This Hadith is not authentic, yet practice is upon it. It was defected by the solitary narration of Ma'mar connecting it and narrating it outside his city (2). And he said once: Abdur-Razzaq used to say: From Ma'mar, from Az-Zuhri as Mursal that Ghailan accepted Islam. And Ma'mar narrated here in Iraq from his memory without a book, so he made it from Az-Zuhri from Salim from Ibn Umar. Ahmad said: And I saw in a book from Yunus bin
foot_note:
1. = the periods of purity, and not as he said: rather he used to say this at first, then he hesitated on it. He said in the narration of Al-Athram also: I used to say: The periods of purity, then I stopped like the saying of the elders. Then he stated definitively that it is menstruation, and explicitly declared his retraction from the 'purity' view. He said in the narration of Ibn Hani: I used to say: It is the periods of purity, and today I hold the view that Al-Iqra' is menstruation. Al-Qadi Abu Ya'la said: This is what is correct from Ahmad (may Allah have mercy on him), and our companions went to this view, and he retracted his saying of 'periods of purity'. Then he mentioned the text of his retraction from the narration of Ibn Hani. It is the saying of the Imams of the People of Opinion like Abu Hanifa and his companions. And a group said: Al-Aqra': Periods of purity. This is the saying of Aisha the Mother of the Believers, Zaid bin Thabit, Abdullah bin Umar, and it is narrated from the seven jurists, Aban bin Uthman, Az-Zuhri, and the generality of the jurists of Medina. Malik, Ash-Shafi'i, and Ahmad in one of the two narrations from him said it.
1. Reported by Ibn Majah (1953), he said: Yahya bin Hakim narrated to us, Muhammad bin Ja'far narrated to us, Ma'mar narrated to us, from Az-Zuhri, from Salim, from Ibn Umar, who said: Ghailan accepted Islam... The Hadith.

He said: I fear my soul will follow her. He said: "Enjoy her" (2). Imam Ahmad said: Nothing is proven from the Prophet (peace be upon him) in this chapter, and it has no basis (3). And he said once: It does not have excellent chains - meaning: they are weak Hadiths (4).
