text: 538 - What came regarding the Sunnah of the slave's divorce. Hadith of Ibn Abbas (may Allah be pleased with them both): Regarding a slave who had a female slave under him, so he divorced her twice, then they were freed after that: Is it proper for him to propose to her? He said: Yes, the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) decreed that (1). Imam Ahmad said: When it was said to him: Is Umar bin Mu'attab trustworthy? He said: I do not know. And he said: Hisham Ad-Dastawa'i did not hear this Hadith from Yahya bin Abi Kathir; he said: He wrote to Yahya (2). And he said once: As for Abu Al-Hasan, he is known to me, but I do not know Umar bin
foot_note:
1. = Abu Ubaid, Al-Khallal, An-Nasa'i, Ibn Al-Arabi, Al-Khattabi, Al-Ghazali, and An-Nawawi, and it is implied by Ar-Rafi'i's deduction using it here. And it was said: Its meaning is squandering, and that she does not prevent anyone who asks her for something from her husband's money. Ahmad, Al-Asma'i, and Muhammad bin Nasir said this, and Ibn al-Jawzi reported it from the scholars of Islam, and he criticized those who went to the first view. Some skilled later scholars said: His saying (peace be upon him) to him "Keep her" means keep her from adultery or from squandering, either by monitoring her, or by preserving the money, or by frequent intercourse. Al-Qadi Abu At-Tayyib preferred the first; because generosity is recommended and would not be a cause for his saying: "Divorce her", and because if the squandering was from her money, she has the right to dispose of it, and if it was from his money, he must protect it, and none of that necessitates the command to divorce her. It was said: The apparent meaning of his saying: Does not repel the hand of a toucher, is that she does not refuse anyone who extends his hand to enjoy touching her. If he had meant intercourse by it, he would be considered a slanderer (Qadhif), or that her husband understood from her condition that she does not refuse anyone who wants indecency from her, not that it actually occurred from her.

text: 540 - What came regarding Khula (divorce at wife's instance), there are two Hadiths in it: First: Hadith of Uthman (may Allah be pleased with him): That Khula is a divorce (1). It was said to him: It is not authentic? Imam Ahmad said: I do not know; I do not know Jahman (2). Second: Hadith of Ibn Jurayj from Ata: That the Prophet (peace be upon him) disliked taking from the woman seeking Khula more than what he gave her (3). Imam Ahmad said: Waki narrated to us, saying: I asked Ibn Jurayj about it, and he denied it and did not know it (4). 541 - What came regarding Lian (public cursing). Hadith of Ibn Abbas (may Allah be pleased with them both), he said: Hilal bin Umayyah - and he is one of the three whom Allah turned to in forgiveness - came from his land in the evening and found a man with his wife... The Hadith (5).

text: Imam Ahmad said: It is only Ibn Abi Yahya, from Dawud bin Husain, from Ikrimah (1). And he said once: The Hadith of Lian from Ikrimah is Mursal. Yahya bin Sa'id used to say: Mursal from Ikrimah (2).
foot_note:
1. = what he brought and it was severe upon him, so there was revealed: {And those who accuse their wives and have no witnesses except themselves - then the witness of one of them} the two verses both. So the distress was lifted from the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) and he said: "Rejoice, O Hilal, for Allah (Mighty and Majestic) has made for you a relief and a way out." Hilal said: I was hoping for that from my Lord. So the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: "Send for her." So she came, and the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) recited them to both of them, reminded them, and informed them that the punishment of the Hereafter is more severe than the punishment of the world. Hilal said: By Allah, I have told the truth against her. She said: He has lied. So the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: "Let them curse each other." It was said to Hilal: Testify. So he testified four testimonies by Allah that he is indeed of the truthful. When it was the fifth, it was said to him: O Hilal, fear Allah, for the punishment of the world is lighter than the punishment of the Hereafter, and this is the binding one that obligates the punishment upon you. He said: By Allah, Allah will not punish me for it just as He did not flog me for it. So he testified the fifth that the curse of Allah be upon him if he is of the liars. When it was the fifth [for her], it was said to her: Fear Allah, for the punishment of the world is lighter than the punishment of the Hereafter, and this is the binding one that obligates the punishment upon you. She hesitated for a while, then said: By Allah, I will not disgrace my people. So she testified the fifth that the wrath of Allah be upon her if he is of the truthful. So the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) separated them. And he decreed that her child not be called by a father, and that she not be accused nor her child be accused; whoever accuses her or accuses her child, upon him is the Hadd punishment. And he decreed that she has no housing upon him nor maintenance; because they separate without divorce or death. And he said: "If she brings him reddish-white, with light buttocks, thin calves, he is for Hilal. And if she brings him dark, curly-haired, ugly/bulky, with fleshy calves, large buttocks, he is for the one with whom she was accused." So she brought him dark, curly-haired, ugly/bulky, with fleshy calves, large buttocks. The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: "Were it not for the oaths, there would have been a matter between me and her."

text: 542 - What came regarding cursing (Lian) due to pregnancy. Hadith of Ibn Abbas (may Allah be pleased with them both): That the Prophet (peace be upon him) performed Lian due to pregnancy (1). Imam Ahmad said: Munkar (Denounced). And he said: Waki' only erred, so he said: He performed Lian due to pregnancy. The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) only performed Lian when he came and testified to adultery, and he did not perform Lian due to pregnancy [alone] (2). And he said once: This is false. Then he said: 'If she brings him such and such', this is what is established. And he said: Abbad bin Ikrimah is nothing; he is weak. It was said to Imam Ahmad: Did the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) perform Lian due to pregnancy? He said: No. Then he said: It reached me that Ibn Abi Shaybah reported it, and this is a clear mistake. And he began to wonder at his reporting of it (3). (542 m) - What came regarding attributing the child of the cursed woman (Mula'anah) to his mother. Hadith of Ibn Umar (may Allah be pleased with them both) that the Prophet (peace be upon him) performed Lian between a man and his wife, so he denied her child, so he separated them and attributed the child to the woman (4). Imam Ahmad said: Malik narrated from Nafi' things that others did not narrate. Ibn Umar

text: Join the child of the woman who invokes mutual curses (Mula'anah) to its mother (1). 543 - What has been related regarding mourning (Hidad). There are two Hadiths in it: First: Hadith of Asma' bint 'Umais, may Allah be pleased with both of them: "Mourn for three days, then do as you wish" (2).
foot_note:
1. (1) "Masa'il Abu Dawood" (1987). I say: Al-Hafiz quoted in "Al-Fath" 9/730 from Al-Daraqutni that he said: Malik was alone in reporting this addition. And Ibn Abd al-Barr said in "Al-Tamhid" 15/20-21 (summarized): A group claimed that Malik was also alone in this Hadith of his by his saying in it: And join the child to the woman, or join the child to its mother. They said: And no one says this except Malik from Nafi' from Ibn Umar in this chapter. Ubaidullah bin Umar narrated it from Nafi' from Ibn Umar, that the Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, invoked mutual curses between a man and his wife and separated them. And thus everyone who narrated it from Nafi' narrated it, they mentioned the mutual cursing and the separation, and they did not mention that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, joined the child to the woman. But Malik said it from Nafi' as you saw, and Malik is sufficient in memorization and precision. A group of the Imams of Hadith have said: Malik is more established in Nafi' and Ibn Shihab than others. And this wording: And join the child to its mother or to the woman, which they claimed Malik was alone in, is also preserved from other aspects: Among them is that Ibn Wahb mentioned in his "Muwatta", he said: Yunus informed me, from Ibn Shihab, from Sahl bin Sa'd Al-Sa'idi, he said: I attended their mutual cursing before the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, while I was fifteen years old, and he narrated the Hadith. He said: And in it: Then she left pregnant, so the child was for its mother. And Al-Faryabi mentioned, from Al-Awza'i, from Al-Zuhri, from Sahl bin Sa'd Al-Sa'idi in this report - the report of the two who mutually curse - and he said in it: So the child was called after its mother.

text: Imam Ahmad said: This is the irregular (Shadh) Hadith that is not acted upon. It has been narrated from the Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, from several aspects contrary to this irregularity. Ishaq said: How excellent is what he said (1). Second: Hadith of Ibn Umar, may Allah be pleased with both of them: "No mourning beyond three days" (2). Imam Ahmad said: This is a denounced (Munkar) Hadith. Then he said: From other than Hanzalah. It was said to him: Hamid bin Al-Aswad. He said: Affan used to attack this Sheikh, and Abd al-Rahman was his son-in-law (3).
foot_note:
1. (1) "Sharh 'Ilal Al-Tirmidhi" by Ibn Rajab 236, "Masa'il Al-Kawsaj" (3345). I say: The authentic Hadiths indicate contrary to this. Al-Bukhari narrated (5334) from the Hadith of Zainab bint Abi Salamah, she said: I entered upon Umm Habibah, the wife of the Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, when her father Abu Sufyan bin Harb died. Umm Habibah called for perfume containing yellowness - Khaluq or other than it - so a girl applied some of it, then she touched her cheeks with it, then she said: By Allah, I have no need for perfume, except that I heard the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, saying: "It is not lawful for a woman who believes in Allah and the Last Day to mourn for a dead person for more than three nights, except for a husband, four months and ten days." Benefit: Al-Hafiz said in "Al-Fath" 9/397 (summarized): Our Sheikh said in "Sharh Al-Tirmidhi": Its apparent meaning is that mourning is not obligatory on the one whose husband died after the third day; because Asma' bint 'Umais was the wife of Ja'far bin Abi Talib by agreement. Rather, the apparent prohibition is that mourning is not permissible. He answered that this Hadith is irregular (Shadh) and contrary to the authentic Hadiths, and they have agreed on contradicting it. Al-Hafiz said: Al-Bayhaqi found fault with the Hadith due to disconnection, saying: The hearing of Abdullah bin Shaddad from Asma' is not established. This is a refutable criticism, for Ahmad authenticated it, but he said: It contradicts the authentic Hadiths regarding mourning. I say: And this is his resorting to faulting it due to irregularity (Shudhudh). 
2. Mentioned by Al-Uqayli in "Al-Du'afa" 1/268 from the path of Hanzalah, from Salim, from Ibn Umar, raised (to the Prophet). 
3. "Al-Du'afa" by Al-Uqayli 1/268.

text: 544 - What has been related regarding the waiting period ('Iddah) of the mother of a child (Umm al-Walad). Hadith of 'Amr bin Al-'Aas, may Allah be pleased with him: Do not confuse upon us the Sunnah of our Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, the waiting period of the one whose husband has died is four months and ten days (1). Imam Ahmad said - after mentioning the difference in the chains of narration - Sa'id narrated it from Matar, from Raja' bin Haywah, from Qabisah bin Dhu'ayb, from 'Amr bin Al-'Aas: Do not confuse upon us the Sunnah of our Prophet. And Sa'id also narrated it from Qatadah, from Raja' similarly. And Qatadah is more established in Hadith than Matar. And Sa'id bin Abd al-Aziz narrated it from Sulaiman bin Musa, from Raja' bin Haywah, from Qabisah, from 'Amr bin Al-'Aas: "The waiting period of the mother of a child is the waiting period of a free woman" (2). And Al-Awza'i and Sa'id narrated it from Al-Zuhri, from Qabisah, from 'Amr bin Al-'Aas: "The waiting period of the mother of a child is the waiting period of a free woman" (3). And Yahya bin Sa'id narrated from Thawr, from Raja' bin Haywah, he said: 'Amr bin

text: Al-'Aas was asked about the waiting period of the mother of a child, he said: Do not confuse us in our religion, if she is a slave woman, then her waiting period is the waiting period of a free woman (1). Imam Ahmad said: So these did not say: The Sunnah of our Prophet. Salih bin Imam Ahmad said: It was as if he weakened it (2). And he said once: This is a denounced (Munkar) Hadith (3). And once: Weak, not authentic (4). And once: Imam Ahmad was amazed by it, then he said: Where is the Sunnah of the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, in this? And he said: Four months and ten days is only the waiting period of a free woman from marriage. And this is a slave woman who went from slavery to freedom, and it is binding on those who say this to let her inherit. And there is no validity to the saying of those who said: She waits for three menstrual cycles, that is only for the divorced woman. (5)
foot_note:
1. (1) Narrated by Al-Daraqutni 3/309, he said: Narrated to us Abu Ali Al-Maliki, narrated to us Abu Hafs 'Amr bin Ali, narrated to us Yahya bin Sa'id, narrated to us Thawr bin Yazid, he said: I heard Raja' bin Haywah say: 'Amr bin Al-'Aas was asked... So he mentioned it. 
2. "Masa'il Salih" (497). 
3. "Sunan Al-Bayhaqi" 7/448, "Nasb Al-Rayah" 3/530, "Zad Al-Ma'ad" 5/722, "Tahdhib Al-Tahdhib" 6/99-100, "Al-'Ilal" narration of Abdullah (2656). I say: Al-Daraqutni also weakened this Hadith in his "Sunan" 3/309, saying: Qatadah and Matar raised it, and the suspended (Mawquf) is more correct, and Qabisah did not hear from 'Amr bin Al-'Aas, and the correct version is: Do not confuse us in our religion, suspended (Mawquf).

text: 545 - What has been related regarding the start of the waiting period for the woman whose husband has died. Hadith of Ibn Abbas, may Allah be pleased with both of them: Regarding the woman whose husband dies, he said: She waits from the day he dies (1). Imam Ahmad said: Ismail Ibn Ulayyah used to narrate to us, from Ayyub, from 'Amr bin Dinar, from Jabir bin Zaid, he said: I think it is from Ibn Abbas, then he left the doubt later, so he did not say: I think, he said: From Ibn Abbas, then he narrated and did not doubt. Ahmad said: So I said to Ismail: O Abu Bishr, Al-Thaqafi Abd al-Wahhab says: From Ayyub, from 'Amr bin Dinar, from a man, from Jabir bin Zaid. Ismail said: Ayyub, from 'Amr, from a man, from Jabir bin Zaid! And Ismail moved his hand right and left, and did not pay attention to it. Ahmad said: And Hammad narrated it from Ayyub, from Ibn Abbas as disconnected (Mursal), and Ma'mar said: From Ayyub, from Ikrimah, from Ibn Abbas (2). 546 - What has been related regarding the waiting period of the woman who seeks Khul' (divorce at the instance of the wife). Hadith of Ibn Abbas, may Allah be pleased with both of them: That the wife of Thabit bin Qais sought Khul' from her husband during the time of the Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, so the Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, ordered her to wait for one menstrual cycle (3).
foot_note:
1. (1) "Musannaf Ibn Abi Shaybah" 4/138, he said: Narrated to us Ibn Ulayyah, from Ayyub, from 'Amr bin Dinar, from Jabir bin Zaid, he thinks it is from Ibn Abbas... So he mentioned it. 
2. "Al-'Ilal" (3555). 
3. Narrated by Al-Tirmidhi (1185), he said: Informed us Muhammad bin Abd al-Rahim Al-Baghdadi, informed us Ali bin Bahr, informed us Hisham bin Yusuf, from Ma'mar, from 'Amr bin Muslim, from Ikrimah, from Ibn Abbas... So he mentioned it.

text: Imam Ahmad said: Ikrimah sends it (Mursal) from the Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him (1). 547 - What has been related regarding the end of the waiting period of the woman whose husband has died by giving birth. Hadith of Ibn Mas'ud, may Allah be pleased with him: That Subai'ah bint Al-Harith gave birth to her load after the death of her husband by fifteen nights... The Hadith (2). Imam Ahmad mentioned in "Al-Musnad" the disagreement: Muhammad bin Ja'far narrated it from Sa'id mentioning Ibn Mas'ud, and Abdullah bin Bakr (3) narrated it from Sa'id without mentioning Ibn Mas'ud, and Qatadah (4) followed Abd al-Wahhab from Khilas on the disconnected narration (Irsal).
foot_note:
1. (1) "Masa'il Salih" (1073). 
2. Narrated by Ahmad 1/447, he said: Narrated to us Muhammad bin Ja'far, narrated to us Sa'id, from Qatadah, from Khilas, and from Abu Hassan, from Abdullah bin Utbah bin Mas'ud, from Abdullah bin Mas'ud that Subai'ah bint Al-Harith gave birth to her load after the death of her husband by fifteen nights, so Abu Al-Sanabil entered upon her and said: It looks like you are hoping for marriage! You cannot do that until the furthest of the two terms passes. So she went to the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, and informed him of what Abu Al-Sanabil said, so the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, said: "Abu Al-Sanabil lied, if someone you are pleased with comes to you, come to me with him" or he said: "Inform me." So he informed her that her waiting period had ended. 
3. "Musnad Ahmad" 1/447, he said: Narrated to us Abdullah bin Bakr, narrated to us Sa'id, from Qatadah, from Khilas, from Abdullah bin Utbah that Subai'ah bint Al-Harith, and she mentioned the Hadith or similar to it, and he said in it: "And if a compatible person comes to you, come to me" or "inform me" and Ibn Mas'ud is not in it. 
4. Narrated by Ahmad 1/447 with the same previous source, and Abd al-Wahhab said: From Khilas, from Ibn Utbah, disconnected (Mursal).

text: And he said once: Ghundar erred in it, he said: From Abdullah, and they contradicted him, it is not from Abdullah, meaning disconnected (Mursal) (1). 548 - What has been related regarding the duration of the waiting period and its manner. There are two Hadiths from Ibn Umar with different texts. First: Hadith of Ibn Umar, may Allah be pleased with both of them, regarding the waiting period: Her waiting period is from the day he divorces her and from the day he dies leaving her (2). Second: Hadith of Ibn Umar regarding the provision (Mut'ah) for the divorced woman: For every divorced woman is a provision, except the one who

I say: The text is authentic and established, for Muslim narrated it (1484), he said: Narrated to me Abu Al-Tahir and Harmalah bin Yahya, narrated to me Yunus bin Yazid, from Ibn Shihab, narrated to us Ubaidullah bin Abdullah bin Utbah bin Mas'ud that his father wrote to Umar bin Abdullah bin Al-Arqam Al-Zuhri ordering him to enter upon Subai'ah bint Al-Harith Al-Aslamiyyah and ask her about her Hadith and what the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, said to her when she asked him for a fatwa. So Umar bin Abdullah wrote to Abdullah bin Utbah informing him that Subai'ah informed him that she was married to Sa'd bin Khawlah, who was from Bani Amir bin Lu'ayy, and was one of those who witnessed Badr, and he died leaving her during the Farewell Pilgrimage while she was pregnant. She did not wait long until she gave birth to her load after his death. When she recovered from her post-partum bleeding, she beautified herself for suitors, so Abu Al-Sanabil bin Ba'kak - a man from Bani Abd al-Dar - entered upon her and said to her: Why do I see you beautified? Perhaps you hope for marriage, by Allah, you cannot marry until four months and ten days pass over you. Subai'ah said: When he said that to me, I gathered my clothes on me when evening came, and I went to the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, and asked him about that, so he gave me a fatwa that I became lawful when I gave birth to my load, and ordered me to marry if I wished. 
2. Narrated by Ibn Abi Shaybah in his "Musannaf" 4/160, he said: Narrated to us Abu Mu'awiyah, from Ubaidullah, from Nafi', from Ibn Umar... The Hadith.

text: Imam Ahmad said: It is in the Hadith, and it resembles the speech of Al-Zuhri (1). 551 - What has been related regarding the woman in waiting period going out of her house. Hadith of Al-Sha'bi from Fatimah bint Qais: That the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, did not assign for her residence nor maintenance. Then Al-Aswad took a handful of pebbles and threw it at him and said: Woe to you! You narrate the likes of this. Umar said: We do not leave the Book of Allah and the Sunnah of our Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, for the saying of a woman we do not know if she remembered or forgot; she has residence and maintenance, Allah the Mighty and Majestic said: {Do not turn them out of their [husbands'] houses, nor should they [themselves] leave unless they are committing a clear immorality} [Al-Talaq: 1] (2). Imam Ahmad said: It is not authentic from Umar (3). And he said once: The Hadith of Fatimah bint Qais, I go to it, and it is authentic, she has no maintenance nor residence. It was said to him: Ibrahim Al-Nakha'i says: She has residence and maintenance. Imam Ahmad said: This is a strength for the Hadith of Fatimah (4).

text: Chapter of Custody 552 - What has been related regarding drawing lots for the child if they dispute. In it is the Hadith of Zaid bin Arqam, may Allah be pleased with him: That three people from the people of Yemen came to Ali disputing before him regarding a child, they had intercourse with a woman in one period of purity (1). Imam Ahmad said: I do not know it to be authentic and I consider it weak (2). And once he preferred the Hadith of physiognomists (Qafah) over it, and said: The Hadith of physiognomists is more beloved to me (3). Meaning the Hadith of Umar (4).
foot_note:
1. (1) Narrated by Abu Dawood (2269), he said: Narrated to us Musaddad, narrated to us Yahya, from Al-Ajlah, from Al-Sha'bi, from Abdullah bin Al-Khalil, from Zaid bin [Arqam], he said: I was sitting with the Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, when a man from Yemen came and said: Three people from the people of Yemen came to Ali disputing before him regarding a child, they had intercourse with a woman in one period of purity. So he said to two of them: Will you give up the child for this one? They refused. Then he said to two: Will you give up the child for this one? They refused. Then he said to two: Will you give up the child for this one? They refused. So he said: You are disputing partners, I will draw lots between you, whoever the lot falls on, the child is his, and he owes two-thirds of the blood money to his two companions. So he drew lots between them, and assigned it to the one the lot fell on. The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, laughed until his molar teeth or premolars appeared.

So Umar, may Allah be pleased with him, said to him: Take whichever of them you wish.

text: Book of Breastfeeding 554 - What has been related regarding one suckling or two sucklings. Hadith of Al-Zubair, may Allah be pleased with him: "One suckling does not prohibit (marriage), nor two sucklings, nor one suckling (Imlajah) nor two sucklings" (1). Imam Ahmad said: Muhammad bin Dinar was - they claimed - not a memorizer, he used to memorize for them. The Hadith of the suckling was mentioned to him. So he denied it (2). And he said once when asked if one suckling or two sucklings prohibit? He said: I do not dare upon it. It was said to him: They are authentic Hadiths. He said: Yes, but I am cowardly about them (3).
foot_note:
1. (1) Narrated by Abu Ya'la 1/329 (684), he said: Narrated to us Muhammad bin Dinar Al-Tahi, narrated to us Hisham bin Urwah, from his father, from Ibn Al-Zubair, from Al-Zubair, raised (to the Prophet) with it. 
2. "Su'alat Abu Dawood" (547), "Al-Du'afa" by Al-Uqayli 4/64. 
3. "Masa'il Abdullah" (1258). I say: And the text of the Hadith is authentic and established, for Muslim narrated it (1450) from the path of Ibn Abi Mulaikah, from Abdullah bin Al-Zubair, from Aisha that the Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, said: "One suckling and two sucklings do not prohibit." Issue: Ibn Al-Qayyim said in "Al-Zad" 5/570-571: This is a place where scholars differed. A group of the predecessors and successors affirmed prohibition by a small amount of breastfeeding and a large amount, and this is narrated from Ali and Ibn Abbas, and it is the saying of Sa'id bin Al-Musayyib, Al-Hasan, Al-Zuhri, Qatadah, Al-Hakam, Hammad, Al-Awza'i, and Al-Thawri, and it is the school of Malik and Abu Hanifa. Al-Layth bin Sa'd claimed that the Muslims agreed that a small amount of breastfeeding and a large amount prohibits in the cradle what fasting prohibits, and this is a narration from Imam Ahmad may Allah have mercy on him.

text: 555 - What has been related regarding prohibition by breastfeeding from the milk of the stallion (husband). Hadith of Aisha, may Allah be pleased with her: Those whom her sisters and her brother's daughters breastfed would enter upon her, but those whom her brothers' wives breastfed would not enter upon her (1). It was said to Ahmad: Is not the Hadith of Abd al-Rahman bin Al-Qasim contrary to the Hadith of Abu Al-Qu'ais? (2) He said: Yes, Al-Qasim used to deny the Hadith of Abu Qu'ais (3).
foot_note:
1. = And another group said: Prohibition is not established by less than three breastfeedings, and this is the saying of Abu Thawr, Abu Ubaid, Ibn Al-Mundhir, and Dawood bin Ali, and it is a second narration from Ahmad. And another group said: Prohibition is not established by less than five breastfeedings, and this is the saying of Abdullah bin Mas'ud, Abdullah bin Al-Zubair, Ata, and Tawus, and it is one of the three narrations from Aisha, may Allah be pleased with her. The second narration: From her is that less than seven does not prohibit. And the third: Less than ten does not prohibit. And the saying of five is the school of Al-Shafi'i and Ahmad in the apparent of his school, and it is the saying of Ibn Hazm, and he differed with Dawood in this issue. 
1. Narrated by Malik in "Al-Muwatta" 2/604, he said: From Abd al-Rahman bin Al-Qasim, from his father that he informed him that Aisha, the wife of the Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, those whom her sisters and her brother's daughters breastfed would enter upon her, and those whom her brothers' wives breastfed would not enter upon her. 
2. Narrated by Al-Bukhari (5103), he said: Narrated to us Abdullah bin Yusuf, informed us Malik, from Ibn Shihab, from Urwah bin Al-Zubair, from Aisha that Aflah, the brother of Abu Al-Qu'ais, came asking permission to enter upon her - and he was her uncle through breastfeeding after the Hijab was revealed - so I refused to give him permission. When the Messenger of Allah came, I informed him of what I did, so he ordered me to give him permission. 
3. "Masa'il Ishaq bin Mansur Al-Kawsaj" (3348).

text: Book of 'Aqiqah 556 - What has been related regarding every boy being pledged for his 'Aqiqah. Hadith of Samurah bin Jundub, may Allah be pleased with him: "Every boy is pledged for his 'Aqiqah, it is slaughtered for him on the seventh day, his head is shaved, and he is named" (1). Imam Ahmad said: Its chain of narration is good (2). 557 - What has been related regarding the Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, performing 'Aqiqah for himself. Hadith of Anas, may Allah be pleased with him: That the Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, performed 'Aqiqah for himself (3). Imam Ahmad said: This is a denounced (Munkar) Hadith. And he weakened Abdullah bin Al-Muharrir (4).
foot_note:
1. (1) Narrated by Ahmad 5/12, he said: Narrated to us Ishaq, narrated to us Sa'id, from Qatadah, from Al-Hasan, from Samurah that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, said... The Hadith. 
2. "Al-Mughni" by Ibn Qudamah 11/1200, "Tuhfat Al-Mawdud" 63. 
3. Narrated by Al-Bayhaqi (3008), he said: Informed us Abu Al-Hasan Muhammad bin Al-Hussein bin Dawood Al-Alawi, may Allah have mercy on him, informed us Hajib bin Ahmad bin Sufyan Al-Tusi, narrated to us Muhammad bin Hammad Al-Abiwardi, narrated to us Abd al-Razzaq, informed us Abdullah bin Muharrir, from Qatadah, from Anas, raised (to the Prophet) with it. 
4. "Zad Al-Ma'ad" 2/332, "Tuhfat Al-Mawdud" 115.

publisher: Dar Al-Falah for Scientific Research and Heritage Verification, Fayoum - Arab Republic of Egypt
text: 558 - The 'Aqiqah for a boy is two sheep, and for a girl is one sheep. Hadith of Umm Kurz Al-Ka'biyyah, may Allah be pleased with her: She heard the Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, at Al-Hudaibiyah and went to ask for some meat: "For the boy two sheep and for the girl one sheep, it does not harm you whether they are male or female" (1). Imam Ahmad said: Sufyan errs in these Hadiths, Ubaidullah heard them from Siba' bin Thabit (2). Then Imam Ahmad mentioned the hearing of Ubaidullah from Siba' from the path of Hammad bin Zaid (3). 559 - What has been related regarding the prohibition of touching the boy's head with the blood of the 'Aqiqah. There are two Hadiths in it: First: Hadith of Yazid bin Abd Al-Muzani, may Allah be pleased with him: "The 'Aqiqah is performed for the boy and his head is not touched with blood" (4). Imam Ahmad said: I do not know it, and I do not know Abd bin Yazid Al-Muzani, nor this Hadith. It was said to him: Do you deny it? He said: I do not know it (5)
foot_note:
1. (1) Narrated by Ahmad 6/381, he said: Narrated to us Ubaidullah bin Abi Yazid, from his father, from Siba' bin Thabit, I heard Umm Kurz Al-Ka'biyyah who narrates from the Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him... The Hadith. 
2. "Musnad Ahmad" 6/381. 
3. The previous source. 
4. Narrated by Ibn Majah (3166), he said: Narrated to us Yaqub bin Humaid bin Kasib, narrated to us Abdullah bin Wahb, narrated to me 'Amr bin Al-Harith, from Ayyub bin Musa that he narrated to him that Yazid bin Abd Al-Muzani, raised (to the Prophet) with it. 
5. "Zad Al-Ma'ad" 2/330.

book_title: Al-Jami' li 'Ulum al-Imam Ahmad - 'Ilal al-Hadith
publisher: Dar Al-Falah for Scientific Research and Heritage Verification, Fayoum - Arab Republic of Egypt
text: And he said once: When this Hadith was mentioned to him, how elegant it is (1). Second: Hadith of Samurah bin Jundub, may Allah be pleased with him: "Every boy is pledged for his 'Aqiqah, it is slaughtered for him on the seventh day, his head is shaved, and he is smeared with blood (yudamma)" (2). Imam Ahmad said: Ibn Abi Arubah (3) said in it: "He is named (yusamma)" and Hammam said: "And he is smeared with blood (yudamma)" and I do not see it except as a mistake, and it has been said it is a misspelling from the narrator (4). And he said once: Blood is disliked, and it was not reported except in the Hadith of Samurah (5). 560 - What has been related regarding the dislike of 'Aqiqah. Hadith of Abu Rafi', may Allah be pleased with him: "Do not perform 'Aqiqah, but shave his head then give in charity its weight in silver in the way of Allah" (6). Imam Ahmad said: It is nothing, no attention is paid to it (7).
foot_note:
1. (1) "Al-Mughni" by Ibn Qudamah 11/123. 
2. Narrated by Abu Dawood (2837), he said: Narrated to us Hafs bin Umar Al-Namari, narrated to us Hammam, narrated to us Qatadah, from Al-Hasan, from Samurah, raised (to the Prophet) with it. 
3. Narrated by Abu Dawood (2838), he said: Narrated to us Ibn Al-Muthanna, narrated to us Ibn Abi Adi, from Sa'id, from Qatadah, from Al-Hasan, from Samurah bin Jundub that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, said... And in it: "And he is named (yusamma)". 
4. "Al-Mughni" by Ibn Qudamah 11/123, "Tuhfat Al-Mawdud" 60. 
5. "Tuhfat Al-Mawdud" 60, "Masa'il Ishaq bin Mansur Al-Kawsaj" (2789). 
6. Narrated by Ahmad 6/392, he said: Narrated to us Zakariya bin Adi, he said: Informed me Ubaidullah - meaning: Ibn 'Amr - from Abdullah bin Muhammad bin Aqil, he said: So I asked Ali bin Al-Hussein, and he narrated to me from Abu Rafi', the freed slave of the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, that when Al-Hasan bin Ali was born, Fatimah wanted to perform 'Aqiqah for him with two rams, so he said... So he mentioned it. 
7. "Tuhfat Al-Mawdud" 64.

text: Book of Hunting, Slaughtering, and Sacrifices 561 - What has been related regarding the prohibition of eating every possessor of a talon from birds and every possessor of a fang from beasts of prey. There are two Hadiths in it: First: Hadith of Khalid bin Al-Walid, may Allah be pleased with him, and in it: "...The wealth of those under covenant is not lawful except by its right, and forbidden to you are domestic donkeys, horses, mules, every possessor of a fang from beasts of prey, and every possessor of a talon from birds" (1). Imam Ahmad said: This is a denounced (Munkar) Hadith (2). And he said once: It does not have a good chain of narration, and there are two men in it who are not known, Thawr narrates it from a man who is not known (3).
foot_note:
1. (1) Narrated by Ahmad 4/89-90, he said: Narrated to us Ali bin Bahr, narrated to us Muhammad bin Harb Al-Khawlani, narrated to us Abu Salamah Al-Himsi, from Salih bin Yahya bin Al-Miqdam, from Ibn Al-Miqdam from his grandfather Al-Miqdam bin Ma'di Karib, he said: I fought along with the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, in the Battle of Khaybar, and the people rushed to the enclosures of the Jews, so he said: "O Khalid, call out among the people that the prayer is gathering, no one enters Paradise except a Muslim." So I did, so he stood up among the people and said: "O you people, what is the matter with you rushing to the enclosures of the Jews, indeed..." The Hadith. 
2. "Al-Talkhis Al-Habir" 4/151, "Al-Mughni" by Ibn Qudamah 11/70. 
3. "Al-Mughni" by Ibn Qudamah 11/70. I say: The prohibition of domestic donkeys is established in "Sahih Al-Bukhari" (5521) from the path of Ibn Umar, may Allah be pleased with them both: The Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, forbade the meat of domestic donkeys on the Day of Khaybar, and the Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, permitted horses. As narrated by Al-Bukhari (5524) from the Hadith of Jabir, may Allah be pleased with them both.

text: Second: Hadith of Ali, may Allah be pleased with him: He forbade every possessor of a fang from beasts of prey, every possessor of a talon from birds, the price of dead animals, the meat of domestic donkeys, the dowry of a prostitute, the stud fee of a stallion, and purple saddle cushions (1). Imam Ahmad said: The Hadiths of Al-Hasan bin Dhakwan are false, he did not hear from Habib bin Abi Thabit, these are only the Hadiths of 'Amr bin Khalid Al-Wasiti (2). 562 - What has been related regarding the slaughter of an animal that has fallen. Hadith of Abu Al-'Ushara' from his father: I said: O Messenger of Allah, is slaughter only in the throat and the upper chest? He said: "If you stabbed it in its thigh, it would suffice for you" (3).
foot_note:
1. = And as for the prohibition of every possessor of a fang from beasts of prey, and every possessor of a talon from birds, it is established in "Sahih Muslim" (1934) from the path of Ibn Abbas, may Allah be pleased with them both, he said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, forbade every possessor of a fang from beasts of prey, and every possessor of a talon from birds. Some have found fault with this Hadith. Ibn Al-Qattan said in "Al-Wahm wa Al-Iham": Maimun bin Mihran did not hear this Hadith from Ibn Abbas, between them is Sa'id bin Jubair. And Al-Bukhari said in his "Tarikh": From Ali Al-Arqat that he said: I think between Maimun and Ibn Abbas is Sa'id bin Jubair. I say: As for the first paragraph of the Hadith, it is established in the Two Sahihs from the Hadith of Abu Tha'labah Al-Khushani. 
2. Narrated by Abdullah bin Ahmad in his additions to "Al-Musnad" 1/147, he said: Narrated to me Muhammad bin Yahya, narrated to us Abd al-Samad, narrated to me my father, narrated to us Hasan bin Dhakwan, from Habib bin Abi Thabit, from Asim, from Ali, raised (to the Prophet) with it. 
3. "Al-Kamil fi Al-Du'afa" 1/223. 
3. Narrated by Al-Tirmidhi (1481), he said: Narrated to us Hannad and Muhammad bin Al-Ala', he said: Narrated to us Wa...

text: Imam Ahmad said: To me, it is a mistake, and it does not please me, and I do not resort to it except in a place of necessity (1). He said on another occasion: This Abu al-Ashra' is not well-known (2). And another time: Imam Ahmad weakened the Hadith of Abu al-Ashra' (3). And he said once: If only it were established (4). It was said to Imam Ahmad: Do you know of any Hadith by Abu al-Ashra' other than this one? He said: No (5).
foot_note:
1. = From Hammad bin Salamah. Ahmad bin Mani' said: Yazid bin Harun told us, Hammad bin Salamah informed us, from Abu al-Ashra', from his father, in a Marfu' (raised) form with it.
1. "Bahr al-Dam" (1226), "Tahdhib al-Kamal" 34/86, "Tahdhib al-Tahdhib" 6/409.
2. "Al-Mughni" by Ibn Qudamah 11/44.
3. "Sharh Ilal al-Tirmidhi" by Ibn Rajab 238.
4. "Al-Mughni" 11/163.
5. "Tarikh Baghdad" 1/413, "Tahdhib al-Kamal" 34/85, "Tahdhib al-Tahdhib" 6/409. I say: The text has a witness supporting the meaning, recorded by Al-Bukhari (5509) from the path of Rafi' bin Khadij, who said: I said: 'O Messenger of Allah, we will meet the enemy tomorrow and we do not have knives.' ... And in it: 'We acquired some camels and sheep as spoil, and a camel among them bolted. A man shot it with an arrow and stopped it. The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said: "Indeed, these camels have wildness like the wildness of wild beasts; so if one of them overpowers you, do this to it."' Issue: Al-Khattabi said in "Ma'alim al-Sunan" 4/260: This applies to slaughtering what is not under one's control. As for what is under control, nothing purifies it except cutting the throat and upper chest; I know of no disagreement on this among the scholars. They weakened this Hadith because its narrator is unknown, and Abu al-Ashra' al-Darimi's father is not known, and no one narrated from him except Hammad bin Salamah. They differed regarding domesticated animals that become wild; most scholars said: If the arrow wounds it and blood flows, it is pure (Halal), even if it does not hit the throat. Malik said: This is not slaughter unless the throat is cut; he said: The ruling of livestock does not change by becoming wild.

text: And another time: I do not know of any Hadith for Abu al-Ashra' except three Hadiths, and no one narrated from him except Hammad bin Salamah (1). 563 - What has been reported regarding when a dog eats from the game. It has two paths from Abu Tha'labah al-Khushani: The first: From Abu Idris from him: "If you send your dog and mention the name of Allah, then eat, even if it eats from it; and eat what your hands return to you" (2). Imam Ahmad said: They differ regarding Hushaim in it (3). He said another time: The Hadith of Al-Sha'bi from Adi (4) is among the soundest of what has been narrated from the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace (5). The second: From Sa'id bin al-Musayyib from him: "Eat what your bow returns to you" (6).
foot_note:
1. (1) "Siyar A'lam al-Nubala" 13/218.
2. Recorded by Abu Dawud (2852), he said: Muhammad bin Isa told us, Hushaim told us, Dawud ibn Amr told us, from Busr bin Ubaidullah, from Abu Idris al-Khawlani, from Abu Tha'labah al-Khushani, in a Marfu' form with it.
3. "Al-Mughni" by Ibn Qudamah 11/8.
4. Recorded by Al-Bukhari (5483), he said: Qutaibah bin Sa'id told us, Muhammad bin Fudayl told us, from Bayan, from Al-Sha'bi, from Adi bin Hatim, who said: I asked the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, saying: 'We are a people who hunt with these dogs.' He said: "If you send your trained dogs and mention the name of Allah, then eat from what they catch for you, even if they kill, unless the dog eats, for I fear that it caught it only for itself. And if other dogs mix with them, do not eat."
5. "Al-Mughni" by Ibn Qudamah 11/8.
6. Recorded by Ibn Majah (3211), he said: Abu Umayr Abs bin Muhammad al-Nahhas and Isa bin =

text: Imam Ahmad said: What does Sa'id bin al-Musayyib have to do with Abu Tha'labah? It was said to him: Do you fear that it has no basis? He said: Yes (1). 564 - What has been reported regarding the price of a hunting dog. The Hadith of Imran bin Abi Anas stating that a man had a hunting dog, for which he had been offered twenty camels. He proposed to a woman, and a man from her people proposed along with him. She said: I will not marry you unless it is for your dog. So he married her and drove the dog to him. Then the other man attacked it and killed it. They took the case to Uthman bin Affan, and he fined him twenty camels (2). Imam Ahmad said: This is false; the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, forbade the price of a dog (3).
foot_note:
1. = Yunus al-Ramli, they said: Damrah bin Rabi'ah told us, from Al-Awza'i, from Yahya bin Sa'id, from Sa'id bin al-Musayyib, from Abu Tha'labah al-Khushani, that the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said: "Eat what your bow returns to you."
1. "Tarikh Abi Zur'ah" 217 - 381.
2. Recorded by Abdullah in "Al-Ilal" (2753), he said: I heard my father say: Abbad bin al-Awwam told us, from Muhammad bin Ishaq from Imran bin Abi Anas, and he mentioned it. It was also recorded under number (2754), he said: Abu Ali al-Sawwaf said: And Ahmad bin Sahl al-Ushnani told us, he said: Abu Zakariya Yahya bin al-Mubarak told us, he said: Abbad bin al-Awwam told us, with it. And Al-Bayhaqi recorded it in "Al-Sunan" 6/7 from the path of Al-Rabi', from Al-Shafi'i, from some of those who debated him, saying: Some of our companions informed me, from Muhammad bin Ishaq, with it.
3. "Al-Ilal", narration of Abdullah (2753).

text: 565 - What has been reported regarding night hunting. The Hadith of Ibn Abbas, may Allah be pleased with them both: "Do not knock on birds in their nests; for the night is safety for them" (1). Imam Ahmad said: This is nothing. Furat bin al-Sa'ib narrates it, and he is nothing. And Hafs bin Umar narrated it from him, and I do not know him (2). And he said once: I do not know of anything established in it as a Hadith (3). 566 - What has been reported regarding sea game. The Hadith of Jabir bin Abdullah, may Allah be pleased with them both: "Eat from what the sea recedes from and what it casts out, but what you find dead or floating on the water, do not eat it" (4). Imam Ahmad said: This Hadith is not authentic (5).
foot_note:
1. (1) I say: I did not find it from the path of Ibn Abbas, but Al-Tabarani recorded it in "Al-Kabir" 3/131 from another path, saying: Muhammad bin Abdullah al-Hadrami told us, Musa bin Abdul Rahman al-Bakri told us, Uthman bin Abdul Rahman al-Qurashi told us, Aisha bint Talhah told us, from Fatimah bint al-Hussein, from her father that the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said: ... The Hadith.
2. "Al-Mughni" by Ibn Qudamah 11/23.
3. "Bada'i al-Fawa'id" by Ibn al-Qayyim 4/49.
4. Recorded by Al-Daraqutni 4/267, he said: Yaqub told us, from Ibrahim, Yusuf bin Yaqub, Ibn al-Rabi', and Ibn Makhlad, they said: Al-Hasan bin Arafah told us, Isma'il bin Ayyash told us, from Abdul Aziz bin Ubaidullah, from Wahb bin Kaysan, from Jabir, in a Marfu' form with it.
5. "Al-Tahqiq" by Ibn al-Jawzi 8/157, "Tanqih al-Tahqiq" by Ibn Abdul Hadi 3/386.

text: 567 - What has been reported regarding the slaughter of a fetus being the slaughter of its mother. The Hadith of Jabir, may Allah be pleased with him: "The slaughter of the fetus is the slaughter of its mother" (1). Imam Ahmad said when asked about Al-Hasan bin Bishr: I do not know what to tell you; he narrated from Zuhair, from Abu al-Zubayr, from Jabir regarding the fetus (2). And he said: I do not see any harm in him personally, but he narrated objectionable things (Manakir) from Zuhair (3). 568 - What has been reported regarding whether Udhiyah (sacrifices) are obligatory or not. The Hadith of Abu Huraira, may Allah be pleased with him: "Whoever finds means and does not sacrifice, let him not approach our prayer place" (4). Imam Ahmad said: This is a Munkar (denounced) Hadith (5).
foot_note:
1. (1) "Musnad Ibn al-Ja'd" 1/388 (2653), he said: Harun told us, Al-Hasan bin Bishr told us, Zuhair told us, from Abu al-Zubayr, from Jabir, in a Marfu' form with it.
2. "Tarikh Baghdad" 7/290, "Tahdhib al-Kamal" 6/60, "Tahdhib al-Tahdhib" 1/476.
3. "Al-Jarh wa al-Ta'dil" 3/3, "Tarikh Baghdad" 7/290, "Tahdhib al-Kamal" 6/60, "Tahdhib al-Tahdhib" 1/476. I say: Ibn Hibban said in "Al-Majruhin" 1/251 in the biography of Hammad bin Shu'aib: This Hadith has no basis except from the Hadith of Yunus bin Abi Ishaq bin Abi al-Waddak from Abu Sa'id al-Khudri. And Ibn Adi said in "Al-Kamil" 3/15: This Hadith is not narrated from Abu al-Zubayr as Musnad (connected) except by Hammad bin Shu'aib and Zuhair bin Mu'awiyah, and from Zuhair by Al-Hasan bin Bishr alone.
4. Recorded by Ahmad 2/321, he said: Abu Abdul Rahman told us, Abdullah bin Ayyash told us, from Abdul Rahman bin Hormuz al-A'raj, from Abu Huraira who said: The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said: ... The Hadith.
5. "Al-Frusiyah" by Ibn al-Qayyim, p. 200.

text: 569 - What has been reported regarding what is not permissible in sacrifices. The Hadith of Al-Bara' bin Azib, may Allah be pleased with him: "Four are not permissible in sacrifices" (1). Imam Ahmad said: How excellent is the Hadith of Al-Bara' regarding sacrifices (2). 570 - What has been reported regarding Al-Atirah. The Hadith of Abu al-Ashra' from his father: I mentioned the Atirah to the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, and he deemed it good (3). Imam Ahmad said: How excellent it is; it appears to be authentic because it is from the speech of the Arabs. And he said to his son: Bring the inkwell and the paper, so he wrote it down from me (4). And he said once: This is a Gharib (strange) Hadith, and he deemed it good (5).
foot_note:
1. (1) Recorded by Abu Dawud (2802), he said: Hafs bin Umar al-Namari told us, Shu'bah told us, from Sulayman bin Abdul Rahman, from Ubayd bin Fayruz, who said: I asked Al-Bara' bin Azib: What is not permissible in sacrifices? He said: The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, stood among us—and my fingers are shorter than his fingers, and my fingertips are shorter than his fingertips—and said: "Four are not permissible in sacrifices: The one clearly one-eyed, the one clearly sick, the one clearly lame, and the emaciated one that has no marrow."
2. "Tahdhib al-Kamal" 12/33, "Tahdhib al-Tahdhib" 2/415.
3. Recorded by Al-Khatib in his "Tarikh" 1/413, he said: Ali bin Ahmad bin Umar al-Muqri informed us, he said: Ibrahim bin Ahmad al-Qarmisini told us, he said: Umar bin Abdullah bin al-Hasan al-Asbahani the Just informed us, he said: Abu Mas'ud—meaning Ahmad bin al-Furat—told us, he said: Abdul Rahman bin Qays informed us, from Hammad bin Salamah, from Abu al-Ashra' al-Darimi, from his father, in a Marfu' form with it.
4. "Tarikh Baghdad" 1/413, "Manaqib Al-Imam Ahmad" by Ibn al-Jawzi p. 66, "Tahdhib al-Tahdhib" 6/410.
5. "Tarikh Baghdad" 9/57, "Al-Manaqib" by Ibn al-Jawzi p. 66. Benefit: Al-Khattabi said: The explanation of Al-Atirah in the Hadith is that it is a sheep slaughtered in Rajab, and this resembles the meaning of the Hadith.

text: 571 - What has been reported regarding mercy when slaughtering a sheep. The Hadith of Qurrah al-Muzani, may Allah be pleased with him: "And the sheep, if you have mercy on it, Allah will have mercy on you" (1). It was said to Imam Ahmad: Does anyone narrate the Hadith of Mu'awiyah bin Qurrah from his father with his chain other than Isma'il? He said: I do not know if I heard it from anyone else. It was said to him: Hammad bin Salamah narrates it from Ziyad from Mu'awiyah as Mursal (2).
foot_note:
1. (1) Recorded by Ahmad 5/34, he said: Isma'il bin Ibrahim told us, Ziyad bin Mikhraq told us, Mu'awiyah bin Qurrah told us, from his father that a man said: O Messenger of Allah, I slaughter a sheep and I have mercy on it. Or he said: I have mercy on the sheep while I slaughter it. ... The Hadith.
2. "Tahdhib al-Kamal" 9/509.

text: Book of Jihad 572 - What has been reported regarding the virtue of fighting in the path of Allah. The Hadith of Ibn Mas'ud, may Allah be pleased with him, as Mawquf (stopped): Killing in the path of Allah expiates every sin except the trust (Amanah) (1). Imam Ahmad said: Its chain is a good chain (2). 573 - What has been reported regarding the one whose feet become dusty in the path of Allah. The Hadith of Malik bin Abdullah al-Khath'ami, may Allah be pleased with him: "Whoever's feet become dusty in the path of Allah, Allah forbids him to the Fire" (3). Imam Ahmad said: Al-Khath'ami does not have companionship (Suhbah), and he is old (4).
foot_note:
1. (1) Recorded by Al-Bayhaqi in "Al-Sunan" 6/288, he said: Abu Tahir the Jurist informed us, Abu Bakr Muhammad ibn al-Hussein al-Qattan informed us, Abu al-Azhar told us, Al-Aswad bin Amir told us, Sufyan al-Thawri told us, from Abdullah bin al-Sa'ib, from Zadhan, from Ibn Mas'ud, who said: Killing in the path of Allah expiates every sin except the trust; the one entrusted with it will be brought, even if he was killed in the path of Allah, and it will be said to him: Return your trust. He will say: My Lord, the world has gone, so from where shall I return it? He will say: Take him to the Abyss. So he is brought to the bottom of the Abyss, and his trust is represented to him as it was the day it was given to him. He carries it on his neck and climbs up with it in the Fire, until he thinks he has come out of it, it falls, and he falls after it forever and ever. And Abdullah recited: {Indeed, Allah commands you to render trusts to whom they are due} [An-Nisa: 58].
2. "Masa'il Abdullah" (943).
3. Recorded by Ahmad 5/226, he said: Waki' told us, Muhammad bin Abdullah al-Sha'ithi told us, from Layth ibn al-Mutawakkil, from Malik bin Abdullah al-Khath'ami, in a Marfu' form with it.
4. "Al-Mughni" by Ibn Qudamah 10/375.

text: 574 - What has been reported regarding goodness being tied to the forelocks of horses. The Hadith of Abu Huraira, may Allah be pleased with him: "Goodness is tied to the forelocks of horses until the Day of Judgment" (1). Imam Ahmad said: It is a Munkar (denounced) Hadith (2). 575 - What has been reported regarding the share of the horse. The Hadith of Ibn Umar, may Allah be pleased with them both: "He assigned two shares for the horse and one share for the man." It has two paths from Ibn Umar: The first: The path of Hushaim, from Ubaidullah, from Nafi', from Ibn Umar, in a Marfu' form with it (3).

text: Imam Ahmad said: Hushaim did not hear it from Ubaidullah (1). The second: The path of Abu Usamah, from Ubaidullah, from Nafi', from Ibn Umar, in a Marfu' form with it (2). It was said to Imam Ahmad: Is this Hadith established? He said: Yes, trustworthy narrators (Thiqat) narrated it, Salim bin Akhdar and others. It was said to him: But they say: Ubaidullah only heard it from his brother Abdullah. He said: Does his brother narrate it? It was said to him: Yes. He said: Ubaidullah did not narrate anything from his brother. He rejected that and said: Abdullah narrated from Ubaidullah. And he said: Abdullah was a righteous man; he used to ask about Hadith during the life of Ubaidullah, and he would say: As long as Abu Uthman is alive; so he did not mean Ubaidullah (3). And he said once: Abdul Rahman said: I asked Sufyan about the Hadith of Ibn Umar: "For the rider are three shares." He said they opposed me in it. Ahmad said: They only said: For the horse are two shares. Meaning: There is no disagreement; because the horse has two shares, and its rider has one share. So that is three shares (4).

text: 576 - What has been reported regarding the killing of Hamza, may Allah be pleased with him, and his mutilation. The Hadith of Ibn Abbas, may Allah be pleased with them both: "Were it not that the women would grieve or that it would become a Sunnah after me, I would have left him until Allah resurrects him from the bellies of beasts and birds" (1). Imam Ahmad said: This is from the Hadith of Al-Hasan bin Amarah; this is not from the Hadith of Ibn Abi Ghaniyah. He is too God-fearing to narrate the likes of this (2). 577 - What has been reported regarding disliked qualities in horses. The Hadith of Abu Huraira, may Allah be pleased with him: The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, disliked the Shikal (having three white legs and one conforming color, or vice versa) in horses (3).
foot_note:
1. (1) Recorded by Al-Daraqutni in his "Sunan" 4/118, he said: Abdullah bin Muhammad bin Abdul Aziz told us, Al-Hakam bin Musa told us, Isma'il bin Ayyash told us, from Abdul Malik bin Abi Ghaniyah or someone else, from Al-Hakam bin Utaybah, from Mujahid, from Ibn Abbas, may Allah be pleased with them both, who said: When the polytheists turned away from the slain of Uhud, the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, turned back and saw a sight that distressed him; he saw Hamza, may Allah be pleased with him, with his belly ripped open, his nose cut off, and his ears lopped off. He said: "Were it not that the women would grieve or that it would become a Sunnah after me, I would have left him until Allah resurrects him from the bellies of beasts and birds. I shall surely mutilate seventy men in his place." Then he called for a cloak and covered his face with it, but his feet stuck out, so the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, covered his face and placed some Idhkhir (grass) on his feet. Then he brought him forward and said Takbir over him ten times. Then men would be brought and placed while Hamza remained in his place, until he prayed seventy prayers over him. The slain were seventy. When they were buried and finished with, this verse was revealed: {Invite to the way of your Lord with wisdom and good instruction} [An-Nahl: 125] to His saying: {And be patient, and your patience is not but through Allah} [An-Nahl: 127]. So the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, was patient and did not mutilate anyone.

text: 580 - What has been reported regarding those who stayed behind from the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, in the Battle of Tabuk. The Hadith of Abu Ruhm al-Ghifari, may Allah be pleased with him, and in it: "...For the most cherished of my family to me are those who stay behind from me: the Muhajirun of Quraysh, the Ansar, Aslam, and Ghifar" (1). Imam Ahmad said: Muhammad bin Ishaq did not hear it from Al-Zuhri (2).
foot_note:
1. (1) Recorded by Al-Tabarani in "Al-Kabir" 19/185-186, he said: Ahmad bin Abdullah bin Abdul Rahim al-Barqi told us, Abdul Malik bin Hisham al-Sadusi told us, Ziyad bin Abdullah al-Bakka'i told us, from Muhammad bin Ishaq, from Al-Zuhri, from Ibn Akimah al-Laythi, from the nephew of Abu Ruhm, that he heard Abu Ruhm Kulthum bin Husayn—who was one of the Companions of the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, who pledged allegiance under the tree—saying: I campaigned with the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, in the Battle of Tabuk. I traveled one night with him, and we were at Al-Akhdar near the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace. Drowsiness was cast upon us, and I began to wake up while my riding camel had come close to the riding camel of the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace. Its closeness to him alarmed me for fear that I might hurt his leg in the stirrup. So I began to move my camel away from him until sleep overcame my eyes at some point in the road while we were in the night. My camel crowded the camel of the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, and his leg was in the stirrup. I only woke up to his saying: "Hiss." I said: O Messenger of Allah, ask forgiveness for me. He said: "Travel on." Then the Messenger of Allah began asking me about those who stayed behind from Bani Ghifar, so I informed him. He said while asking me: "What did the tall, red, beardless group do?" I told him about their staying behind. He said: "And what did the short, curly-haired, black ones do?" I said: By Allah, I do not know these people among us. He said: "Yes, those who have livestock at the network of Shadakh." I recalled them among Bani Ghifar, and I did not remember them until I remembered that they were a group from Aslam who were allies among us. I said: O Messenger of Allah, those are from Aslam; they were allies among us. The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said: "What prevented one of those, when he stayed behind, from loading onto a camel of his camels a man energetic in the path of Allah? Indeed, the most cherished of my family to me to stay behind from me..." So he mentioned it.

text: Book of Jizyah 585 - What has been reported regarding there being no Jizyah on a Muslim. 590 - What came regarding the Alliance of the Scented Ones (Hilf al-Mutayyabin). The Hadith of Abdur-Rahman bin Awf (may Allah be pleased with him): "I witnessed the Alliance of the Scented Ones with my uncles while I was a lad, and I would not love to have red camels in exchange for breaking it" (1). Imam Ahmad said: It is Munkar (denounced) unless others narrated it, meaning: Abdur-Rahman bin Ishaq (2). And once, when Imam Ahmad mentioned this Hadith in front of Ahmad bin Salih, Ahmad bin Salih said: "You are the professor, yet you mention the likes of this?" So Ahmad began to smile and said: "A man who is accepted or righteous narrated it from Az-Zuhri: Abdur-Rahman bin Ishaq." He said: "Who narrated it from Abdur-Rahman?" He said: "Two trustworthy men narrated it to us: Isma'il bin Ulayyah and Bishr bin Al-Mufaddal." So Ahmad bin Salih said: "I ask you by Allah to dictate it to me." So Ahmad said: "From the book." He stood up and entered, brought out the book, and dictated it to him. Ahmad bin Salih said: "If I had not benefited from Iraq except for this Hadith, it would have been

591 - What came regarding the Hadith of the Slander (Ifk). The Hadith of Aisha (may Allah be pleased with her): The long Hadith of the Slander (2). Imam Ahmad said: Hisham bin Urwah improved it and perfected it (3). And he said once: Abu Usama narrated strange things (Ghara'ib) from Hisham bin Urwah, and he mentioned among them the Hadith of the Slander. It was said to him: The Hadith of the Slander was narrated by Malik. He said: Like this? Who narrates it from Malik? It was said to him: Al-Zanbari. So he smiled and remained silent (4).

And they slandered them involving [a man], by Allah, I have not known any evil from him ever, and he never entered my house except while I was present, nor did I travel on a journey except that he was absent with me..." And in it: And the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) entered my house and asked my servant girl, and she said: By Allah, I do not know any fault in her except that she sleeps until the sheep enters and eats her dough - or she said her yeast, Hisham doubted - so some of his companions scolded her and said: Tell the truth to the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) until they pressed her on it, so she said: Glory be to Allah! By Allah, I do not know about her except what the goldsmith knows about the red gold ore.

592 - What came regarding Migration (Hijrah) after the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) - therein are two Hadiths:
The First: The Hadith of Umar bin Al-Khattab (may Allah be pleased with him): There is no Hijrah after the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) (2). Imam Ahmad said: There is nothing in Ghundar's book from Yahya bin Hani other than this (3).
The Second: The Hadith of Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him): "There is no Hijrah after three [days] or beyond three. So whoever migrates after three or beyond three and dies, enters the Fire" (4). Imam Ahmad said: Shu'bah raised it (attributed it to the Prophet) once, then he did not raise it afterwards (5).

And At-Tirmidhi said about this Hadith: Hasan Sahih Gharib from the Hadith of Hisham. I say: And the text of this long Hadith is established in the two Sahihs.

4. Reported by Ahmad 2/457, he said: Muhammad narrated to us, he said: Shu'bah narrated to us, from Mansur, from Abu Hazim, narrating from Abu Hurairah, raised (Marfu') with it.

593 - What came regarding the virtue of the Prophet (peace be upon him) - The Hadith of Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him): They said: O Messenger of Allah, when was Prophethood established for you? He said: "While Adam was between the spirit and the body" (1). Imam Ahmad said: This is a Munkar (denounced) Hadith. And he said: This is from the error of Al-Awza'i. And he often makes mistakes regarding Yahya bin Abi Kathir (2).

594 - What came regarding his preference (peace be upon him) over those before him among the Prophets. The Hadith of Abu Musa Al-Ash'ari (may Allah be pleased with him): "I was given five things that no one before me was given" (3). Imam Ahmad said: Abu Ahmad Al-Zubairi did not connect its chain (Isnad) from Isra'il (4).

2. "Sharh Ilal At-Tirmidhi" by Ibn Rajab (346), "Ilal Al-Marudhi" (268), "Al-Muntakhab min Al-Ilal lil-Khallal" (93).

Reported by Ahmad 4/416, he said: Husain bin Muhammad narrated to us, Isra'il narrated to us, from Abu Ishaq, from Abu Burdah, from Abu Musa, who said: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: "I was given five things: I was sent to the red and the black, the earth was made for me a purifier and a mosque, war booty was made lawful for me and it was not made lawful for anyone before me, I was supported by awe [in the hearts of enemies] for a month's distance, and I was given Intercession, and there is no Prophet except that he asked for intercession; and indeed I have saved my Intercession, then made it for whoever died from my Ummah not associating anything with Allah."
4. "Musnad Ahmad" 4/416.

595 - What came regarding the Seal of Prophethood. The Hadith of Abdullah bin Sarjis (may Allah be pleased with him) that he saw the Seal which was between the shoulders of the Prophet (peace be upon him) (1). Imam Ahmad said: And he saw the Prophet (peace be upon him), but he did not have Companionship (Suhbah) (2).

596 - What came regarding the signs of Prophethood. The Hadith of Ibn Mas'ud (may Allah be pleased with him): "O Jew, from both it is created: from the sperm of the man, and from the sperm of the woman" (3).
foot_note:
1. = I say: The text is authentic and established, for Al-Bukhari reported it (438) without his saying: "And there is no Prophet except that he asked for intercession".
1. Reported by Ahmad 5/82, he said: Abu Sa'id narrated to us, Thabit narrated to us, Asim narrated to us, from Abdullah bin Sarjis, raised (Marfu') with it.
2. "Musnad Ahmad" 5/82. I say: And affirming the Seal of Prophethood is established and authentic, for Muslim reported it (110) from the path of Shu'bah, from Simak, who said: I heard Jabir bin Samurah say: I saw a seal on the back of the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) as if it were a pigeon's egg.
3. Reported by Ahmad 1/465, he said: Husain bin Al-Hasan narrated to us, Abu Kudaynah narrated to us, from Ata bin As-Sa'ib, from Al-Qasim bin Abdur-Rahman, from his father, from Abdullah who said: A Jew passed by the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) while he was speaking to his companions. So Quraysh said: O Jew, indeed this one claims that he is a Prophet. So he said: I will surely ask him about something that no one knows except a Prophet. He said: So he came until he sat down, then said: O Muhammad, from what is man created? He said: "O Jew, from both it is created, from the sperm of the man and from the sperm of the woman. As for the sperm of the man, it is thick; from it are the bone and the nerve. And as for the sperm of the woman, it is thin; from it are the flesh and the blood." So the Jew stood up and said: This is how those before you used to say.

597 - What came regarding the honor of the Messenger (peace be upon him) before Allah and among the evidences of the Prophethood of the Messenger (peace be upon him) - therein are two Hadiths:
The First: The Hadith of Makhul (may Allah be pleased with him) that the Prophet (peace be upon him) was brought a shield containing an image of an eagle, so he placed his hand upon it and Allah removed it (2). Imam Ahmad said: It is not authentic from Makhul. It was said to him: Do you think it is from the side of Al-Awza'i? He said: It is likely. It was said to him: Do you think he engaged in Tadlis regarding it? He said: I do not know; some of them say: Al-Awza'i from Khasif, and some of them say: Al-Awza'i from Abdur-Rahman bin Al-Qasim from his father, and it is not authentic (3).
The Second: The Hadith: "I am too honorable before Allah for Him to leave me after two hundred years" (4).

Imam Ahmad said: This is a Munkar (denounced) Hadith (3).

599 - What came regarding the bravery of the Prophet (peace be upon him) - The Hadith of Abdullah bin Mughaffal (may Allah be pleased with him): So we came to him and sat around him weeping (4).

text: 602 - What came regarding the Prophet's admiration for looking at pigeons (Hamam). The Hadith of Aisha (may Allah be pleased with her): The Prophet (peace be upon him) used to like looking at pigeons (1). It was said to Imam Ahmad: That Ibn Al-Himmani narrated it, from Sharik, from Hisham bin Urwah, from his father, from Aisha... The Hadith. So they denied it from him, so he retracted from raising it (Raf') and said: From Aisha as Mursal (2). So Ahmad said: This is a lie; Husain bin Ulwan was attributed with it, and they say he only fabricated it upon Hisham (3). It was said to him: Some of the scholars of Hadith claimed that Al-Saylahini narrated it from Sharik. He said: He lied against Al-Saylahini; this is a false (Batil) Hadith (4).

604 - What came regarding the warning against cursing the one whose name is Muhammad. The Hadith of Anas (may Allah be pleased with him): "They name them Muhammad and curse them" (3). Imam Ahmad said: This is a Munkar (denounced) Hadith (4).

text: 605 - What came regarding kissing the hand and foot of the Messenger (peace be upon him) - The Hadith of Safwan bin Assal (may Allah be pleased with him): A Jew said to his companion: Go with us to this Prophet. His companion said: Do not say 'Prophet', for if he heard you, he would have four eyes (1). Imam Ahmad said: Yahya bin Sa'id opposed more than one person. They said: "We testify that you are a Prophet." And he said: If they said: "We testify that you are the Messenger of Allah," they would have become Muslims; but Yahya erred in it a grave error (2).
foot_note:
1. (1) Reported by At-Tirmidhi (2733), he said: Abu Kurayb narrated to us, Abdullah bin Idris and Abu Usama narrated to us, from Shu'bah, from Amr bin Murrah, from Abdullah bin Salamah, from Safwan bin Assal who said: A Jew said to his companion: Go with us to this Prophet. His companion said: Do not say 'Prophet', for if he heard you, he would have four eyes. So they came to the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) and asked him about nine clear signs. He said to them: "Do not associate anything with Allah, do not steal, do not commit adultery, do not kill the soul which Allah has forbidden except by right, do not walk with an innocent person to a ruler to kill him, do not practice magic, do not consume usury, do not slander a chaste woman, do not turn back in flight on the day of the advance [in battle], and upon you Jews specifically, do not transgress in the Sabbath." He said: So they kissed his hand and his foot. They said: We testify that you are a Prophet. He said: "Then what prevents you from following me?" They said: David prayed to his Lord that there would not cease to be a Prophet in his offspring, and we fear that if we follow you, the Jews will kill us.
2. Book "Al-Ilal" narration of Abdullah (4286), "Al-Jami'" by Al-Khallal 2/373.

The Book of Virtues

Virtues of the Arabs

606 - What came regarding the virtue of the Arabs. The Hadith of Abu Musa Al-Ash'ari (may Allah be pleased with him): "I prayed for the Arabs and said: O Allah, whoever among them meets You believing in You and affirming [the truth], forgive him regarding the days of his reckoning, and it is the supplication of Abraham or Ishmael, peace be upon them" (1). Imam Ahmad said: Marwan bin Mu'awiyah narrated a Hadith from Al-Hasan bin Bishr and gave it a chain (Isnad) (2), and I have heard it from Marwan bin Mu'awiyah, from Yahya bin Al-Ajami, from Az-Zuhri, a Hadith concerning the Arabs. And he said once when asked about Al-Hasan bin Bishr: I do not know what to tell you (3). And he said: I do not think there was any harm in him personally. I say: Meaning regarding his integrity (Adalah), but the Imams weakened him.

607 - What came regarding the virtue of Joshua son of Nun (Yusha' bin Nun). The Hadith of Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him): "Indeed, the sun was never held back for any human being except for Joshua during the nights he marched to Jerusalem (Bayt al-Maqdis)" (1). Imam Ahmad said: When asked: Did anyone narrate it other than Al-Aswad from Abu Bakr? He said: I did not hear it except from Al-Aswad. Then Abu Abdullah said: Abu Bakr bin Ayyash used to be disordered (Mudtarib) in the Hadith of these younger ones, but regarding those older ones, how close he is (2).

608 - What came regarding the virtue of the Muhammadan Ummah. The Hadith of Anas (may Allah be pleased with him): "My Ummah is like the rain; it is not known whether its beginning is better or its end" (3). Imam Ahmad said: This is a mistake; this is only narrated from Al-Hasan (4).

2. "Al-Muntakhab min Al-Ilal lil-Khallal" (101). Benefit: Imam Ahmad indicated that the narration of Abu Bakr bin Ayyash from Hisham and his likes is disordered, and this is a defect in the Hadith.
3. Reported by At-Tirmidhi (2869), he said: Qutaibah narrated to us, Hammad bin Yahya Al-Abh narrated to us, from Thabit Al-Bunani, from Anas, raised (Marfu') with it.

609 - What came regarding the virtue of the Companions. The Hadith of Jabir bin Abdullah (may Allah be pleased with them both): "Indeed Allah chose my companions over all the worlds except the Prophets and Messengers, and He chose from my companions four: Abu Bakr, Umar, Uthman, and Ali, and He made them the best of my companions, and in all my companions there is good" (1). Imam Ahmad said: This is a fabricated (Mawdu') Hadith (2).

610 - What came regarding following the Companions of the Prophet (peace be upon him) - The Hadith of Umar bin Al-Khattab (may Allah be pleased with him): "My companions are like the stars; whichever of them you follow, you will be guided" (3). Imam Ahmad said: This Hadith is not authentic (4).
foot_note:
1. = I say: And the Mursal narration of Al-Hasan Al-Basri was mentioned by Ibn Qudamah in "Al-Muntakhab" (12), he said: Abdullah said: My father narrated to us, from Hammad bin Salamah, from Thabit, Humaid, and Yunus, from Al-Hasan, from the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him)... The Hadith.
1. Reported by Ibn Hibban in "Al-Majruhin" 2/41, he said: Muhammad bin Yahya informed us, he said: Ad-Darimi narrated to us, he said: Abdullah bin Salih narrated to us, he said: Nafi' bin Yazid narrated to us, from Zuhrah bin Ma'bad, from Sa'id bin Al-Musayyib, from Jabir, raised (Marfu').
2. "Sharh Ilal At-Tirmidhi" by Ibn Rajab (216), "Al-Muntakhab" from "Al-Ilal" by Al-Khallal (105).
3. Reported by Ibn al-Jawzi in "Al-Ilal Al-Mutanahiyah" 1/282-283. He said: Nu'aym bin Hammad narrated, he said: Abdur-Rahman bin Zaid Al-Ammi narrated to us, from his father, from Sa'id bin Al-Musayyib, from Umar bin Al-Khattab who said: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: "I asked my Lord about what my companions will differ in after me? So He revealed to me: O Muhammad, indeed your companions are to Me like the status of stars..." The Hadith.
4. "Al-Muntakhab min Al-Ilal lil-Khallal" (69).

text:
611 - What came regarding the virtues of the Ansar. The Hadith of Al-Harith bin Ziyad (may Allah be pleased with him): "Whoever loves the Ansar, Allah loves him, and whoever hates the Ansar, Allah hates him" (1). Imam Ahmad said: Thus said Muhammad bin Ubaid, and he erred in it (2).

612 - The virtue of those who witnessed Badr among the Muslims. The Hadith of Rafi' bin Khadij (may Allah be pleased with him): That Gabriel or an angel came to the Prophet (peace be upon him) and said: "How do you count those who witnessed Badr among you?" He said: "The best of us." He said: "And likewise they are, with us, the best of the angels" (3). Al-Athram said: I said to Abu Abdullah: Ath-Thawri says: From Abayah bin Rifa'ah, from Rafi' bin Khadij, and others say: From Mu'adh bin Rifa'ah, from his father (4).
foot_note:
1. (1) Reported by Ahmad 4/221, he said: Yazid bin Harun narrated to us, Muhammad bin Amr informed us, from Sa'd bin Al-Mundhir, from Hamzah bin Abi Usayd, who said: I heard Al-Harith bin Ziyad... so he mentioned it raised (Marfu') with it. And Ahmad reported it 2/527: From the path of Muhammad bin Ubaid, he said: Amr narrated to us, from Abu Salamah, from Abu Hurairah, raised (Marfu') with it.
2. Book "Al-Ilal" narration of Abdullah (4851). I say: And the text is established and authentic, for Al-Bukhari reported it (3783) from the Hadith of Al-Bara' bin Azib (may Allah be pleased with him).
3. Reported by Ahmad 3/465, he said: Waki' narrated to us, Sufyan narrated to us, from Yahya bin Sa'id, from Abayah bin Rifa'ah, from his grandfather Rafi' bin Khadij... The Hadith.
4. Reported by Al-Bukhari (3992), he said: Ishaq bin Ibrahim narrated to me, Jarir informed us, from Yahya bin Sa'id, from Mu'adh bin Rifa'ah bin Abi Rafi' Az-Zuraqi, from his father - and his father was among the people of Badr - who said: Gabriel came... The Hadith.

text: He said: No one said in it: 'From Abayah' other than Ath-Thawri. He said: And I used to think that Waki' was the one who differed in it, until I saw more than one person narrating it from Ath-Thawri like this. I said: So it is from the side of Ath-Thawri? He said: Yes. And Muhanna said: I asked Ahmad about Abayah, I said: Did he not catch his grandfather Rafi' bin Khadij? He said: I do not know. I said: Is Abayah bin Rifa'ah the brother of Mu'adh bin Rifa'ah? He said: No, this is from the offspring of Rafi' bin Khadij (1).
foot_note: 1. (1) "Al-Muntakhab min Al-Ilal lil-Khallal" (126).

text:
613 - What came regarding the virtues of the Rightly Guided Caliphs. The Hadith of Anas (may Allah be pleased with him): That the Prophet (peace be upon him) ascended Uhud, and Abu Bakr, Umar, and Uthman were with him, so it shook with them. He said: "Be firm, Uhud, for upon you is a Prophet, a Siddiq (Truthful one), and two Martyrs" (1). Al-Athram said: Qatada narrated from Yunus bin Jubayr, from a man from the Companions of the Prophet (peace be upon him) that he ascended Uhud and with him were Abu Bakr, Umar, and Uthman, so the mountain shook... The Hadith. At-Taimi had a delusion in it, for it was narrated by Qatada from Anas. Then Al-Athram said: I mentioned that to Imam Ahmad, and he said: This is Idtirab (disorder/confusion) (2).

Virtues of Abu Bakr As-Siddiq

614 - What came regarding Abu Bakr giving all his wealth in charity. The Hadith of Aisha (may Allah be pleased with her): "No wealth benefited me, as the wealth of Abu Bakr benefited me" (3). Imam Ahmad said: Munkar (denounced). And he said: Who narrated it? It was said to him: Yahya bin Ma'in, Sufyan narrated to us, from Az-Zuhri, from Urwah, from Aisha. Yahya said: A man said to Sufyan: Who from Az-Zuhri? He said: Wa'il. Ahmad said: We see that Wa'il did not hear from Az-Zuhri; Wa'il only narrated from his father. And he denied it very strongly and said: This is a mistake.
foot_note:
1. (1) Reported by Al-Bukhari (3675), he said: Muhammad bin Bashar narrated to us, Yahya bin Sa'id narrated to us, from Qatada that Anas bin Malik (may Allah be pleased with him) told them that the Prophet (peace be upon him) ascended Uhud... The Hadith.
2. "Sharh Ilal At-Tirmidhi" by Ibn Rajab (341).
3. Reported by Ahmad in "Fada'il as-Sahabah" 1/67, he said: Abdullah narrated to us, Yahya bin Ma'in narrated to me, Sufyan narrated to us, from Az-Zuhri, from Urwah, from Aisha, raised (Marfu') with it.

text: Then he said: Abd al-Razzaq told us, from Ma'mar, from Al-Zuhri, from Sa'id bin al-Musayyib (1) who said: The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said (2). 615 - What has been reported regarding the virtue of Abu Bakr and Umar, in it are three Hadiths: The First: The Hadith of Anas, may Allah be pleased with him: That the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, used to go out to the mosque, in which were the Muhajirun and the Ansar. None of them would raise his head from his Habwah (sitting posture holding knees) except Abu Bakr and Umar; he would smile at them, and they would smile at him (3). Imam Ahmad denied it (4). The Second: The Hadith of Ibn Mas'ud, may Allah be pleased with him, that Sa'id bin Zaid asked him: The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, passed away, so where is he? He said: He is in Paradise. He said: Abu Bakr passed away, so where is he? He said: That is the compassionate one, sought at every good. He said: Umar passed away, so where is he? He said: When the righteous are mentioned, then come to Umar (5).
foot_note:
1. (1) Recorded by Ahmad in "Fada'il al-Sahabah" 1/72, he said: Abd al-Razzaq told us, from Ma'mar, from Al-Zuhri, from Sa'id as Mursal (hurried).
2. "Fada'il al-Sahabah" by Ahmad 1/71-72, "Al-Ilal" narration of Abdullah (2532), "Al-Muntakhab min al-Ilal by Al-Khallal" (107).
3. Recorded by Ahmad 3/150, he said: Sulayman bin Dawud told us, Ibn Atiyyah—meaning: Al-Hakam—told us, from Thabit, from Anas... The Hadith.
4. "Al-Muntakhab min al-Ilal by Al-Khallal" (103).
5. Recorded by Al-Tabarani in "Al-Kabir" 9/163-164, he said: Ishaq bin Ibrahim al-Dabari told us, from Abd al-Razzaq, from Ma'mar, from Abd al-Karim al-Jazari, from Abu Ubaidah, from Ibn Mas'ud that Sa'id bin Zaid said: O Abu Abd al-Rahman... so he mentioned it.
