text: Imam Ahmad said: I do not know what this Hadith is (1). He said on another occasion: This is narrated from Abu Ubaidah that Ibn Mas'ud said this statement, and what is narrated from Sa'id regarding the Ten is more beloved to me (2). The Third: The Hadith of Abu Sa'id al-Khudri, may Allah be pleased with him: "There is no Prophet except that he has two ministers from the inhabitants of the heavens and two ministers from the inhabitants of the earth" (3). Imam Ahmad said: Talid told us from Abu al-Jahhaf who said: The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said... and he mentioned the like of it, and he did not connect its chain from Atiyyah nor Abu Sa'id (4). Virtues of Umar, may Allah be pleased with him - 616 - What has been reported regarding the supplication of the Messenger, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, for Umar for faith. The Hadith of Ibn Umar, may Allah be pleased with them both, that the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, struck Umar's chest when he accepted Islam and said: "O Allah, bring out what is in his chest of rancor and replace it with faith" (5).
foot_note:
1. (1) "Masa'il Ishaq bin Mansur al-Kawsaj" (3524).
2. "Bada'i' al-Fawa'id" by Ibn al-Qayyim 4/66. I say: The Hadith of Sa'id bin Zaid regarding the Ten Promised Paradise is more beloved to Imam Ahmad; because in it is that Abu Bakr and Umar are in Paradise, and the Hadith of Ibn Mas'ud does not contain that. And Allah knows best.
3. Recorded by Ahmad in "Fada'il al-Sahabah" 1/164, he said: Abdullah told us, he said: Abu Sa'id al-Ashajj Abdullah bin Sa'id al-Kindi told me, Talid bin Sulayman told us, from Abu al-Jahhaf, from Atiyyah, from Abu Sa'id, in a Marfu' form with it.
4. "Fada'il al-Sahabah" 1/67.
5. Recorded by Al-Tabarani in "Al-Kabir" 5/305-306, he said: Ja'far bin Muhammad al-Firyabi told us, Abu Ja'far al-Nufayli told us, Khalid bin Abi Bakr bin Ubaidullah bin Abdullah bin Umar told us, from Salim, from Ibn Umar, in a Marfu' form with it.

text: Imam Ahmad said: When he was asked about this Hadith: Who narrates it from Salim? It was said to him: There is no one between them. It was as if he was amazed by it (1). 617 - What has been reported regarding the virtue of Umar bin Al-Khattab in the heavens. The Hadith of Ammar bin Yasir, may Allah be pleased with them both: "Jibril came to me just now, so I said: O Jibril, tell me of the virtues of Umar in the heavens. He said: O Muhammad, if I were to tell you of the virtues of Umar in the heavens as long as Noah stayed among his people—one thousand years less fifty years—the virtues of Umar would not be exhausted, and indeed Umar is a good deed among the good deeds of Abu Bakr" (2). Imam Ahmad said: This is a fabricated Hadith, and I do not know Isma'il (3). 618 - What has been reported regarding the choice of the Messenger, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, of Umar after him. The Hadith of Uqbah bin al-Harith, may Allah be pleased with him: "If there were to be a prophet after me, it would have been Umar" (4). Imam Ahmad said: Strike it out; for to me, it is Munkar (denounced) (5).
foot_note:
1. (1) "Al-Muntakhab min Ilal al-Khallal" (104).
2. Recorded by Ibn al-Jawzi in "Al-Mawdu'at" 1/321 from the path of Abu Ali Isma'il bin Muhammad al-Saffar, who said: Al-Hasan bin Arafah told us, he said: Al-Walid bin al-Fadl al-Anazi told me, he said: Isma'il bin Ubaid bin Nafi' al-Basri told me, from Hammad bin Abi Sulayman, from Ibrahim al-Nakha'i, from Alqamah, from Ammar bin Yasir, in a Marfu' form with it.
3. "Al-Mawdu'at" by Ibn al-Jawzi 1/321, "Al-Muntakhab min al-Ilal by Al-Khallal" (108).
4. Recorded by Al-Tirmidhi (3686), he said: Salamah bin Shabib told us, Al-Muqri told us, from Haywah bin Shurayh, from Bakr bin Amr, from Mishrah bin Ha'an, from Uqbah bin Amir, in a Marfu' form with it.
5. "Al-Muntakhab min al-Ilal by Al-Khallal" (106).

text: 619 - What has been reported regarding the testimony of the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, for Umar regarding inspiration (Ilham). The Hadith of Aisha, may Allah be pleased with them both: "There used to be in the nations before you people who were inspired (Muhaddathun). If there is any of them in my nation, then Umar bin Al-Khattab is one of them" (1). Imam Ahmad said: Ibrahim bin Sa'd narrates it from his father, from Abu Huraira (2), and Ibn Ajlan says: From Sa'd, from Abu Salamah, from Aisha (3). So he said: It is in his book from his father as Mursal (4), and he only narrated it from his memory, and it is from Aisha (5).
foot_note:
1. (1) Recorded by Muslim (2398), he said: Abu al-Tahir Ahmad bin Amr bin Sarh told me, Abdullah bin Wahb told us, from Ibrahim bin Sa'd, from his father Sa'd bin Ibrahim, from Abu Salamah, from Aisha, from the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, that he used to say... The Hadith.
2. Recorded by Al-Bukhari (3689), he said: Yahya bin Qaza'ah told us, Ibrahim bin Sa'd told us, from his father, from Abu Salamah, from Abu Huraira, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said... so he mentioned it.
3. Recorded by Muslim (2398), he said: Qutaibah bin Sa'id told us, Layth told us, H. And Amr al-Naqid and Zuhair bin Harb told us, they said: Ibn Uyaynah told us, both of them from Ibn Ajlan, from Sa'd bin Ibrahim, from Abu Salamah, from Aisha, in a Marfu' form with it.
4. Recorded by Ahmad 2/339, he said: Yaqub told us, my father told us, from his father, who said: Abu Salamah bin Abd al-Rahman told me that the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace... so he mentioned it as Mursal. This is what Al-Daraqutni pointed to in "Al-Ilzamat wa al-Tatabbu'" (167) from the path of Ibn al-Had, Yaqub and Sa'd the sons of Ibrahim, Abu Salih the scribe of Layth, and others, from Ibrahim bin Sa'd, from his father, from Abu Salamah who said: It has reached me that the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace... The Hadith.
5. "Masa'il Salih" (1241). I say: There has been much discussion about this Hadith. Al-Daraqutni criticized it in "Al-Ilzamat wa al-Tatabbu'" 165-167 and declared it defective due to Irsal. Al-Hafiz said in "Al-Fath" 7/61: Thus said the companions of Ibrahim bin Sa'd bin Ibrahim bin Abd al-Rahman bin Awf, from his father, from Abu Salamah; and Ibn Wahb opposed them, saying: from Ibrahim bin Sa'd with this chain, from Abu Salamah, from Aisha. Abu Mas'ud said: I do not know =

text: 620 - What has been reported regarding the virtues of Uthman, may Allah be pleased with him - The Hadith of Uqbah bin Amir, may Allah be pleased with him: "I am for the Caliph after you, the slain one, Uthman bin Affan" (1). Imam Ahmad said: This is nothing (2).
foot_note:
1. = anyone who followed Ibn Wahb in this, and what is known from Ibrahim bin Sa'd is that it is from Abu Huraira, not from Aisha. Zakariya bin Abi Za'idah followed him, from Ibrahim bin Sa'd. And Muhammad bin Ajlan said, from Sa'd bin Ibrahim, from Abu Salamah, from Aisha. Abu Mas'ud said: It is famous from Ibn Ajlan, so it is as if Abu Salamah heard it from Aisha and from Abu Huraira, both of them. I say: It has a basis from the Hadith of Aisha from the path of Ibn Abi Atiq from her. Also, Al-Nawawi reported in "Sharh Muslim" the criticism of Al-Daraqutni and remained silent about it.
1. Recorded by Al-Uqayli in "Al-Du'afa" 2/230, he said: Muhammad bin Ahmad bin al-Nadr al-Azdi told us, he said: Abd al-Rahman bin Affan told us, he said: Abd al-Rahman bin Ibrahim al-Dimashqi told us, from Layth bin Sa'd, from Yazid bin Abi Habib, from Abu al-Khayr, from Uqbah bin Amir, who said: The Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said: "When I was ascended to the heavens, I entered the Garden of Eden. An apple fell into my hand, and it split open revealing a pleasing Houri (nymph) whose eyelashes were like the wings of a vulture. I said: To whom do you belong? She said: I am for the Caliph after you, the slain one, Uthman bin Affan."
2. "Al-Muntakhab min al-Ilal by Al-Khallal" (111).

text: Virtues of Ali bin Abi Talib, may Allah be pleased with him - 621 - What has been reported regarding the returning of the sun for Ali bin Abi Talib. The Hadith of Asma bint Umays: "Indeed he was in Your obedience and the obedience of Your Messenger, so return the sun for him" (1). Imam Ahmad said: It has no basis (2).
foot_note:
1. (1) Recorded by Ibn al-Jawzi in "Al-Mawdu'at" 1/355, he said: Abd al-Wahhab al-Hafiz informed us, he said: Muhammad bin al-Muzaffar informed us, he said: Al-Atiqi informed us, he said: Yusuf bin Ahmad told us, he said: Al-Uqayli told us, he said: Ahmad bin Dawud told us, he said: Ammar bin Matrah told us. And Muhammad bin Nasir informed us, he said: Abd al-Wahhab bin Mandah informed us—and the wording is his—he said: My father informed us, he said: Uthman bin Ahmad al-Tinnisi told us, he said: Abu Umayyah told us, he said: Abdullah bin Musa told us, both said: Fudayl bin Marzuq told us, from Ibrahim bin al-Hasan bin al-Hussein, from Fatimah bint al-Hussein, from Asma bint Umays, who said: The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, was receiving revelation while his head was in the lap of Ali, may Allah be pleased with him, so he [Ali] did not pray Asr until the sun set. The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said: "Indeed he was in Your obedience and the obedience of Your Messenger, so return the sun for him." Asma said: So I saw it set, then I saw it rise after it had set.
2. "Asna al-Matalib" by Al-Bayruti 225 (710), "Al-Maqasid al-Hasanah" 226.

text: 622 - What has been reported regarding following Ali, may Allah be pleased with him - The Hadith of Abu Dharr, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: "O Ali, whoever separates from me has separated from Allah, and whoever separates from you has separated from me" (1). Imam Ahmad said when asked about this Hadith: Strike it out; and he disliked that it be narrated (2). 623 - What has been reported regarding the brotherhood of Ali to the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace - The Hadith of Ali bin Abi Talib, may Allah be pleased with him, as Mawquf: "I am the servant of Allah and the brother of His Messenger, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, and I am the Great Siddiq (Truthful One); no one claims it after me except a liar" (3). Imam Ahmad said: Strike it out, for it is a Munkar (denounced) Hadith (4).
foot_note:
1. (1) Recorded by Ahmad in "Fada'il al-Sahabah" 2/570 (926), he said: Ibn Numayr told us, Amir bin al-Sibt told us, he said: Abu al-Jahhaf told me, from Mu'awiyah bin Tha'labah, from Abu Dharr in a Marfu' form with it.
2. "Al-Muntakhab min al-Ilal by Al-Khallal" (115).
3. Recorded by Ahmad in "Fada'il al-Sahabah" 2/586 (993): He said: Ibn Numayr and Abu Ahmad al-Zubayri told us, they said: Al-Ala' bin Salih told us, from Al-Minhal bin Amr, from Abbad bin Abdullah al-Asadi, who said: Ali bin Abi Talib, may Allah be pleased with him, said... The Hadith.
4. "Al-Mawdu'at" by Ibn al-Jawzi 1/341, "Al-Muntakhab min al-Ilal by Al-Khallal" (114), "Minhaj al-Sunnah al-Nabawiyyah" 7/444, "Tahdhib al-Tahdhib" 3/67. Benefit: Ibn al-Jawzi said: And among what invalidates these Hadiths is that it contradicts the precedence of the Islam of Khadijah, Zaid, and Abu Bakr, and that Umar became Muslim in the sixth year of Prophethood after forty [people], so how can this be correct?! I say: In the Sahih there is what contradicts this from Ali, may Allah be pleased with him, for Al-Bukhari recorded (3671) =

text: 624 - What has been reported regarding allegiance to Ali bin Abi Talib, may Allah be pleased with him - The Hadith of Ali, may Allah be pleased with him: "O Allah, befriend whoever befriends him and be hostile to whoever is hostile to him" (1). Imam Ahmad said: Very Munkar. —Al-Uqayli said: It is as if he did not doubt that this is a lie—: This is not from the Hadith of Ibn Uyaynah (2). And he said once: This is a Kufan addition, meaning: "O Allah, befriend..." (3). And he said once: This is a mistake from Hussein; they opposed him, there is no mention of Anas in it (4). 625 - What has been reported regarding the virtue of Ali, may Allah be pleased with him, over the rest of the Arabs. The Hadith of Aisha, may Allah be pleased with them both: "I am the master of the children of Adam, and Ali is the master of the Arabs" (5). Imam Ahmad denied it with severe denial. Al-Athram said: I said to Abu Abdullah: Ibn al-Himmani narrated it and the people denied it from him,
foot_note:
1. = from Muhammad bin al-Hanafiyyah, who said: I said to my father—meaning: Ali bin Abi Talib—: Which of the people is best after the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace? He said: Abu Bakr. I said: Then who? He said: Then Umar. I feared that he would say Uthman. I said: Then you? He said: I am but a man from the Muslims.
1. I found it from the path of Hussein al-Ashqar, from Ibn Uyaynah, from Ibn Tawus, from his father who informed me, four of the Companions of the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, that he said to Ali... The Hadith.
2. "Al-Muntakhab min al-Ilal by Al-Khallal" (122), Al-Uqayli in "Al-Du'afa" 1/249, "Tahdhib al-Tahdhib" 1/522.
3. "Al-Fatawa" by Ibn Taymiyyah 4/417.
4. "Al-Ilal" narration of Abdullah (5157).
5. Recorded by Al-Hakim in "Al-Mustadrak" 3/124, he said: Abu al-Abbas Muhammad bin Ahmad told us, Muhammad bin Mu'adh told us, Abu Hafs Umar bin al-Hasan al-Rasibi told me, from Abu Awanah, from Abu Bishr, from Sa'id bin Jubayr, from Aisha in a Marfu' form with it.

text: so behold, someone else has narrated it. He said: Who? I said: That Harrani, Ahmad bin Abd al-Malik. He said: Like this! As if he was amazed. Then he said: Did you hear it from him? I said: I heard it while he was speaking about this. I said to him: Ibn al-Himmani has narrated it. He said: So why do they deny it from me, when Al-Himmani has narrated it?! And he did not narrate it to us (1). 626 - What has been reported regarding the status of Ali with the Lord of the Worlds. The Hadith of Sa'id bin Abi Waqqas, may Allah be pleased with him: "It was not I who brought him in and put you out; rather Allah brought him in and put you out" (2). Imam Ahmad said: This is a Munkar Hadith; it has no basis (3).
foot_note:
1. (1) "Al-Muntakhab min al-Ilal by Al-Khallal" (118).
2. Recorded by Al-Khatib in his "Tarikh" 5/293, he said: Abu Bakr Ahmad bin Muhammad bin Ahmad bin al-Hussein bin Muhammad al-Asbahani known as Al-Fayj informed us—I heard from him in Hamadhan—Abu Bakr Ahmad bin Abdan bin Muhammad al-Shirazi the Hafiz informed us in Ahvaz, Ali bin al-Hussein bin Ma'dan told us, Luwayn told us—in Baghdad in the city of Abu Ja'far in the year two hundred and forty—Sharik told us, Abu Bakr Muhammad bin Umar bin Bukayr al-Najjar and Abu al-Hasan Muhammad bin al-Hussein bin Umar bin Burhan al-Ghazzal informed us, they said: Abu al-Fadl Ubaidullah bin Abd al-Rahman al-Zuhri told us, Abu Bakr Muhammad bin Harun bin Humayd al-Mujaddar told us, Muhammad bin Sulayman Luwayn told us, Sufyan bin Uyaynah told us, from Amr bin Dinar, from Abu Ja'far, from Ibrahim bin Sa'd, from his father, who said: A group of people were with the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, and Ali entered, so they went out. When they went out, they blamed one another and returned. The Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said... The Hadith.
3. "Ilal al-Marwazi" (280), "Al-Muntakhab min al-Ilal by Al-Khallal" (122), "Bahr al-Dam" (196), "Tarikh Baghdad" (1316).

book_title: The Collection of Imam Ahmad's Sciences - Hadith Defects
publisher: Dar Al-Falah for Scientific Research and Heritage Verification, Fayoum - Arab Republic of Egypt
text: 627 - What has been reported regarding the command to follow Ali, may Allah be pleased with him - The Hadith of Abu Sa'id al-Khudri, may Allah be pleased with him: "Indeed, I am leaving among you the Two Weighty Things (Al-Thaqalayn), one of them is greater than the other: The Book of Allah, a rope extended from the heaven to the earth, and my offspring, the people of my household (Ahl al-Bayt)" (1). Imam Ahmad narrated it, and when he finished it, he said: These Hadiths of the Kufans are Manakir (denounced) (2).
foot_note:
1. (1) Recorded by Ahmad in "Al-Musnad" 3/14, he said: Aswad bin Amir told us, Abu Isra'il—meaning: Isma'il bin Abi Ishaq al-Mula'i—informed us, from Atiyyah, from Abu Sa'id who said: The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said: "Indeed, I am leaving among you the Two Weighty Things, one of them is greater than the other: The Book of Allah, a rope extended from the heaven to the earth, and my offspring, the people of my household. And they will never separate until they return to me at the Basin (Hawd)."
2. "Al-Muntakhab min al-Ilal by Al-Khallal" (117). I say: It has a witness in "Sahih Muslim" (2408), he said: Zuhair bin Harb and Shuja' bin Makhlad told me, both from Ibn Ulayyah; Zuhair said: Zuhair bin Harb and Shuja' bin Makhlad told me, both from Ibn Ulayyah, Zuhair said: Isma'il bin Ibrahim told us, Abu Hayyan told me, Yazid bin Hayyan told me, he said: Husayn bin Sabrah, Umar bin Muslim, and I went to Zaid bin Arqam. When we sat with him, Husayn said to him: You have encountered, O Zaid, much good; you saw the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, and heard his Hadith... And in it: "And I am leaving among you two weighty things: The first of them is the Book of Allah; in it is guidance and light, so take the Book of Allah and hold fast to it." So he urged regarding the Book of Allah and encouraged it, then he said: "And the people of my household, I remind you of Allah regarding the people of my household, I remind you of Allah regarding the people of my household, I remind you of Allah regarding the people of my household."

book_title: The Collection of Imam Ahmad's Sciences - Hadith Defects
publisher: Dar Al-Falah for Scientific Research and Heritage Verification, Fayoum - Arab Republic of Egypt
text: 628 - What has been reported that Ali is the most knowledgeable of the Companions. The Hadith of Ibn Abbas, may Allah be pleased with them both: "I am the city of knowledge and Ali is its gate" (1). Imam Ahmad was asked about Abu al-Salt, so he said: He narrated Munkar Hadiths. It was said to him: He narrated the Hadith of Mujahid from Ali: "I am the city of knowledge, and Ali is its gate." He said: We have not heard of this. It was said to him: Is this what you deny from him? He said: Other than this; as for this, we have not heard of it. And he narrated from Abd al-Razzaq one [Hadith] that we do not know, and we did not hear it. It was said to Abu Abdullah: Did Abd al-Razzaq have any of these poor (radi') Hadiths? He said: I did not hear anything of them (2). And he said once: May Allah uglify Abu al-Salt; that man mentioned a Hadith from Abd al-Razzaq that has no basis (3).
foot_note:
1. (1) Recorded by Al-Tabarani 11/65-66, he said: Al-Ma'mari and Muhammad bin Ali al-Sa'igh al-Makki told us, they said: Abd al-Salam bin Salih Abu al-Salt al-Harawi told us, Abu Mu'awiyah told us, from Al-A'mash, from Mujahid, from Ibn Abbas, in a Marfu' form with it.
2. "Ilal al-Marwazi" (308), "Tahdhib al-Tahdhib" 3/450.
3. "Al-Mawdu'at" by Ibn al-Jawzi 1/354, "Al-Muntakhab min al-Ilal by Al-Khallal" (120), "Tarikh Baghdad" 11/48, "Tahdhib al-Kamal" 18/77, "Tahdhib al-Tahdhib" 4/268, "Al-Jarh wa al-Ta'dil" 6/99.

book_title: The Collection of Imam Ahmad's Sciences - Hadith Defects
publisher: Dar Al-Falah for Scientific Research and Heritage Verification, Fayoum - Arab Republic of Egypt
text: 629 - What has been reported regarding specifying Ali by opening his door to the Mosque. The Hadith of Ibn Abbas, may Allah be pleased with them both: "Close all the doors of the Mosque except the door of Ali" (1). Imam Ahmad denied it. And it was said to him: Does Amr bin Maymun narrate from Ibn Abbas? He said: I do not know that I am aware of it (2). And he said once: Abu Balj narrated a Munkar Hadith "Close the doors" (3).
foot_note:
1. (1) Recorded by Ibn al-Jawzi in "Al-Mawdu'at" 1/364, he said: Muhammad bin Abd al-Baqi bin Ahmad informed us, he said: Hamad bin Ahmad informed us, he said: Abu Nu'aym the Hafiz informed us, he said: Muhammad ibn Ahmad bin al-Hasan told us, he said: Abu Shu'ayb al-Harrani told us, he said: Yahya bin Abd al-Hamid told us, he said: Abu Awanah told us, from Abu Balj, from Amr bin Maymun, from Ibn Abbas, in a Marfu' form with it.
2. "Sharh Ilal al-Tirmidhi" 364.
3. "Bahr al-Dam" (1144), "Al-Mawdu'at" by Ibn al-Jawzi 1/336, "Tahdhib al-Tahdhib" 6/317.

book_title: The Collection of Imam Ahmad's Sciences - Hadith Defects
publisher: Dar Al-Falah for Scientific Research and Heritage Verification, Fayoum - Arab Republic of Egypt
text: 630 - What has been reported regarding the virtues of Abd al-Rahman bin Awf, may Allah be pleased with him - The Hadith of Aisha, may Allah be pleased with them both: I heard the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, say: "I saw Abd al-Rahman bin Awf entering Paradise crawling." This reached Abd al-Rahman bin Awf, so he said: If I could, I would surely enter it standing. So he gave it [the caravan] with its saddles and loads in the path of Allah, Azza wa Jalla (1). Imam Ahmad said: This is a Munkar Hadith (2).
foot_note:
1. (1) Recorded by Ahmad 6/115, he said: Abd al-Samad bin Hassan told us, he said: Umarah informed us, from Thabit, from Anas, who said: While Aisha was in her house, she heard a sound in Medina, so she said: What is this? They said: A caravan belonging to Abd al-Rahman bin Awf has arrived from Sham carrying something of everything. He said: It was seven hundred camels. He said: Medina shook from the sound, so Aisha said... The Hadith.
2. "Siyar A'lam al-Nubala" 1/76. I say: Al-Dhahabi quoted in "Al-Siyar" the statement of Imam Ahmad regarding the denouncement (Nakarah) of the Hadith and attributed it to "Musnad Ahmad", but I did not find it. Al-Dhahabi said in "Al-Siyar" 1/77-78: In any case, even if Abd al-Rahman were delayed from his companions for the accounting and entered Paradise crawling metaphorically and as a proverb, his status in Paradise is not less than the status of Ali and Al-Zubayr, may Allah be pleased with all. Among his virtues is that the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, testified for him regarding Paradise, and that he is among the people of Badr to whom it was said: "Do whatever you wish," and among the people of this verse: {Certainly was Allah pleased with the believers when they pledged allegiance to you under the tree} [Al-Fath: 18], and the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, prayed behind him.

book_title: The Collection of Imam Ahmad's Sciences - Hadith Defects
publisher: Dar Al-Falah for Scientific Research and Heritage Verification, Fayoum - Arab Republic of Egypt
text: 631 - What has been reported regarding the virtues of Al-Zubayr, may Allah be pleased with him - The Hadith of Abdullah bin al-Zubayr, may Allah be pleased with them both: "For every prophet there is a disciple (Hawari), and Al-Zubayr is my disciple and the son of my paternal aunt" (1). Imam Ahmad said: Yahya and Waki' told us from Hisham bin Urwah as Mursal, and Sulayman bin Harb told us, he said: Hammad bin Zaid told us as Mursal; Ibn al-Zubayr is not in it (2). 632 - What has been reported regarding the virtues of Abu Dharr, may Allah be pleased with him - The Hadith of Abu Huraira, may Allah be pleased with him: "Whoever is pleased to look at the humility of Jesus, son of Mary, let him look at the humility of Abu Dharr" (3). Imam Ahmad was asked about this Hadith, so he said: Strike out the Hadith of Abu Dharr (4).
foot_note:
1. (1) Recorded by Ahmad 4/4, he said: Yunus told us, he said: Hammad bin Zaid told us, from Hisham bin Urwah, from his father, from Abdullah bin al-Zubayr in a Marfu' form with it.
2. "Musnad Ahmad" 4/4. I say: The text of the Hadith is established and authentic without the phrase "and the son of my paternal aunt," for Al-Bukhari recorded it (4113) from the Hadith of Jabir, may Allah be pleased with him.
3. Recorded by Ibn Sa'd in "Al-Tabaqat" 4/172, he said: Yazid bin Harun informed us, he said: Abu Umayyah bin Ya'la informed us, from Abu al-Zinad, from Al-A'raj, from Abu Huraira who said: The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said: "The sky has not shaded nor has the earth carried anyone more truthful in speech (dialect) than Abu Dharr. Whoever is pleased to look at the humility of Jesus, son of Mary, let him look at Abu Dharr."
4. "Al-Muntakhab min al-Ilal by Al-Khallal" (125).

book_title: The Collection of Imam Ahmad's Sciences - Hadith Defects
publisher: Dar Al-Falah for Scientific Research and Heritage Verification, Fayoum - Arab Republic of Egypt
text: 633 - Virtues of Bilal, may Allah be pleased with him - The Hadith of Buraydah al-Aslami, may Allah be pleased with him: "Bilal will be brought a she-camel from the she-camels of Paradise, and he will ride it and call out the Adhan. Whoever hears him from the believers will confirm him, until he reaches the Gathering place. And Bilal will be brought two suits from the suits of Paradise and will be clothed in them; so the first of the Mu'adhdhin (callers to prayer) to be clothed will be Bilal" (1). Imam Ahmad said: When asked about Muhammad bin al-Fadl bin Atiyyah, he said: He was a liar who would bring you calamities (Tamat), and he is the owner of the Hadith of the she-camel of Thamud and Bilal the Mu'adhdhin (2).
foot_note:
1. (1) Recorded by Abu Nu'aym in "Tarikh Asbahan" 1/284, he said: Abu al-Hasan Ali bin Muhammad bin al-Hussein al-Warraq al-Mu'addib told us, Abu Salih Muhammad bin al-Hasan bin al-Muhallab told us, Muhammad bin Isa al-Tarsusi told us, Abd al-Aziz bin al-Khattab told us, Muhammad bin al-Fadl ibn Atiyyah told us, from his father, from Abdullah bin Buraydah, from his father, who said: The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said: "Allah will resurrect the she-camel of Salih, and he will drink its milk along with those of his people who believed in him. And I have a Basin (Hawd) as wide as the distance between Aden and Oman; its cups are as numerous as the stars of the sky. The Prophets will seek drink, and Allah will resurrect Salih on his she-camel." Mu'adh said: O Messenger of Allah, and you on Al-Adba'? He said: "I will be resurrected on Al-Buraq, Allah Azza wa Jalla favors me with it among the Prophets, and Fatima my daughter on Al-Adba', and Bilal will be brought..." The Hadith.
2. "Ahwal al-Rijal" by Al-Juzjani 372, "Tarikh Baghdad" 3/150, "Al-Kamil" by Ibn Adi 6/161, "Tahdhib al-Kamal" 26/282, "Tahdhib al-Tahdhib" 5/257.

publisher: Dar Al-Falah for Scientific Research and Heritage Verification, Fayoum - Arab Republic of Egypt
text: 634 - What has been reported regarding the virtue of Al-Hasan and Al-Hussein. In it are two Hadiths: The First: The Hadith of Abu Sa'id al-Khudri, may Allah be pleased with him: "They are the two masters of the youth of Paradise" (1). Imam Ahmad was asked about this Hadith: Is it authentic? He said: Yes. It was said to him: But a people claimed that it is not authentic? So he denied what they said (2). The Second: The Hadith of Fatima al-Kubra, may Allah be pleased with them both: "For every sons of a father there is a paternal lineage (Asabah) to which they belong, except the children of Fatima; I am their paternal lineage" (3). Imam Ahmad said: This is a very Munkar Hadith, as if it is fabricated. And he said: We see him imagining these Hadiths—meaning: Uthman bin Muhammad bin Abi Shaybah—we ask Allah for safety, O Allah, save us, save us (4).
foot_note:
1. (1) Recorded by Al-Tirmidhi (3768), he said: Mahmud bin Ghaylan told us, Abu Dawud al-Hafari told us, from Sufyan, from Yazid bin Abi Ziyad, from Ibn Abi Nu'm, from Abu Sa'id al-Khudri, in a Marfu' form with it.
2. "Al-Muntakhab min al-Ilal by Al-Khallal" (124).
3. Recorded by Al-Tabarani in "Al-Kabir" 3/44, he said: Muhammad bin Abdullah al-Hadrami told us, Uthman bin Abi Shaybah told us, Jarir told us, from Shaybah bin Na'amah, from Fatima bint Hussein, from Fatima al-Kubra, who said... The Hadith.
4. "Al-Ilal" narration of Abdullah (1333), "Al-Muntakhab min al-Ilal by Al-Khallal" (123), "Al-Du'afa" by Al-Uqayli 3/223, "Bahr al-Dam" (682), "Tarikh Baghdad" 11/284-285, "Al-Jarh wa al-Ta'dil" 6/166-167, "Tahdhib al-Kamal" 19/483, "Tahdhib al-Tahdhib" 4/97-98, "Mizan al-I'tidal" 4/333.

publisher: Dar Al-Falah for Scientific Research and Heritage Verification, Fayoum - Arab Republic of Egypt
text: Virtues of Mu'awiyah, may Allah be pleased with him - 635 - What has been reported regarding the testimony of the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, for guidance and right conduct. The Hadith of Talha bin Ubaidullah, may Allah be pleased with him: "Indeed, he is guided" or "of right conduct" (1). Muhanna mentioned this Hadith to Ahmad, so Ahmad said: If he said to you: "Abd al-Rahman told me," then he has lied; because Abd al-Rahman did not narrate from Ishaq bin Yahya; because he [Ishaq] is Matruk (abandoned) in Hadith. I said: So where was Ishaq from? He said: A Kufan. I said: What is his condition? He said: Munkar al-Hadith (2). 636 - What has been reported regarding the one who loves Mu'awiyah. The Hadith of Al-Nu'man bin Bashir, may Allah be pleased with him: "Whoever loves Mu'awiyah has loved me, and whoever hates Mu'awiyah has hated me" (3). Imam Ahmad said: Al-Ajlah is Shi'a; how could he narrate the likes of this?!
foot_note:
1. (1) Recorded by Ibn al-Jawzi in "Al-Ilal al-Mutanahiyah" 1/275-276, he said: Ali bin Ubaidullah informed us, he said: Ali bin Ahmad informed us, he said: Ibn Battah informed us, he said: Abdullah bin Muhammad bin Ishaq told us, he said: Muhammad bin Ibrahim al-Qasmali told us, he said: Al-Hasan bin Salim told us, he said: Al-Hasan bin al-Rabi' told us, he said: Abu Yusuf al-Sulhi told us, he said: Abd al-Rahman bin Mahdi told us, from Ishaq bin Yahya bin Talha, from his uncle Isa bin Talha, from Talha bin Ubaidullah, who said: I heard the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace... The Hadith.
2. "Al-Muntakhab min al-Ilal by Al-Khallal" (139).
3. I did not find it from the path of Ubaidullah bin Musa, from Al-Thawri, from Al-Ajlah, from Al-Sha'bi, from Al-Nu'man bin Bashir from the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace.

text: And he said: If a Levantine (Shami) narrated it, it would be [plausible], but as for the people of Kufa, then no (1). 637 - What has been reported regarding the supplication of the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, for Mu'awiyah. The Hadith of Al-Irbad bin Sariyah: "O Allah, teach him—meaning: Mu'awiyah—the Book and protect him from the punishment" (2). Muhanna said to Imam Ahmad: Indeed, the Kufans do not mention this: "Teach him the Book and the arithmetic (Hisab) and protect him from the punishment," did they cut it? Ahmad said: Abd al-Rahman did not mention it, and he only mentioned it in what was between me and him (3).
foot_note:
1. (1) "Al-Muntakhab min al-Ilal by Al-Khallal" (140). Benefit: Ibn al-Qayyim said in "Al-Manar al-Munif" 116: Ishaq bin Rahwayh said: Nothing is authentic regarding the virtue of Mu'awiyah bin Abi Sufyan from the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace. Ibn al-Qayyim said: His meaning and the meaning of those from the people of Hadith who said that, is that no Hadith is authentic regarding his specific virtues; otherwise, what is authentic according to them regarding the virtues of the Companions in general and the virtues of Quraysh, then Mu'awiyah, may Allah be pleased with him, is included in it.
2. Recorded by Ahmad 4/127, he said: Abd al-Rahman bin Mahdi told us, from Mu'awiyah—meaning: Ibn Salih—from Yunus bin Sayf, from Al-Harith bin Ziyad, from Abu Ruhm, from Al-Irbad bin Sariyah al-Sulami, who said: I heard the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, while he was inviting us to the Suhoor in the month of Ramadan: "Come to the blessed meal." Then I heard him say... The Hadith.
3. "Al-Muntakhab min al-Ilal by Al-Khallal" (141). I say: Imam Ahmad said, quoting from "Al-Mawdu'at" by Ibn al-Jawzi 2/24, that Ali had many enemies, so his enemies searched for a fault in him but did not find one, so they came to a man who had fought him and battled him, and they praised him out of spite against him [Ali].

text: 638 - What has been reported regarding the criticism of Mu'awiyah, may Allah be pleased with him - In it are four Hadiths: The First: The Hadith of Abdullah bin Amr, may Allah be pleased with them both: "A man from the people of the Fire will rise upon you," then Mu'awiyah rose (1). Imam Ahmad said: Ibn Tawus only narrated it from his father, from Abdullah bin Amr, or someone else; he doubted in it (2). The Second: The Hadith of Ibn Umar, may Allah be pleased with them both: "Every nation has a Pharaoh, and the Pharaoh of this nation is Mu'awiyah bin Abi Sufyan" (3). Imam Ahmad said: It is not authentic. This Hadith is not known among the Hadiths of Ubaidullah. And Abd al-Majid did not hear anything from Ubaidullah, so Abd al-Majid must have practiced Tadlis (concealment) in it; he heard it from a person and narrated it (4). The Third: The Hadith of Abu Huraira, may Allah be pleased with him: "The Caliphate is in Medina, and the Kingship is in Sham" (5).
foot_note:
1. (1) I did not find it from the path of Sharik, from Layth, from Tawus, from Abdullah.
2. "Al-Muntakhab min al-Ilal by Al-Khallal" (136).
3. Recorded by Ibn al-Jawzi in "Al-Ilal al-Mutanahiyah" 1/279, he said: Abd al-Majid bin Abi Rawad has narrated it, from Ubaidullah ibn Umar, from Nafi', from Ibn Umar, who said: The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said: "For every nation..." The Hadith.
4. "Al-Ilal al-Mutanahiyah" 1/280, "Al-Muntakhab min al-Ilal by Al-Khallal" (135).
5. Recorded by Al-Hakim in "Al-Mustadrak" 3/72, he said: Abu Bakr Ahmad bin Balawayh told me from the original of his book, Muhammad bin Uthman bin Abi Shaybah told us, Yahya bin Ma'in told us, Hushaim told us, from Al-Awwam bin Hawshab, from Sulayman bin Abi Sulayman, from his father, from Abu Huraira, may Allah be pleased with him, from the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace... The Hadith.

text: Imam Ahmad said: The known companions of Abu Huraira do not have this [Hadith] (1). The Fourth: The Hadith of Al-Hasan, may Allah be pleased with him: "If you see Mu'awiyah on this pulpit of mine preaching, then kill him" (2). Imam Ahmad said: This is not from the Hadith of Yunus (3).
foot_note:
1. (1) "Al-Muntakhab min al-Ilal by Al-Khallal" (137). Benefit: Ibn al-Qayyim said in "Al-Manar al-Munif" 117: Every Hadith regarding the criticism of Mu'awiyah is a lie.
2. Recorded by Al-Khatib in "Tarikh Baghdad" 12/181 from the path of Ibn Numayr, from Sufyan, he said: Yunus told us, from Al-Hasan, from the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace... The Hadith.
3. "Al-Ilal" narration of Abdullah (2850).

publisher: Dar Al-Falah for Scientific Research and Heritage Verification, Fayoum - Arab Republic of Egypt
text:
The Book of Leadership (Imarah)

639 - What came regarding the Imams (Leaders) being from Quraysh.
The Hadith of Anas (may Allah be pleased with him): "The Imams are from Quraysh" (1).
Imam Ahmad said: This is not in the books of Ibrahim; it is not fitting that it has a basis [in those books] (2).
foot_note:
1. (1) Reported by Abu Dawud At-Tayalisi (284), he said: Ibn Sa'd narrated to us, from his father, from Anas, raised (Marfu') to the Prophet.
2. "Masa'il Abi Dawud" (1860), "Siyar A'lam al-Nubala" 8/309, "Sharh Ilal At-Tirmidhi" 327, "Tahdhib al-Tahdhib" 1/81, "Mizan al-I'tidal" 1/34. I say: Witnessing to this Hadith is what Al-Bukhari reported (3500) via Mu'awiyah (may Allah be pleased with him) raised to the Prophet, containing: "Indeed, this matter is in Quraysh; no one opposes them except that Allah throws him down on his face, as long as they establish the religion..." Also, what Muslim reported (1818) via Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) raised to the Prophet: "People are followers of Quraysh in this matter; their Muslim follows their Muslim, and their disbeliever follows their disbeliever." Issue: An-Nawawi said in "Sahih Muslim" 12/201: These Hadiths and their likes are apparent evidence that the Caliphate is exclusive to Quraysh and it is not permissible to contract it for anyone other than them. Upon this, the consensus was established during the time of the Companions, and likewise after them. Whoever opposes this among the people of innovation, or hints at opposition from others, is refuted by the consensus of the Companions and the Successors and those after them based on the authentic Hadiths. Al-Qadi said: The condition of being Qurashi is the school of all scholars. He said: Abu Bakr and Umar (may Allah be pleased with them) used it as proof against the Ansar on the Day of the Saqifah, and no one denied it. Al-Qadi said: The scholars have counted it among the issues of consensus, and no saying or action contrary to what we mentioned has been transmitted from any of the Predecessors regarding it, nor from those after them in all ages.

publisher: Dar Al-Falah for Scientific Research and Heritage Verification, Fayoum - Arab Republic of Egypt
text:
640 - What came regarding the Caliphate of Quraysh.
There are two Hadiths in this:
The First: The Hadith of Thawban (may Allah be pleased with him): "Be straight for Quraysh as long as they are straight for you" (1).
Imam Ahmad said: It is not authentic; Salim bin Abi Al-Ja'd did not meet Thawban (2).
The Second: The Hadith of Umm Hani, similar to it (3).
Imam Ahmad said: It is not authentic; it is Munkar (denounced) (4).
He said once: The Hadiths are contrary to this. The Prophet (peace be upon him) said: "Listen and obey even if [the leader is] an Abyssinian slave with amputated limbs." And he said: "Hearing and obeying in your hardship and your ease, and when others are preferred over you." So, regarding what is narrated from the Prophet (peace be upon him) in Hadiths contrary to the Hadith of Thawban, I do not know what its direction is (5).

641 - What came regarding the rights due upon Quraysh.
The Hadith of Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him): "Indeed, I have a right over Quraysh, and indeed Quraysh has
foot_note:
1. (1) Reported by Ahmad 5/277, he said: Waki' narrated to us, from Al-A'mash, from Salim, from Thawban, raised to the Prophet, and it contains: "If they are not straight for you, then carry your swords on your shoulders and annihilate their green [multitude]; if you do not do so, then be miserable farmers and eat from the toil of your hands."
2. "As-Sunnah" by Al-Khallal 1/127.
3. "As-Sunnah" by Al-Khallal 1/128 via Ali bin Abis, narrated from him by Al-Himm ani, from Abu Fazarah, from Abu Salih the Mawla of Umm Hani, from Umm Hani, raised to the Prophet.
4. "As-Sunnah" by Al-Khallal 1/128.
5. "As-Sunnah" by Al-Khallal 1/127.

Imam Ahmad said: I do not know it, except that Ibn Abi Dhi'b narrated more than one Hadith from him [Ma'mar] (2).

642 - What came regarding the Caliphate after the Prophet (peace be upon him).
There are three paths from Safinah, the Mawla of the Prophet (peace be upon him):
The First: From the path of Hashraj bin Nubatah, from Sa'id bin Jumhan, from Safinah: When the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) built the Mosque, he placed a stone in the construction and said to Abu Bakr: "Place your stone next to my stone" (3).
Imam Ahmad said: I do not know it (4).
foot_note:
1. (1) Reported by Ahmad in "Al-Musnad" 2/270, he said: Abdur-Razzaq narrated to us, Ma'mar narrated to us, from Ibn Abi Dhi'b, from Sa'id Al-Maqburi, from Abu Hurairah, who said: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said... The Hadith.
2. "As-Sunnah" by Al-Khallal 1/129-130.

Reported by Al-Uqayli in "Ad-Du'afa" 1/297, he said: Muhammad bin Isma'il narrated to us, he said: Yahya bin Abdul-Hamid Al-Himmani narrated to us, he said: Hashraj bin Nubatah narrated to us, from Sa'id bin Jumhan, from Safinah, who said: When the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) built the Mosque, he placed a stone in the construction and said to Abu Bakr: "Place your stone next to my stone." Then he said to Umar: "Place your stone next to Abu Bakr's stone." Then he said to Uthman: "Place your stone next to Umar's stone." Then he said: "These are the Caliphs after me."
4. "Al-Muntakhab min Al-Ilal lil-Khallal" (129). I say: Al-Bukhari said in "At-Tarikh Al-Kabir" 3/117: This has not been corroborated, because Umar bin Al-Khattab and Ali said: The Prophet (peace be upon him) did not appoint a successor. And Ibn Adi said in "Al-Kamil" 2/460: This is what Al-Bukhari denied from Hashraj regarding this Hadith.

The Second: From the path of Abdul-Warith bin Sa'id, from Sa'id bin Jumhan, from Safinah: "The Caliphate of Prophethood is thirty years, then Allah gives the Dominion—or His Dominion—to whom He wills" (1).
Imam Ahmad said: It is authentic (Sahih).
Al-Marudhi said to Imam Ahmad: They criticize Sa'id bin Jumhan?
He said: Sa'id bin Jumhan is trustworthy (Thiqah). More than one of them narrated from him: Hashraj, Hammad, and Al-Awwam.
I [Al-Marudhi] said: Abbas bin Salih narrated from Ali bin Al-Madini, from Yahya Al-Qattan that he spoke against him?
He became angry and said: False! I never heard Yahya speak against him (2).
And once Ahmad affirmed him (3).
The Third: From the path of Hammad bin Salamah, from Sa'id bin Jumhan, from Safinah, similar to it (4).
Imam Ahmad said when asked about this Hadith: Is it established? He said: Yes (5).

Sa'id said: Safinah said to me: Count for yourself: Abu Bakr for two years, Umar for ten, Uthman for twelve, and Ali such-and-such. 643 - What came regarding if allegiance is pledged to two Caliphs.
The Hadith of Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him): "If allegiance is pledged to two Caliphs, then kill the latter of them" (1).
Imam Ahmad said: This is Mursal from Sa'id bin Al-Musayyib, from the Prophet (peace be upon him). Affan narrated to us, from Hammam, from Qatadah, from Sa'id bin Al-Musayyib, from the Prophet (peace be upon him). And Abu Hilal is confused/disordered (Mudtarib) in Hadith from Qatadah (2).
And they only connected this chain (as Musnad) via Al-Jurayri, from Abu Nadrah, from Abu Sa'id (3) from the Hadith of Khalid; no one else narrates it.
It was said to him: They say Khalid's hearing was after [Al-Jurayri's] confusion/deterioration (Ikhtilat).
He said: I do not know (4).
And he said once: This Hadith is among the singular/strange narrations (Ghara'ib) of Al-Jurayri (5).
foot_note:
1. (1) Reported by At-Tabarani in "Al-Awsat" 3/216-217, he said: Ibrahim narrated to us, he said: Ammar bin Harun narrated to us, he said: Abu Hilal narrated to us, from Qatadah, from Sa'id bin Al-Musayyib, from Abu Hurairah, raised to the Prophet.
2. "Al-Muntakhab" by Ibn Qudamah (87).
3. Reported by Muslim (1853), he said: And Wahb bin Baqiyyah Al-Wasiti narrated to me, Khalid bin Abdullah narrated to us, from Al-Jurayri, from Abu Nadrah, from Abu Sa'id, raised to the Prophet.
4. "Al-Muntakhab" by Ibn Qudamah (87).
5. "Siyar A'lam al-Nubala" 6/155.

644 - What came regarding the ruling on one who divides the affair of the Muslims while they are united.
The Hadith of Arfajah bin Shuraih (may Allah be pleased with him): "There will be afflictions and afflictions (Hanat wa Hanat); so whoever you see trying to divide the Ummah of Muhammad (peace be upon him) while they are united, kill him, whoever he may be" (1).
Imam Ahmad said: Abu Nu'aym used to narrate it from Shayban saying 'Ibn Surayh', and some said 'Shurayh', and some said 'Shurayh' [different vocalizations]. As for Shu'bah, he did not mention his lineage and said in it: 'I heard the Prophet (peace be upon him)' (2).
foot_note:
1. (1) Reported by Muslim (1852), he said: Abu Bakr bin Nafi' and Muhammad bin Bashar narrated to me. Ibn Nafi' said: Ghundar narrated to us. And Ibn Bashar said: Muhammad bin Ja'far narrated to us, Shu'bah narrated to us, from Ziyad bin Ilaqah, he said: I heard Arfajah say: I heard the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) say... The Hadith.
2. "Al-Muntakhab min Ilal Al-Khallal" by Ibn Qudamah (92).

The Book of Virtues of the Quran

645 - What came regarding the Reciters (Qurra').
The Hadith of Abdullah bin Amr (may Allah be pleased with them both): "Indeed, most of the hypocrites of my Ummah are its reciters" (1).
It was said to Imam Ahmad: Is this Hadith authentic?
He said: Allah knows best, I do not know (2).

646 - What came regarding the virtues of the Surahs of the Quran.
The Hadith of Ubayy bin Ka'b (may Allah be pleased with him): "Yes, O Ubayy, whichever Muslim recites the Opening of the Book (Al-Fatihah), he is given reward as if he read two-thirds of the Quran" (3).
foot_note:
1. (1) Reported by Ahmad 2/175, he said: Hasan narrated to us, Ibn Lahi'ah narrated to us, Darraj narrated to us, from Abdur-Rahman bin Jubayr, from Abdullah bin Amr bin Al-Aas, raised to the Prophet.
2. "Masa'il Salih" (285), "Al-Muntakhab min Al-Ilal lil-Khallal" (161).
3. Mentioned by Az-Zayla'i in "Nasb al-Rayah" 4/345. Witnessing to it is what Ibn Al-Jawzi reported in "Al-Mawdu'at" 1/239-240, he said: Al-Mubarak bin Khayrun bin Abdul-Malik informed us, Ahmad bin Al-Hasan bin Khayrun said: Abu Tahir Muhammad bin Ali bin Al-Allaf informed us, Uthman bin Muhammad Al-Adami informed us, Abu Bakr bin Abi Dawud As-Sijistani informed us by permission, Muhammad bin Asim narrated to us, Shababah bin Sawwar narrated to us, Muhammad bin Abdul-Wahid narrated to us, from Ali bin Zaid bin Jud'an and Ata bin Abi Maymunah, from Zirr bin Hubaysh, from Ubayy bin Ka'b, who said: The Quran was presented to the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) twice in the year he passed away, and he said: "Gabriel (peace be upon him) commanded me to read the Quran to you and to convey peace to you." So Ubayy said: I said when the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) read to me: Was it specifically for me, and was I specifically granted the reward of the Quran for what Allah taught you and revealed to you? He said: Yes, O Ubayy, whichever Muslim reads the Opening of the Book (Al-Fatihah) is given reward as if he read two-thirds of the Quran, and he is given reward as if he gave charity to every believing man and woman. And whoever reads Al-Imran is given for every verse of it safety on the bridge of Hell. And whoever reads Surah An-Nisa is given reward as if he gave charity to everyone who would inherit from him... [listing virtues for every Surah until the end of the Quran].

647 - What came regarding the names of the Surahs of the Quran.
The Hadith of Anas (may Allah be pleased with him): "Do not say Surah Al-Baqarah, nor Surah Al-Imran, nor Surah An-Nisa, and likewise the entire Quran. But say: The Surah in which the Cow is mentioned, and the one in which the Family of Imran is mentioned, and likewise the entire Quran" (2).
Imam Ahmad said: This is a Munkar (denounced) Hadith (3), and the Hadiths of 'Ubais are Munkar narrations.

648 - What came regarding the desirability of beautifying the voice with the Quran.
There are two Hadiths in this:
The First: The Hadith of Aisha (may Allah be pleased with her): "He is not of us who does not chant (Taghanna) the Quran" (1).
Imam Ahmad said: There is nothing of this [authentic]; whoever said it from Aisha has erred. And he weakened Asal bin Sufyan (2).
foot_note:
1. (1) Reported by Al-Hakim 1/570, he said: Abu Ali Al-Husain bin Ali Al-Hafiz narrated to us, Abdan Al-Ahwazi informed us, Nasr bin Ali Al-Jahdami narrated to us, Al-Harith bin Murrah narrated to us, Asal bin Sufyan narrated to us, from Ibn Abi Mulaykah, from Aisha (may Allah be pleased with her) raised to the Prophet.
2. "Ilal Al-Marudhi" (256), "Al-Muntakhab min Al-Ilal lil-Khallal" (46). I say: As for the text, Al-Bukhari reported it (7527) from the path of Az-Zuhri, from Abu Salamah, from Abu Hurairah raised to the Prophet with the wording: "He is not of us who does not chant the Quran." However, Ad-Daraqutni in "Al-Ilzamat wa At-Tatabbu'" (170) criticized this Hadith, saying: It is said that Abu Asim was deluded in it, and the correct version is what Az-Zuhri, Muhammad bin Ibrahim, Yahya bin Abi Kathir, Muhammad bin Amr, and others narrated from Abu Salamah, from Abu Hurairah, from the Prophet (peace be upon him): "Allah has not listened to anything as He listens to a Prophet with a beautiful voice chanting the Quran, reciting it aloud." And Abu Asim's saying is a delusion. Uqayl, Yunus, Amr bin Al-Harith, Amr bin Dinar, Amr bin Atiyyah, Ishaq bin Rashid, Ma'mar and others narrated it from Az-Zuhri contrary to what Abu Asim narrated from Ibn Jurayj with the wording we previously mentioned. Ibn Jurayj only narrated this wording which Abu Asim mentioned from him with another chain narrated from Ibn Abi Mulaykah, from Abu Nahik, from Sa'id; Ibn Uyainah said it from him. Al-Khatib said in "Tarikh Baghdad" 1/295 with modification: And Abu Asim's saying in it: "He is not of us who does not chant the Quran" is a delusion from Abu Asim; because of the large number of those who narrated it from him like that. Likewise, Al-Awza'i, Amr bin Al-Harith, Muhammad bin Al-Walid Az-Zubaidi, Shu'aib bin Abi Hamzah, Ma'mar bin Rashid, Uqayl bin Khalid, Yunus bin Yazid, Ubaidullah bin Abi Ziyad, Ishaq bin Rashid, Mu'awiyah bin Yahya As-Sadafi, and Al-Walid bin Muhammad Al-Waqari narrated it from Az-Zuhri, and they all agreed, including Ibn Jurayj, that its wording is: "Allah has not listened to anything as He listens to a Prophet chanting the Quran." Al-Hafiz said in "Al-Fath" 13/511: The Hadith is one, except that some of them narrated it with the wording "Allah has not listened..." and some narrated it with "He is not of us...". I say: What appears to me is that this Hadith has been criticized, and Allah knows best. Issue: Al-Hafiz said in "Al-Fath" 8/688-689: Ibn Al-Jawzi said: They differed regarding the meaning of his saying 'yataghanna' on four views: First: Beautifying the voice. Second: Being self-sufficient (Istighna). Third: Becoming sad/sorrowful, said by Ash-Shafi'i. Fourth: Occupying oneself with it; the Arabs say 'taghanna' in a place meaning he stayed there. I [Al-Hafiz] say: There is another view narrated by Ibn Al-Anbari in "Al-Zahir", he said: The meaning is finding pleasure and sweetness in it just as the people of music find pleasure in singing, so it was termed 'taghanni' because he does at it what is done at singing. At-Tabari mentioned from Ash-Shafi'i that he was asked about Ibn Uyainah's interpretation of 'taghanni' as 'Istighna' (self-sufficiency), and he did not approve of it and said: If he meant self-sufficiency, he would have said 'lam yastaghni' (does not seek sufficiency), but rather he meant beautifying the voice.

Imam Ahmad said: There is nothing of this [authentic], and he weakened it (2).

649 - The virtue of whoever listens to a verse from the Book of Allah.
The Hadith of Ibn Abbas (may Allah be pleased with them both): "Whoever listens to a verse from the Book of Allah, it will be a light for him on the Day of Resurrection" (1).
Imam Ahmad said: This is a Munkar (denounced) Hadith. It is as if he denied its chain (2).

650 - What came regarding taking payment for teaching the Quran.
The Hadith of Ubadah bin As-Samit (may Allah be pleased with him), containing: "If it pleases you to be encircled by a collar of fire, then accept it" (3).
Imam Ahmad said: This is a Munkar (denounced) Hadith (4). And he said once: Al-Mughirah bin Ziyad is weak in Hadith, narrating denounced Hadiths, and every Hadith he raises [to the Prophet] is Munkar (5).
foot_note:

I said: It is not money, and I shoot from it in the cause of Allah. So I asked the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) about it. He said... The Hadith.
4. "At-Talkhis Al-Habir" 4/7.
5. "Al-Ilal Al-Mutanahiyah" 1/76.

651 - What came regarding the virtue of learning the Quran.
The Hadith of Ali (may Allah be pleased with him): "Whoever learns the Quran, memorizes it, and retains it, Allah will admit him into Paradise and accept his intercession for ten of his household, all of whom had deserved the Fire" (1).
Imam Ahmad said: I do not know Hammad, and Abu Umar Al-Bazzaz is Matruk (abandoned) in Hadith (2).

652 - What came regarding teaching children the Quran.
The Hadith of Ibn Abbas, which has paths from Ibn Abbas:
The First Path: Abu Bishr, from Sa'id bin Jubayr, from him: The Prophet (peace be upon him) passed away when I was ten years old, and I had read the Muhkam (3).
Imam Ahmad said: This, in my view, is a flimsy (Wahin) Hadith. Abdullah bin Ahmad said: I think he said: Weak (4).
The Second Path: Ibn Idris, from his father, from Abu Ishaq, from Sa'id, from him: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) passed away while I was circumcised (5).
foot_note:
1. (1) Reported by Ahmad 1/149, he said: Abdullah narrated to us, Muhammad bin Bakkar narrated to me, Hafs bin Sulayman - meaning Abu Umar the Reciter - narrated to us, from Kathir bin Zadhan, from Asim bin Damrah, from Ali (may Allah be pleased with him), who said: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: "Whoever learns the Quran, memorizes it, and retains it, Allah will admit him into Paradise..."
2. "Al-Muntakhab min Al-Ilal lil-Khallal" (53).
3. (1) Reported by Al-Bukhari (5035), he said: Musa bin Isma'il narrated to us, Abu Awanah narrated to us, Abu Bishr narrated to us, from Sa'id bin Jubayr, from Ibn Abbas... The Hadith.
4. "Al-Ilal" narration of Abdullah (1712), "Siyar A'lam al-Nubala" 3/336.
5. Reported by Ibn Abi Asim in "Al-Ahad wal-Mathani" 1/285, he said: Yusuf bin Musa narrated to us, Ibn Idris narrated to us, from his father, from Abu Ishaq, from Sa'id bin Jubayr, from Ibn Abbas, with it.

Imam Ahmad said: We have always heard that this is a flimsy Hadith (1).
And he said once: The Hadith of Shu'bah (2) seems to agree with the Hadith of Az-Zuhri, from Ubaidullah, from Ibn Abbas (3): "I came on a she-donkey, and I had neared puberty (Ihtilam)" (4).
foot_note:
1. (1) "Al-Ilal" narration of Abdullah 1/237.
2. Reported by Abu Dawud At-Tayalisi (343), he said: Shu'bah narrated to us, from Abu Ishaq, from Sa'id bin Jubayr, from Ibn Abbas... The Hadith.
3. Reported by Al-Bukhari (493), he said: Abdullah bin Yusuf narrated to us, he said: Malik informed us, from Ibn Shihab, from Ubaidullah bin Abdullah bin Utbah, from Ibn Abbas that he said: I came riding on a she-donkey, and I was on that day near puberty, and the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) was leading the people in prayer... The Hadith.
4. "Al-Ilal" narration of Abdullah (1715), (1716), "Siyar A'lam al-Nubala" 3/336, "Tahdhib al-Kamal" 15/161, "Tahdhib al-Tahdhib" 3/181. Issue: Al-Hafiz said in "Al-Fath" 8/702-703: Iyad found problematic the statement of Ibn Abbas: "The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) passed away when I was ten years old" due to what preceded in the [Book of] Prayer from another perspective that he was nearing puberty during the Farewell Pilgrimage. Also, it was reported in [the Book of] Seeking Permission from another perspective that "The Prophet (peace be upon him) died while I was circumcised," and they used not to circumcise a man until he reached maturity. And also from him that he was fifteen years old at the death of the Prophet (peace be upon him). Al-Isma'ili preceded in noting this difficulty, saying: The Hadith of Az-Zuhri, from Ubaidullah, from Ibn Abbas which passed in Prayer is a delusion. Iyad answered that it is possible his saying: (I was ten years old) refers to memorizing the Quran, not to the death of the Prophet (peace be upon him), and the estimated meaning would be: "He died while I had gathered the Muhkam and I was ten years old." So there is a shifting of words. Amr bin Al-Fallas said: The correct view according to us is that Ibn Abbas was thirteen years old, having completed them, at the death of the Prophet (peace be upon him). Similar is reported by Abu Ubaid. Al-Bayhaqi attributed to Mus'ab Az-Zubayri that he was fourteen, and Ash-Shafi'i asserted this in "Al-Umm", then narrated that it was said: sixteen, and narrated the opinion of thirteen, which is the famous one. Al-Bayhaqi reported via Abu Al-Aliyah from Ibn Abbas: "I read the Muhkam during the time of the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) while I was twelve years old." These are six opinions. Al-Hafiz said: The basis is the saying of Az-Zubayr bin Bakkar and other genealogists that the birth of Ibn Abbas was...

653 - What came regarding the prohibition of teaching women and children the Quran.
The Hadith of Mu'awiyah (may Allah be pleased with him): "Do not teach women, children, and slaves the Quran" (1).
Imam Ahmad said: I do not know this from [authentic] Hadith (2).
foot_note:
1. ... three years before the Hijrah, and Banu Hashim were in the Ravine (Shi'b), and that was before the death of Abu Talib. Similar is reported by Abu Ubaid. It is possible to reconcile the different narrations except for sixteen and twelve, for neither of them has a proven chain. The most famous is that he neared puberty when he approached thirteen, then reached it when he completed it and entered the year after. So the mention of fifteen considers rounding up the fractions, ten and thirteen consider dropping the fraction, and fourteen considers rounding one of them.
1. I did not find it from the Hadith of Mu'awiyah, but Al-Hakim reported it 2/396 from the path of Abdul-Wahhab bin Ad-Dahhak, Shu'aib bin Ishaq narrated to us, from Hisham bin Urwah, from his father, from Aisha, who said: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: "Do not settle them in rooms and do not teach them writing - meaning: women - but teach them spinning and Surah An-Nur."
2. "Al-Muntakhab min Al-Ilal lil-Khallal" (54), "Masa'il Harb" p. 469.
