654 - What came regarding Ya-Sin being the heart of the Quran.
The Hadith of Anas (may Allah be pleased with him): "Everything has a heart, and the heart of the Quran is Ya-Sin" (1).
Imam Ahmad said: This speech is fabricated (Mawdu') (2).

655 - What came regarding the reward of reciting Surah Al-Waqi'ah.
The Hadith of Ibn Mas'ud (may Allah be pleased with him): "Whoever reads Surah Al-Waqi'ah every night, poverty will never afflict him" (3).
Imam Ahmad said: This is a Munkar (denounced) Hadith. He said: As-Sarri bin Yahya is established, trustworthy, trustworthy (Thiqah Thiqah), but Shuja' who narrated from As-Sarri, I do not know him, and Abu Taybah, I do not know him (4).
foot_note:
1. (1) Reported by At-Tirmidhi (2887), he said: Qutaibah and Sufyan bin Waki' narrated to us, they said: Humaid bin Abdur-Rahman Ar-Ru'asi narrated to us, from Al-Hasan bin Salih, from Harun Abu Muhammad, from Muqatil bin Hayyan, from Qatadah, from Anas raised to the Prophet... and it contains: "And whoever reads Ya-Sin, Allah writes for him, by his reading of it, the reading of the Quran ten times."
2. "Al-Muntakhab min Al-Ilal lil-Khallal" (50).
3. Reported by Ibn As-Sunni in "Amal Al-Yawm wal-Laylah" (678), he said: Abu Ya'la informed us, Ishaq bin Abi Isra'il narrated to us, Muhammad bin Munib Al-Adani narrated to us, As-Sarri bin Yahya Ash-Shaybani narrated to us, from Abu Taybah that Ibn Mas'ud (may Allah be pleased with him) said... so he mentioned it raised to the Prophet.
4. "Al-Ilal Al-Mutanahiyah" 1/105, "Al-Muntakhab min Al-Ilal lil-Khallal" (49).

book_title: The Collection of Imam Ahmad's Sciences - Ills of Hadith
publisher: Dar Al-Falah for Scientific Research and Heritage Verification, Fayoum - Arab Republic of Egypt
text:
656 - What came regarding the virtue of Surah Al-Mulk and As-Sajdah.
The Hadith of Jabir (may Allah be pleased with him): He used not to sleep until he read {Alif Lam Mim Tanzil} (As-Sajdah) and {Tabarak Alladhi Biyadihi Al-Mulk} (Al-Mulk) (1).
Imam Ahmad said: Zuhair is sufficient for you if he brings you something; Zuhair is trustworthy. It was only Layth (2) who narrated it (3).

657 - What came regarding lightening the Quran for the Prophet of Allah, David (peace be upon him).
The Hadith of Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him): "The Quran was lightened for David, peace be upon him" (4).
Imam Ahmad said: This is a strange (Gharib) Hadith (5).
foot_note:
1. (1) Reported by Al-Hakim in "Al-Mustadrak" 2/412, he said: Ja'far bin Muhammad bin Nusayr Al-Khawwas narrated to us, Al-Harith bin Abi Usama narrated to us, Abu An-Nadr Hashim bin Al-Qasim narrated to us, Abu Khaythamah Zuhair bin Mu'awiyah narrated to us, he said: I said to Abu Az-Zubayr: Did you hear Jabir mention that the Prophet (peace be upon him)... The Hadith. So Abu Az-Zubayr said: Safwan, or Abu Safwan, narrated it to me.
2. Reported by At-Tirmidhi (2892), he said: Huraym bin Mis'ar At-Tirmidhi narrated to us, Al-Fudayl bin Iyad narrated to us, from Layth, from Abu Az-Zubayr, from Jabir, raised to the Prophet.
3. "Bahr ad-Dam" (319), "Tabaqat al-Hanabilah" 1/310.
4. Reported by Al-Bukhari (3417), he said: Abdullah bin Muhammad narrated to us, Abdur-Razzaq narrated to us, Ma'mar informed us, from Hammam, from Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him), from the Prophet (peace be upon him) who said: "The Quran was lightened for David, peace be upon him, so he would order his beasts to be saddled, and he would read the Quran before his beasts were saddled, and he would not eat except from the work of his hand."
5. "Al-Muntakhab min Al-Ilal lil-Khallal" (51). I say: Imam Ahmad (may Allah have mercy on him) describes the scroll of Ma'mar, from Hammam, from Abu Hurairah as containing...

book_title: The Collection of Imam Ahmad's Sciences - Ills of Hadith
publisher: Dar Al-Falah for Scientific Research and Heritage Verification, Fayoum - Arab Republic of Egypt
text:
658 - What came regarding what is permissible of reciting Quran and Remembrance (Dhikr) in prayer intending an answer or alert.
The Hadith of Ali (may Allah be pleased with him): He was in the Fajr prayer, and a man from the Kharijites called out to him {If you should associate [anything] with Allah, your work would surely become worthless} [Az-Zumar: 65]. So Ali (may Allah be pleased with him) answered him while in prayer {So be patient. Indeed, the promise of Allah is truth. And let them not disquiet you who are not certain} [Ar-Rum: 60] (1).
Imam Ahmad denied it (2).
foot_note:
1. ... denounced (Munkar) narrations. Al-Maymuni mentioned in "Al-Muntakhab min Al-Ilal lil-Khallal": Abu Abdullah mentioned that Ma'mar met Hammam - meaning Ibn Munabbih - as an old man during the days of Sudan, so he read to Ma'mar, then the Sheikh became weak, so Ma'mar read the rest to him, which are one hundred and forty Hadiths, containing strange things, among them... then he mentioned this Hadith. Adh-Dhahabi quoted in "As-Siyar" 5/312 the words of Imam Ahmad regarding the scroll, then said: If anyone had heard it from Hammam as Ma'mar lived after Abu Hurairah for seventy-some years, he would have lived until the year two hundred and something, and we have not seen anyone narrate the scroll from Hammam except Ma'mar, and everyone who lived after him for twenty-odd years. Al-Bukhari said: Ali said: I asked a man who met Hammam about his death, and he said: The year one hundred and thirty-two. Benefit: Hammam was not unique in narrating it from Abu Hurairah, for Al-Bukhari said after mentioning the Hadith: Musa bin Uqbah narrated it from Safwan, from Ata bin Yasar, from Abu Hurairah, and Al-Bukhari connected it in "Khalq Af'al al-Ibad".
1. Reported by Al-Bayhaqi 2/245, he said: Abu Abdullah Al-Hafiz informed us, Ali bin Hamshadh Al-Adl narrated to us, Muhammad bin Uthman bin Abi Shaybah narrated to us, Yahya bin Abdul-Hamid narrated to us, Sharik narrated to us, from Imran bin Zabyan, from Abu Yahya - meaning Hakim bin Sa'd who said... The Hadith.
2. "Masa'il Ishaq bin Mansur Al-Kawsuj" (3383).

book_title: The Collection of Imam Ahmad's Sciences - Ills of Hadith
publisher: Dar Al-Falah for Scientific Research and Heritage Verification, Fayoum - Arab Republic of Egypt
text:
659 - What came regarding the placing of the Quran in the Mushafs as script.
The Hadith of Jabir (may Allah be pleased with him): Indeed Allah, Mighty and Majestic, created the Quran as a creation, so He made it on tongues as memorization and in Mushafs as script (1).
Imam Ahmad said: A lie, a lie. And he denied it with the utmost denial (2).
foot_note:
1. (1) Ibn Qudamah mentioned in "Al-Muntakhab" from the path of a Sheikh, from Abu Nu'aym, from Sufyan, from Muhammad bin Al-Munkadir, from Jabir, his saying.
2. "Al-Muntakhab min Al-Ilal lil-Khallal" (174).

book_title: The Collection of Imam Ahmad's Sciences - Ills of Hadith
publisher: Dar Al-Falah for Scientific Research and Heritage Verification, Fayoum - Arab Republic of Egypt
text:
The Book of Tafsir (Exegesis)

660 - What came regarding His saying, Exalted is He: {They said, "Will You place therein one who will cause corruption therein?"} [Al-Baqarah: 30].
The Hadith of Ibn Umar (may Allah be pleased with them both): "When Adam was sent down to the earth, the angels said: O Lord, will You place therein one who will cause corruption therein?" (1).
Imam Ahmad said: This is Munkar (denounced) (2); it is only narrated from Ka'b (3).
foot_note:
1. (1) Reported by Ahmad 1/134, he said: Yahya bin Abi Bukair narrated to us, Zuhair bin Muhammad narrated to us, from Musa bin Jubayr, from Nafi' - the Mawla of Abdullah bin Umar - from Abdullah bin Umar that he heard the Prophet of Allah (peace be upon him) saying: "When Allah, Exalted is He, sent Adam (peace be upon him) down to the earth, the angels said: O Lord, will You place therein one who will cause corruption therein and shed blood, while we declare Your praise and sanctify You? He said: Indeed, I know that which you do not know. They said: Our Lord, we are more obedient to You than the sons of Adam. Allah the Exalted said to the angels: Bring forth two angels from the angels so that we may send them down to the earth and see how they act. They said: Our Lord, Harut and Marut. So they were sent down to the earth, and Al-Zuhrah (Venus) was presented to them as a woman of the most beautiful humans. So she came to them, and they asked her for herself. She said: No, by Allah, until you speak this word of idolatry. They said: By Allah, we will never associate anything with Allah. So she went away from them, then returned carrying a boy. They asked her for herself. She said: No, by Allah, until you kill this boy. They said: By Allah, we will never kill him. So she went away, then returned carrying a cup of wine. They asked her for herself. She said: No, by Allah, until you drink this wine. So they drank and became intoxicated, and fell upon her and killed the boy. When they sobered up, the woman said: By Allah, you have not left anything you refused me regarding except that you did it when you were intoxicated. So they were given a choice between the punishment of the world and the Hereafter, and they chose the punishment of the world."
2. "Al-Muntakhab min Al-Ilal lil-Khallal" (194).
3. Reported by Abdur-Razzaq in "At-Tafsir" 1/282, he said: Ath-Thawri narrated to us, from Musa bin Uqbah, from Salim, from Ibn Umar, from Ka'b, stopped at him (Mawquf).

book_title: The Collection of Imam Ahmad's Sciences - Ills of Hadith
publisher: Dar Al-Falah for Scientific Research and Heritage Verification, Fayoum - Arab Republic of Egypt
text:
661 - What came regarding His saying, Exalted is He: {And do not throw [yourselves] with your [own] hands into destruction} [Al-Baqarah: 195].
The Hadith of Ibn Abbas (may Allah be pleased with them both): Regarding His saying: {And do not throw [yourselves] with your [own] hands into destruction}, he said: Spending in the cause of Allah (1).
Muhanna said: I said to Ahmad: It reached me from Yahya bin Sa'id that he said: Sufyan told me: Al-Kalbi told me: Abu Salih told me: Everything I narrated to you is a lie.
So Ahmad said to me: Yahya bin Yaman said: Sufyan said: Al-Kalbi told me: Indeed, I found these books and looked into them.
I said to Ahmad: Did you hear it from Yahya bin Yaman?
He said: No, but it reached me from him. And Ahmad said: Abu Salih did not have anything of Musnad Hadith. Meaning: except a little thing.
I said: What thing?
So he mentioned this Hadith (2).
foot_note:
1. (1) Reported by At-Tabari 2/117, he said: Ibn Bashar narrated to us, he said: Yahya narrated to us, from Sufyan, from Mansur, from Abu Salih, from Ibn Abbas... so he mentioned it.
2. "Al-Muntakhab min Al-Ilal lil-Khallal" (60), "Ilal Abdullah" (2767).

book_title: The Collection of Imam Ahmad's Sciences - Ills of Hadith
publisher: Dar Al-Falah for Scientific Research and Heritage Verification, Fayoum - Arab Republic of Egypt
text: 662 - Interpretation of the saying of the Exalted: {So whoever has made Hajj obligatory upon himself therein [by entering the state of Ihram], there is [to be for him] no sexual relations (Rafath) and no disobedience and no disputing during Hajj} [Al-Baqarah: 197]. The Hadith of Ibn Abbas (may Allah be pleased with them both): That Ibn Abbas got down from his mount and began driving it while reciting: 'And they walk with us a gentle pace ... If the birds tell true, we shall make love to Lamis.' He mentioned intercourse while it was not about him. So I said: 'O Ibn Abbas, do you mention Rafath (sexual talk) while you are in Ihram?' He said: 'Rafath is only what is spoken to women regarding it [intercourse]' (1). Imam Ahmad said: They differ in its chain. Some say Awf, from Ziyad bin Husayn, from his father. And some say: Ziyad bin Husayn, from Abu Al-Aliyah (2).
foot_note:
1. (1) Reported by Sa'id bin Mansur in his "Sunan" 3/806 (345), he said: Hushaym narrated to us, he said: Awf narrated to us, from Ziyad bin Husayn, from his father, he said: Ibn Abbas dismounted... The Hadith.
2. "Masa'il Harb" p. 469.

book_title: The Collection of Imam Ahmad's Sciences - Ills of Hadith
publisher: Dar Al-Falah for Scientific Research and Heritage Verification, Fayoum - Arab Republic of Egypt
text: 663 - What came regarding the saying of the Exalted: {In the shadows of the clouds} [Al-Baqarah: 210]. The Hadith of Abdullah bin Mas'ud (may Allah be pleased with him): Allah the Exalted says: {In the shadows of the clouds} from the Throne to the Chair (Kursi) (1). Imam Ahmad said: This Hadith is Gharib (strange). We did not receive it from Muhammad bin Salamah, and he deemed it good. He said: Al-A'mash narrated it as Mawquf (stopped), and Abu Yazid Al-Dalani narrated it as Marfu' (raised). He said once: How good it is; we only heard it from Abu Awanah from Al-A'mash as Mursal (2).
foot_note:
1. (1) Reported by At-Tabarani 9/357-361, he said: Ali bin Abdul-Aziz narrated to us, Abu Ghassan narrated to us, Abdul-Salam bin Harb narrated to us, from Abu Khalid Al-Dalani, from Al-Minhal bin Amr, from Abu Ubaidah, from Masruq, from Abdullah bin Mas'ud, H. And Muhammad bin An-Nadr Al-Azdi, Abdullah bin Ahmad bin Hanbal, and Al-Hadrami narrated to us, they said: Isma'il bin Ubaid bin Abi Karima Al-Harrani narrated to us, Muhammad bin Salamah Al-Harrani narrated to us, from Abu Abdur-Rahim, from Zaid bin Abi Anisah, from Al-Minhal bin Amr, from Abu Ubaidah bin Abdullah, from Masruq bin Al-Ajda', Abdullah bin Mas'ud narrated to us, from the Prophet (peace be upon him) who said: "Allah will gather the first and the last for a known appointed time, standing for forty years, their eyes fixed staring at the sky, waiting for the separation of judgment..." The Hadith.
2. "Al-Muntakhab min Ilal Al-Khallal" (166).

book_title: The Collection of Imam Ahmad's Sciences - Ills of Hadith
publisher: Dar Al-Falah for Scientific Research and Heritage Verification, Fayoum - Arab Republic of Egypt
text: 664 - What came regarding the saying of the Exalted: {Look at its fruit when it yields} [Al-An'am: 99]. The Hadith of Al-Bara' bin Azib (may Allah be pleased with him) regarding His saying: {Look at its fruit when it yields} [Al-An'am: 99]. He said: Its ripening when it ripens (1). Imam Ahmad said: This is not from the Hadith of Abu Ishaq, this one eats [words/letters?]. As if he denied it from the Hadith of Ammar, that it is a delusion, and Ibrahim Al-Harawi narrated the Hadith to us (2). 665 - What came regarding the saying of the Exalted: {Say, "I do not find within that which was revealed to me [anything] forbidden..."} [Al-An'am: 145]. The Hadith of Ibn Abbas (may Allah be pleased with them both): When he was asked about the meat of domestic donkeys, he recited His saying: {Say, "I do not find within that which was revealed to me [anything] forbidden..."} (3). Imam Ahmad said: Hushaym did not hear it from Amr (4).
foot_note:
1. (1) Reported by Ibn Abi Hatim in "At-Tafsir" 4/1631, he said: Al-Hasan bin Arafah narrated to us, Ammar bin Muhammad narrated to us, from Sufyan Ath-Thawri, from Abu Ishaq, from Al-Bara', his saying.
2. "Al-Ilal" narration of Abdullah (5705).
3. I did not find it from the path of Hushaym, from Amr, from Jabir, from Ibn Abbas. But the Hadith is in Al-Bukhari (5529) from the path of Ali bin Abdullah, Sufyan narrated to us, Amr said: I said to Jabir bin Zaid: They claim that the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) forbade the meat of domestic donkeys. He said: Al-Hakam bin Amr Al-Ghifari used to say that among us in Basra, but that ocean [of knowledge] Ibn Abbas refused that and recited: {Say, "I do not find within that which was revealed to me [anything] forbidden..."} [Al-An'am: 145].
4. "Ilal Abdullah" (2177).

book_title: The Collection of Imam Ahmad's Sciences - Ills of Hadith
publisher: Dar Al-Falah for Scientific Research and Heritage Verification, Fayoum - Arab Republic of Egypt
text: 666 - What came regarding the interpretation of the saying of the Exalted: {Gardens of Eden (Adn)} [At-Tawbah: 73]. The Hadith of Abdullah bin Mas'ud (may Allah be pleased with him) as Mawquf: {Gardens of Eden}, he said: The center of Paradise (1). Imam Ahmad said: They differ regarding it. They say: From Abu Ad-Duha, from Masruq (2). 667 - What came in the chapter of the saying of the Exalted: {Abiding therein as long as the heavens and the earth endure, except as your Lord should will. Indeed, your Lord is an effecter of what He intends} [Hud: 107]. The Hadith of Abdullah bin Amr (may Allah be pleased with them both) as Mawquf: A time will surely come upon Hell when its doors will flap with no one in it, and that is after they have remained in it for ages (Ahqab) (3). Imam Ahmad said: If it has a basis that times will come upon Hell when there is no one in it, it refers to the place of the people of Monotheism (4).
foot_note:
1. (1) Reported by Abdur-Razzaq in "At-Tafsir" 2/235, he said: From Ibn Uyainah, from Al-A'mash, from Abdullah bin Murrah, from Masruq, from Abdullah.
2. "Masa'il Ibn Hani" (2234).
3. Reported by Ya'qub Al-Fasawi in his "Tarikh" 3/107: From the path of Bundar, from Abu Dawud, from Shu'bah, from Abu Balj, from Amr bin Maymun, from Abdullah bin Amr, his saying.
4. "Masa'il Harb" p. 430.

book_title: The Collection of Imam Ahmad's Sciences - Ills of Hadith
publisher: Dar Al-Falah for Scientific Research and Heritage Verification, Fayoum - Arab Republic of Egypt
text: 668 - What came regarding the saying of the Exalted: {And establish prayer at the two ends of the day} [Hud: 114]. The Hadith of Ibn Abbas (may Allah be pleased with them both): The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said to him: "Pray some Rak'ahs," so Allah (Mighty and Majestic) revealed: {And establish prayer at the two ends of the day and at the approach of the night. Indeed, good deeds do away with misdeeds} [Hud: 114] (1). Imam Ahmad said: I view this only as a liar, or a lie. And he denied it strongly (2). 669 - What came regarding the saying of the Exalted: {Indeed in that are signs for those who discern} [Al-Hijr: 75]. The Hadith of Abu Sa'id Al-Khudri (may Allah be pleased with him): "Beware the insight (Firasah) of the believer, for indeed he sees by the light of Allah," then he recited: {Indeed in that are signs for those who discern} (3).
foot_note:
1. (1) Reported by Al-Bayhaqi in "Shu'ab Al-Iman" 5/404, he said: Muhammad bin Al-Husain Al-Qattan informed us, Ali bin Abdur-Rahman bin Hani informed us, Ahmad bin Hazim bin Abi Gharzah narrated to us, Ubaidullah bin Musa informed us, from Ibn Uyainah, from Az-Zuhri, from Ubaidullah bin Abdullah bin Utbah, from Ibn Abbas, who said: A man from the companions of the Prophet (peace be upon him) desired a woman, and he was one day with the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him), so he asked the Prophet (peace be upon him) permission for a need, and he permitted him. So he went out on a rainy day, and behold there was a woman washing at a pool. When he saw her, he sat from her the sitting of a man from his wife and moved his penis, and behold it was limp. So he stood up regretting, and came to the Prophet (peace be upon him) and mentioned that to him... The Hadith.
2. "Ilal Abdullah" (2039), "Tarikh Baghdad" 14/304.
3. Reported by At-Tirmidhi (3127), he said: Muhammad bin Isma'il narrated to us, Ahmad bin Abi At-Tayyib narrated to us, Mus'ab bin Salam narrated to us, from Amr bin Qais, from Atiyyah, from Abu Sa'id Al-Khudri, raised (Marfu') with it.

book_title: The Collection of Imam Ahmad's Sciences - Ills of Hadith
publisher: Dar Al-Falah for Scientific Research and Heritage Verification, Fayoum - Arab Republic of Egypt
text: Imam Ahmad said after mentioning this Hadith: The Hadiths of Yusuf bin Suhayb were flipped on Mus'ab bin Salam; he made them from Az-Zabraqan As-Sarraj. And Ibn Abi Shaybah came and began discussing with him Hadiths from Shu'bah and Al-Hasan bin Umarah that were flipped on him (1). 670 - What came regarding His saying: {Sons and grandsons (Hafadah)} [An-Nahl: 72]. The Hadith of Abdullah bin Mas'ud (may Allah be pleased with him) as Mawquf: The Hafadah are the sons-in-law (2). Imam Ahmad said: Abu Mu'awiyah did not narrate anything from Aban bin Taghlib except one Hadith, the Hadith of Abdullah: The Hafadah: The sons-in-law (3). 671 - What came regarding {Dhul-Qarnayn} [Al-Kahf: 83]. The Hadith of Ibn Abbas (may Allah be pleased with them both) as Mawquf: That Abraham (peace be upon him) met Dhul-Qarnayn and shook his hand (4).
foot_note:
1. (1) "At-Tarikh Al-Kabir" by Al-Bukhari 7/354.
2. Reported by At-Tabari in his "Tafsir" 14/143, he said: Abu Kurayb narrated to us, from Abu Mu'awiyah, Aban bin Taghlib narrated to us, from Al-Minhal bin Amr, from Ibn Hubaysh, from Abdullah... The Hadith.
3. "Ilal Abdullah" (3558).
4. Reported by Bahshal in "Tarikh Wasit" 247, he said: Yusuf bin Ya'qub narrated to us, he said: Sa'id bin Mansur narrated to us, he said: Hushaym narrated to us, from Al-Fadl bin Atiyyah, from Ata, from Ibn Abbas, his saying...

book_title: The Collection of Imam Ahmad's Sciences - Ills of Hadith
publisher: Dar Al-Falah for Scientific Research and Heritage Verification, Fayoum - Arab Republic of Egypt
text: Imam Ahmad said: This is a Gharib (strange) Hadith. I do not think anyone heard the Hadith of Al-Fadl bin Atiyyah regarding Dhul-Qarnayn from Hushaym except a few people (1). 672 - What came regarding the saying of the Exalted: {And warn your closest kindred} [Ash-Shu'ara: 214]. The Hadith of Qabisah bin Mukhariq: When {And warn your closest kindred} [Ash-Shu'ara: 214] was revealed to the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him), the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) went to a pile of stones on a mountain, climbed to its top, then called out. Or he said: "O family of Abd Manaf, I am a warner. My likeness and your likeness is like a man who saw the enemy, so he went to scout for his family, calling out - or he said shouting - Ya Sabahah (O calamity of the morning)!" (2). Imam Ahmad said: Ibn Adi said: In this Hadith from Qabisah bin Mukhariq or Wahb bin Amr, and it is a mistake; it is only Zuhayr bin Amr. So when he erred, I abandoned Wahb bin Amr (3).
foot_note:
1. (1) "Masa'il Ibn Hani" (2203).
2. Reported by Ahmad in "Al-Musnad" 3/476, he said: Muhammad bin Abi Adi narrated to us, from Sulayman At-Taimi, from Abu Uthman An-Nahdi, from Qabisah bin Mukhariq, raised (Marfu') with it.
3. "Musnad Ahmad" 3/476, "Al-Ilal" narration of Abdullah (2883). I say: The text has an authentic witness, for Al-Bukhari reported it (4971) from the path of Ibn Abbas (may Allah be pleased with them both) who said: When {And warn your closest kindred} [Ash-Shu'ara: 214] was revealed...

book_title: The Collection of Imam Ahmad's Sciences - Ills of Hadith
publisher: Dar Al-Falah for Scientific Research and Heritage Verification, Fayoum - Arab Republic of Egypt
text: 673 - What came regarding the saying of the Exalted: {Whichever of the two terms I fulfill} [Al-Qasas: 28]. The Hadith of Abu Dharr (may Allah be pleased with him): "If you are asked which of the two terms Moses fulfilled, say: The better and more complete of them" (1). Imam Ahmad said when asked about Awbad? He said: I do not know his Hadith (2). 674 - What came regarding the saying of the Exalted: {Call them by [the names of] their fathers; it is more just in the sight of Allah} [Al-Ahzab: 5]. The Hadith of Ibn Umar: We only used to call Zaid bin Harithah "Zaid bin Muhammad" until {Call them by their fathers} was revealed in the Quran (3).
foot_note:
1. (1) Reported by At-Tabarani in "Al-Awsat" 5/478 (5430) and "As-Saghir" (815), he said: Muhammad bin Ja'far Ar-Razi - in Baghdad - narrated to us, he said: Al-Walid bin Shuja' Abu Al-Walid narrated to us, he said: Awbad bin Abi Imran Al-Jawni narrated to us, from his father, from Abdullah bin As-Samit, from Abu Dharr who said: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said to me... and in it: And if you are asked which of the two women he married, say: The younger of them, and she is the one who came and said: {O my father, hire him. Indeed, the best one you can hire is the strong and the trustworthy} [Al-Qasas: 26]. He said: What did you see of his strength? She said: He took a heavy stone and threw it from the well. He said: And what did you see of his trustworthiness? She said: He said: Walk behind me and do not walk in front of me.
2. "Masa'il Ibn Hani" (2370).
3. Reported by Al-Bukhari (4504), he said: Mu'alla bin Asad narrated to us, Abdul-Aziz bin Al-Mukhtar narrated to us, Musa bin Uqbah narrated to us, he said: Salim narrated to me, from Abdullah bin Umar... The Hadith. And reported by Muslim (2425), he said: Qutaibah bin Sa'id narrated to us, Ya'qub bin Abdur-Rahman Al-Qari narrated to us, from Musa bin Uqbah with it.

book_title: The Collection of Imam Ahmad's Sciences - Ills of Hadith
publisher: Dar Al-Falah for Scientific Research and Heritage Verification, Fayoum - Arab Republic of Egypt
text: Imam Ahmad said: From Nafi' is Munkar (denounced); it is only from Salim (1). 675 - What came regarding the saying of the Exalted: {Has he made the gods [all] one God?} [Sad: 5]. The Hadith of Ibn Abbas: Abu Talib fell sick, so Quraysh came to him, and the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) came to visit him (2). Imam Ahmad mentioned the disagreement regarding this Hadith, so he said: Yahya bin Sa'id said: From Sufyan, from Al-A'mash, from Yahya bin Umarah, from Sa'id bin Jubayr, from Ibn Abbas. And Abu Usamah said: Al-A'mash narrated to us, he said: Abbad narrated to us, from Sa'id bin Jubayr, from Ibn Abbas. And Al-Ashja'i said: From Sufyan, from Al-A'mash, from Yahya bin Abbad - Abu Hubayrah. So it was said to him: Who is correct? He said: I do not know (3).
foot_note:
1. (1) "Su'alat Al-Athram" (6).
2. Reported by Ahmad 1/227, he said: Yahya narrated to us, from Sufyan, Sulayman - meaning Al-A'mash - narrated to me, from Yahya bin Umarah, from Sa'id bin Jubayr, from Ibn Abbas who said: Abu Talib fell sick, so Quraysh came to him, and the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) came to visit him. At his head was a seat for a man, so Abu Jahl stood up and sat in it. They said: Indeed your nephew insults our gods. He said: What is the matter with your people complaining about you? He said: "O Uncle, I want them [to agree] on one word by which the Arabs will submit to them and the non-Arabs will pay them Jizyah." He said: What is it? He said: "There is no deity but Allah." So they stood up and said: {Has he made the gods [all] one God?} [Sad: 5]. He said: And there was revealed: {Sad. By the Qur'an containing reminder} [Sad: 1], and he recited until he reached: {Indeed, this is a curious thing} [Sad: 5]. Abdullah bin Ahmad said: My father said: And Abu Usamah narrated to us, Al-A'mash narrated to us, Abbad narrated to us, so he mentioned similar to it. And my father said: Al-Ashja'i said: Yahya bin Abbad.
3. "Ilal Ahmad" narration of Abdullah (586), "Musnad Ahmad" 1/227-228.

text: 676 - Chapter of the saying of the Exalted: {Until, when terror is removed from their hearts, they will say, "What has your Lord said?" They will say, "The Truth." And He is the Most High, the Grand} [Saba: 23]. The Hadith of Ibn Mas'ud (may Allah be pleased with him): "When Allah speaks via Revelation, the inhabitants of the heavens hear a clatter from the sky" (1). Imam Ahmad said: This is not from Mansur, and this is only known from Al-A'mash (2). 677 - What came regarding the saying of the Exalted: {And that the transgressors are the companions of the Fire} [Ghafir: 43]. The Hadith of Ibn Mas'ud (may Allah be pleased with him): {And that the transgressors are the companions of the Fire}, he said: The shedders of blood (3). Imam Ahmad said: There is nothing of this. He denies it from Qabisah (4).
foot_note:
1. (1) Reported by Abu Dawud (4738) from the path of Abu Mu'awiyah, Al-A'mash narrated to us, from Muslim, from Masruq, from Abdullah who said: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: "When Allah speaks via Revelation, the inhabitants of the heavens hear a clatter from the sky like the dragging of a chain on a smooth rock, so they fall unconscious. They do not cease to be like that until Gabriel comes to them. When Gabriel comes to them, the terror is removed from their hearts. He said: Then they say: O Gabriel, what did your Lord say? He says: The Truth. So they say: The Truth, The Truth."
2. "Tarikh Baghdad" 9/127-128. I say: And the text has an authentic witness, for Al-Bukhari reported it (4701) from the Hadith of Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him).

text: 678 - What came regarding the saying of the Exalted: {It is Allah who has created seven heavens and of the earth, the like of them} [At-Talaq: 12]. The Hadith of Ibn Abbas (may Allah be pleased with them both) said: Seven earths, in every earth is a Prophet like your Prophet, and an Adam like Adam, a Noah like Noah, an Abraham like Abraham, and a Jesus like Jesus (1). Imam Ahmad said: This is Shu'bah, from Amr bin Murrah, from Abu Ad-Duha, from Ibn Abbas, who does not mention this; he only says: The Knowledge and Command descend between them. And Ata bin As-Sa'ib became confused, and Abu Abdullah denied the Hadith (2). And he said once: This Hadith is nothing, Ibn As-Sa'ib became confused; it contains nothing of 'Adam like Adam' nor 'a Prophet like your Prophet' (3). 679 - What came regarding the saying of the Exalted: {And fruit and grass (Abba)} [Abasa: 31]. The Hadith of Umar (may Allah be pleased with him): So leave it to its Creator (4).

text: Imam Ahmad said: This is a lie. Al-Walid bin Muslim narrated to us twice, it is not like this; rather it is: 'Leave it to its Knower' (1). And he said once when it was said to him: That Abbas Hajawi said when he narrated it in Al-Askar: I said to Ali bin Al-Madini: They have denied it from you? So he said: I narrated it to you in Basra, and mentioned that Al-Walid erred in it. So Abu Abdullah got angry and said: Yes, he knew - meaning: Ali bin Al-Madini - that Al-Walid erred in it, so why did he want to narrate it to them? Giving them the mistake?! And Abu Abdullah called him a liar (2). 680 - What came regarding the saying of the Exalted: {And [by] the witness and what is witnessed} [Al-Buruj: 3]. The Hadith of Abu Hurairah: The saying of the Exalted: {And [by] the witness and what is witnessed} [Al-Buruj: 3]. He said: Meaning: The witness is the Day of Arafah, and the Promised is the Day of Resurrection (3). Imam Ahmad said: As for Ali, he raised it: That the Prophet (peace be upon him), and as for Yunus, he did not go beyond Abu Hurairah saying it (4).

text: Chapters on Letters and Recitations. 681 - What came regarding the reading of the saying of the Exalted: {Indeed, he is an act not righteous} [Hud: 46]. The Hadith of Asma bint Yazid (may Allah be pleased with her): I heard the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) recite: {Indeed, he is an act not righteous} (1). Imam Ahmad said when it was said to him: That Rawh Al-Muqri' claimed that Asma is Umm Salamah (2), so Ahmad denied that and said: Hammad and Harun differed in this Hadith (3). 682 - What came regarding the reading of the saying of the Exalted: {He thinks that his wealth will make him immortal} [Al-Humazah: 3]. The Hadith of Jabir: I saw the Prophet (peace be upon him) reading "{He thinks that his wealth will make him immortal}" [Al-Humazah: 3] (4). Imam Ahmad said: Munkar (5).

text: The Book of Medicine. 683 - What came regarding Ruqyahs and medicines. There are two Hadiths in it: The First: The Hadith of Abu Khuzamah from his father: Do you see medicine we treat ourselves with, Ruqyahs we use, and protection we guard ourselves with, do they turn back anything from the Decree (Qadar) of Allah, Blessed and Exalted? He said: "They are from the Decree of Allah, Blessed and Exalted" (1). Imam Ahmad said: After mentioning the difference in this Hadith (2): Abu Khuzamah from his father is the correct one; this is what Az-Zubaidi said (3). The Second: The Hadith of Ka'b as Mawquf: Allah the Exalted says: I wound and I heal (4). Imam Ahmad said: Yahya bin Adam erred a grave error, he said: I bewitch and I heal (5).
foot_note:
1. (1) Reported by Ahmad 3/421, he said: Sufyan bin Uyainah narrated to us, from Az-Zuhri, from Ibn Abi Khuzamah, from his father, who said: I said: O Messenger of Allah... The Hadith.
2. Imam Ahmad mentioned the difference in "Al-Musnad" regarding Az-Zuhri. Sometimes Az-Zubaidi from him, from Abu Khuzamah, from his father; and sometimes Amr from him, from Abu Khuzamah, from his father; and sometimes Sufyan from him, from Abu Khuzamah, from his father.
3. "Musnad Ahmad" 3/421.
4. Reported by Ibn Abi Shaybah in his "Musannaf" 5/32, he said: Mu'tamir narrated to us, from Ibn Al-Mubarak, from Khalid, from Abu Qilabah, from Ka'b... with the wording: I make healthy and I heal.
5. "Ilal Abdullah" (4730).

text: 684 - What came regarding seeking healing with the Quran. The Hadith of Ibn Mas'ud (may Allah be pleased with him): While I and the Prophet (peace be upon him) were in some roads of Medina, suddenly there was a man having a seizure, so I approached him and recited in his ear (1). Imam Ahmad said: This Hadith is fabricated (Mawdu'), this is the Hadith of liars, denounced Isnad (2). 685 - What came regarding cauterization (Kayy). The Hadith of Anas (may Allah be pleased with him): That the Prophet (peace be upon him) cauterized As'ad bin Zurarah for a pustule/sting (3). Imam Ahmad said: This is false (Batil). It is only the Hadith of Az-Zuhri, from Sahl bin Abi Umamah, from As'ad bin Sahl bin Hunaif (4).
foot_note:
1. (1) Reported by Abdullah bin Ahmad in "Al-Ilal" (5979) and through his path by Al-Uqayli in "Ad-Du'afa" 2/163, he said: Abdullah bin Ahmad bin Hanbal narrated to us, he said: I told my father a Hadith, Khalid bin Ibrahim - Abu Muhammad the Muezzin - narrated to us, he said: Salam bin Razin - the judge of Antakya - narrated to us, he said: Al-A'mash narrated to us, from Shaqiq, from Ibn Mas'ud who said: While I and the Prophet (peace be upon him) were in some roads of Medina, suddenly there was a man having a seizure, so I approached him and recited in his ear, so he sat up straight. The Prophet (peace be upon him) said: "What did you recite in his ear, O son of Umm Abd?" I said: May my father and mother be sacrificed for you, I recited: {Then did you think that We created you uselessly and that to Us you would not be returned?} [Al-Mu'minun: 115]. The Prophet (peace be upon him) said: "By the One who sent me with the truth, if a person with certainty recited it upon a mountain, it would vanish."
2. "Ilal Abdullah" (5979), "Ad-Du'afa" by Al-Uqayli 2/163, "Al-Mawdu'at" by Ibn al-Jawzi 3/211, "Mizan al-I'tidal" 2/365.

text: 686 - What came regarding leprosy (Judham). There are three Hadiths in it: The First: The Hadith of Aisha (may Allah be pleased with her): "Hair in the nose is safety from leprosy" (1). Imam Ahmad said: There is nothing of this [authentic] (2). The Second: The Hadith of Ash-Sharid bin Suwayd (may Allah be pleased with him): There was a leper man in the delegation of Thaqif, so the Prophet (peace be upon him) sent word to him: "Go back, for I have accepted your allegiance" (3). Imam Ahmad said: Hushaym collected it from Ya'la from a man from the family of Ash-Sharid (4), and if he did not mention a report, he said: From Amr bin Ash-Sharid (5). The Third: The Hadith of Ibn Abbas (may Allah be pleased with them both): The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) forbade using reeds

text: 688 - What came regarding cupping (Hijama). There are four Hadiths in it: The First: The Hadith of Ali bin Abi Talib (may Allah be pleased with him): "If blood becomes agitated in one of you, let him spill it, even with an arrowhead" (1). Imam Ahmad said when asked about this Hadith: It contains Muhammad bin Al-Qasim who lies; his Hadiths are fabricated Hadiths, he is nothing (2). The Second: The Hadith of Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him): "Whoever gets cupped on the seventeenth, nineteenth, and twenty-first, it is a cure for every disease" (3). Imam Ahmad said: This is nothing (4). The Third: The Hadith of Anas (may Allah be pleased with him): That the Prophet (peace be upon him) used to get cupped three times on the two jugular veins and the upper back, and he used to get cupped on the seventeenth, nineteenth, and twenty-first (5).

The Hadith.
2. "Al-Ilal" by Abdullah bin Ahmad (1899), Ibn Adi in "Al-Kamil" 7/491, "Ad-Du'afa by Al-Uqayli" 4/126, "Tahdhib al-Tahdhib" 3/678, "Mizan al-I'tidal" 5/136.
3. Reported by Abu Dawud (3861), he said: Abu Tawbah Ar-Rabi' bin Nafi' narrated to us, Sa'id bin Abdur-Rahman Al-Jumahi narrated to us, from Sahl, from his father, from Abu Hurairah, raised (Marfu') with it.
4. "Masa'il Abi Dawud" (1931).
5. Reported by At-Tirmidhi (2051), he said: Abdul-Quddus bin Muhammad narrated to us, Amr bin Asim narrated to us, Hammam and Jarir bin Hazim narrated to us, they said: Qatada narrated to us, from Anas, raised (Marfu') with it.

The Fourth: The Hadith of Az-Zuhri: "Whoever gets cupped on Wednesday or Saturday and is afflicted with leprosy (Wadah), let him blame no one but himself" (2). Imam Ahmad said: When asked about cupping on Saturday, he said: I prefer that it be avoided, due to the Hadith of Az-Zuhri, even though it is Mursal. Hajjaj (3) bin Artah used to narrate a concession regarding it, a Hadith that has no Isnad (4).

Benefit: Al-Hafiz said in "Al-Fath" 10/157-158 with modification: And Hadiths were reported regarding the times suitable for cupping which have nothing fitting the condition of Al-Bukhari, so it is as if he indicated - meaning: in the chapter: Which hour to cup, and he mentioned the Hadith that the Prophet (peace be upon him) was cupped while fasting - that it is done when needed and is not restricted to one time over another. Physicians hold that the most beneficial cupping is what occurs in the second or third hour, and that it should not occur after evacuation from intercourse, bath, or otherwise, nor after satiety or hunger. Then he quoted from Ahmad that he used to get cupped at any time the blood became agitated and at any hour it was. Al-Hafiz said: Physicians have agreed that cupping is [best] in its [the month's] beginning and end. I say: Among those who weakened the mentioned Hadiths regarding the time of cupping are Al-Uqayli in "Ad-Du'afa" and Abu Zur'ah Ar-Razi, and they said: Nothing is established regarding it.

text:
The Book of Clothing and Adornment

689 - What came regarding what a man says when he wears a new garment.
The Hadith of Ibn Umar (may Allah be pleased with them both): "Wear new, live praiseworthily, and die a martyr" (1).
Imam Ahmad said: He used to narrate this from his memory, and it was not in the books. Meaning: Abdur-Razzaq (2).
And he said once: Munkar (denounced). And the Hadith of Abu Al-Ashhab was with him - meaning: Abdur-Razzaq from Sufyan - and he used to make mistakes in it, saying: From Asim bin Ubaidullah from Abu Al-Ashhab (3).
foot_note:
1. (1) Reported by Ahmad 2/89, he said: Abdur-Razzaq narrated to us, Ma'mar narrated to us, from Az-Zuhri, from Salim, from Ibn Umar, who said: The Prophet (peace be upon him) saw a white garment on Umar, so he said: "Is your garment new or washed?" He said: I do not know what he replied to him. So the Prophet (peace be upon him) said: ... The Hadith.
2. "Sharh Ilal At-Tirmidhi" by Ibn Rajab (323), "Masa'il Abi Dawud" (2004).
3. "Masa'il Abi Dawud" (2004).

text:
690 - What came regarding the prohibition of women imitating men in clothing.
The Hadith of Aisha (may Allah be pleased with her): The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) cursed the masculine woman (Al-Rajulah) among women (1).
Imam Ahmad said: Hajjaj Al-A'war narrated it from Ibn Jurayj with another chain of narration, and it is not from Ibn Abi Mulaykah (2).

691 - What came regarding wearing the Mirt (a type of garment).
The Hadith of Aisha (may Allah be pleased with her): The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) went out one morning wearing a Mirt of black hair (3).
Imam Ahmad said: This is a Munkar (denounced) Hadith (4).
foot_note:
1. (1) Reported by Abu Dawud (4099), he said: Muhammad bin Sulayman Luwayn narrated to us - and some of it was read to him - from Sufyan, from Ibn Jurayj, from Ibn Abi Mulaykah, who said: It was said to Aisha (may Allah be pleased with her): Indeed a woman wears sandals. She said... The Hadith.
2. "Ilal Abdullah" (5265). I say: And the text has an authentic witness; Al-Bukhari reported (5885) from the Hadith of Ibn Abbas (may Allah be pleased with them both) who said: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) cursed men who imitate women and women who imitate men.
3. Reported by Al-Hakim in "Al-Mustadrak" 4/188, he said: Muhammad bin Salih bin Hani narrated to me, Yahya bin Muhammad bin Yahya narrated to us, Musaddad narrated to us, Yahya bin Zakariya bin Abi Za'idah narrated to us, my father informed me, from Mus'ab bin Shaybah, from Safiyyah bint Shaybah, from Aisha, raised (Marfu') with it.
4. Al-Uqayli in "Ad-Du'afa" 4/197.

text:
692 - What came regarding wearing wool.
The Hadith of Ibn Mas'ud (may Allah be pleased with him): "Allah spoke to Moses while he was wearing a woolen Jubbah (cloak)" (1).
Imam Ahmad said: Munkar, not authentic. The Hadiths of Humaid from Abdullah bin Al-Harith are Munkar (2).

693 - What came regarding wearing velvet (Qatifah).
The Hadith of Imran bin Husain (may Allah be pleased with him): I saw the Prophet (peace be upon him) - I think he said: riding - and under him - or: upon him - was a velvet garment from the land of Al-Jazirah (3).
Imam Ahmad denied it. It was said to him: Do you think it is a delusion (Wahm)? He said: It should be so. Later he said: I knew that I had thought about that Hadith, and Al-Batti used to do such-and-such, and say: Thus saw Al-Batti. And I used to write it, so he would look at me when I wrote it and it would please him. So I think this one wrote this chain of narration.
foot_note:
1. (1) Reported by At-Tirmidhi (1734), he said: Ali bin Hujr narrated to us, Khalaf bin Khalifah narrated to us, from Humaid Al-A'raj, from Abdullah bin Al-Harith, from Ibn Mas'ud, from the Prophet (peace be upon him) who said: "On the day his Lord spoke to him, Moses was wearing a woolen garment, a woolen Jubbah, a woolen cap, woolen trousers, and his sandals were from the skin of a dead donkey."
2. "Al-Muntakhab min Ilal Al-Khallal" by Ibn Qudamah (165).
3. Mentioned by Al-Khatib in "Tarikh Baghdad" 2/80 from the path of Abdul-Wahhab Ath-Thaqafi, from Ayyub, from Abu Qilabah, from Abu Al-Muhallab, from Imran bin Husain, raised (Marfu') with it.

book_title: The Collection of Imam Ahmad's Sciences - Ills of Hadith
publisher: Dar Al-Falah for Scientific Research and Heritage Verification, Fayoum - Arab Republic of Egypt
text:
And Ath-Thaqafi said following this chain: I saw Al-Batti wearing a velvet garment from the land of Al-Jazirah. So if it was in the Hadith: 'I saw the Prophet', he intended to say 'I saw Al-Batti' but erred and said: 'The Prophet'. He said: So I informed Muhammad bin Aban of this, and he retracted the Hadith and said: Strike it out (1).

694 - What came regarding the one who used to wrap (the turban) with one turn (Kawr).
The Hadith of Sulayman bin Abi Abdullah who said: I reached the first Muhajirun wrapping turbans of Karabis (cotton cloth), black, white, red, green, and yellow. One of them would place the turban on his head, place the Qalansuwwah (cap) over it, then wrap the turban like this. Meaning: on its fold (Kawr) (2).
Imam Ahmad was asked about this Hadith, so he expressed displeasure (said: Uff) and said: I do not know what it is (3).

695 - What came regarding letting the turban hang between the shoulders (Sadl).
The Hadith of Ibn Umar (may Allah be pleased with them both): When the Prophet (peace be upon him) wore a turban, he would let his turban hang between his shoulders (4).
foot_note:
1. (1) "Tarikh Baghdad" 2/80.
2. Reported by Ibn Abi Shaybah in "Al-Musannaf" 5/181, he said: Sulayman bin Harb narrated to us, he said: Jarir bin Hazim narrated to us, from Ya'la bin Hakim, from Sulayman bin Abi Abdullah... The Hadith.
3. "Masa'il Ishaq Al-Kawsuj" (3401).
4. Reported by At-Tirmidhi (1736), he said: Harun bin Ishaq Al-Hamdani narrated to us, Yahya bin Muhammad Al-Madani narrated to us, from Abdul-Aziz bin Muhammad, from Ubaidullah bin Umar, from Nafi', from Ibn Umar, raised (Marfu') with it.

book_title: The Collection of Imam Ahmad's Sciences - Ills of Hadith
publisher: Dar Al-Falah for Scientific Research and Heritage Verification, Fayoum - Arab Republic of Egypt
text:
Imam Ahmad denied it and said: This is only Mawquf (stopped at the Companion) (1).

696 - What came regarding honoring the hair.
The Hadith of Jabir bin Abdullah (may Allah be pleased with them both): "Does this one not find something with which to calm his hair?" And he saw another man with dirty clothes, so he said: "Does this one not find water with which to wash his garment?" (2).
Imam Ahmad said: I do not deny it as a Hadith! No one narrates it - meaning: from Ibn Al-Munkadir - other than Hassan. Imam Ahmad said: Ibn Al-Munkadir was a righteous man, and he was known for [narrating from] Jabir; like Thabit from Anas. And he used to narrate from Yazid Ar-Raqashi, so perhaps he narrated something as Mursal and they attributed it to Jabir (3).
foot_note:
1. (1) Al-Uqayli in "Ad-Du'afa" 3/21, "Siyar A'lam al-Nubala" 8/367. I say: And the text has an authentic witness; Muslim reported it (1359) from the path of Amr bin Huraith, from his father, who said: As if I am looking at the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) on the pulpit wearing a black turban, having let its two ends hang between his shoulders. And Abu Bakr did not say: on the pulpit.
2. Reported by Abu Dawud (4062), he said: An-Nufaili narrated to us, Miskin narrated to us, from Al-Awza'i, H. And Uthman bin Abi Shaybah narrated to us, from Waki', from Al-Awza'i similar to it, from Hassan bin Atiyyah, from Muhammad bin Al-Munkadir, from Jabir bin Abdullah, who said: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) came to us and saw a disheveled man whose hair was scattered, so he said... The Hadith.
3. "Masa'il Abi Dawud" (1913).

book_title: The Collection of Imam Ahmad's Sciences - Ills of Hadith
publisher: Dar Al-Falah for Scientific Research and Heritage Verification, Fayoum - Arab Republic of Egypt
text:
697 - What came regarding parting the hair.
The Hadith of Anas (may Allah be pleased with him) that the Prophet (peace be upon him) let his forelock hang (Sadl) as long as Allah willed for him to let it hang, then he parted it afterwards (1).
Imam Ahmad said: This is a mistake; it is only (2) from Ibn Abbas (3).

698 - What came regarding the dislike of Al-Qaza' (shaving part of the head and leaving part).
The Hadith of Ibn Umar (may Allah be pleased with them both): The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) forbade Al-Qaza' (4).
Imam Ahmad said: I have not heard anyone narrate from Umar bin Nafi' except this Sheikh - meaning: Uthman bin Uthman - (5).
foot_note:
1. (1) Reported by Malik in "Al-Muwatta" (722). He said: Ziyad bin Sa'id narrated to us, from Az-Zuhri, from Anas, raised (Marfu') with it.
2. Reported by Al-Bukhari (5917), he said: Ahmad bin Yunus narrated to us, Ibrahim bin Sa'd narrated to us, Ibn Shihab narrated to us, from Ubaidullah bin Abdullah, from Ibn Abbas (may Allah be pleased with them both), who said: The Prophet (peace be upon him) used to like agreeing with the People of the Book in what he was not commanded otherwise. The People of the Book used to let their hair hang (Sadl), and the polytheists used to part their heads... The Hadith.
3. "At-Tamhid" by Ibn Abd al-Barr 6/71.
4. Reported by Muslim (2120), he said: Muhammad bin Al-Muthanna narrated to me, Uthman bin Uthman Al-Ghatafani narrated to us, Umar bin Nafi' narrated to us, H. And Umayyah bin Bistam narrated to me, Abu Ja'far Ad-Darimi narrated to us, Abu An-Nu'man narrated to us, Hammad bin Zaid narrated to us, from Abdur-Rahman As-Sarraj, all of them from Nafi', from Ibn Umar, raised (Marfu') with it.
5. "Al-Wuquf wat-Tarajjul" from "Al-Jami' lil-Khallal" (151). I say: This Sheikh - meaning: Uthman bin Uthman - Muslim narrated this Hadith for him, supported by Rawh bin Ubadah. And Al-Bukhari and Muslim narrated it from a group, from Umar bin Nafi', so the Hadith is established and authentic, if Allah wills.

book_title: The Collection of Imam Ahmad's Sciences - Ills of Hadith
publisher: Dar Al-Falah for Scientific Research and Heritage Verification, Fayoum - Arab Republic of Egypt
text:
699 - What came regarding the mustache.
The Hadith of Ibn Umar (may Allah be pleased with them both): "Let the beards grow and trim the mustaches closely" (1).
Imam Ahmad said: This is strange (Gharib) (2).
And he said once: A person debated me once - and I think he said from the people of Medina - he said: It is not "Ahfu Ash-Shawarib" (Trim the mustaches closely), but rather it is "Haffu" without Alif. He said: So I looked in my book; and behold, it is in two places with Alif affirmed: "Ahfu".

700 - What came regarding shaving the back of the neck (Qafa).
Imam Ahmad said: I do not know of any Hadith regarding shaving the back of the neck except what is narrated from Ibrahim that he disliked Firdabzakush (shaving the back of the neck?) (3).
foot_note:
1. (1) Reported by Al-Bukhari (5892), he said: Muhammad bin Minhal narrated to us, Yazid bin Zurai' narrated to us, Umar bin Muhammad bin Zaid narrated to us, from Nafi', from Ibn Umar, from the Prophet (peace be upon him) who said: "Differ from the polytheists: let the beards grow plentifully and trim the mustaches closely."
2. "Al-Wuquf wat-Tarajjul" from "Al-Jami' lil-Khallal" (127).
3. "Masa'il Ishaq bin Mansur Al-Kawsuj" (3419), "Al-Wara'" 104, "Al-Wuquf wat-Tarajjul" 125.

book_title: The Collection of Imam Ahmad's Sciences - Ills of Hadith
publisher: Dar Al-Falah for Scientific Research and Heritage Verification, Fayoum - Arab Republic of Egypt
text:
701 - What came regarding the time limit for trimming nails, plucking armpit hair, and shaving pubic hair.
The Hadith of Anas bin Malik (may Allah be pleased with him): A time limit was set for us regarding trimming the mustache, cutting the nails, plucking the armpit hair, and shaving the pubic hair, that they should not be left for more than forty nights (1).
Imam Ahmad said when asked about the time limit for shaving pubic hair and plucking armpit hair: It is not established (2).
And he said once: We have heard a Hadith regarding it, I do not know how we can establish it. He said: Shu'bah used to deny it. Meaning: the Hadith of Abu Imran Al-Jawni from Anas: A time limit was set for us (3).
And he said once when asked about Sadaqah bin Musa Ad-Daqiqi (4). He said: He has a Munkar (denounced) Hadith. It was said to him: Is it not him? He said: He narrates from Imran Al-Jawni, from Anas: A time limit was set for us regarding shaving pubic hair and plucking armpit hair. It was said to him: Is this Munkar?
foot_note:
1. (1) Reported by Muslim (258), he said: Yahya bin Yahya and Qutaibah bin Sa'id narrated to us, both from Ja'far. Yahya said: Ja'far bin Sulayman informed us, from Abu Imran Al-Jawni, from Anas: A time limit was set for us regarding trimming the mustache... The Hadith.
2. "Al-Wuquf wat-Tarajjul" from "Al-Jami' lil-Khallal" 143.
3. Previous source.
4. Reported by Abu Dawud (4250), he said: Muslim bin Ibrahim narrated to us, Sadaqah Ad-Daqiqi narrated to us, Abu Imran Al-Jawni narrated to us, from Anas bin Malik, who said: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) set a time limit for us... The Hadith.

book_title: The Collection of Imam Ahmad's Sciences - Ills of Hadith
publisher: Dar Al-Falah for Scientific Research and Heritage Verification, Fayoum - Arab Republic of Egypt
text: He said: Yes, Shu'bah used to deny this Hadith (1). And he said once: When asked about the Hadith of Ja'far bin Sulayman Ad-Dub'i, from Abu Imran Al-Jawni, from Anas who said: A time limit of forty days was set for us regarding shaving pubic hair (2). He said: Sadaqah bin Musa Ad-Daqiqi narrates it from Abu Imran Al-Jawni, from Anas, raising it to the Prophet (peace be upon him). It was said to him: What do you say about this Hadith? He said: Shu'bah used to deny it. It was said to him: What is the meaning of 'Shu'bah denies it'? He said: He says: It has no basis. And he said: These two men have narrated it: Ja'far bin Sulayman and Sadaqah bin Musa Ad-Daqiqi. So he wondered at Shu'bah's saying: This Hadith has no basis (3). And he said once: It is more pleasing to me that it be acted upon (4).
foot_note:
1. (1) "Al-Wuquf wat-Tarajjul" 143.
2. Its referencing preceded.
3. "Al-Wuquf wat-Tarajjul" 143.
4. "Al-Wuquf wat-Tarajjul" 144. I say: Imam Ahmad's statement in his follow-up on Shu'bah does not mean authenticating the Hadith; rather, he maintains his view - meaning: Ahmad - that no Hadith is established regarding the time limit, but he sees acting upon it, and Allah knows best.

book_title: The Collection of Imam Ahmad's Sciences - Ills of Hadith
publisher: Dar Al-Falah for Scientific Research and Heritage Verification, Fayoum - Arab Republic of Egypt
text:
702 - What came regarding lengthening fingernails and the prohibition of that.
The Hadith of Abu Ayyub Al-Ansari (may Allah be pleased with him): "One of you asks about the news of the heavens, while he leaves his nails like the nails of birds, in which Janabah (impurity), filth, and dirt gather" (1).
Imam Ahmad said: Waki's tongue slips. He said: I met Abu Ayyub Al-Ansari, but it is only Abu Ayyub Al-Ataki (2).

703 - What came regarding applying paste (for hair removal) to the pubic area.
The Hadith of Ibrahim An-Nakha'i that the Prophet (peace be upon him), when he applied paste, would attend to his own pubic area with his hand (3).
Imam Ahmad said: Hushaym did not hear anything from Layth Abu Al-Musharraf (4).
foot_note:
1. (1) Reported by Ahmad 5/417, he said: Waki' narrated to us, Quraysh bin Hayyan narrated to us, from Abu Wasil, who said: I met Abu Ayyub Al-Ansari, so he shook my hand, and he saw length in my nails, so he said: The Messenger of Allah said... The Hadith.
2. "Musnad Ahmad" 5/417.
3. Reported by Ibn Abi Shaybah in "Al-Musannaf" 1/111, he said: Hushaym and Sharik narrated to us, from Layth Abu Al-Musharraf, from Abu Ma'shar, from Ibrahim, who said: The Prophet (peace be upon him) was... The Hadith.
4. "Ilal Abdullah" (2236).

book_title: The Collection of Imam Ahmad's Sciences - Ills of Hadith
publisher: Dar Al-Falah for Scientific Research and Heritage Verification, Fayoum - Arab Republic of Egypt
text:
704 - What came regarding applying Kohl an odd number of times.
The Hadith of Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him): "Whoever applies Kohl, let him do it an odd number of times. Whoever does so has done well, and whoever does not, there is no harm" (1).
Imam Ahmad said: It has no Isnad (chain of narration) (2).

705 - What came regarding swords and their ornamentation.
The Hadith of Anas (may Allah be pleased with him): The pommel of the sword of the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) was of silver (3).
Imam Ahmad denied it (4). And he said once: Abu Juzi said: He lied, by Allah, Qatada did not narrate to us except from Sa'id bin Abi Al-Hasan. My father said: And it is the saying of Abu Juzi, and Jarir erred (5). And he said once: Mursal (6).
foot_note:
1. (1) Reported by Abu Dawud (35), he said: Ibrahim bin Musa Ar-Razi narrated to us, Isa bin Yunus informed us, from Thawr, from Al-Husain Al-Hibrani, from Abu Sa'id, from Abu Hurairah, from the Prophet (peace be upon him)... The Hadith.
2. "Masa'il Ishaq bin Mansur Al-Kawsuj" (3506). Benefit: It has no Isnad - meaning: an authentic Isnad - and Allah knows best.
3. Reported by At-Tirmidhi (1691), he said: Muhammad bin Bashar narrated to us, Wahb bin Jarir bin Hazim narrated to us, my father narrated to us, from Qatada, from Anas, who said... The Hadith.
4. "Sharh Ilal At-Tirmidhi" by Ibn Rajab 339.
5. "Ilal Abdullah" (312), (1288), "Masa'il Salih" (838), "Ad-Du'afa" by Al-Uqayli 1/199, "Tahdhib al-Tahdhib" 1/367.
6. "At-Talkhis Al-Habir" 1/52.

book_title: The Collection of Imam Ahmad's Sciences - Ills of Hadith
publisher: Dar Al-Falah for Scientific Research and Heritage Verification, Fayoum - Arab Republic of Egypt
text:
706 - What came regarding wearing gold.
The Hadith of Abdullah bin Amr (may Allah be pleased with them both): "Whoever wears gold from my Ummah and dies wearing it, will not wear gold of Paradise" (1).
Abdullah bin Ahmad said: My father crossed out this Hadith, so I thought he crossed it out because it is a mistake. It is only Maimun bin Ustad from Abdullah bin Amr, it does not contain: from As-Sadafi. It is said: This Maimun is As-Sadafi; because Yazid bin Harun's hearing from Al-Jurayri was at the end of his life, and Allah knows best (2).

707 - What came regarding the prohibition of gold for men.
The Hadith of Abu Musa Al-Ash'ari (may Allah be pleased with him): "Silk and gold are forbidden for the males of my Ummah and lawful for their females."
Imam Ahmad said when asked: Which Hadith on this is most established? He said: Is there not the Hadith of Sa'id bin Abi Hind in it? (3). It was said to him: That is Mursal.
foot_note:
1. (1) Reported by Ahmad 2/208-209, he said: Ishaq bin Yusuf Al-Azraq and Hawdhah bin Khalifah narrated to us, they said: Awf narrated to us, from Maimun bin Ustad - Hawdhah said Al-Hazzani - he said: Abdullah bin Amr said raised to the Prophet (Marfu') with it.
2. "Musnad Ahmad" 2/259.
3. Reported by Ahmad 4/394, he said: Muhammad bin Ubaid narrated to us, Ubaidullah narrated to us, from Nafi', from Sa'id bin Abi Hind, from Abu Musa, raised (Marfu') with it.

book_title: The Collection of Imam Ahmad's Sciences - Ills of Hadith
publisher: Dar Al-Falah for Scientific Research and Heritage Verification, Fayoum - Arab Republic of Egypt
text:
He said: Even if it is. Then he said: Is there not the Hadith of the sister of Hudhayfah in it? (1). It was said to him: That is regarding dislike (Karahiyah). He said: He only disliked for her to display it in this Hadith (2).

708 - What came regarding wearing a ring on the right hand.
The Hadith of Anas (may Allah be pleased with him) that the Prophet (peace be upon him) used to wear a ring on his right hand (3).
Imam Ahmad said: I do not know it. Then he said: Abbad has, from Sa'id, more than one mistake Hadith, and I do not know if he heard from him at the end (of his life) or not (4).
foot_note:
1. (1) Reported by Al-Bayhaqi in his "Sunan" 4/141, he said: Abu Abdullah Al-Hafiz and Abu Sa'id bin Abi Amr informed us, they said: Abu Al-Abbas Muhammad bin Ya'qub narrated to us, Harun bin Sulayman Al-Asbahani narrated to us, Abdur-Rahman bin Mahdi narrated to us, from Sufyan, from Mansur, from Rib'i, from his wife, from the sister of Hudhayfah, who said: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) addressed us and said: "O assembly of women, do you not have in silver what you can adorn yourselves with? Indeed, there is no woman among you who adorns herself with gold and displays it except that she will be punished by it."
2. "Ahkam an-Nisa" by Imam Ahmad 43.
3. Reported by An-Nasa'i 8/193, he said: Muhammad bin Amir informed us, he said: Muhammad bin Isa narrated to us, he said: Abbad bin Al-Awwam narrated to us, from Sa'id, from Qatada, from Anas raised (Marfu') with it.
4. "Masa'il Abi Dawud" (1893). I say: The Hadiths regarding the wearing of the ring by the Prophet (peace be upon him) contradicted whether it was on his right or his left hand. Muslim reported (2091) from the Hadith of Ibn Umar (may Allah be pleased with them both) containing: And he put it on his right hand. Also, Muslim reported (2094) from the Hadith of Az-Zuhri from Anas that the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) wore a silver ring on his right hand.

book_title: The Collection of Imam Ahmad's Sciences - Ills of Hadith
publisher: Dar Al-Falah for Scientific Research and Heritage Verification, Fayoum - Arab Republic of Egypt
foot_note: 1. = He also reported (2595) from the Hadith of Anas (may Allah be pleased with him) containing: And he pointed to the little finger of his left hand. I say: Ad-Daraqutni and others criticized the Hadiths of wearing a ring on the right hand. He said in "At-Tatabbu'" 460 regarding the preserved Hadith of Anas from Yunus, Al-Layth, Ibn Wahb, and Uthman bin Umar narrated it - meaning: there was disagreement regarding Yunus. Al-Layth, Ibn Wahb, and Uthman bin Umar narrated it from him without mentioning the right hand, while Talha bin Yahya and Sulayman bin Bilal narrated it from him mentioning it. Ad-Daraqutni preferred not mentioning it, and it is stronger. Al-Hafiz said in "Al-Fath" 10/340 with modification: Ibn Abi Hatim said: I asked Abu Zur'ah about the difference in Hadiths regarding that, so he said: Neither this nor that is established, but 'on his right' is more frequent. He said: There is disagreement among the Shafi'is regarding the issue, and the more correct view is the right hand. I [Al-Hafiz] say: It appears to me that this varies according to the intention. If the wearing is for adornment, then the right hand is better. If it is for sealing (using as a signet), then the left hand is more appropriate; because it is like putting it in deposit, and taking it from there happens with the right hand, and likewise putting it back. Wearing it on the right hand is preferred absolutely; because the left hand is the tool for cleaning oneself, so the ring is protected if it is on the right hand from being touched by impurity. And wearing it on the left hand is preferred based on what I indicated regarding taking it. A group leaned towards the equality of both matters and combined the various Hadiths by this. Abu Dawud indicated this where he titled a chapter: Chapter of Wearing a Ring on the Right and Left, then he listed the Hadiths with their variation in that without preference. An-Nawawi and others reported consensus on permissibility then said: There is no dislike in it - meaning: according to the Shafi'is - but the difference is regarding what is better. Al-Baghawi said: The last of the two matters was wearing the ring on the left. At-Tabari critiqued this saying its apparent meaning is abrogation, and that is not his intent, but rather reporting the reality by agreement. What appears is that the wisdom in it is what was mentioned earlier, and Allah knows best.

book_title: The Collection of Imam Ahmad's Sciences - Ills of Hadith
publisher: Dar Al-Falah for Scientific Research and Heritage Verification, Fayoum - Arab Republic of Egypt
text:
709 - What came regarding the prohibition of wearing a ring except for a person of authority.
The Hadith of Abu Raihanah (may Allah be pleased with him): The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) forbade ten things (1). And in it... wearing a ring except for a person of authority.
Imam Ahmad said: Only the people of Sham narrate it. Ahmad narrated the Hadith of Abu Raihanah, and when he reached 'the ring', he smiled as if amazed, then said: The people of Sham.
Ibn Qudamah said: Ahmad only said that because the Hadiths have been authenticated from the Prophet (peace be upon him) and become widespread regarding its permissibility, and the Companions of the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) and the scholars after them agreed upon it. So if an anomalous (Shadh) Hadith comes contradicting that, it is not relied upon. If it is authentic, it is interpreted as dislike (Tanzeeh) (2).
foot_note:
1. (1) Reported by Abu Dawud (4049), he said: Yazid bin Khalid bin Abdullah bin Mawhab Al-Hamdani narrated to us, Al-Mufaddal bin Fadalah informed us, from Ayyash bin Abbas Al-Qitbani, from Abu Al-Husain - meaning: Al-Haitham bin Shufayy - who said: I went out with a companion of mine nicknamed Abu Amir, a man from Al-Ma'afir; to pray in Iliya (Jerusalem). Their storyteller was a man from Al-Azd called Abu Raihanah from the Companions. Abu Al-Husain said: My companion preceded me to the mosque, then I joined him and sat beside him. He asked me: Did you catch the storytelling of Abu Raihanah? I said: No. He said: I heard him say: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) forbade ten things: sharpening teeth (Washr), tattooing (Washm), plucking hair (Natf), sleeping of a man with another man without an undergarment, sleeping of a woman with another woman without an undergarment, a man putting silk at the bottom of his clothes like the non-Arabs, or putting silk on his shoulders like the non-Arabs, looting (Nuhbah), riding on leopard skins, and wearing a ring except for a person of authority.
2. "Al-Mughni" by Ibn Qudamah 10/346.

book_title: The Collection of Imam Ahmad's Sciences - Ills of Hadith
publisher: Dar Al-Falah for Scientific Research and Heritage Verification, Fayoum - Arab Republic of Egypt
text:
710 - What came regarding dyeing (with henna) for women.
The Hadith of Aisha (may Allah be pleased with her): "If you were a woman, you would have changed your nails" (1). Meaning: with henna.
Imam Ahmad said: This is a Munkar (denounced) Hadith (2).

711 - What came regarding hair extensions.
The Hadith of Aisha (may Allah be pleased with her): The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) cursed the woman who adds hair extensions and the one who asks for it (3).
Imam Ahmad said: Ghundar did not connect (Musnad) from Shu'bah the Hadith of Amr bin Murrah, from Al-Hasan bin Muslim that a girl lost her hair. He omitted from its chain - meaning: Aisha - (4).
foot_note:
1. (1) Reported by Abu Dawud (4166), he said: Muhammad bin Muhammad As-Suri narrated to us, Khalid bin Abdur-Rahman narrated to us, Muti' bin Maimun narrated to us, from Safiyyah bint Ismah, from Aisha (may Allah be pleased with her), who said: A woman signaled from behind a curtain with a letter in her hand to the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him). The Prophet (peace be upon him) withdrew his hand and said: "I do not know if it is the hand of a man or the hand of a woman." She said: Rather, a woman. He said: "If you were..." The Hadith.
2. "At-Talkhis Al-Habir" 2/237, "Al-Frusiyyah" by Ibn al-Qayyim p. 195.
3. Reported by Abu Dawud At-Tayalisi 219, he said: Shu'bah narrated to us, from Amr bin Murrah, who said: I heard Al-Hasan bin Muslim narrating from Safiyyah, from Aisha that a woman from the Ansar lost her hair and they wanted to join it, so she mentioned that to the Prophet (peace be upon him)... The Hadith.
4. "Ilal Abdullah" (5163). I say: The text of the Hadith is established and authentic; Al-Bukhari reported it (5940), and from the Hadith of Ibn Umar (may Allah be pleased with them both) who said: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) cursed the woman who adds hair extensions and the one who asks for it.

book_title: The Collection of Imam Ahmad's Sciences - Ills of Hadith
publisher: Dar Al-Falah for Scientific Research and Heritage Verification, Fayoum - Arab Republic of Egypt
text:
712 - What came regarding putting on shoes while standing.
The Hadith of Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him): That the Prophet (peace be upon him) forbade a man from putting on his shoes while standing (1).
Imam Ahmad said: Munkar. And he said: Al-Harith bin Nabhan only narrates it from Asim. It was said to him: Did he meet Ma'mar? He said: I do not know (2).
foot_note:
1. (1) Reported by Al-Uqayli in "Ad-Du'afa" 1/218, he said: Abbas bin As-Sindi narrated to us, he said: Muslim bin Ibrahim narrated to us, he said: Al-Harith bin Nabhan narrated to us, he said: Ma'mar narrated to us, from Ammar bin Abi Ammar, from Abu Hurairah, raised (Marfu') with it.

text:
713 - What came regarding walking in one leather sock (Khuff).
The Hadith of Ibn Abbas (may Allah be pleased with them both): That the Prophet (peace be upon him) forbade walking in one leather sock or one sandal (1).
Imam Ahmad said: This is a Munkar (denounced) Hadith. It was said to him: Someone other than Abdus-Samad narrates it from Abdul-Warith, from Al-Hasan, from Amr bin Khalid, from Habib. He said: Amr bin Khalid's Hadith is worth nothing; he is not trustworthy (2).
foot_note:
1. (1) Reported by Ahmad in "Al-Musnad" 1/321, he said: From Abdus-Samad, from his father, from Al-Husain bin Dhakwan, from Habib, from Sa'id bin Jubayr, from Ibn Abbas raised (Marfu') with it.
2. "Musnad Ahmad" 1/321, "Ad-Du'afa" by Al-Uqayli 3/268, "Ilal Abdullah" (3634). I say: The text of the Hadith is established and authentic; Al-Bukhari reported it (5855) from the Hadith of Abu Hurairah that the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: "Let none of you walk in one sandal; let him either take them both off or wear them both."

text:
The Book of Foods

714 - What came regarding mentioning the name of Allah over food.
The Hadith of Umar bin Abi Salamah (may Allah be pleased with him): "O boy, mention the name of Allah, eat with your right hand, and eat from what is next to you."
Imam Ahmad said: It is not from a man (1); rather it is from Abu Wajzah from Umar (2). Three people narrated it to me, not saying in it 'from a man' (3).

715 - What came regarding the believer eating in one intestine.
There are two Hadiths in it:
The First: The Hadith of Abu Musa (may Allah be pleased with him): "The believer eats in one intestine, and the disbeliever eats in seven intestines" (4).
foot_note:
1. (1) Reported by An-Nasa'i in "Amal Al-Yawm wal-Laylah" p. 260 (277), he said: Muhammad bin Adam informed me, from Abdah, from Hisham, from Abu Wajzah As-Sa'di, from a man, from Umar bin Abi Salamah, who said: I entered upon the Prophet (peace be upon him) while he was eating, so he said: "Sit and eat, O my son"... The Hadith.
2. Reported by At-Tirmidhi (1857), he said: Abdullah bin As-Sabah Al-Hashimi narrated to us, Abdul-A'la narrated to us, from Ma'mar, from Hisham bin Urwah, from his father, from Umar bin Abi Salamah that he entered upon the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) while he had food, so he said: "Come close, O my son" The Hadith.
3. "Masa'il Ibn Hani" (2390). I say: The text is established, for Al-Bukhari (5376) and Muslim (2022) both reported it from the path of Al-Walid bin Kathir, from Wahb bin Kaysan who heard it from Umar bin Abi Salamah, raised (Marfu') with it.
4. Reported by Muslim (2062), he said: Abu Kuraib Muhammad bin Al-Ala narrated to us, Abu Usamah narrated to us, Buraid narrated to us, from his grandfather, from Abu Musa raised (Marfu') with it.

Imam Ahmad said: Regarding this Hadith, they seek a Hadith from thirty paths, weak Hadiths. And he began mentioning the seeking of paths like this. He said: Something they do not benefit from, or words to that effect (1).
The Second: The Hadith of Abu Hurairah, similar to it (2).
Imam Ahmad said to Abdur-Razzaq: O Abu Bakr, I prefer - meaning: this Hadith - as if he admired the excellence and quality of this Hadith. He said: Yes (3).

716 - What came regarding ablution before and after food.
The Hadith of Salman (may Allah be pleased with him): "The blessing of food is ablution before it and ablution after it" (4).

Benefit: Ibn Rajab said in "Sharh Ilal At-Tirmidhi" 248: As for this Hadith of Abu Musa, Muslim extracted it from Abu Kuraib, and more than one person found it strange from this perspective, and they mentioned that Abu Kuraib was unique in it, among them Al-Bukhari and Abu Zur'ah. text: Imam Ahmad said: It is a Munkar (denounced) Hadith; no one narrated it except Qays, and Qays made many mistakes in Hadith (1). 717 - What has been reported regarding eating with the whole palm. The Hadith of Ibn Akhi al-Zuhri (the nephew of Al-Zuhri) from his wife, from her father, that he [the Prophet], may Allah bless him and grant him peace, used to eat with his whole palm (2). Imam Ahmad said: It is not Sahih (authentic) (3). 718 - What has been reported regarding the virtue of vinegar. In it are two Hadiths: The First: The Hadith of Aisha: "What an excellent condiment -or seasoning- is vinegar" (4).
foot_note:
1. = He said: I read in the Torah that the blessing of food is Wudu (washing) after it. I mentioned that to the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, and informed him of what I read in the Torah, so the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said: ... The Hadith.
1. "Al-Ilal Al-Mutanahiyah" by Ibn al-Jawzi 2/163, "Al-Mughni" by Ibn Qudamah 11/91.

3. "Al-Mughni" by Ibn Qudamah 8/123 and also 11/92. I say: It is established in "Sahih Muslim" (2032) from the Hadith of Ka'b bin Malik, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, used to eat with three fingers and would lick his hand before wiping it.

text: Imam Ahmad said: Munkar (1). The Second: The Hadith of Jabir, similar to it (2). Imam Ahmad said: Munkar (3). 719 - What has been reported regarding eating oil. The Hadith of Umar bin Al-Khattab, may Allah be pleased with him: "Eat oil and anoint yourselves with it, for it is from a blessed tree" (4). Imam Ahmad said: This Hadith was narrated to us by Abd al-Razzaq, from Ma'mar, from Zaid bin Aslam, from his father; it does not mention Umar (5).
foot_note:

1. "Sharh Ilal al-Tirmidhi" by Ibn Rajab 251. I say: Abu al-Fadl bin Ammar al-Shahid declared this Hadith defective (109-110). Ahmad bin Salih said: I looked into the books of Sulayman bin Bilal and did not find a basis for these two Hadiths.

I say: The text is established; Muslim recorded it (2052) from the path of Abu Bishr, from Abu Sufyan, from Jabir, that the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, asked his family for condiment, and they said: We have nothing but vinegar. He called for it and began eating with it, saying: "What an excellent condiment is vinegar, what an excellent condiment is vinegar."
4. Recorded by Al-Tirmidhi (1851), he said: Yahya bin Musa told us, Abd al-Razzaq told us, from Ma'mar, from Zaid bin Aslam, from his father, from Umar, in a Marfu' form with it.
5. "Masa'il Abi Dawud" (1877). I say: Thus Yahya bin Ma'in and Abu Hatim al-Razi declared it defective, and Al-Tirmidhi and Al-Bazzar reported the disagreement.

text: 720 - What has been reported regarding combining two types of food. In it are three Hadiths: The First: The Hadith of Ibn Umar, may Allah be pleased with them both: "I wish I had a white loaf of bread made from brown wheat, moistened with ghee and milk." So a man from the people stood up, prepared it, and brought it. He said: "In what was this [kept]?" He said: In a lizard skin container. He said: "Take it away" (1). Imam Ahmad said: Munkar. And he said: Who narrated this?! It was said to him: Al-Hussein bin Waqid. So he gestured with his hand and shook his head, as if he did not approve of him (2). The Second: The Hadith of Aisha, may Allah be pleased with them both: "You must stick to Al-Murazamah." It was said: What is Al-Murazamah? He said: "Eating bread with grapes, for the best of fruit is grapes, and the best of food is bread" (3). Imam Ahmad said: This Hadith with this chain is Mawdu' (fabricated), and the problem (bala') in it is from Amr (4).
foot_note:
1. (1) Recorded by Abu Dawud in his "Sunan" (3818), he said: Muhammad bin Abdul Aziz bin Abi Rizmah told us, Al-Fadl bin Musa informed us, from Hussein bin Waqid, from Nafi', from Ibn Umar, in a Marfu' form with it.
2. "Al-Du'afa" by Al-Uqayli 1/251, "Tahdhib al-Tahdhib" 1/254, "Mizan al-I'tidal" 2/72.
3. Recorded by Ibn al-Jawzi in "Al-Mawdu'at" 2/288, he said: Abu Mansur bin al-Samarqandi and Abu Mansur bin Khayrun informed us, they said: Isma'il bin Abi al-Fadl informed us, Hamzah bin Yusuf informed us, Abu Ahmad bin Adi informed us, Ahmad bin Ja'far bin Umar al-Sa'di told us, Ahmad bin Nawsah al-Damaghani told us, Al-Hasan bin Shibl al-Bukhari told us, Amr bin Muhammad al-Asadi told us, from Hisham bin Urwah, from his father, from Aisha, in a Marfu' form with it.
4. "Al-Mawdu'at" by Ibn al-Jawzi 2/288.

text: The Third: The Hadith of Sahl bin Sa'd, may Allah be pleased with him: The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, used to eat fresh dates with watermelon (1). Imam Ahmad said: Yaqub bin al-Walid is from the people of Medina, and he was one of the major liars; he narrates from Abu Hazim from Sahl bin Sa'd (2). And he said once, when Yaqub bin al-Walid was mentioned: I wrote from him and tore up his Hadith a long time ago; he used to fabricate Hadith from Hisham bin Urwah, Abu Hazim, and Ibn Abi Dhi'b. And he said: A liar who fabricates Hadith (3). 721 - What has been reported regarding the virtue of watermelon. The Hadith of Ibn Abbas, may Allah be pleased with them both: "Its water is mercy and its sweetness is like the sweetness of Paradise" (4).

text: Imam Ahmad said: Nothing is Sahih (authentic) regarding the virtue of watermelon (1). 722 - What has been reported regarding eating cheese and ghee. The Hadith of Salman al-Farsi, may Allah be pleased with him: The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, was asked about ghee, cheese, and fur. He said: "The Halal (lawful) is what Allah has made lawful in His Book, and the Haram (unlawful) is what Allah has made unlawful in His Book, and what He remained silent about, it is among that which He has pardoned" (2). Imam Ahmad said: This is a Munkar Hadith (3).
foot_note:
1. = Al-Qasim al-Bazquhi informed us, Ahmad bin Yaqub bin Abdul Jabbar told us, Ja'far bin Ahmad bin Muhammad bin al-Sabah told us, Abu Mus'ab told us, from Musa bin Shaybah, from Isma'il bin Abdullah bin Ka'b bin Malik, from Ka'b bin Malik, who said: We were with Ibn Abbas in Ta'if. While we were walking one day in a melon field, the owner of the melon field stood up and harvested two watermelons from his field and placed them before us. I began to eat and throw away the rind. Ibn Abbas said: Do not do that, for its rind is from the mountains of Paradise. If people knew what was in it, they would wish that all their fruits and sustenance were watermelon. Indeed, it is a food that Adam ate in Paradise, so Iblis weighed a weight under the boundaries of the seventh earth when he knew that Adam ate it. And he said: I fear that no one from his offspring will remain with me in the Fire unless he is taken out of it; for Allah places blessing upon it and upon whoever eats from it, and how can one whom the Compeller has blessed be in the Fire?! And I heard the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, say: ... The Hadith.
1. "Asna al-Matalib" by Al-Bayruti (591), "Al-Manar al-Munif" (130).
2. Recorded by Ibn Majah (3367), he said: Isma'il bin Musa al-Suddi told us, Sayf bin Harun told us, from Sulayman al-Taymi, from Abu Uthman al-Nahdi, from Salman al-Farsi, in a Marfu' form with it.
3. "Jami' al-Ulum wa al-Hikam" (243). I say: The Hadith of Abu Tha'labah al-Khushani supports it, but it is not Sahih from the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace. However, Ibn Rajab quoted in "Jami' al-Ulum wa al-Hikam" (243) from Abu Bakr al-Sam'ani who said: This Hadith is a major principle among the principles of religion and its branches.
