text: 723 - What has been reported regarding eating the cheese of the Magi. The Hadith of Ibn Abbas, may Allah be pleased with them both: "Put the knife, mention the name of Allah, and eat" (1). Imam Ahmad said: This is a Munkar Hadith (2). And he said once: The best Hadith regarding the cheese of the Magi is the Hadith of Umar (3).
foot_note:
1. = And he also said: Whoever acts according to this Hadith has acquired reward and is safe from punishment; because whoever performs the obligatory duties, avoids the prohibitions, stops at the limits, and leaves searching for what is hidden from him, has fully attained the divisions of virtue and the rights of religion; because the laws do not go beyond these types mentioned in this Hadith.
1. Recorded by Ahmad 1/234, he said: Waki' told us, Isra'il told us, from Jabir, from Ikrimah, from Ibn Abbas, that the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, was brought cheese. He said: His companions began striking it with a stick, so the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said: ... The Hadith.
2. "Jami' al-Ulum wa al-Hikam" (249).
3. "Jami' al-Ulum wa al-Hikam" (249), "Al-Mughni" by Ibn Qudamah 11/89. I say: Al-Bukhari recorded in his "Sahih" (5507) something similar regarding meats from the Hadith of Aisha, may Allah be pleased with her, who said: A people said to the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace: Indeed, a people bring us meat and we do not know if the name of Allah was mentioned over it or not. The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said: "Mention the name of Allah over it yourselves and eat it." She said: And they were new to Islam (recently in a state of Kufr). I say: But this Hadith has been criticized by some scholars who declared it defective due to being Mursal (hurried/disconnected), among them Abu Zur'ah al-Razi and Al-Daraqutni, may Allah have mercy on them. However, as is well known about Al-Bukhari, an addition from a trustworthy Hafiz is acceptable to him provided the addition is not excessive. Accordingly, he used this Hadith as proof, but I—and Allah knows best—lean towards it being Mursal =

text: 724 - What has been reported regarding the prohibition of cutting meat with a knife. The Hadith of Aisha, may Allah be pleased with her: "Do not cut meat with a knife, for that is from the ways of the non-Arabs (A'ajim)" (1). Imam Ahmad said: It is not Sahih, and this is not known (2). And he said: The Hadith of Amr bin Umayyah al-Damri contradicts this (3). 725 - What has been reported regarding the prohibition of eating horse meat. In it are two Hadiths: The First: The Hadith of Khalid bin al-Walid, may Allah be pleased with him, that the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, forbade eating the meat of horses, mules, and donkeys (4). Imam Ahmad said: This is a Munkar Hadith, and Baqiyyah is one of the Mudallisin (those who conceal defects in the chain); he narrates from

2. "Zad al-Ma'ad" 4/304, "Al-Mawdu'at" by Ibn al-Jawzi 2/303, "Al-Manar al-Munif" (129), "Al-Mughni" 8/121, and also 11/92.

In it: ...that he saw the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, cutting meat from a sheep's shoulder in his hand, then he was called to prayer, so he put it down and the knife with which he was cutting, then stood up and prayed and did not perform Wudu.
4. Recorded by Abu Dawud (3790), he said: Sa'id bin Shabib and Haywah bin Shurayh al-Homsi told us, Haywah said: Baqiyyah told us, from Thawr bin Yazid, from Salih bin Yahya bin al-Miqdam bin Ma'd Yakrib, from his father, from his grandfather, from Khalid bin al-Walid, in a Marfu' form with it.

text: 727 - What has been reported regarding what is disliked from the sheep when slaughtered. The Hadith of Mujahid: The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, disliked seven things from the sheep: The blood, the gall bladder, the penis, the two testicles, the vulva, the gland, and the bladder. He said: And the part of the sheep he liked most was its forepart (1). Imam Ahmad said: This is a Munkar Hadith (2). 728 - What has been reported regarding the permission to eat fruit for the one passing by it. The Hadith of Ibn Umar, may Allah be pleased with them both: "Whoever enters a garden, let him eat and not take a collection (in his garment)" (3). Imam Ahmad said: This is a weak (Da'if) Hadith (4).
foot_note:

2. "Al-Mughni" by Ibn Qudamah 11/89.
3. Recorded by Al-Tirmidhi (1287), he said: Muhammad bin Abdul Malik bin Abi al-Shawarib told us, Yahya bin Sulaym told us, from Abdullah bin Umar, from Nafi', from Ibn Umar in a Marfu' form with it.
4. "Masa'il Abi Dawud" (1927), "Sharh Ilal al-Tirmidhi" by Ibn Rajab (192). Abu Isa said 3/574: Some people of knowledge permitted the wayfarer to eat fruits, while some disliked it except for a price.

text: Book of Drinks 729 - What has been reported regarding drinking while standing. The Hadith of Ibn Umar, may Allah be pleased with them both: We used to eat during the time of the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, while walking, and drink while standing (1). Imam Ahmad said: I do not know what that is—as one denying it—I did not hear this except from Ibn Abi Shaybah from Hafs. Then he said: It is actually the Hadith of Yazid bin Atarid (2). 730 - What has been reported regarding drinking from the broken edge of a cup. The Hadith of Abu Sa'id al-Khudri, may Allah be pleased with him: The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, forbade drinking from the broken edge of a cup and blowing into the drink (3). Imam Ahmad said: The Hadith of Abu Sa'id is Munkar (4).
foot_note:
1. (1) Recorded by Al-Tirmidhi (1880), he said: Abu al-Sa'ib Salm bin Junadah al-Kufi told us, Hafs bin Ghiyath told us, from Ubaidullah bin Umar, from Nafi', from Ibn Umar... so he mentioned it.
2. "Tarikh Baghdad" 8/195, "Mizan al-I'tidal" 2/91, "Tahdhib al-Tahdhib" 1/569.
3. Recorded by Abu Dawud (3722), he said: Ahmad bin Salih told us, Abdullah bin Wahb told us, Qurrah bin Abdul Rahman informed me, from Ibn Shihab, from Ubaidullah bin Abdullah bin Utbah, from Abu Sa'id al-Khudri, in a Marfu' form with it.
4. "Masa'il Ibn Hani" (1788). I say: The prohibition of blowing into the drink is established; Al-Bukhari recorded it (5630) from the Hadith of Abu Qatadah who said: The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said: "If one of you drinks, let him not breathe into the vessel."

book_title: The Collection of Imam Ahmad's Sciences - Hadith Defects
publisher: Dar Al-Falah for Scientific Research and Heritage Verification, Fayoum - Arab Republic of Egypt
text: 731 - What has been reported regarding seeking sweet water. The Hadith of Aisha, may Allah be pleased with her, that the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, used to have sweet water sought for him from the houses of Al-Suqya (1). Imam Ahmad said: I see this as wind (baseless) (2). And he said once: It has no basis from the book of Al-Darawardi. He used to narrate it from memory. Ahmad said: His book is more correct than his memory (3). 732 - What has been reported regarding that of which a large amount intoxicates, a small amount is Haram. In it are three Hadiths: The First: The Hadith of Ibn Umar, may Allah be pleased with them both: "Whatever a Faraq (a large measure) of it intoxicates, then a sip of it is Haram" (4). Imam Ahmad said: Munkar (5).
foot_note:
1. (1) Recorded by Abu Dawud (3735), he said: Sa'id bin Mansur, Abdullah bin Muhammad al-Nufayli, and Qutaibah bin Sa'id told us, they said: Abdul Aziz bin Muhammad told us, from Hisham, from his father, from Aisha, in a Marfu' form with it.
2. "Masa'il Abi Dawud" (1948).
3. "Sharh Ilal al-Tirmidhi" (324), "Masa'il Abi Dawud" (1948).
4. Recorded by Ibn Adi in "Al-Kamil" 3/212, he said: Umar bin Sinan informed us, Dawud bin Sulayman ibn Hafs bin Abi Dawud informed us in Tarsus, they said: Zakariya bin Manzur al-Ansari told us, Abu Hazim informed us, from Nafi', from Ibn Umar, in a Marfu' form with the wording: "Whatever a large amount of it intoxicates, a drop of it is Haram."
5. "Masa'il Abi Dawud" (299).

book_title: The Collection of Imam Ahmad's Sciences - Hadith Defects
publisher: Dar Al-Falah for Scientific Research and Heritage Verification, Fayoum - Arab Republic of Egypt
text: The Second: The Hadith of Aisha, may Allah be pleased with her: "Whatever a Faraq of it intoxicates, then a handful of it is Haram" (1). Imam Ahmad was asked about one who said: Indeed this Hadith is not Sahih. He said: This is a Mughill (extremist) man (2), meaning: he has gone to extremes in his statement. The Third: The Hadith of Ibn Abbas, may Allah be pleased with them both: "Wine (Khamr) was forbidden specifically, in small and large amounts, and intoxication from every drink is Haram" (3). Imam Ahmad said: Ibn Shubrumah did not hear anything from Abdullah bin Shaddad (4). 733 - What has been reported regarding Nabidh (date-water). In it are two Hadiths: The First: The Hadith of Abu Mas'ud, may Allah be pleased with him: The Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, became thirsty around the Kaaba and asked for drink. He was brought Nabidh from the Siqayah. He smelled it and frowned. He said: "Bring me a bucket from Zamzam." He poured it over it, then drank. A man said: Is it Haram, O Messenger of Allah?
foot_note:
1. (1) Recorded by Al-Tirmidhi (1866), he said: Muhammad bin Bashar told us, Abdul A'la bin Abdul A'la told us, from Hisham bin Hassan, from Mahdi bin Maymun. And Abdullah bin Mu'awiyah al-Jumahi told us, Mahdi bin Maymun told us—the meaning is one—from Abu Uthman al-Ansari, from Al-Qasim bin Muhammad, from Aisha who said: The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said: "Every intoxicant is Haram..." The Hadith.
2. "Jami' al-Ulum wa al-Hikam" (368), "Masa'il Salih" (212).
3. Recorded by Al-Nasa'i in "Al-Kubra" 3/233, he said: Abu Bakr bin Ali informed us, he said: Al-Qawariri informed us, he said: Abdul Warith told us, he said: I heard Ibn Shubrumah mention it from Abdullah bin Shaddad bin al-Had, from Ibn Abbas who said: ... The Hadith.
4. "Al-Ilal" narration of Abdullah (723).

book_title: The Collection of Imam Ahmad's Sciences - Hadith Defects
publisher: Dar Al-Falah for Scientific Research and Heritage Verification, Fayoum - Arab Republic of Egypt
text: He said: "No" (1). Imam Ahmad said: This is Munkar (2). And he said once: Yahya bin Yaman used to make mistakes, and he weakened him. It was said to him: Did anyone else narrate it? He said: No, except one who is weaker than him (3). And once Imam Ahmad spoke against it (4). And once Imam Ahmad denied that anything regarding the lawfulness of Nabidh (if fermented) is Sahih (5). The Second: The Hadith of Ibn Umar, may Allah be pleased with them both: "Look at these drinks; if they become strong (fermented) upon you, break their strength with water" (6).
foot_note:
1. (1) Recorded by Al-Nasa'i 8/325, he said: Al-Hasan bin Isma'il bin Sulayman informed us, he said: Yahya bin Yaman informed us, from Sufyan, from Mansur, from Khalid bin Sa'd, from Abu Mas'ud, in a Marfu' form with it.
2. "Masa'il Abi Dawud" (1903).
3. "Al-Tahqiq" by Ibn al-Jawzi 8/257.
4. "Al-Nasikh wa al-Mansukh" by Al-Athram (175).
5. "Jami' al-Ulum wa al-Hikam" 367, "Masa'il Salih" (253), but with the wording: "Nothing is established with me regarding the lawfulness of an intoxicant," "Al-Du'afa" 2/200, "Al-Tahqiq" 8/209, "Tahdhib al-Tahdhib" 2/528.
6. Recorded by Ibn Abi Shaybah in "Al-Musannaf" 5/110, he said: Waki' told us, from Isma'il bin Abi Khalid, from Qurrah al-Ijli, from Abdul Malik bin al-Qa'qa', from Ibn Umar who said: We were with the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, and he was brought a cup containing a drink. He brought it close to his mouth, then returned it. Some of those sitting said: Is it Haram, O Messenger of Allah? He said: "Return it." So they returned it. Then he called for water and poured it over it, then drank it. He said: "Look at these drinks..." The Hadith.

book_title: The Collection of Imam Ahmad's Sciences - Hadith Defects
publisher: Dar Al-Falah for Scientific Research and Heritage Verification, Fayoum - Arab Republic of Egypt
text: Imam Ahmad said when asked about this Hadith: Abdul Malik is unknown (Majhul) (1). 734 - What has been reported regarding the permissibility of Nabidh if it has not become strong and has not become an intoxicant. The Hadith of Aisha, may Allah be pleased with her: She used to make Nabidh for the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, in the morning. When evening came, he would have dinner and drink it with his dinner. If anything remained, she would pour it out or empty it. Then she would make Nabidh for him at night. When morning came, he would have lunch and drink it with his lunch. She said: The waterskin was washed in the morning and evening (2). Imam Ahmad said: How excellent a Hadith it is (3).
foot_note:
1. (1) "Tahdhib al-Tahdhib" 3/516.
2. Recorded by Abu Dawud (3712), he said: Musaddad told us, Al-Mu'tamir told us, he said: I heard Shabib bin Abdul Malik narrating from Muqatil bin Hayyan, he said: My paternal aunt Amrah told me from Aisha... The Hadith.
3. "Al-Ashribah" by Imam Ahmad (8). I say: The text has a Sahih witness; Muslim recorded it (2004) from the Hadith of Ibn Abbas, may Allah be pleased with them both, who says: Nabidh used to be made for the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, at the beginning of the night, and he would drink it in the morning of that day, and the coming night, and the next day and the other night, and the next day until Asr. If anything remained, he would give it to the servant to drink, or order it to be poured out.

book_title: The Collection of Imam Ahmad's Sciences - Hadith Defects
publisher: Dar Al-Falah for Scientific Research and Heritage Verification, Fayoum - Arab Republic of Egypt
text: 735 - What has been reported regarding the utensils of the disbelievers. The Hadith of Abu Tha'labah al-Khushani, may Allah be pleased with him: "If you do not find others, wash them with water" (1). Imam Ahmad said: This is from Hammad; he was not competent in the likes of this. He gathers the men (narrators) and makes it one chain, while they differ (2).
foot_note:
1. (1) Recorded by Al-Tirmidhi (1797), he said: Ali bin Isa al-Baghdadi told us, Ubaidullah bin Muhammad al-Qurashi told us, Hammad bin Salamah told us, from Ayyub and Qatadah, from Abu Qilabah, from Abu Asma' al-Rahabi, from Abu Tha'labah al-Khushani that he said: O Messenger of Allah, we are in a land of People of the Book; shall we cook in their pots and drink from their vessels? The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said: "If you do not find others, wash them with water." Then he said: O Messenger of Allah, indeed we are in a land of game, so what should we do? He said: "If you send your trained dog and mention the name of Allah and it kills, then eat. And if it is untrained, then slaughter (the catch) and eat. And if you shoot with your arrow and mention the name of Allah and it kills, then eat."
2. "Sharh Ilal al-Tirmidhi" (359). I say: The text is established; Al-Bukhari recorded it (5496) from the path of Abu Tha'labah al-Khushani, but not from the path of Hammad bin Salamah. He said: I came to the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, and said: O Messenger of Allah, indeed we are in a land of People of the Book, so shall we eat from their vessels? And in a land of game; I hunt with my bow, and I hunt with my trained dog and with my dog that is not trained. The Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said: "As for what you mentioned that you are in a land of People of the Book, do not eat from their vessels unless you find no alternative. If you find no alternative, wash them and eat from them. And as for what you mentioned that you are in a land of game, whatever you hunt with your bow, mention the name of Allah and eat. And whatever you hunt with your trained dog, mention the name of Allah and eat. And whatever you hunt with your dog that is not trained, then slaughter it."

book_title: The Collection of Imam Ahmad's Sciences - Hadith Defects
publisher: Dar Al-Falah for Scientific Research and Heritage Verification, Fayoum - Arab Republic of Egypt
text: 736 - What has been reported regarding the prohibition of Dubba' (gourd containers) and Muzaffat (pitch-coated containers). In it are two Hadiths: The First: The Hadith of Abdul Rahman bin Ya'mar, may Allah be pleased with him, that the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, forbade Dubba' and Muzaffat (1). Imam Ahmad said: This Hadith—Shu'bah only narrated the Hadith of Hajj with this chain (2)(3). And he said once: He denied it from Shababah (4). And once: I do not know what to tell you; I did not hear it from anyone (5). The Second: The Hadith of Aisha, may Allah be pleased with her, similar to it (6).
foot_note:
1. (1) Recorded by Al-Nasa'i in "Al-Kubra" 3/220, he said: Muhammad bin Aban al-Balkhi told us, Shababah bin Sawwar told us, Shu'bah told us, from Bukayr bin Ata', from Abdul Rahman bin Ya'mar that the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace... The Hadith.
2. Recorded by Ahmad 4/309, he said: Muhammad bin Ja'far told us, Shu'bah told us, from Bukayr bin Ata', he said: I heard Abdul Rahman bin Ya'mar say: I heard the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, while a man was asking him about Hajj at Arafah, saying: "The Hajj is the day of Arafah—or Arafat—and whoever catches the night of Muzdalifah (Jam') before the morning prayer, his Hajj is complete. The days of Mina are three; whoever hastens in two days, there is no sin upon him, and whoever delays, there is no sin upon him."
3. "Al-Du'afa" by Al-Uqayli 2/196, "Sharh Ilal al-Tirmidhi" (250), "Tarikh Baghdad" 9/296, "Siyar A'lam al-Nubala" 5/515.
4. "Sharh Ilal al-Tirmidhi" 249, "Siyar A'lam al-Nubala" 5/516.
5. "Tarikh Baghdad" 9/297.
6. Recorded by Ahmad 6/244, he said: Ruh told us, he said: Shu'bah told us, he said: Malik bin Arfatah told us, he said: I heard Abd Khayr narrating from Aisha... so he mentioned it.

book_title: The Collection of Imam Ahmad's Sciences - Hadith Defects
publisher: Dar Al-Falah for Scientific Research and Heritage Verification, Fayoum - Arab Republic of Egypt
text: Imam Ahmad said: It is actually Khalid bin Alqamah al-Hamdani—meaning instead of Malik bin Arfatah—Shu'bah erred (1). 737 - What has been reported regarding the license to drink in containers and vessels. In it are two Hadiths: The First: The Hadith of Abu Burdah bin Niyar, may Allah be pleased with him: "Drink in containers but do not get intoxicated" (2). Imam Ahmad said: The Hadith of Abu al-Ahwas from Simak, from Al-Qasim bin Abdul Rahman, from his father, from Abu Burdah is an error in chain and text. As for the chain: Sharik and Ayyub (3) and Muhammad the two sons of Jabir narrated it from
foot_note:
1. (1) "Musnad Ahmad" 6/344. I say: This text is Sahih; Al-Bukhari recorded it (5594) from the Hadith of Ali bin Abi Talib, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: The Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, forbade Dubba' and Muzaffat. Imam Ahmad said about this Hadith: There is no Hadith in Kufa from Ali more authentic than this.
2. Recorded by Al-Nasa'i 8/319, he said: Hannad bin al-Sari informed us, from Abu al-Ahwas, from Simak, from Al-Qasim bin Abdul Rahman, from his father, from Abu Burdah bin Niyar, in a Marfu' form with it.
3. "Musnad Ahmad" 5/356-357, he said: Hussein bin Muhammad told us, Ayyub bin Jabir told us, from Simak, from Al-Qasim bin Abdul Rahman, from Ibn Buraydah, from his father, who said: I went out with the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, until when we were at Waddan, he said: "Stay in your places until I come to you." So he left, then came to us looking unwell. He said: "I came to the grave of the mother of Muhammad and asked my Lord for intercession, but He denied it to me. And indeed, I used to forbid you from visiting graves, so visit them. And I forbade you from the meat of sacrifices after three days, so eat and keep what seems good to you. And I forbade you from these drinks in these vessels, so drink in what seems good to you."

book_title: The Collection of Imam Ahmad's Sciences - Hadith Defects
publisher: Dar Al-Falah for Scientific Research and Heritage Verification, Fayoum - Arab Republic of Egypt
text: Simak, from Al-Qasim bin Abdul Rahman, from Ibn Buraydah, from his father, from the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace—as the people narrated it—: "So make Nabidh in every vessel and do not drink an intoxicant" (1). And he said once: Abu al-Ahwas used to err in this Hadith; Sharik opposed him in its chain (2) and its wording. He [Abu al-Ahwas] says: From Abu Burdah. They said to him: Ibn Niyar? He said: Yes, and he persisted in it. The people of drinks (those who permit Nabidh) used it as proof. The Hadith is actually the Hadith of Ibn Buraydah (3).
foot_note:
1. (1) "Al-Ilal by Ibn Abi Hatim" 2/25 (1551), "Nasb al-Rayah" 6/239, "Al-Nasikh wa al-Mansukh" by Al-Athram (174), "Tanqih al-Tahqiq" 482-483.
2. Recorded by Al-Nasa'i 8/319-320, he said: Muhammad bin Isma'il informed us, he said: Yazid told us, he said: Sharik informed us, from Simak bin Harb, from Ibn Buraydah, from his father, that the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, forbade Dubba', Hantam, Naqir, and Muzaffat.
3. "Sunan Al-Nasa'i" 8/319, "Nasb al-Rayah" 6/239, "Masa'il Abi Dawud" (1859), "Al-Nasikh wa al-Mansukh" by Al-Athram (175), "Mukhtasar al-Khilafiyat by Al-Bayhaqi" 5/15, "Mizan al-I'tidal" 2/367, "Tanqih al-Tahqiq" 3/482. I say: The text of the Hadith is established in "Sahih Muslim" (1999) from the path of Muharib bin Dithar, from Ibn Buraydah, from his father, who said: The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said: "I used to forbid you from drinks in leather vessels, so drink in every vessel, but do not drink an intoxicant." Benefit: Al-Qadi said in "Sharh Sahih Muslim" 13/167: This narration contains a change from some narrators; the correct version is: "I used to forbid you from drinks EXCEPT in leather vessels," so the word (except) was omitted for the exception, and it is necessary. I say: What Al-Qadi, may Allah have mercy on him, mentioned is supported by the narration of Muslim which Al-Hafiz brought in "Al-Fath" 10/60 with the wording: "Except in leather vessels," so perhaps it is a scribal error, and Allah knows best. Issue: Al-Hafiz said in "Al-Fath" 10/60: Al-Khattabi said: The majority holds that the prohibition was initially there and then abrogated. A group held that the prohibition of making Nabidh in these vessels remains,

book_title: The Collection of Imam Ahmad's Sciences - Hadith Defects
publisher: Dar Al-Falah for Scientific Research and Heritage Verification, Fayoum - Arab Republic of Egypt
text: The Second: The Hadith of Aisha: "Drink in these vessels and do not get intoxicated" (1). Imam Ahmad said: Munkar (2).
foot_note:
1. = Among them Ibn Umar and Ibn Abbas. And Malik, Ahmad, and Ishaq said this. Thus he stated generally. He said: The first (opinion) is more correct. The meaning of the prohibition: The time of the permission of wine was recent, so when the prohibition became well-known, making Nabidh in every vessel was permitted for them on the condition of avoiding drinking intoxicants. It is as if those who held to the continuation of the prohibition had not received the abrogating text. I say: There is a witness in "Al-Bukhari" (5592) from the path of Jabir bin Abdullah who said: The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, forbade containers. The Ansar said: We have no choice but to use them. He said: "Then no (prohibition) in that case."
1. Recorded by Al-Nasa'i 8/320, he said: Abu Bakr bin Ali informed us, he said: Ibrahim bin Hajjaj informed us, he said: Abu Awanah told us from Simak from Qarsafah—a woman among them—from Aisha, she said: ... so she mentioned it as Mawquf.
2. "Mizan al-I'tidal" 4/307.

book_title: The Collection of Imam Ahmad's Sciences - Ills of Hadith
publisher: Dar Al-Falah for Scientific Research and Heritage Verification, Fayoum - Arab Republic of Egypt
text: The Book of Inheritance (Al-Fara'id) 738 - What came regarding the prohibition of selling Wala' (clientage) and gifting it. The Hadith of Ibn Umar (may Allah be pleased with them both): The Prophet (peace be upon him) forbade selling Wala' and gifting it (1). Imam Ahmad said: Abdullah bin Dinar is not corroborated in this. He indicated that the correct narration is what Nafi' narrated from Ibn Umar that the Prophet (peace be upon him) said: "The Wala' belongs to the one who freed" (2), and he did not mention: The prohibition of selling Wala' and gifting it (3). And once: Ahmad weakened the Hadith of Abdullah bin Dinar (4).
foot_note:
1. (1) Reported by Al-Bukhari (6756) and Muslim (1506), both from the path of Sufyan from Abdullah bin Dinar from Ibn Umar as Marfu' (raised to the Prophet).
2. Reported by Al-Bukhari (6757) and Muslim (1504), both from the path of Malik, from Nafi', from Ibn Umar: That Aisha, Mother of the Believers, wanted to buy a slave girl to free her, but her owners said: We sell her to you on the condition that her Wala' is ours. She mentioned that to the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) and he said: "Do not let that prevent you, for Wala' belongs to the one who freed."
3. "Sharh Ilal At-Tirmidhi" by Ibn Rajab (238), "Ilal Al-Marudhi" (450), "Bahr al-Dam" (520).
4. "Masa'il Al-Kawsuj" (3169). Benefit: Ibn Rajab said in "Sharh Ilal At-Tirmidhi" 239: And Nafi' narrated from Ibn Umar from his own saying: The prohibition of selling Wala' and gifting it, not raised (Marfu'). This is among the things that defect the Hadith of Abdullah bin Dinar. And Allah knows best. Al-Hafiz said in "Al-Fath" 12/44-45 with modification: This Hadith became famous from Abdullah bin Dinar, to the point that Muslim said in his "Sahih": People regarding this Hadith are dependent on Abdullah bin Dinar. At-Tirmidhi said after extracting it: Hasan Sahih, we do not know it except from the Hadith of Abdullah bin Dinar. It is narrated from Shu'bah that he said: I wished that when Abdullah bin Dinar narrated this Hadith to me, he had permitted me so I could stand up to him and kiss his head. And in "Musnad At-Tayalisi" from Shu'bah: I said to Abdullah bin Dinar: Did you hear this from Ibn Umar? He said: Yes, his son asked him about it. Abu Awanah mentioned it from Bahz bin Asad from Shu'bah: I said to Ibn Dinar: Did you hear it from Ibn Umar? He said: Yes, and his son Hamzah asked him about it. The same occurred in the narration of Affan from Shu'bah with Abu Nu'aym. It was extracted from another path that Shu'bah said: I said to Ibn Dinar: By Allah, did you hear Ibn Umar say this? So he swore to him. It was said to Ibn Uyainah: Shu'bah makes Abdullah bin Dinar swear. He said: But we did not make him swear; I heard it from him repeatedly. Ibn Al-Arabi said in "Sharh At-Tirmidhi": Abdullah bin Dinar was unique in this Hadith, and it is of the second degree of report; because he did not mention the wording of the Prophet (peace be upon him), and it is as if he conveyed the meaning of the Prophet's saying (peace be upon him): "Wala' belongs only to the one who freed." I say: This is supported by the fact that Ibn Umar narrated this Hadith from Aisha in the story of Barirah, but the wording of the Hadith came from him via another path extracted by An-Nasa'i and Abu Awanah from the path of Al-Layth from Yahya bin Ayyub, from Malik, with the wording: I heard the Prophet (peace be upon him) forbidding the sale of Wala' and gifting it. Issue: Al-Hafiz said in "Al-Fath" 12/45: Ibn Battal said: The scholars agreed that transferring lineage is not permissible, so if the ruling of Wala' is like lineage, then just as lineage is not transferred, Wala' is not transferred. In Jahiliyyah, they used to transfer Wala' by sale and other means, so the Sharia forbade that. Ibn Abd al-Barr said: The community agreed on acting upon this Hadith except what was narrated from Maimunah that she gifted the Wala' of Sulayman bin Yasar to Ibn Abbas. And Abdur-Razzaq narrated from Ibn Jurayj, from Ata: It is permissible for the master to permit his slave to take as Wala' whom he wishes.

book_title: The Collection of Imam Ahmad's Sciences - Ills of Hadith
publisher: Dar Al-Falah for Scientific Research and Heritage Verification, Fayoum - Arab Republic of Egypt
text: 739 - What came regarding the inheritance of the freed slave (Mawla al-Asfal). The Hadith of Ibn Abbas (may Allah be pleased with them both) that a man died during the time of the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) and did not leave an heir except a slave whom he had freed, so the Prophet (peace be upon him) gave him his inheritance (1).
foot_note: 1. (1) Reported by At-Tirmidhi (2106), he said: Ibn Abi Umar narrated to us, Sufyan narrated to us, from Amr bin Dinar, from Awsajah, from Ibn Abbas... The Hadith.

book_title: The Collection of Imam Ahmad's Sciences - Ills of Hadith
publisher: Dar Al-Falah for Scientific Research and Heritage Verification, Fayoum - Arab Republic of Egypt
text: The Hadith of Awsajah from Ibn Abbas regarding inheritance was mentioned to Ahmad, so he said: I do not know Awsajah (1). 740 - What came regarding the invalidation of inheritance between a Muslim and a Disbeliever. The Hadith of Usama bin Zaid (may Allah be pleased with them both): "A Muslim does not inherit from a disbeliever, nor does a disbeliever inherit from a Muslim" (2). Imam Ahmad said: Hushaym did not hear it from Az-Zuhri, and I wrote it (3). And he said once: Only Amr bin Shu'aib narrates it, from his father, from his grandfather (4): "People of two different religions do not inherit from each other" (5).
foot_note:
1. (1) "Su'alat Abi Dawud" (235), "Masa'il Abi Dawud" (1418). Abu Isa said: The practice according to the people of knowledge regarding this chapter is that if a man dies and leaves no Asabah (male agnates), his inheritance is placed in the treasury of the Muslims (Bayt al-Mal).
2. Reported by At-Tirmidhi (2107), he said: Sa'id bin Abdur-Rahman Al-Makhzumi and more than one said: Sufyan narrated to us from Az-Zuhri, and Ali bin Hujr narrated to us, Hushaym informed us, from Az-Zuhri, from Ali bin Husain, from Amr bin Uthman, from Usama bin Zaid raised (Marfu') with it.
3. "Masa'il Al-Imam Ahmad" narration of Ibn Hani (2140), "Al-Ilal" narration of Abdullah (2202). I say: And the text of the Hadith is established and authentic; Al-Bukhari reported it (6764) from the path of Ibn Jurayj, from Ibn Shihab, from Ali bin Husain, from Amr bin Uthman, from Usama bin Zaid (may Allah be pleased with him) that the Prophet (peace be upon him) said: "A Muslim does not inherit from a disbeliever, nor does a disbeliever inherit from a Muslim."
4. Reported by Abu Dawud (2911), he said: Musa bin Isma'il narrated to us, Hammad narrated to us, from Habib Al-Mu'allim, from Amr bin Shu'aib, from his father, from his grandfather... The Hadith.
5. "Al-Jami' lil-Khallal" 2/405, "Ahkam Ahl al-Dhimmah" by Ibn al-Qayyim 1/318.

book_title: The Collection of Imam Ahmad's Sciences - Ills of Hadith
publisher: Dar Al-Falah for Scientific Research and Heritage Verification, Fayoum - Arab Republic of Egypt
text: 741 - What came regarding the inheritance of the grandmother. There are two Hadiths in it: First: The Hadith of Abu Bakr (may Allah be pleased with him): Regarding the inheritance of the grandmother (1). Imam Ahmad said: Only Malik connected its chain (Musnad) from Az-Zuhri (2). Second: The Hadith of Zaid bin Thabit as Mawquf: A grandmother does not inherit while her son is alive (3). Imam Ahmad said: Hisham narrates this, and he also said: Sa'id did not bring it like this, so I do not know if it is authentic or not (4). 742 - What came regarding the inheritance of Dhu al-Arham (blood relatives who are not fixed-share heirs or residuaries). The Hadith of Abdullah bin Shaddad bin Al-Had, he said: A freed slave (Mawla) of the daughter of Hamzah died and left

And Ishaq bin Isa said: Malik informed me, from Az-Zuhri, from Uthman bin Kharashah, H. And Ishaq bin Isa said: From Uthman bin Kharashah, H. And Mus'ab Az-Zubayri narrated to us from Malik similar to it, so Uthman bin Ishaq bin Kharashah - from Banu Amir bin Lu'ay - said from Qabisah bin Dhu'aib who said: The grandmother came to Abu Bakr (may Allah be pleased with him) asking for her inheritance. He said: I do not know of anything for you in the Book of Allah, nor do I know of anything for you in the Sunnah of the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) until I ask the people. So he asked, and Al-Mughirah bin Shu'bah said: I heard the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) give her one-sixth. He said: Who witnesses with you or who knows with you? So Muhammad bin Maslamah stood up and said similar to that. So he executed it for her. And Ishaq bin Isa said: Is anyone else with you?

text: Imam Ahmad said: It is not authentic according to me (1). And he said once: It has a weak chain (2), and he impugned it. And he said once: If the Hadith of Tamim Ad-Dari is not established, then Wala' (clientage) belongs only to the one who bestowed the favor (of freeing). The Prophet (peace be upon him) said: "The Wala' belongs to the one who freed" (3). And he said once: This is only narrated from Abdul-Aziz bin Umar, and it is not Musnad (connected). It was said to him: Does Yahya bin Hamzah make mistakes? It was said to him: This is from the Prophet (peace be upon him); did you consider it regarding inheritance? He said: Yes, that is how it is with me if it were authentic, but it is not established. The Prophet (peace be upon him) only said: "The Wala' belongs to the one who freed" (4), and I do not see it as authentic. And he said once: Some say from Qabisah from Tamim Ad-Dari, and some do not include Qabisah in it. Some of our companions said: Qabisah did not meet Tamim Ad-Dari (5). And he said once: It is only Ibn Mawhab, from Qabisah, from Tamim (6). And once: Abu Nu'aym (7) narrates it saying: I heard Tamim Ad-Dari. And Yahya bin Hamzah inserts a man between them (8).

The Hadith of Aisha (may Allah be pleased with her): "Whoever becomes Muslim regarding something, it is his" (1). Imam Ahmad said: Ibn Jurayj narrated it: I said to Ata: Whoever becomes Muslim regarding something (2). 746 - What came regarding the child belonging to the bed (marriage bed). There are two Hadiths in it: First: The Hadith of Khuzaimah bin Thabit: "The child belongs to the bed, and their reckoning is upon Allah" (3). Imam Ahmad said when this Hadith was mentioned to him: Abdul-Aziz bin Abdullah, this one who narrates from Khasif, strike out his Hadiths; they are lies, or he said: fabricated (4).

text: The Book of Judgments (Ahkam) 748 - What came regarding seeking judgeship. The Hadith of Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him): "Whoever is made a judge has been slaughtered without a knife" (1). Imam Ahmad said: I do not think he heard it from Sa'id. This is the Hadith of Uthman Al-Akhnasi. Muhammad bin Umar Al-Muqaddami narrated it to us, from Safwan, from Abdullah bin Sa'id, from Muhammad bin Uthman, from Al-Maqburi, from Abu Hurairah, from the Prophet (peace be upon him). But it is actually Uthman bin Muhammad Al-Akhnasi (2); Safwan erred in it (3). 749 - What came regarding judging by an oath and a witness. There are two Hadiths in it: First: The Hadith of Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him): He judged by an oath along with a witness (4).

1. (1) Reported by Ahmad 2/229, he said: Safwan bin Isa narrated to us, Abdullah bin Sa'id bin Abi Hind informed us, from Sa'id Al-Maqburi, from Abu Hurairah, raised (Marfu') with it.

He said: And Abu Ahmad bin Adi informed us, he said: Ali bin Ibrahim bin Al-Haitham narrated to us, he said: Muhammad bin Awf narrated to us, they said: Muhammad bin Al-Mubarak narrated to us, Al-Mughirah bin Abdur-Rahman narrated to us, from Abu Az-Zinad, from Al-A'raj, from Abu Hurairah, raised (Marfu') with it.

text: Imam Ahmad said: The Hadith of Al-A'raj is the most authentic thing in the chapter (1). Second: The Hadith of Jabir, similar to it (2). Imam Ahmad crossed out this Hadith and said: No one agreed with Ath-Thaqafi regarding Jabir. Abdullah bin Imam Ahmad said: I kept at him until he read it to me and wrote 'it is correct' on it (3).
foot_note:
1. (1) "At-Talkhis Al-Habir" 4/192, "Sunan Al-Bayhaqi" 10/169, "Al-Kamil" by Ibn Adi 6/356, "Siyar A'lam al-Nubala" 8/166-167.
2. "Musnad Ahmad" 3/305, he said: Abdul-Wahhab Ath-Thaqafi narrated to us, from Ja'far, from his father, from Jabir, raised (Marfu') with it.
3. "Musnad Ahmad" 3/305. I say: Imam Ahmad's saying (may Allah have mercy on him): 'The Hadith of Al-A'raj is the most authentic thing in the chapter' does not imply authenticity (Sihhah), for Al-Mughirah bin Abdur-Rahman is not among the companions of Abu Az-Zinad, and he was alone in narrating this root, and he is spoken about (criticized); therefore, Ibn Adi mentioned him in his book in the biography of Al-Mughirah bin Abdur-Rahman, denouncing this Hadith from him, and said: Ibn Ajlan and more than one narrated it from Abu Az-Zinad, from Ibn Abi Safiyyah, from Shuraih, his saying. Benefit: One might say: Imam Ahmad declared the Hadith of Abu Az-Zinad to be the most authentic thing in this chapter, how so when Muslim reported in his "Sahih" (1712) from the path of Zaid bin Al-Hubab, he said: Saif bin Sulayman narrated to me, Qais bin Sa'd informed me, from Amr bin Dinar, from Ibn Abbas: That the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) judged by an oath and a witness. So did Imam Ahmad not view this Hadith as authentic? The answer: Yes. At-Tirmidhi asked Al-Bukhari in "Al-Ilal Al-Kabir" 1/546 about this Hadith, so he said: According to me, Amr bin Dinar did not hear this Hadith from Ibn Abbas. From this, the insight of the Imam of 'Ilal, Imam Ahmad (may Allah have mercy on him), becomes clear to you; although Ash-Shafi'i, Al-Bayhaqi, and Ibn Abd al-Barr in "At-Tamhid" authenticated this Hadith.

text: 750 - What came regarding two men disputing over a fence. The Hadith of Hudhayfah bin Al-Yaman (may Allah be pleased with him): "You have hit the mark and done well" (1). This Hadith was mentioned to Imam Ahmad, and it did not convince him. It was mentioned to Ishaq bin Rahwayh,
foot_note:
1. = And Al-Uqayli 2/174 said: The best Hadith in the chapter: Oath with the witness, is this Hadith of Saif, and the rest of the narrations contain leniency (weakness). Issue: Ibn Abd al-Barr said in "At-Tamhid" 2/153-154 with modification: Among those who advocated the oath with the witness are Companions of the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him), and it has not been reported from any of the Companions that he denied the oath with the witness. This is the view of the majority of the Tabi'in in Medina: Sa'id bin Al-Musayyib, Abu Salamah bin Abdur-Rahman, Al-Qasim bin Muhammad, Urwah, Salim, Abu Bakr bin Abdur-Rahman, Ubaidullah bin Abdullah, Kharijah bin Zaid, Sulayman bin Yasar, Ali bin Husain, Abu Ja'far Muhammad bin Ali, Abu Az-Zinad, and Umar bin Abdul-Aziz. None of them differed on that except Urwah, for it was differed upon regarding him, and likewise regarding Ibn Shihab. Judging by an oath and a witness is the view of Malik and his companions, Ash-Shafi'i, Ahmad, Ishaq, Abu Ubaid, Abu Thawr, Dawud, and the group of Ahl al-Athar. Abu Hanifa and his companions, Ath-Thawri, and Al-Awza'i said: Judgment is not passed by an oath with a single witness; this is the view of Ata, Al-Hakam bin Utaybah, and a group.

And Abu Abdur-Rahman As-Sulami and Abu Bakr bin Al-Harith Al-Faqih informed us, they said: Ali bin Umar Al-Hafiz informed us, Ibn Mani' narrated to us, Dawud bin Rashid narrated to us, he said: Marwan bin Mu'awiyah narrated to us, Dahtham bin Qurran narrated to us, Uqayl bin Dinar - Mawla of Jariyah bin Zafar - narrated to us from Jariyah bin Zafar: That there was a house between two brothers, and they built a fence in the middle of it. Then they perished and each left offspring. The offspring of each claimed that the fence belonged to him to the exclusion of his companion. The offspring of both took their dispute to the Prophet (peace be upon him), so he sent Hudhayfah bin Al-Yaman (may Allah be pleased with him) to judge between them. He judged the fence to belong to the one whom the knots of the binding were facing. Then he returned and informed the Prophet (peace be upon him), so the Prophet (peace be upon him) said: "You have hit the mark."

text: The Book of Legal Punishments (Hudud) 752 - What came regarding flogging the drinker of alcohol. The Hadith of Anas (may Allah be pleased with him) that the Prophet (peace be upon him) was brought a man who had drunk alcohol, so he beat him with two palm stalks about forty times (1). Imam Ahmad said: This is nothing. More than one narrated it from Shu'bah (2) from Qatada from Anas (3). 753 - What came regarding the one on whom the Hadd was established by his confession to adultery in multiple sessions. The Hadith of Umar (may Allah be pleased with him) when he intended to repeat the Hadd punishment on Abu Bakrah, so Ali said: If you flog him, then stone your companion (3).
foot_note:

Muhammad bin Abdullah bin Numair narrated to us - and they were close in the wording of the Hadith - my father narrated to us, Bashir bin Al-Muhajir narrated to us, Abdullah bin Buraidah narrated to us, from his father that Ma'iz bin Malik Al-Aslami came to the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) and said: O Messenger of Allah, indeed I have wronged myself and committed adultery, and I want you to purify me. He turned him away. When it was the next day, he came to him and said: O Messenger of Allah, indeed I have committed adultery. He turned him away a second time. So the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) sent to his people and said: "Do you know of any problem with his intellect, do you denounce anything from him?" They said: We do not know him except to be of sound intellect, among our righteous ones as far as we see. So he came to him a third time, and he sent to them again and asked about him, and they informed him: That there is no harm with him nor with his intellect. When it was the fourth time, he dug a hole for him then ordered regarding him, and he was stoned... The Hadith.

Abu Bakrah, Shibl bin Ma'bad, and Abu Abdullah Nafi' testified. Then Ziyad testified and said: As for adultery, I do not testify to it, but I saw a foul matter. Umar said: Allah is Greatest, flog them. When he finished flogging Abu Bakrah, Abu Bakrah stood up and said: I testify that he is an adulterer. So Umar intended to repeat the Hadd on him, so Ali said: If you flog him, then stone your companion.

text: Imam Ahmad said: I indeed deny that Ali said to Umar: If you flog him, then stone your companion? And he said: I do not know if it is from the Hadith of Sufyan or not? We only heard it from Ishaq (1). 755 - What came regarding the Hadd of adultery. The Hadith of Salamah bin Al-Muhabbaq (may Allah be pleased with him): "Take from me, take from me, Allah has made a way for them. The virgin with the virgin: flogging of one hundred and exile for a year. And the non-virgin (Thayyib) with the non-virgin: flogging of one hundred and stoning" (2). Imam Ahmad said: This is a Munkar (denounced) Hadith, meaning: a mistake (3).

text: 756 - What came regarding the man who has intercourse with his wife's slave girl. The Hadith of Salamah bin Al-Muhabbaq (may Allah be pleased with him) that the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) judged regarding a man who had intercourse with his wife's slave girl: "If he coerced her, she is free and he owes her mistress a similar one. If she obeyed him, she belongs to him, and he owes her mistress a similar one" (1). Imam Ahmad said: The one who narrated it from Salamah bin Al-Muhabbaq is a Sheikh who is not known, and no one narrates from him except Al-Hasan - meaning: Qabisah bin Huraith (2). 757 - What came regarding killing the one who marries his father's wife. The Hadith of Al-Bara' (may Allah be pleased with him): The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) sent us to a man from Banu Tamim who married his father's wife after him, so he commanded us to kill him and take his wealth. He said: So they did (3). Abdullah bin Ahmad said: My father did not narrate anything to me from Abu Maryam Abdul-Ghaffar except this Hadith because of its defect (4).
foot_note:
1. (1) Reported by Abu Dawud (4460), he said: Ahmad bin Salih narrated to us, Abdur-Razzaq narrated to us, Ma'mar informed us, from Qatada, from Al-Hasan, from Qabisah bin Huraith, from Salamah bin Al-Muhabbaq, that the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him)... so he mentioned it.
2. "Masa'il Abi Dawud" (1916), "Zad al-Ma'ad" 5/39.
3. Reported by Ahmad 4/295, he said: Yahya bin Abi Bukair narrated to us, Abdul-Ghaffar bin Al-Qasim narrated to us, Adi bin Thabit narrated to me, he said: Yazid bin Al-Bara' narrated to me, from his father, who said: I met my uncle carrying a banner, so I said: Where are you going? He said: ... The Hadith.
4. "Musnad Ahmad" 4/295.

publisher: Dar Al-Falah for Scientific Research and Heritage Verification, Fayoum - Arab Republic of Egypt
text: 758 - What came regarding killing a believer for a disbeliever. The Hadith of Ibn Umar (may Allah be pleased with them both) that the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) killed a Muslim for a person under covenant (Mu'ahid). And he said: "I am the most entitled of those who fulfill their covenant" (1). Imam Ahmad said: It has no Isnad. It is from the Hadith of Rabi'ah from Ibn Al-Baylamani; he said: It is Mursal (2), and the Hadith of Ali is more established, and Umar, and Uthman (3). And he said once: Whoever judges by the Hadith of Ibn Al-Baylamani is, in my view, mistaken. And if a judge judges by it and it is raised to another judge, he rejects it (4).
foot_note:
1. (1) Reported by Al-Bayhaqi 8/30, he said: Abu Bakr Ahmad bin Muhammad bin Al-Harith Al-Asbahani Al-Faqih informed us, Abu Al-Hasan Ali bin Umar Al-Hafiz informed us, Al-Hasan bin Ahmad bin Sa'id Ar-Rahawi narrated to us, my grandfather Rabi'ah bin Abi Abdur-Rahman informed me, from Ibn Al-Baylamani, from Ibn Umar, raised (Marfu') with it.
2. Reported by Abu Dawud in "Al-Marasil" (97), he said: Muhammad bin Dawud bin Abi Najiyah Al-Iskandarani narrated to us, Ibn Wahb informed us, Sulayman bin Bilal narrated to me, Rabi'ah narrated to me, from Abdur-Rahman bin Al-Baylamani who narrated to him that the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him)... The Hadith.
3. "Al-Jami' lil-Khallal" 2/399, "Al-Mughni" by Ibn Qudamah 9/342.
4. "Al-Tahqiq" by Ibn al-Jawzi 7/301, "Tanqih al-Tahqiq" by Ibn Abd al-Hadi 3/255.

text: 759 - What came regarding the stoning of the People of the Book. The Hadith of Ikrimah: That the Prophet (peace be upon him) stoned a Jewish man and a Jewish woman (1). Imam Ahmad said: This is only from Sharik, from Simak, from Jabir (2), so perhaps Sharik's tongue slipped. Al-Warkani said: Yahya bin Ma'in has looked into this. So Imam Ahmad said: And what does Yahya bin Ma'in know? Or does Yahya know everything? Strike it out. So he struck it out (3). 760 - What came regarding the one who kills his slave. The Hadith of Samurah (may Allah be pleased with him): "Whoever kills his slave, we kill him; and whoever mutilates his slave, we mutilate him" (4). Imam Ahmad said: I fear that this Hadith is not established. It was said to him: So what do you say? He said: If I fear that it is not established, I do not affirm it, and a free person is not killed
foot_note:
1. (1) Mentioned by Abu Ya'la in "Tabaqat al-Hanabilah" 1/287 from the path of Sharik, from Simak, from Ikrimah.
2. Reported by At-Tirmidhi 4/43, he said: Hannad narrated to us, Sharik narrated to us, from Simak bin Harb, from Jabir bin Samurah, raised (Marfu') with it.
3. "Tabaqat al-Hanabilah" 1/287, "Al-Manhaj" 1/236, "Tarikh Baghdad" 2/117, "Tanqih al-Tahqiq" 3/291-292. I say: And the text is established; Al-Bukhari reported it (6819) from the Hadith of Ibn Umar (may Allah be pleased with them both).
4. Reported by Ahmad 5/10, he said: Abu An-Nadr narrated to us, from Shu'bah, from Qatada, from Al-Hasan, from Samurah - and he did not hear from him - that the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: ... The Hadith.

text: with a slave nor with a Dhimmi (protected non-Muslim), and he is killed for a woman. He said: Khalid narrated it from Al-Hasan as Mawquf (stopped at the companion). Qatada said: Al-Hasan forgot this Hadith afterwards, and Al-Hasan used not to give fatwas according to it afterwards (1). And he said once: The Hadith of Samurah, Al-Hasan abandoned it (2). And he said once: Al-Hasan did not hear it from Samurah (3). And once: Imam Ahmad criticized it (4). And once he said: I do not adopt the Hadith of Samurah, and Al-Hasan used to say: 'A free man is not killed for a slave,' and his contradiction indicates its weakness (5). 761 - What has been reported regarding pardoning the killer. The Hadith of Anas, may Allah be pleased with him: "Pardon," but he refused. So he said: "Take your indemnity (Arsh)" (6).
foot_note:
1. (1) "Masa'il Ahmad" narration of Abdullah (1416), (1462).
2. "Masa'il Ahmad" narration of Ibn Hani (1549).
3. "Musnad Ahmad" 5/10, "Al-Mughni" 9/350.
4. "Jami' al-Ulum wa al-Hikam" (108).
5. "Masa'il Salih" (1095), "Al-Mughni" 9/350.
6. Recorded by Ibn Majah (2691), he said: Abu Umayr Isa bin Muhammad bin al-Nahhas, Isa ibn Yunus, and Al-Hussein bin Abi al-Sari al-Asqalani told us, they said: Damrah bin Rabi'ah told us, from Ibn Shawdhab, from Thabit al-Bunani, from Anas ibn Malik, who said: A man brought the killer of his kin to the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace. The Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said: "Pardon," but he refused. He said: "Take your indemnity," but he refused. He said: "Go and kill him, for you are like him." He said: So he caught up with him, and it was said to him: The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, has said: "Kill him, for you are like him." So he let him go. He said: He was seen dragging his strap going to his family. He said: It was as if he had tied him up.

text: Imam Ahmad said: I fear that this is like that—meaning: when he said regarding the Hadith "Whoever owns a Mahram relative, then he [the relative] is free," this is Munkar (denounced)—and he rejected it with severe rejection (1). 762 - What has been reported regarding amputation for snatching and betrayal. The Hadith of Jabir, may Allah be pleased with him: "There is no amputation upon a traitor, nor a plunderer, nor a snatcher" (2). Imam Ahmad said: Ibn Jurayj did not hear this Hadith from Abu al-Zubayr; Ibn Jurayj only heard it from Yasin al-Zayyat (3).
foot_note:
1. (1) "Tarikh Abi Zur'ah" (217, 381).
2. Recorded by Al-Tirmidhi (1448), he said: Ali bin Khashram told us, Isa bin Yunus told us, from Ibn Jurayj, from Abu al-Zubayr, from Jabir, in a Marfu' form with it.
3. "Sunan Abi Dawud" 2/542 (4393), "Sunan Al-Bayhaqi" 8/279. Issue: Al-Khattabi said in "Ma'alim al-Sunan" 3/264: The people of knowledge have agreed that the snatcher and the traitor are not amputated. That is because Allah, Glory be to Him, only obligated amputation upon the thief, and theft is taking wealth that is guarded secretly from its owner, while snatching is not guarded against in that manner.

text: 763 - What has been reported regarding one who has intercourse with an animal. The Hadith of Ibn Abbas, may Allah be pleased with him: "Whoever has intercourse with an animal, kill him and kill the animal" (1). Imam Ahmad said, when asked about this Hadith: The Hadith of Amr bin Abi Amr regarding that is not established. And since the Hadd (prescribed punishment) is averted by doubts, it is not permissible to establish it with a Hadith containing this doubt and weakness (2). And he said once: There is disagreement regarding it from Ibn Abbas. As for Asim, he narrated from Abu Razin, from Ibn Abbas: "There is no Hadd upon the one who comes unto an animal" (3). And Amr bin Abi Amr narrated from Ikrimah, from Ibn Abbas, from the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace: "Whoever has intercourse with an animal, kill him and kill the animal." And the Hadith of Dawud bin al-Husayn, from Ikrimah, from Ibn Abbas is similar to it (4).
foot_note:
1. (1) Recorded by Al-Tirmidhi (1455), he said: Muhammad bin Amr al-Sawwaq told us, Abdul Aziz ibn Muhammad told us, from Amr bin Abi Amr, from Ikrimah, from Ibn Abbas, in a Marfu' form with it.
2. "Al-Mughni" by Ibn Qudamah 10/163.
3. Recorded by Al-Tirmidhi (1455), he said: Muhammad bin Bashar told us, Abdul Rahman bin Mahdi told us, Sufyan al-Thawri told us, from Asim, from Abu Razin, from Ibn Abbas, as Mawquf upon him.
4. "Masa'il Ahmad" narration of Abdullah (1538).

text: 764 - What has been reported regarding the prayer over one who was killed by a Hadd punishment. The Hadith of Abu Barzah al-Aslami that the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, did not pray over Ma'iz bin Malik, nor did he forbid prayer over him (1). Imam Ahmad said: We do not know that the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, left the prayer over anyone except the one who stole from the spoils (Al-Ghal) and the one who killed himself (2).
foot_note:
1. (1) Recorded by Abu Dawud (3186), he said: Abu Kamil told us, Abu Awanah told us, from Abu Bishr, a group from the people of Basra told me, from Abu Barzah al-Aslami, in a Marfu' form with it.
2. "Tanqih al-Tahqiq" 2/155.

text: Book of Diyat (Blood Money) 765 - What has been reported regarding one who unsheathes his sword and then puts it down among people. The Hadith of Ibn al-Zubayr, may Allah be pleased with him: "Whoever unsheathes his sword and then puts it down, his blood is lawful (waste)" (1). Imam Ahmad said: I do not know what this is (2). 766 - What has been reported regarding the severity against one who kills a Muslim unjustly. The Hadith of Abu Huraira, may Allah be pleased with him: "Whoever aids in the killing of a believer by half a word, will meet Allah, Azza wa Jalla, with 'Despairing of Allah's mercy' written between his eyes" (3). Imam Ahmad said: This Hadith is not Sahih (4). 767 - What has been reported regarding distributing the Diyah (blood money) in installments upon the 'Aqilah (male agnates). The Hadith of Al-Shafi'i, who said: We found it generally among the people of knowledge that the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, judged in the accidental killing of a free Muslim by a free man, one hundred camels upon the 'Aqilah of the offender, and generally among them that it is over the course of three years, in each year a third of it
foot_note:
1. (1) Recorded by Al-Nasa'i 7/117, he said: Ishaq bin Ibrahim informed us, he said: Al-Fadl bin Musa informed us, he said: Ma'mar told us, from Tawus, from his father, from Ibn al-Zubayr in a Marfu' form with it.
2. "Masa'il al-Kawsaj" (2505).
3. Recorded by Ibn Majah (2620), he said: Amr bin Rafi' told us, Marwan bin Mu'awiyah told us, Yazid bin Ziyad told us, from Al-Zuhri, from Sa'id bin al-Musayyib, from Abu Huraira, in a Marfu' form with it.
4. "Al-Mawdu'at" by Ibn al-Jawzi 3/105.

text: and with specific ages (1). Imam Ahmad said: I do not know anything in it. It was said to him: Abdullah narrated it from the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace. He said: Perhaps he heard it from that Madinan, for he had a good opinion of him—meaning: Ibrahim bin Abi Yahya (2). 768 - What has been reported regarding the Diyah for accidental killing. The Hadith of Ali, may Allah be pleased with him: Regarding the story of the pit (Zubyah) they dug for the lion (3).
foot_note:
1. (1) Recorded by Al-Bayhaqi in "Al-Sunan" 8/109, he said: Abu Abdullah the Hafiz informed us, Abu al-Abbas Muhammad bin Yaqub told us, Al-Rabi' bin Sulayman informed us, Al-Shafi'i informed us, saying: ... The Hadith.
2. "Al-Talkhis al-Habir" 4/32. I say: Ibn al-Mundhir said: What Al-Shafi'i said has no known basis from a book or Sunnah.
3. Recorded by Ahmad 1/77, he said: Abu Sa'id told us, Isra'il told us, Simak told us, from Hanash, from Ali, who said: The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, sent me to Yemen. We came upon a people who had built a pit (Zubyah) for a lion. While they were pushing each other, a man fell and grabbed another, then that man grabbed another, until four of them ended up in it. The lion wounded them. A man volunteered with a spear and killed it. They all died from their wounds. The guardians of the first rose against the guardians of the last, and they brought out weapons to fight. Ali, may Allah be pleased with him, came to them at that moment and said: Do you wish to fight while the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, is alive? I will judge between you with a judgment; if you are satisfied, it is the judgment, otherwise I will prevent you from each other until you come to the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, and he will be the one to judge between you. Whoever transgresses after that has no right. Gather from the tribes of those who dug the well a quarter of the Diyah, a third of the Diyah, half of the Diyah, and a full Diyah. For the first is a quarter, because he perished from above them; for the second a third of the Diyah; for the third half of the Diyah [and for the fourth a full Diyah]. They refused to be satisfied, so they came to the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, while he was at the Maqam of Ibrahim, and told him the story. He said: "I will judge between you," and sat down. A man from the people said: Indeed Ali judged among us. So they told him the story, and the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, approved it.

text: Imam Ahmad said: I do not reject the Hadith of Simak if there is no one opposing him (1). 769 - What has been reported regarding there being no retaliation (Qawad) except with a sword. The Hadith of Al-Nu'man bin Bashir, may Allah be pleased with him: "There is no Qawad except with a sword" (2). Imam Ahmad said: Its chain is not good (3). And he said once: The Hadith of Anas (4): meaning regarding the killing of a Jew with stones, is more established and better (5).
foot_note:
1. (1) "Masa'il al-Kawsaj" (2443).
2. Recorded by Ibn Majah (2667), he said: Ibrahim bin al-Mustamir al-Aruqi told us, Abu Asim told us, from Sufyan, from Jabir, from Abu Azib, from Al-Nu'man bin Bashir, in a Marfu' form with it.
3. "Jami' al-Ulum wa al-Hikam" 132, "Al-Mughni" by Ibn Qudamah 9/387. I say: Imam Ahmad's statement here applies to all paths of the Hadith, not just the path of Al-Nu'man.
4. Recorded by Al-Bukhari (6877), he said: Muhammad told us, Abdullah bin Idris informed us, from Shu'bah, from Hisham bin Zaid bin Anas, from his grandfather Anas bin Malik, who said: A girl went out wearing ornaments in Medina. He said: A Jew threw a stone at her. He said: She was brought to the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, while she had a last breath of life. The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said to her: "Did so-and-so kill you?" She raised her head. He repeated it to her, saying: "Did so-and-so kill you?" She raised her head. He said to her the third time: "Did so-and-so kill you?" She lowered her head. So the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, called for him and killed him between two stones.
5. "Jami' al-Ulum wa al-Hikam" (132).

publisher: Dar Al-Falah for Scientific Research and Heritage Verification, Fayoum - Arab Republic of Egypt
text: 770 - What has been reported regarding the Diyah of the leg. The Hadith of Jariyah bin Zafar, may Allah be pleased with him, that a man struck another man with a sword and cut off his leg at the joint. He sought justice from the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, and he judged for him five thousand dirhams, and said: "Take it, may Allah bless it for you" (1). Imam Ahmad said: Dahtham bin Qarran is nothing; he is only known by two Hadiths, and he mentioned this Hadith among them (2). 771 - What has been reported regarding imprisonment for accusation. The Hadith of Mu'awiyah bin Haydah, may Allah be pleased with him: He imprisoned a man on an accusation then released him (3). Imam Ahmad said: Its chain is Sahih (4).
foot_note:
1. (1) Recorded by Al-Tabarani 2/260 (2090), he said: Muhammad bin Abdullah al-Hadrami told us, Abu al-Rabi' al-Zahrani told us, Asad bin Amr al-Bajali told us, from Dahtham bin Qarran, from Nimran bin Jariyah, from his father... The Hadith.
2. "Al-Ilal" narration of Abdullah (5676).
3. Recorded by Al-Tirmidhi (1417), he said: Ali bin Sa'id al-Kindi told us, Ibn al-Mubarak told us, from Ma'mar, from Bahz bin Hakim, from his father, from his grandfather, in a Marfu' form with it.
4. "Zad al-Ma'ad" 5/5.

publisher: Dar Al-Falah for Scientific Research and Heritage Verification, Fayoum - Arab Republic of Egypt
text: 772 - What has been reported regarding that no one commits a crime against another (vicarious liability). The Hadith of Abu Rimthah al-Taymi, may Allah be pleased with him: "He does not commit a crime against you, nor do you commit a crime against him" (1). Imam Ahmad said: Hushaim erred in this in two places. He said: Abu Rimthah al-Tamimi, but it is actually Al-Taymi. And he said: I came to the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, with a son of mine, but it is: I came to the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace... with a son (2) of mine (3). 773 - What has been reported regarding "The fire is Jubar (waste, no compensation)." The Hadith of Abu Huraira, may Allah be pleased with him: "The fire is Jubar" (4). Imam Ahmad said: This is false (Batil); there is nothing of this. Then he said: Who narrates it from Abd al-Razzaq? It was said to him: Ahmad bin Shabawayh. He said: These people heard after he became blind; he used to be prompted, so he would accept the prompting, and it is not in his book. They have attributed to him Hadiths that are not in his books; he was prompted with them after he became blind (5).

1. (1) Recorded by Ahmad in "Al-Musnad" 4/163, he said: Hushaim told us, Abdul Malik bin Umayr informed us, from Iyad bin Laqit, he said: Abu Rimthah al-Tamimi informed me, he said: I came to the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, and with me was a son of mine. He said: "Is this your son?" I said: Yes, I testify to it. He said: ... The Hadith.
2. Thus in "Al-Ilal", and the correct version is: with my father.
3. "Ilal Ibn Abi Hatim" 1/481 (1438).
4. Recorded by Ibn Majah (2676), he said: Ahmad bin al-Azhar told us, Abd al-Razzaq told us, from Ma'mar, from Hammam, from Abu Huraira, in a Marfu' form with it.
5. "Sunan Al-Daraqutni" 3/153, "Sunan Al-Bayhaqi" 8/344, "Masa'il Ibn Hani" (2101), "Sharh Ilal al-Tirmidhi" 320, "Al-Kamil" by Ibn Adi 6/281, "Bahr al-Dam" (619),

text: And he said once: The people of Yemen write 'Al-Nar' (Fire) as 'Al-Nir', and they write 'Al-Bir' (Well)—meaning: like that—so it is a misspelling (Tashif) (1). 774 - What has been reported regarding a slain body found between two villages. The Hadith of Abu Sa'id al-Khudri, may Allah be pleased with him: A slain body was found between two villages, so the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, ordered that it be measured to which of them it was closer. He found it closer to one of them by a span. He said: It is as if I am looking at the span of the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace. So the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, held liable the one to which it was closer (2). Imam Ahmad said: This is a Munkar Hadith (3). 775 - What has been reported regarding the slave being killed, his value whatever it reaches. The Hadith of Umar and Ali, may Allah be pleased with him: Regarding a free man killing a slave, they said: His value whatever it reaches (4). Ahmad denied that this is from the Hadith of Sa'id bin Abi Arubah and said: We see that

text: this is from the Hadith of Abu Jazi (1). 776 - What has been reported regarding the Diyah of horses. Imam Ahmad said: There is nothing Sahih in it (2). 777 - What has been reported regarding killing by Qasamah (oath-taking). The Hadith of Sahl bin Abi Hathmah: That Muhayyisah bin Mas'ud and Abdullah bin Sahl came to Khaybar, and Abdullah bin Sahl was killed... The Hadith, the Hadith of Qasamah (3). Imam Ahmad said: This Hadith is weak, and the authentic one from Bashir bin Yasar is what Yahya bin Sa'id narrated from him (4).
foot_note:
1. (1) "Al-Ilal" narration of Abdullah (2225).
2. "Masa'il Salih" (1258).
3. Recorded by Al-Bukhari (6898) and Muslim (1669), both from the path of Sa'id bin Ubaid from Bashir bin Yasar, who claimed that a man from the Ansar called Sahl bin Abi Hathmah informed him that a group of his people went to Khaybar and dispersed in it, and they found one of them killed. They said to those among whom he was found: You killed our companion. They said: We did not kill nor do we know a killer. So they went to the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, and said: O Messenger of Allah, we went to Khaybar and found one of us killed. He said: "Let the oldest speak, let the oldest speak." He said to them: "Do you bring evidence against who killed him?" They said: We have no evidence. He said: "Then they swear." They said: We do not accept the oaths of the Jews. The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, disliked that his blood be wasted, so he paid his blood money as one hundred camels from the camels of Sadaqah.
4. Recorded by Al-Bukhari (3173) and Muslim (1669), both from the path of Yahya bin Sa'id, from Bashir bin Yasar, from Sahl bin Abi Hathmah, who said: Abdullah bin Sahl and Muhayyisah bin Mas'ud bin Zaid set out to Khaybar, and it was a time of peace. They separated, and Muhayyisah came to Abdullah bin =

publisher: Dar Al-Falah for Scientific Research and Heritage Verification, Fayoum - Arab Republic of Egypt
text: He said: And I adopt it (1). And he said once: He mentioned the contradiction of Sa'id bin Ubaid to Yahya bin Sa'id in this Hadith, so he shook his hand and said: That is nothing; he narrated it according to what the Kufans say. And he said: I follow the Hadith of the Madinans, Yahya bin Sa'id (2).
foot_note:
1. = Sahl, and he was gasping in his blood, killed. So he buried him, then came to Medina. Abdul Rahman bin Sahl, and Muhayyisah and Huwayyisah the sons of Mas'ud, went to the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace. Abdul Rahman started to speak, so he said: "Let the oldest speak, let the oldest speak"—and he was the youngest of the people—so he fell silent, and they spoke. He said: "Do you swear and claim right to your killer or your companion?" They said: How can we swear when we did not witness and did not see? He said: "Then the Jews will acquit themselves to you with fifty [oaths]?" They said: How can we take the oaths of disbelieving people? So the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, paid his Diyah from himself.
1. "Al-Tamhid" by Ibn Abd al-Barr 23/209, "Masa'il Harb" p. 465.
2. "Jami' al-Ulum wa al-Hikam" (275). Issue: Al-Nawawi said in "Sharh Muslim" 11/148: regarding his wording: (from the camels of Sadaqah), some scholars said: It is a mistake from the narrators; because the obligatory Sadaqah (Zakat) is not spent in this manner; rather it is for the categories Allah the Exalted named. Imam Abu Ishaq al-Marwazi from our companions said it is permissible to spend it from the camels of Zakat based on this Hadith, taking its apparent meaning. The majority of our companions and others said: Its meaning is that he bought it from the people of Sadaqah after they had owned it, then he paid it as a donation to the family of the slain. Al-Nawawi said: The chosen view is what we related from the majority, that he bought it from the camels of Sadaqah.

text: Book of Oaths and Vows 778 - Whoever swears an oath then sees something else better than it. The Hadith of Abu Huraira, may Allah be pleased with him: "Whoever swears an oath then sees something better than it, so he does what is better, then that is its expiation" (1). It was said to Imam Ahmad: Yahya bin Sa'id narrated from Yahya bin Ubaidullah. He said: He abandoned him after that, and he deserved that. His Hadiths are Manakir (denounced), and his father is not known (2).
foot_note:
1. (1) Recorded by Al-Bayhaqi in his "Sunan" 10/34, he said: Abu Bakr bin al-Harith al-Asbahani informed us, Abu Muhammad bin Hayyan informed us, Hamid bin Shu'ayb told us, Surayj told us, Hushaim told us, from Yahya bin Ubaidullah, from his father, from Abu Huraira, in a Marfu' form with it.
2. "Sunan Abi Dawud" 3/379, "Sunan Al-Bayhaqi" 10/34. Benefit: Abu Dawud said in "Al-Sunan" 3/379: All the Hadiths from the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, are: "And let him expiate for his oath," except in what is not significant. I say: This is from the aspect that Al-Bukhari recorded (6623) from the path of Abu Burdah from his father who said: I came to the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, among a group of Ash'aris... And in it: "And indeed I, by Allah—if Allah wills—do not swear an oath and then see other than it better than it, except that I expiate for my oath and do what is better, -or- I do what is better and expiate for my oath."

publisher: Dar Al-Falah for Scientific Research and Heritage Verification, Fayoum - Arab Republic of Egypt
text: 779 - What has been reported regarding making an exception (saying InshaAllah) in an oath. The Hadith of Ibn Umar, may Allah be pleased with them both: "Whoever swears and says: 'If Allah wills,' there is no breaking of the oath (Hinth) upon him" (1). Imam Ahmad said: Ayyub raised it (to the Prophet), and the people opposed him—Ubaidullah and others—so they stopped it (made it Mawquf) (2). 780 - What has been reported regarding a vow of disobedience and its expiation. The Hadith of Aisha, may Allah be pleased with her: "There is no vow in disobedience to Allah, and its expiation is the expiation of an oath" (3).
foot_note:
1. (1) Recorded by Al-Tirmidhi (1531), he said: Mahmud bin Ghaylan told us, Abdul Samad bin Abdul Warith told us, my father and Hammad bin Salamah told me, from Ayyub, from Nafi', from Ibn Umar in a Marfu' form with it.
2. "Sharh Ilal al-Tirmidhi" by Ibn Rajab (241-242), "Masa'il Harb" p. 462-463. I say: There is a witness regarding the exception recorded by Al-Bukhari (5242) from the path of Abd al-Razzaq, Ma'mar informed us, from Ibn Tawus, from his father, from Abu Huraira who said: Solomon son of David, peace be upon him, said: I will surely go around tonight to one hundred women, each woman giving birth to a boy who fights in the path of Allah. The angel said to him: Say: If Allah wills. But he did not say it, and he forgot. So he went around to them, and none of them gave birth except one woman to half a human. The Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said: "Had he said: If Allah wills, he would not have broken his oath and it would have been more likely to fulfill his need." I say: Abu Isa al-Tirmidhi said: The Hadith of Ibn Umar is a Hasan Hadith. Ubaidullah bin Umar and others narrated it from Nafi', from Ibn Umar as Mawquf. Likewise, it was narrated from Salim, from Ibn Umar, may Allah be pleased with them both, as Mawquf. We do not know of anyone who raised it except Ayyub al-Sakhtiyani. Isma'il bin Ibrahim said: Ayyub used to raise it sometimes and sometimes he would not raise it. The practice upon this according to most people of knowledge among the Companions of the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, and others is that if the exception is connected to the oath, there is no breaking of the oath upon him. It is the saying of Sufyan al-Thawri, Al-Awza'i, Malik bin Anas, Abdullah bin al-Mubarak, Al-Shafi'i, Ahmad, and Ishaq.
3. Recorded by Al-Tirmidhi (524), he said: Qutaibah told us, Abu Safwan told us, from Yunus bin Yazid, from Ibn Shihab, from Abu Salamah, from Aisha in a Marfu' form with it.

text: Imam Ahmad said: They spoiled the Hadith of Al-Zuhri for us—meaning: the Hadith of Al-Zuhri from Abu Salamah, from Aisha, from the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace. They said: From Sulayman bin Arqam—meaning they said: From Al-Zuhri from Sulayman bin Arqam—from Yahya bin Kathir, from Abu Salamah (1). It was said to Ahmad: So the spoiling of the Hadith is correct according to you, and it was only narrated—meaning: by Ibn Abi Uways? Ahmad said: Ayyub—meaning: Ibn Sulayman—was more exemplary than him. Abu Dawud said: Ayyub from Sulayman bin Bilal (2). And he said once: This is a Munkar Hadith (3). 781 - What has been reported regarding one who vows to walk to the Kaaba. The Hadith of Ibn Abbas, may Allah be pleased with them both: "Indeed, Allah is free of need (Ghani) from her vow; command her to ride" (4). Imam Ahmad said: So-and-so and So-and-so say from Ikrimah: Mursal... - meaning:
foot_note:
1. (1) Recorded by Al-Tirmidhi (1525), he said: Abu Isma'il al-Tirmidhi, and his name is Muhammad bin Isma'il bin Yusuf, told us, Ayyub bin Sulayman bin Bilal told us, Abu Bakr bin Abi Uways told us, from Sulayman bin Bilal, from Musa bin Uqbah and Abdullah bin Abi Atiq, from Al-Zuhri, from Sulayman bin Arqam, from Yahya bin Abi Kathir, from Abu Salamah, from Aisha in a Marfu' form with it.
2. "Masa'il Abi Dawud" (1897), "Sunan Abi Dawud" (3291).
3. "Al-Frusiyah" by Ibn al-Qayyim p. 201.
4. Recorded by Abu Dawud (3297), he said: Muslim bin Ibrahim told us, Hisham told us, from Qatada, from Ikrimah, from Ibn Abbas that when the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, was informed that the sister of Uqbah bin Amir vowed to perform Hajj walking... The Hadith.

And he said once: Ruh says (2): Yahya bin Ayyub, and Ibn Bakr and Abd al-Razzaq say: Sa'id bin Abi Ayyub (3), meaning they say: from Ibn Jurayj from them (4).

text: Book of Salutation (Salam) 782 - What has been reported regarding the virtue of Salam. The Hadith of Imran bin Husayn, may Allah be pleased with him: A man came to the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, and said: Al-Salamu Alaykum. He replied to him, then he sat down. He said: "Ten." Then another came and said: Al-Salamu Alaykum wa Rahmatullah. He replied to him, then he sat down. He said: "Twenty." Then another came and said: Al-Salamu Alaykum wa Rahmatullah wa Barakatuh. He replied to him, then he sat down. He said: "Thirty" (1). Imam Ahmad said: Hawdhah told us, from Awf, from Abu Raja' as Mursal. And others said likewise (2). 783 - What has been reported regarding shaking hands (Musafahah). The Hadith of Anas, may Allah be pleased with him: Do we bow to one another? He said: "No." We said: Do we embrace one another? He said: "No, but shake hands" (3). Imam Ahmad denounced it (4).
foot_note:
1. (1) Recorded by Ahmad 4/339, he said: Muhammad bin Kathir—brother of Sulayman bin Kathir—told us, Ja'far bin Sulayman told us, from Awf, from Abu Raja' al-Utardi, from Imran... so he mentioned it.
2. "Musnad Ahmad" 4/440.
3. Recorded by Ibn Majah (3702), he said: Ali bin Muhammad told us, Waki' told us, from Jarir bin Hazim, from Hanzalah bin Abdul Rahman al-Sadusi, from Anas bin Malik, who said: We said: O Messenger of Allah... The Hadith.
4. "Al-Talkhis al-Habir" 3/149, "Bahr al-Dam" (239), "Ilal al-Marwazi" (468), "Al-Jarh wa al-Ta'dil" 3/241, "Du'afa al-Uqayli" 1/289-290, "Tahdhib al-Kamal" 7/449.

text: 784 - What has been reported regarding standing for a comer and greeting him. The Hadith of Abu Juhayfah, may Allah be pleased with him, regarding standing for the comer, greeting them, and embracing them (1). Imam Ahmad said: Munkar. And he said: Makhlad:—meaning: he was not a Hafiz, I wrote from him in Mecca (2). 785 - What has been reported regarding a man greeting with one finger. The Hadith of Jabir, may Allah be pleased with him: "A man greeting with one finger, pointing with it, is the action of the Jews" (3). Imam Ahmad said: This is a Munkar Hadith; he denied it severely. And he said: This is fabricated (Mawdu'). Or: It is as if it is fabricated. And he said: We see him imagining these Hadiths—meaning: Uthman bin Muhammad bin Abi Shaybah (4).
foot_note:
1. (1) I say: Perhaps it is what Ibn Hibban recorded in his "Sahih" 19/282, he said: Muhammad bin Umar bin Yusuf informed us, Yusuf bin Musa told us, Waki' told us, Mis'ar bin Kidam told us, from Awn bin Abi Juhayfah, from his father, who said: I entered upon the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, I and two men from Bani Amir. He said: "Who are you?" We said: From Bani Amir. The Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said: "Welcome to you, you are from me."
2. "Masa'il Harb" p. 314.
3. Recorded by Al-Tabarani in "Al-Awsat" 5/19, he said: Abdullah bin Najiyah told us, he said: Uthman bin Abi Shaybah told us, he said: Abu Khalid al-Ahmar told us, from Thawr bin Yazid, from Abu al-Zubayr, from Jabir in a Marfu' form with it.
4. "Al-Ilal" narration of Abdullah (1331), "Al-Du'afa" by Al-Uqayli 3/223, "Mizan al-I'tidal" 4/433.

text: 786 - What has been reported regarding the dislike of saying: "Alaykas-Salam" (Upon you be peace) when initiating. The Hadith of Abu Tamimah al-Hujaymi, may Allah be pleased with him: "Do not say 'Alaykas-Salam', for it is the greeting of the dead" (1). Imam Ahmad said: This is from the strange narrations (Ghara'ib) of Al-Jurayri (2). 787 - What has been reported regarding replying to the People of the Book. The Hadith of Abu Abd al-Rahman al-Juhani, may Allah be pleased with him: "I am riding tomorrow to the Jews, so do not initiate the greeting with them. If they greet you, say: Wa Alaykum (And upon you)" (3). Imam Ahmad said: He—meaning Ibn Ishaq—was opposed by Abdul Hamid bin Ja'far and Ibn Lahi'ah (4), they said: From Abu Basrah. Abu Asim told us, from Abdul Hamid bin Ja'far
foot_note:
1. (1) Recorded by Ahmad in "Al-Musnad" 3/482-483, he said: Isma'il bin Ibrahim told us, he said: Sa'id al-Jurayri told us, from Abu Salil, from Abu Tamimah al-Hujaymi. Isma'il said once: From Abu Tamimah al-Hujaymi from a man of his people, he said: I met the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, on some of the roads of Medina, and he was wearing a cotton waist-wrapper with a loose hem. I said: Upon you be peace, O Messenger of Allah. He said: "Indeed 'Upon you be peace' is the greeting of the dead, indeed 'Upon you be peace' is the greeting of the dead, indeed 'Upon you be peace' is the greeting of the dead. Peace be upon you, Peace be upon you..." The Hadith.
2. "Siyar A'lam al-Nubala" 6/155.
3. Recorded by Ahmad 4/144, he said: Muhammad bin Abi Adi told us, from Ibn Ishaq, he said: Yazid bin Abi Habib told me, from Marthad bin Abdullah al-Yazani, from Abu Abd al-Rahman al-Juhani... The Hadith.
4. The Hadith of Abdul Hamid bin Ja'far was recorded by Al-Tabarani in "Al-Kabir" 2/277, he said: Abu Muslim al-Kashshi told us, Abu Asim told us, from Abdul Hamid bin Ja'far, from Yazid bin Abi Habib, from Marthad bin Abdullah al-Yazani, from Abu Basrah al-Ghifari, in a Marfu' form with it.
