publisher: Dar Al-Falah for Scientific Research and Heritage Verification, Fayoum - Arab Republic of Egypt
text:
The Book of Supplications and Remembrance (Adhkar)

788 - What came regarding the virtue of the remembrance of Allah, Mighty and Majestic.
The Hadith of Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him): "Indeed, Allah has angels roaming the earth..." The Hadith (1).
Imam Ahmad said: Muhammad bin Ja'far narrated to us, Shu'bah narrated to us, from Sulayman, from Dhakwan, from Abu Hurairah, and he did not raise it [to the Prophet] (2).
foot_note:
1. (1) Reported by Ahmad in his "Musnad" 2/251-252, he said: Abu Mu'awiyah narrated to us, Al-A'mash narrated to us, from Abu Salih, from Abu Hurairah or from Abu Sa'id - meaning Al-A'mash doubted - he said: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: "Indeed, Allah has angels roaming the earth, in addition to the scribes of people. So when they find a people remembering Allah, they call out: 'Come to your objective!' So they come and surround them up to the lowest heaven. Then Allah says: 'What did you leave My servants doing?' They say: 'We left them praising You, glorifying You, and remembering You.' He says: 'Have they seen Me?' They say: 'No.' He says: 'So how would it be if they saw Me?' They say: 'If they saw You, they would be more intense in praising, glorifying, and remembering.' He says: 'So what do they seek?' They say: 'They seek Paradise.' He says: 'And have they seen it?' He says: They say: 'No.' He says: 'So how would it be if they saw it?' They say: 'If they saw it, they would be more eager for it and more seeking of it.' He says: 'So what do they seek refuge from?' They say: 'From the Fire.' He says: 'And have they seen it?' They say: 'No.' He says: 'So how would it be if they saw it?' They say: 'If they saw it, they would be fleeing from it more intensely and fearing it more.' He says: 'So I make you witnesses that I have forgiven them.' He says: They say: 'Indeed, among them is so-and-so the sinner; he did not intend them, he only came for a need.' He says: 'They are the people whose companion will not be miserable."
2. "Musnad Ahmad" 2/252. I say: And the text is established; Al-Bukhari reported it (6408) from the Hadith of Abu Hurairah with similar wording.

book_title: The Collection of Imam Ahmad's Sciences - Ills of Hadith
publisher: Dar Al-Falah for Scientific Research and Heritage Verification, Fayoum - Arab Republic of Egypt
text:
789 - What came regarding supplication with the palms of the hands.
The Hadith of Abdur-Rahman bin Muhayriz (may Allah be pleased with him): "When you ask Allah, ask Him with the palms of your hands and do not ask Him with the backs of them" (1).
Imam Ahmad said: Abdur-Rahman bin Abdullah bin Muhayriz; Isma'il bin Ayyash As-Saffar narrated from him. Abu Qilabah only narrates from Abdullah bin Muhayriz, but thus said Khalid (2).

790 - What came regarding supplication by intercession (Tawassul) through righteous deeds.
The Hadith of Anas (may Allah be pleased with him): The long Hadith of the Companions of the Cave (3).
foot_note:
1. (1) Reported by Ibn Abi Shaybah in his "Musannaf" 7/64 [Al-Fikr edition], he said: Hafs bin Ghiyath narrated to us, from Khalid, from Abu Qilabah, from Ibn Muhayriz, raised (Marfu') with it.
2. "Al-Ilal" narration of Abdullah (2227).
3. Reported by Ahmad in "Al-Musnad" 3/142-143, he said: Yahya bin Hammad narrated to us, Abu Awanah narrated to us, from Qatada, from Anas, from the Prophet (peace be upon him): "Three men from among the people before you set out searching for their families, then the rain overtook them, so they entered a cave. A rock fell from the mountain blocking the cave on them, until they could see no opening from it. Some of them said to others: The rock has fallen and traces are wiped out, and no one knows your place except Allah (Mighty and Majestic), so invoke Allah (Blessed and Exalted) by your most trustworthy deeds." He said: So one of them said: 'O Allah, if You know that I had two parents, and I used to milk for them in their vessel, then come to them. If I found them sleeping, I would stand at their heads, disliking to wake them from their sleep, until they woke up whenever they woke up. O Allah, if You know that I did that only hoping for Your mercy and fearing Your punishment, then relieve us.' So one-third of the rock moved. The other said: 'O Allah, if You know that I hired a worker for a job he did, then he came to me asking for his wage and I was angry so I rebuked him. He left and abandoned his wage. So I gathered it and invested it until it became all this wealth. Then he came to me asking for his wage...' The Hadith.

book_title: The Collection of Imam Ahmad's Sciences - Ills of Hadith
publisher: Dar Al-Falah for Scientific Research and Heritage Verification, Fayoum - Arab Republic of Egypt
text:
Imam Ahmad said: Bahz narrated it from Abu Awanah and did not raise it [to the Prophet] (1).

791 - What came regarding the virtue of a parent's supplication for his child.
The Hadith of Anas (may Allah be pleased with him): "The supplication of a parent for his child is like the supplication of the Prophet (peace be upon him) for his Ummah" (2).
Imam Ahmad said: This Hadith is false (Batil) and denounced (Munkar), and Sa'd Abu Habib's Hadith is worth nothing (3).
foot_note:
1. (1) "Musnad Ahmad" 3/143. I say: And the text of the Hadith is established; Al-Bukhari reported it (2272) from the Hadith of Abdullah bin Umar (may Allah be pleased with him).
2. Reported by Abu Nu'aym in "Tarikh Asbahan" 1/226, he said: My father narrated to us, Muhammad bin Ahmad bin Yazid narrated to us, Ibrahim bin Ma'mar narrated to us, Zuraiq Al-Himsi narrated to us, Yahya bin Sa'id Al-Umawi narrated to us, Khalaf bin Habib Ar-Raqashi narrated to us, I heard Anas bin Malik saying: ... so he mentioned it raised (Marfu').
3. "Masa'il Ibn Hani" (2371), "Al-Mawdu'at" by Ibn al-Jawzi 3/87, "Al-Muntakhab min Al-Ilal lil-Khallal" (207).

book_title: The Collection of Imam Ahmad's Sciences - Ills of Hadith
publisher: Dar Al-Falah for Scientific Research and Heritage Verification, Fayoum - Arab Republic of Egypt
text:
792 - What came regarding the child's supplication for his deceased parent.
The Hadith of Abu Qatadah (may Allah be pleased with him): "The best of what a man leaves behind after him are three: a righteous child who supplicates for him, a charity that continues whose reward reaches him, and knowledge that is acted upon after him" (1).
Imam Ahmad said: Zaid bin Aslam from Ibn Abu Qatadah; how strange (Gharib) this Hadith is. It was said to him: Did Zaid bin Abi Anisah hear from Zaid bin Aslam? He said: I do not know (2).

793 - What came regarding the supplication of the Prophet (peace be upon him) for Aslam.
The Hadith of Jabir (may Allah be pleased with him): "Aslam, may Allah keep it safe (salamaha)" (3).
Imam Ahmad denied it very strongly.
foot_note:
1. (1) Reported by Ibn Majah (241), he said: Isma'il bin Abi Karima Al-Harrani narrated to us, Muhammad bin Salamah narrated to us, from Abu Abdur-Rahim, Zaid bin Abi Anisah narrated to me, from Zaid bin Aslam, from Abdullah bin Abu Qatadah, from his father, raised (Marfu') with it.
2. "Al-Wuquf wat-Tarajjul" from "Al-Jami'" by Al-Khallal (85). I say: And the text has an authentic witness; Muslim reported it (1631) from the Hadith of Abu Hurairah that the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: "When a human being dies, his deeds are cut off except for three: except for a continuing charity, or knowledge from which benefit is derived, or a righteous child who supplicates for him."
3. Reported by Abu Nu'aym in "Al-Hilyah" 7/316, he said: Al-Qadi Abu Ahmad Muhammad bin Ahmad narrated to us, Ibrahim narrated to us, Al-Husain bin Isma'il narrated to us, Ishaq bin Bahlul narrated to us, Yahya bin Al-Husain narrated to us, from Ibn Uyainah, from Amr bin Dinar, from Jabir, raised (Marfu') with it.

book_title: The Collection of Imam Ahmad's Sciences - Ills of Hadith
publisher: Dar Al-Falah for Scientific Research and Heritage Verification, Fayoum - Arab Republic of Egypt
text:
He said: This is Abdullah bin Dinar from Ibn Umar (1); look at from whom the delusion came (2).

794 - What came regarding the supplication of the Arabian horse.
The Hadith of Abu Dharr (may Allah be pleased with him): "There is no Arabian horse but that it is permitted for it with every dawn to supplicate with two supplications, saying: O Allah, You have entrusted me to whom You have entrusted me from the sons of Adam, so make me among the most beloved of his family and wealth to him, or the most beloved of his family and wealth to him" (3).
Imam Ahmad said: Amr bin Al-Harith opposed him and said: From Yazid from Abdur-Rahman bin Shamasah. And he said: Layth from Ibn Shamasah as well (4).
foot_note:
1. (1) Reported by Muslim (2518), he said: Yahya bin Yahya, Yahya bin Ayyub, Qutaibah, and Ibn Hujr narrated to us. Yahya bin Yahya said: We were informed. And the others said: Isma'il bin Ja'far narrated to us, from Abdullah bin Dinar that he heard Ibn Umar saying: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: "Ghifar, may Allah forgive it; and Aslam, may Allah keep it safe; and Usayyah has disobeyed Allah and His Messenger."
2. "Ilal Al-Marudhi" (264).
3. Reported by Ahmad in "Al-Musnad" 1/170, he said: Yahya bin Sa'id narrated to us, from Abdul-Hamid bin Ja'far, Yazid bin Abi Habib narrated to me, from Suwaid bin Qais, from Mu'awiyah bin Hudayj, from Abu Dharr raised (Marfu') with it.
4. "Musnad Ahmad" 1/170, "Al-Ilal" narration of Abdullah (5777).

book_title: The Collection of Imam Ahmad's Sciences - Ills of Hadith
publisher: Dar Al-Falah for Scientific Research and Heritage Verification, Fayoum - Arab Republic of Egypt
text:
795 - What came regarding the supplication of the marketplace.
The Hadith of Umar (may Allah be pleased with him): "Whoever enters the market and says: 'There is no deity but Allah alone, He has no partner, to Him belongs the dominion and to Him belongs the praise, He gives life and causes death, and He is Living and does not die, in His Hand is the good, and He is over all things omnipotent,' Allah writes for him a million good deeds, erases from him a million bad deeds, and raises him a million degrees."
It was said to Imam Ahmad: Yahya bin Sulaym, from Imran Al-Qasir, from Abdullah bin Dinar, from Ibn Umar (1) from the Prophet (peace be upon him): "Whoever says in a market of the Muslims' markets" like the Hadith of the steward of the family of Az-Zubayr? (2).
Ahmad said: Imran did not narrate from Abdullah bin Dinar, and this is a Munkar (denounced) Hadith. It was said to him: Perhaps it is other than that; meaning: perhaps this Imran is other than Imran bin Muslim Abu Bakr Al-Basri Al-Qasir? So Ahmad remained silent (3).
foot_note:
1. (1) Reported by Al-Hakim in "Al-Mustadrak" 1/538, he said: Abu Bakr bin Ishaq narrated it to us, Ali bin Muhammad bin Abdul-Malik bin Abi Ash-Shawarib informed us, from Abdullah bin Abdul-Wahhab Al-Hajabi, Yahya bin Sulaym Al-Makki narrated to us, Imran bin Muslim narrated to us, from Abdullah bin Dinar, from Ibn Umar (may Allah be pleased with them both) who said: ... The Hadith.
2. Reported by At-Tirmidhi (3429), he said: Ahmad bin Abdah Ad-Dabbi narrated that to us, Hammad bin Zaid and Al-Mu'tamir bin Sulayman narrated to us, they said: Amr bin Dinar - and he is the steward of the family of Az-Zubayr - narrated to us, from Salim bin Abdullah bin Umar, from his father, from his grandfather that the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: ... The Hadith.
3. "Masa'il Abi Dawud" (1879).

book_title: The Collection of Imam Ahmad's Sciences - Ills of Hadith
publisher: Dar Al-Falah for Scientific Research and Heritage Verification, Fayoum - Arab Republic of Egypt
text:
796 - What came regarding supplicating for the completion of favor (Ni'mah).
The Hadith of Mu'adh bin Jabal (may Allah be pleased with him) who said: The Prophet (peace be upon him) passed by a man who was saying: O Allah, indeed I ask You for patience. He said: "You have asked for trial, so ask Allah for well-being (Afiyah)." He said: And he passed by a man saying: O Allah, indeed I ask You for the completion of favor. He said: "O son of Adam, do you know what the completion of favor is?" He said: A supplication I made hoping for good by it. He said: "Indeed, the completion of favor is salvation from the Fire and entering Paradise" (1).
Imam Ahmad said: If Al-Jurayri had not narrated anything but this Hadith, it would have been [enough] (2).

797 - What came regarding transgression in supplication.
The Hadith of Sa'd bin Abi Waqqas (may Allah be pleased with him): "There will be a people who will transgress in supplication" (3).
Imam Ahmad said: Its chain is not established, meaning: Ziyad bin Mikhraq (4).
foot_note:
1. (1) Reported by Ahmad 5/231, he said: Abdur-Razzaq narrated to us, Sufyan narrated to us, from Sa'id Al-Jurayri, from Abu Al-Ward - meaning: Ibn Thumamah - H. And Yazid bin Harun, Al-Jurayri informed us, from Abu Al-Ward Ibn Thumamah, both from Al-Lajlaj, from Mu'adh bin Jabal... The Hadith.
2. "Al-Ilal" by Abdullah bin Ahmad (506), (1433).
3. Reported by Abu Dawud (1480), he said: Musaddad narrated to us, Yahya narrated to us, from Shu'bah, from Ziyad bin Mikhraq, from Abu Na'amah, from a son of Sa'd that he said: My father heard me saying: O Allah, I ask You for Paradise, its delights, its splendor, and such and such, and I seek refuge in You from the Fire, its chains, its shackles, and such and such. So he said: O my son, indeed I heard the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) say: ... so he mentioned it.
4. "Tahdhib al-Kamal" 9/509, "Tahdhib al-Tahdhib" 2/224.

book_title: The Collection of Imam Ahmad's Sciences - Ills of Hadith
publisher: Dar Al-Falah for Scientific Research and Heritage Verification, Fayoum - Arab Republic of Egypt
text:
798 - What came regarding the non-acceptance of supplication.
The Hadith of Abu Musa (may Allah be pleased with him): "Three supplicate but are not answered" (1).
Imam Ahmad said: It is not connected (Musnad) with us, and Ghundar narrated it to us unconnected (2).

799 - What came regarding wiping the face with the hands after finishing supplication.
There are three Hadiths in it:
The First: The Hadith of Umar bin Al-Khattab (may Allah be pleased with him): When the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) raised his hands in supplication, he would not put them down until he wiped his face with them (3).
Imam Ahmad said: I have not heard of it. And he said once: I have not heard anything regarding it. And Ahmad did not use to do it (4).
foot_note:
1. (1) Reported by Al-Hakim 2/302, he said: Ali bin Hamshadh Al-Adl narrated to us, Abu Al-Muthanna Mu'adh bin Mu'adh Al-Anbari narrated to us, my father narrated to us, Shu'bah narrated to us, from Firas, from Ash-Sha'bi, from Abu Burdah, from Abu Musa Al-Ash'ari (may Allah be pleased with him), from the Prophet (peace be upon him) who said: "Three supplicate to Allah but are not answered: A man who has a wife of bad character but does not divorce her, and a man who has money owed by a man but did not have it witnessed, and a man who gave his money to a fool, while Allah the Exalted has said: {And do not give the foolish your property}."
2. "Masa'il Harb" p. 457.
3. Reported by At-Tirmidhi (3395), he said: Abu Musa Muhammad bin Al-Muthanna and Ibrahim bin Ya'qub and more than one narrated to us, they said: Hammad bin Isa Al-Juhani narrated to us, from Hanzalah bin Abu Sufyan Al-Jumahi, from Salim bin Abdullah, from his father, from Umar bin Al-Khattab, raised (Marfu') with it.
4. "Masa'il Abi Dawud" (486). Issue: The scholars differed regarding the legitimacy of wiping the face after supplication on several opinions: First: It is not prescribed, and Al-Izz said: It is an innovation. Among those who said it is not prescribed are Malik, Ahmad =

publisher: Dar Al-Falah for Scientific Research and Heritage Verification, Fayoum - Arab Republic of Egypt
text:
The Second: The Hadith of Yazid bin As-Sa'ib (may Allah be pleased with him), similar to it (1).
Imam Ahmad said: I reckon that Qutaibah erred in it; they say from Khallad bin As-Sa'ib from his father (2).
The Third: The Hadith of Ibn Abbas (may Allah be pleased with them both), similar to it (3).
Imam Ahmad said: This - that he used to wipe his face after supplication - is not known except from Al-Hasan (4).

800 - What came regarding Tasbih (glorification of Allah).
The Hadith of Abu Hurairah as Mawquf: I glorify Allah in the day and night twelve thousand times according to my religion/debt (5).
foot_note:
1. = and Ibn Al-Mubarak and Al-Bayhaqi in prayer, and it is attributed to some Shafi'is, and it is a narration according to Hanbali scholars inside prayer, and according to some of them inside and outside. Second: It is recommended inside and outside prayer, and this is according to some Shafi'is and Hanbalis. Third: It is recommended outside prayer but not inside it, and this is a view in the Shafi'i school.
1. Reported by Abu Dawud (1492), he said: Qutaibah bin Sa'id narrated to us, Ibn Lahi'ah narrated to us, from Hafs bin Hashim bin Utbah bin Abu Waqqas, from As-Sa'ib bin Yazid, from his father, raised (Marfu') with it.
2. "Musnad Ahmad" 4/221.
3. Reported by Abu Dawud (1485), he said: Abdullah bin Salamah narrated to us, Abdul-Malik bin Muhammad bin Ayman narrated to us, from Abdullah bin Ya'qub bin Ishaq, from someone who narrated to him from Muhammad bin Ka'b Al-Qurazi, Abdullah bin Abbas narrated to me raised (Marfu') with it.
4. "Al-Ilal Al-Mutanahiyah" 2/357.
5. Reported by Abu Nu'aym in "Al-Hilyah" 1/383, he said: Abu Bakr bin Malik narrated to us, Abdullah bin Ahmad bin Hanbal narrated to us, my father and Ibrahim bin Ziyad narrated to us, they said: Isma'il bin Ulayyah narrated to us, from Khalid =

It was said to him: Is it in the Hadith from Abu Hurairah, or the saying of Ikrimah, or from someone below him?
Imam Ahmad said: The Hadith is from Abu Hurairah (1).
foot_note:
1. = Al-Hadhdha, from Ikrimah, who said: Abu Hurairah said: Indeed I seek forgiveness from Allah and repent to Him every day twelve thousand times, and that is according to my debt or according to his religion.
1. "Masa'il Salih" (686).

text:
The Book of Tribulations (Fitan)

801 - What came regarding the destruction of this Ummah.
There are two paths from Abu Hurairah:
The First: From Malik bin Zalim from him: "The destruction of my Ummah is at the hands of young men from Quraysh" (1).
Imam Ahmad said: It is known, except that Abdur-Rahman bin Mahdi used to err in it, saying: Abdullah bin Zalim, but it is only Malik bin Zalim. It was said to him: Did you hear it from him? He said: Yes (2).
The Second: From Abu Zur'ah from him: "This clan from Quraysh will destroy my Ummah." They said: What do you command us, O Messenger of Allah? He said: "If only the people would withdraw from them" (3).
Imam Ahmad said: Strike out this Hadith; for it contradicts the Hadiths from the Prophet (peace be upon him) - meaning: his saying: "Listen and obey and be patient" (4). Al-Marudhi said: And I had heard him say: It is a bad Hadith used as proof by
foot_note:
1. (1) Reported by Ahmad 2/304, he said: Abdur-Rahman narrated to us, Sufyan narrated to us, from Simak, Abdullah bin Zalim narrated to us, he said: I heard Abu Hurairah say: I heard my beloved Abu Al-Qasim (peace be upon him) say: ... The Hadith.
2. "Al-Muntakhab" by Ibn Qudamah (81).
3. Reported by Al-Bukhari (3604) and Muslim (2917), and the wording is Al-Bukhari's: Muhammad bin Abdur-Rahim narrated to us, Abu Ma'mar Isma'il bin Ibrahim narrated to us, Abu Usamah narrated to us, Shu'bah narrated to us, from Abu At-Tayyah, from Abu Zur'ah, from Abu Hurairah, raised (Marfu') with it.
4. "Al-Frusiyyah" p. 204, "Khasa'is Al-Musnad" by Al-Madini p. 24.

book_title: The Collection of Imam Ahmad's Sciences - Ills of Hadith
publisher: Dar Al-Falah for Scientific Research and Heritage Verification, Fayoum - Arab Republic of Egypt
text:
the Mu'tazilah to abandon Jumu'ah (1).

802 - What came regarding the phases of this Ummah.
The Hadith of Abu Hurairah: "This Ummah will act for a period according to the Book of Allah, then act for a period according to the Sunnah of the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him), then act for a period according to opinion. When they act [according to opinion], they have gone astray and led others astray" (2).
Imam Ahmad said: This is a very Munkar (denounced) Hadith (3).

803 - What came regarding the shedding of blood.
The Hadith of Umm Habibah: That the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: "I was shown what my Ummah will encounter after me, and the shedding of blood of some of them by others. And that was preordained by Allah, so I asked Him to grant me intercession regarding them, and He did" (4).
foot_note:
1. (1) "Al-Muntakhab" by Ibn Qudamah (84). I say: Perhaps this Hadith is among the Ghara'ib (strange narrations) of the Hadith of Shu'bah as indicated by Al-Hafiz in "Al-Fath" 6/712.
2. Reported by Abdullah bin Ahmad in "Al-Ilal" (1090) and via his path Al-Uqayli in "Ad-Du'afa" 1/207, he said: Abdullah bin Ahmad narrated to us, from Jabarah Al-Kufi, from Hammad Al-Abh, from Az-Zuhri, from Sa'id bin Al-Musayyib, from Abu Hurairah... The Hadith.
3. "Ad-Du'afa" by Al-Uqayli 1/207, "Al-Ilal" narration of Abdullah (1090), "Al-Muntakhab" by Ibn Qudamah (78).
4. Reported by Imam Ahmad 6/428, he said: Abu Al-Yaman narrated to us, Shu'aib bin Abi Hamzah informed us - so he mentioned this Hadith following the Hadiths of Ibn Abi Husain - and he said: Anas bin Malik informed us, from Umm Habibah, from the Prophet (peace be upon him)... The Hadith.

book_title: The Collection of Imam Ahmad's Sciences - Ills of Hadith
publisher: Dar Al-Falah for Scientific Research and Heritage Verification, Fayoum - Arab Republic of Egypt
text:
Imam Ahmad said: Munkar (1).
Imam Ahmad said: When it was said to him that people narrate it from Abu Al-Yaman, from Shu'aib, from Az-Zuhri. He said: This is not from the Hadith of Az-Zuhri, it is only from the Hadith of Ibn Abi Husain (2).
And he said once: There is no basis for this Hadith from Az-Zuhri, and the book of Shu'aib from Ibn Abi Husain was attached to the book of Az-Zuhri. As if he meant that it got mixed with the book of Az-Zuhri, so he used to excuse Abu Al-Yaman and not hold it against him (3).

804 - What came regarding the lifting of adornment.
The Hadith of Abdur-Rahman bin Awf (may Allah be pleased with him): "The adornment of the world will be lifted after one hundred and twenty-five years" (4).
Imam Ahmad said: This is very Munkar. Ibn Abi Fudaik did not care from whom he narrated (5).
foot_note:
1. (1) "Tahdhib al-Kamal" 7/151.
2. "Musnad Ahmad" 6/428, "Siyar A'lam al-Nubala" 10/322, "Tahdhib al-Kamal" 7/152, "Tarikh Abi Zur'ah" (214).
3. "Tahdhib al-Kamal" 7/152, "Tahdhib al-Tahdhib" 1/583, "As-Siyar" 10/323.
4. Reported by Abu Ya'la 2/160-161, he said: Abu Ghurayb Muhammad bin Al-Ala bin Ghurayb Al-Hamdani narrated to us, Ibn Abi Fudaik narrated to us, Abdul-Malik bin Zaid bin Sa'id bin Nufail narrated to us from Mus'ab bin Mus'ab, from Ibn Shihab, from Abu Salamah bin Abdur-Rahman bin Awf, from his father, raised (Marfu') with it.
5. "Al-Muntakhab" by Ibn Qudamah (189).

book_title: The Collection of Imam Ahmad's Sciences - Ills of Hadith
publisher: Dar Al-Falah for Scientific Research and Heritage Verification, Fayoum - Arab Republic of Egypt
text:
805 - What came regarding the severity of the affliction.
The Hadith of Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him): "You are today in a time where whoever acts upon one-tenth of what he is commanded is saved" (1).
Imam Ahmad was asked about this Hadith and he did not recognize it (2).

806 - What came regarding the people of Medina leaving it when afflictions occur.
The Hadith of Umar bin Al-Khattab (may Allah be pleased with him): "A rider will surely pass by the side of the valley of Medina (3) and say: There were once many believers present here."
Imam Ahmad said: And Hasan (4) Al-Ashyab did not report it to Jabir (5).
foot_note:
1. (1) Reported by Abu Nu'aym in "Al-Hilyah" 7/316, he said: Abdullah bin Ja'far narrated to us, Isma'il bin Abdullah narrated to us, Nu'aym bin Hammad narrated to us, from Sufyan bin Uyainah, from Abu Az-Zinad, from Al-A'raj, from Abu Hurairah, raised (Marfu') with it.
2. "Al-Muntakhab" by Ibn Qudamah (36).
3. Reported by Ahmad 1/20, he said: Yahya bin Ishaq narrated to us, Ibn Lahi'ah narrated to us, from Abu Az-Zubayr, from Jabir, he said: Umar bin Al-Khattab informed me, he said: I heard the Prophet (peace be upon him) say: ... The Hadith.
4. Reported by Ahmad 3/341, he said: Hasan narrated to us, Ibn Lahi'ah narrated to us, Abu Az-Zubayr narrated to us, from Jabir that the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: ... The Hadith.
5. "Musnad Ahmad" 1/20. I say: It has a witness in Al-Bukhari (1874) from the Hadith of Abu Hurairah who said: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: "You will leave Medina in the best state it was, covered by nothing but Al-Awafi - meaning: beasts of prey and birds - and the last to be gathered will be two shepherds from Muzainah intending Medina, calling out to their sheep, and they will find it wild (deserted), until they reach Thaniyyat Al-Wada', they will fall on their faces."

book_title: The Collection of Imam Ahmad's Sciences - Ills of Hadith
publisher: Dar Al-Falah for Scientific Research and Heritage Verification, Fayoum - Arab Republic of Egypt
text:
807 - What came regarding the disparagement of those born after the hundred.
The Hadith of Sakhr bin Qudamah (may Allah be pleased with him): "No newborn will be born after one hundred years who Allah has a need for" (1).
Imam Ahmad said: It is not authentic, and it is Munkar (denounced) (2).

808 - What came regarding the duration of a Qarn (century/generation).
The Hadith of Abdullah bin Busr (may Allah be pleased with him): "This boy will live a century" (3).
Imam Ahmad said: There is nothing more established regarding the Qarn and its duration than the Hadith of Abdullah bin Busr (4).
foot_note:
1. (1) Reported by At-Tabarani 8/27, he said: Ahmad bin Al-Qasim bin Musawir Al-Jawhari and Muhammad bin Ja'far bin A'yan narrated to us, they said: Khalid bin Khidash narrated to us, Hammad bin Zaid narrated to us, from Ayyub, from Al-Hasan, from Sakhr bin Qudamah, raised (Marfu') with it.
2. "Al-Muntakhab" by Ibn Qudamah (190), "Al-Mawdu'at" by Ibn al-Jawzi 3/192.
3. Reported by Al-Hakim in "Al-Mustadrak" 4/505, he said: Al-Husain bin Al-Hasan informed us, Abu Hatim narrated to us, Dawud bin Rashid narrated to us, Shuraih bin An-Nu'man narrated to us, from Ibrahim bin Muhammad bin Ziyad Al-Alhani, from his father, from Abdullah bin Busr (may Allah be pleased with him) that the Prophet (peace be upon him) said to him: "This boy will live a century." So he lived one hundred years, and he had a wart on his face, so he said: "He will not die until the wart goes from his face." So he did not die until it went.
4. "As-Sunnah" by Al-Khallal 2/845.

book_title: The Collection of Imam Ahmad's Sciences - Ills of Hadith
publisher: Dar Al-Falah for Scientific Research and Heritage Verification, Fayoum - Arab Republic of Egypt
text:
809 - What came regarding fighting the rebellious group (Ahl al-Baghy).
The Hadith of Abu Sa'id Al-Khudri (may Allah be pleased with him): "Woe to Ammar! The rebellious group will kill him; he invites them to Paradise and they invite him to the Fire." He said: Ammar says: I seek refuge in Allah from afflictions (1).
Imam Ahmad said: This Hadith has been narrated from twenty-eight paths, none of which is an authentic path (2).
And he said once: There is no authentic Hadith in it (3).
And he said once: There is more than one authentic Hadith in it from the Prophet (peace be upon him) (4).
And he said once: I do not speak about it; silence is safer (5).
foot_note:
1. (1) Reported by Al-Bukhari (447), he said: Musaddad narrated to us, he said: Abdul-Aziz bin Mukhtar narrated to us, he said: Khalid Al-Hadhdha narrated to us, from Ikrimah who said: Ibn Abbas said to me and to his son Ali: Go to Abu Sa'id and listen to his Hadith. So we went, and found him in a garden putting it right. He took his cloak and wrapped himself, then began narrating to us until he came to the mention of the building of the Mosque, and said: We were carrying one brick at a time and Ammar was carrying two bricks at a time. The Prophet (peace be upon him) saw him and dusted off the dirt from him and said: ... The Hadith. And Muslim also reported it (2915) from the path of Abu Nadrah from Abu Sa'id Al-Khudri.
2. "At-Talkhis Al-Habir" 4/43, "Al-Ilal Al-Mutanahiyah" 2/365, "Al-Fath" by Ibn Rajab 3/299.
3. "At-Talkhis Al-Habir" 4/43, "As-Sunnah" by Al-Khallal 3/463, "Al-Muntakhab" by Ibn Qudamah (131).
4. "Siyar A'lam al-Nubala" 1/421, "Fath al-Bari" by Ibn Rajab 3/299.
5. "Masa'il Al-Kawsuj" (3509). Benefit: Al-Hafiz quoted in "At-Talkhis" 4/43 from Ibn Al-Jawzi that he quoted from Ibn Ma'in and Abu Khaithamah that they said: It is a Hadith that is not authentic. Ibn Abd al-Barr said: The reports about that are Mutawatir (mass transmitted), and it is among the most authentic Hadiths. Ibn Dihyah said: There is no impugning its authenticity, and if it were not authentic, Mu'awiyah would have rejected and denied it.

book_title: The Collection of Imam Ahmad's Sciences - Ills of Hadith
publisher: Dar Al-Falah for Scientific Research and Heritage Verification, Fayoum - Arab Republic of Egypt
foot_note: 1. = Sheikh al-Islam Ibn Taymiyyah said in "Minhaj as-Sunnah" 2/211: It was authenticated by Imam Ahmad and others among the Imams, even if it was narrated from him that he weakened it, the final matter from him is that he authenticated it. End quote. Al-Hafiz said in "Al-Fath" 1/646 with modification: It was narrated from a group of Companions and most of its paths are authentic (Sahih) or good (Hasan). I say: Ibn Rajab said in "Al-Fath" 2/494: This attribution - meaning: to Ahmad - is not known. What has been narrated from Ahmad contradicts this. Ya'qub bin Shaybah As-Sadusi said in the Musnad of Ammar in his "Musnad": I heard Ahmad bin Hanbal being asked about the Hadith of the Prophet (peace be upon him): "The rebellious group will kill him." Ahmad said: Just as the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said, the rebellious group killed him. He said: There is more than one authentic Hadith regarding this from the Prophet (peace be upon him), and he disliked speaking about this more than that. Al-Hakim said in "Tarikh Naysabur": I heard Abu Isa Muhammad bin Isa Al-Farid praising him: I heard Salih bin Muhammad Al-Hafiz - meaning: Jazarah - say: I heard Yahya bin Ma'in and Ali bin Al-Madini authenticating the Hadith of Al-Hasan from his mother, from Umm Salamah: "The rebellious group will kill Ammar." And Ahmad said: I do not speak about this, and silence about it is safer. Uthman bin Abi Shaybah said in his "Su'alat" to Ibn Al-Madini (78): I heard Ali say: I do not memorize from Khalid, from Sa'id bin Abi Al-Hasan, except this Hadith, meaning: the Hadith of Umm Salamah: "The rebellious group will kill Ammar." Al-Hafiz said in "Al-Fath" 1/646: And its wording is "Woe to Ammar! The rebellious group will kill him; he invites them to Paradise." Know that this addition was not mentioned by Al-Humaidi in "Al-Jam'" and he said: Al-Bukhari did not mention it at all, and Abu Mas'ud said likewise. Al-Humaidi said: Perhaps it did not reach Al-Bukhari, or it occurred but he deleted it intentionally. He said: And Al-Isma'ili and Al-Barqani extracted it in this Hadith. I say: It appears to me that Al-Bukhari deleted it intentionally; due to a subtle point, which is that Abu Sa'id Al-Khudri admitted that he did not hear this addition from the Prophet (peace be upon him), which indicates that it is interpolated (Mudraj) in this narration, and the narration that clarified [this] does not meet Al-Bukhari's condition. End quote.

book_title: The Collection of Imam Ahmad's Sciences - Ills of Hadith
publisher: Dar Al-Falah for Scientific Research and Heritage Verification, Fayoum - Arab Republic of Egypt
text:
810 - What came regarding the signs of the Hour.
There are five Hadiths in it:
The First: The Hadith of Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him): "Indeed, among the signs of the Hour are bad neighborliness, severing of kinship ties, the sword being disabled from Jihad, and the world being acquired by religion" (1).
Imam Ahmad said: This is not authentic; Umar bin Harun is not known (2).
The Second: The Hadith of Abdullah bin Amr (may Allah be pleased with them both): "The Hour will not be established until Allah takes His chosen ones from the people of the earth, so there remains in it a riffraff who do not recognize good nor deny evil" (3).
Imam Ahmad said: Affan (4) does not raise it [to the Prophet] (5).
foot_note:
1. = Benefit: Al-Hafiz said in "Al-Fath" 1/646 with modification: The Hadith "The rebellious group will kill Ammar" was narrated by a group of Companions, including Qatada bin An-Nu'man, Umm Salamah, Abu Hurairah, Abdullah bin Amr bin Al-Aas, Uthman bin Affan, Hudhayfah, Abu Ayyub, Abu Rafi', Khuzaimah bin Thabit, Mu'awiyah, Amr bin Al-Aas, Abu Al-Yasar, and Ammar himself. In this Hadith is a sign from the signs of Prophethood, a clear virtue for Ali and Ammar, and a refutation of the Nawasib who claim that Ali was not correct in his wars.
1. (1) Reported by Al-Mussisi Luwayn (107), he said: Yahya bin Al-Mutawakkil narrated to us, from Umar bin Harun Al-Ansari, from Abu Hurairah, raised (Marfu') with it.
2. "Al-Ilal Al-Mutanahiyah" by Ibn al-Jawzi 2/368.

The Hadith of Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him): "He created the Trumpet and gave it to Israfil" (3).

The Hadith of Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him): "Jesus, son of Mary, will descend, kill the pig, erase the cross, and prayer will be gathered for him. text: Imam Ahmad said: Al-Muharibi was a companion of Saif bin Muhammad, the son of Sufyan At-Thawri's sister, and Saif was a liar. I think Al-Muharibi heard it from him. It was said to him: Abdul-Aziz bin Aban narrated it from Sufyan. He said: Everyone who narrated it from Sufyan is a liar. It was said to him: Luwayn narrated it twice from Muhammad bin Jabir. He said: Muhammad bin Jabir perhaps inserted into his book, or he said: The Hadith is inserted into his book. Imam Ahmad said: This Hadith is not authentic (Sahih), or he said: It is a lie (1). And he said once: No trustworthy person narrated it (2). And he said once: There is no basis (origin) for this Hadith (3). And he said once to Ismail bin Aban Al-Ghanawi: From whom did you hear this? Imam Ahmad said: This is a Munkar (denounced) Hadith (2).

817 - What was reported regarding the reign of Bani Abbas, wherein are two Hadiths:
The First: The Hadith of Ka'b, may Allah be pleased with him: "O Ibn Abbas, a man from your descendants will rule" (3). Imam Ahmad said: I did not deny anything from the Hadith of Abbas Al-Ansari except this Hadith. Then he said: As for his narration from Yunus, Khalid, Dawud, and Shu'bah, it is authentic (Sahih) except for this Hadith; in my view, it is a lie and falsehood, and he was one of the companions of Sa'id (4).

818 - What was reported regarding the Great Battles (Al-Malahim) and the mention of the Sufyani and the Mahdi, wherein are six Hadiths:
The First: The Hadith of Ibn Abbas, may Allah be pleased with them both: "If it is the year such-and-such, then in it is such-and-such" (1).
The Second: The Hadith of Ali bin Abi Talib, stopped (Mawquf) [at him]: A man will emerge from his loins named after your Prophet (2).
The Third: The Hadith of Abu Huraira, may Allah be pleased with him, containing the mention of the signs of the Hour, and in it: "And unjust, wicked rulers are employed, so they make them swear by divorce and emancipation" (3).
The Fourth: The Hadith of Thawban, may Allah be pleased with him: "Woe to my nation from the children of so-and-so; they clothed them in sects and shed their blood" (4).

When the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, saw them, his eyes filled with tears and his color changed. He said: So I said: We still see something in your face that we dislike. text: 820 - The emergence of a man from the family of Al-Aas against the people with his sword, the Hadith of Ibn Umar, may Allah be pleased with them both: "Indeed, this one will contradict the Book of Allah and the Sunnah of His Prophet, peace be upon him, and from his loins will emerge one whose smoke reaches the sky" (1). Imam Ahmad said: Hussein bin Qais, who is called Hanash, is abandoned in Hadith (Matruk Al-Hadith), but he has one good (Hasan) Hadith which At-Taymi narrated from him regarding the story of bad omens (2).
foot_note:
1. (1) Narrated by Ibn Asakir in his "Tarikh" 57/ 267. He said: Abu Ghalib bin Al-Banna informed us, Abu Al-Hussein bin Al-Abnusi informed us, Abu Al-Hasan Ad-Daraqutni informed us, Abu Amr Yusuf bin Ya'qub bin Yusuf An-Naysaburi told us, Muhammad bin Sadran told us, Al-Mu'tamir bin Sulaiman told us, from his father, from Hanash, from Ata', from Ibn Umar, who said: I went out in the afternoon heat to the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, and Abu Hasan came, so he [the Prophet], peace be upon him, said to him: "Come close." He kept bringing him closer until he whispered in his ears. While he, peace be upon him, was whispering to him, he raised his head looking startled. He said: Someone knocked on the door with his sword, or knocked on the door. So he said to Ali: "Go and lead him just as a sheep is led to its milker." Then Al-Hakam - meaning: Ibn Abi Al-Aas - entered, being held by his ear, and he had a tremor, until he stood him before the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace. So the Prophet of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, cursed him three times, then said: Put him in a corner until a group of the Muhajirin and Ansar went to him. Then he called for him and cursed him, then said: "Indeed, this one will contradict the Book of Allah and the Sunnah of His Prophet, peace be upon him, and from his loins will emerge one whose smoke reaches the sky." So two men from the people said: He is too insignificant and lowly for this to come from him. He said: "Yes, and he will distress you on that day with his sword."

The Book of Etiquette

821 - What was reported regarding Righteousness and Sin, the Hadith of Wabisah Al-Asadi, may Allah be pleased with him: "Consult your heart and consult your soul - three times - Righteousness is what the soul finds tranquility in, and Sin is what wavers in the soul and hesitates in the chest, even if the people give you a verdict and give you a verdict" (1). Imam Ahmad said: Az-Zubayr did not hear it from Ayyub (2).

822 - What was reported regarding pleasing one's parents, the Hadith of Abdullah bin Abi Awfa, may Allah be pleased with him: A man came to the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, and said: O Messenger of Allah, there is a boy here who is dying, and it is said to him: 'Say La ilaha illa Allah' (There is no god but Allah), but he is unable
foot_note:
1. (1) Narrated by Ahmad 4/ 228. He said: Affan told us, Hammad bin Salamah told us, Az-Zubayr Abu Abdus-Salam informed us, from Ayyub bin Abdullah bin Mikraz, who said: His companions told me, he said: I came to the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, and I intended not to leave anything of righteousness and sin except that I asked him about it - and around him was a group of Muslims asking him for verdicts - so I began stepping over them. They said: Stay away, O Wabisah, from the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace. So I said: Leave me to get close to him, for he is the most beloved of people for me to get close to. He said: "Leave Wabisah alone, come close O Wabisah," twice or thrice. He said: So I got close to him until I sat in front of him. He said: "O Wabisah, shall I inform you or will you ask me?" I said: No, rather inform me. He said: "You came to ask me about righteousness and sin." He said: Yes. So he gathered his fingers and began tapping my chest with them and saying: "O Wabisah..." so he mentioned it.
2. "Musnad Ahmad" 4/ 228, "Jami' Al-Ulum wal-Hikam" 219. I say: The text of the Hadith is established, for Muslim narrated it (2553) from the Hadith of An-Nawwas bin Sam'an, may Allah be pleased with him.

823 - What was reported regarding the prohibition of a man cursing his parents, the Hadith of Abdullah bin Amr, may Allah be pleased with them both: "It is of the major sins for a man to curse his parents." They said: And how does a man curse his parents? He said: "He insults a man's father, so he insults his father, and he insults his mother, so he insults his mother" (3). Imam Ahmad said: Sufyan raised it (Marfu', attributed it to the Prophet) and Mis'ar stopped it (Mawquf, attributed it to the Companion) (4).

He said: "So what prevented him from it at his death?" So the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said: "Does he have parents or one of them?" They said: A mother. So she was called. He said: "Be pleased with your son." She said: I appeal to you, O Messenger of Allah, that I am pleased with my son. He said: "Say La ilaha illa Allah." So he said: La ilaha illa Allah. 824 - What was reported regarding the discipline of a child, the Hadith of Jabir bin Samura, may Allah be pleased with him: "For a man to discipline his child - or one of you his child - is better for him than to give half a Sa' in charity every day" (1). Abdullah bin Ahmad said: My father did not include this Hadith in his "Musnad" because of Nasih; because he is weak in Hadith, and he dictated it to me in the 'Nawadir' (Rarities) (2). And he said once: My father did not narrate to me from Nasih Abu Abdullah anything other than this Hadith (3).

825 - What was reported regarding a man eating from his child's wealth, the Hadith of Aisha, may Allah be pleased with her: "A man's child is from his earning, from his best earning, so eat from their wealth in enjoyment" (4). Imam Ahmad said: This Hadith is agitated (Mudtarib); Mansur and Al-A'mash narrated it from Ibrahim, from Umara, from his paternal aunt, from Aisha. Likewise, Sufyan bin Uyainah said: From Al-A'mash. And Al-Hakam narrated it from Umara, from his father, from Aisha. And Al-A'mash said: From Ibrahim, from Al-Aswad, from Aisha.
foot_note:
1. (1) Narrated by Abdullah bin Ahmad in his additions to "Al-Musnad" 5/ 96. He said: Ali bin Thabit Al-Jazari told us, from Nasih Abu Abdullah, from Simak bin Harb, from Jabir bin Samura raised (Marfu') with it.
2. "Musnad Ahmad" 5/ 96.
3. "Musnad Ahmad" 5/ 102.
4. Narrated by Abu Dawud (3529). He said: Ubaid bin Umar bin Maysarah and Uthman bin Abi Shaybah told us the meaning, they said: Muhammad bin Ja'far told us, from Shu'bah, from Al-Hakam, from Umara bin Umair, from his mother, from Aisha raised (Marfu') with it.

book_title: The Comprehensive Collection of Imam Ahmad's Sciences - Hadith Defects
publisher: Dar Al-Falah for Scientific Research and Heritage Verification, Faiyum - Arab Republic of Egypt
text:
It was said to Imam Ahmad: From Al-A'mash other than Sufyan bin Uyainah? He said: I do not know it. And he said: From Sufyan, from Al-A'mash, from Umara, from a paternal aunt of his, from Aisha, from the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace: "Indeed your children are from your best earnings, so eat from the earnings of your children" (1). Imam Ahmad said: He mixed up in this, and Al-A'mash heard it from Umara himself. It was said to Imam Ahmad: Abu Hamza As-Sukkari narrated, from Ibrahim As-Sa'igh, from Hammad, from Ibrahim, from Al-Aswad, from Aisha from the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace: "The best of what a man eats is from the earning of his child, so eat from the earning of your children if you need it" (2). So Imam Ahmad was amazed by it. And he said: Sufyan narrated it from Hammad, and did not raise it (did not attribute it to the Prophet) (3).

826 - What was reported regarding the prohibition of terrifying a Muslim, the Hadith of Abu Huraira, may Allah be pleased with him: "The angels curse one of you if he points at his brother with a piece of iron, even if he is his brother by his father and his mother" (4).
foot_note:
1. (1) Narrated by Abu Dawud (3528). He said: Muhammad bin Kathir told us, Sufyan informed us, from Mansur, from Ibrahim, from Umara bin Umair, from his paternal aunt that she asked Aisha... The Hadith.
2. Narrated by Ibn Majah (2137). He said: Abu Bakr bin Abi Shaybah, Ali bin Muhammad, and Ishaq bin Ibrahim bin Habib told us, they said: Muawiyah told us, Al-A'mash told us, from Ibrahim, from Al-Aswad, from Aisha, raised (Marfu') with it.
3. "Al-Muntakhab min Ilal Al-Khallal" by Ibn Qudamah (209).
4. Narrated by Muslim (2616). He said: Abu Bakr bin Abi Shaybah told us, Yazid bin Harun told us, from Ibn Awn, from Muhammad, from Abu Huraira raised (Marfu') with it.

book_title: The Comprehensive Collection of Imam Ahmad's Sciences - Hadith Defects
publisher: Dar Al-Falah for Scientific Research and Heritage Verification, Faiyum - Arab Republic of Egypt
text:
Ahmad said: Ibn Abi Adi did not raise it (did not attribute it to the Prophet) (1).

827 - What was reported regarding withholding harm from people, the Hadith of Abu Said Al-Khudri, may Allah be pleased with him: "Whoever eats pure food, acts according to a Sunnah, and people are safe from his calamities will enter Paradise." A man said: O Messenger of Allah: Indeed this is frequent among the people today. He said: "And it will be in generations after me" (2). Imam Ahmad said: I have not heard anything more Munkar (denounced) than this Hadith; I do not know Hilal bin Miqlas nor Abu Bishr (3).

828 - What was reported regarding the sin of he whose neighbor is not safe from his calamities, the Hadith of Abu Shuraih Al-Ka'bi, may Allah be pleased with him: "By Allah he does not believe, by Allah he does not believe, by Allah he does not believe." It was said: And who, O Messenger of Allah? He said: "He whose neighbor is not safe from his calamities" (4).
foot_note:
1. (1) "Musnad Ahmad" 2/ 256. I say: Ibn Awn was followed up by Ayyub in Muslim (2616) and Ibn Sirin was also followed up, so the Hadith is authentic (Sahih); the fact that Ibn Abi Adi did not raise it does not affect it, and Allah knows best. Benefit: Ad-Daraqutni recounted in "Al-Ilal" 10/ 39 the disagreement regarding it being raised (Marfu') or stopped (Mawquf) and preferred it being raised, and Abu Hatim also preferred it being raised in "Al-Ilal" (2266).
2. Narrated by At-Tirmidhi (2520). He said: Hannad, Abu Zur'ah, and more than one told us, they said: Qabisah informed us, from Isra'il, from Hilal bin Miqlas As-Sayrafi, from Abu Bishr, from Abu Wa'il, from Abu Said Al-Khudri raised (Marfu') with it.
3. "Al-Ilal Al-Mutanahiyah" 2/ 263.
4. Narrated by Al-Bukhari (6016). He said: Asim bin Ali told us, Ibn Abi Dhi'b told us, from Sa'id, from Abu Shuraih, raised (Marfu') with it.

book_title: The Comprehensive Collection of Imam Ahmad's Sciences - Hadith Defects
publisher: Dar Al-Falah for Scientific Research and Heritage Verification, Faiyum - Arab Republic of Egypt
text: Imam Ahmad said: Rawh and Uthman bin Umar told me, they said: Ibn Abi Dhi'b told us from Sa'id Al-Maqburi, from Abu Huraira that the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said: "By Allah he does not believe" (1). Imam Ahmad said: Rawh and Uthman heard it in Medina, while Hajjaj and Yazid heard it in Baghdad, and thus he said in Baghdad. And Muhanna said: I asked Ahmad about the Hadith of Ibn Abi Dhi'b, is it a mistake or is it from both of them? He said: I do not know; however, whoever narrated from him in Medina says: From Ibn Abi Dhi'b from Al-Maqburi, from Abu Huraira; and whoever heard in Baghdad said: From Abu Shuraih (2). And he said once, when it was said to him that both are authentic: It is possible that both are authentic (3).
foot_note:
1. (1) Narrated by Al-Bukhari in suspended form (Mu'allaq) (6016). He said: And Humaid bin Al-Aswad, Uthman bin Umar, Abu Bakr bin Ayyash, and Shu'ayb bin Ishaq said from Ibn Abi Dhi'b, from Al-Maqburi, from Abu Huraira, raised (Marfu') with it. And Ahmad connected it in "Al-Musnad" 2/ 336. He said: Uthman bin Umar told us, Ibn Abi Dhi'b informed us, from Sa'id Al-Maqburi, from Abu Huraira, raised (Marfu') with it.
2. "Al-Muntakhab" by Ibn Qudamah from "Al-Ilal" by Al-Khallal (160).
3. "Al-Ilal" by Ibn Abi Hatim 2/ 238. I say: Al-Bukhari, may Allah have mercy on him, mentioned the disagreement after quoting the Hadith, so he said: Shababah and Asad bin Musa followed him up - meaning: from Asim from Ibn Abi Dhi'b - mentioning Abu Shuraih. And he said: Humaid bin Al-Aswad, Uthman bin Umar, Abu Bakr bin Ayyash, and Shu'ayb bin Ishaq, from Ibn Abi Dhi'b, from Abu Huraira. Al-Hafiz said in "Al-Fath" 10/ 458: The majority said in it: From Abu Huraira, so it would be appropriate to prefer them, and this is supported by the fact that the narrator, if he narrates in his own city, is more precise in what he narrates than when he is traveling. However, this is countered by the fact that Sa'id Al-Maqburi is famous for narrating from Abu Huraira, so whoever said from him 'from Abu Huraira' followed the common path (Al-Jaddah). Thus, those who said from him: (from Abu Shuraih) had additional =

book_title: The Comprehensive Collection of Imam Ahmad's Sciences - Hadith Defects
publisher: Dar Al-Falah for Scientific Research and Heritage Verification, Faiyum - Arab Republic of Egypt
text:
829 - What was reported regarding bad character, the Hadith of Ali bin Abi Talib, may Allah be pleased with him: "Whoever worries much, his body sickens; and whoever has bad character, punishes himself; and whoever argues with men, his chivalry falls and his dignity leaves" (1). Imam Ahmad said: This is false (Batil) (2).

830 - What was reported regarding mentioning the sinner (Fajir), the Hadith of Muawiyah bin Haydah, may Allah be pleased with him: "Do you refrain from mentioning the sinner? Mention him with what is in him so the people may beware of him" (3). It was said to Imam Ahmad: Does anyone other than Al-Jarud narrate it? He said: Not that I know (4). And he said once: I do not know anyone besides him who narrated it (5).
foot_note:
1. = knowledge that the others did not have. Also, the meaning of the Hadith was found in the narration of Al-Layth from Sa'id Al-Maqburi from Abu Shuraih, so in it was a strengthening for the one who saw it from Ibn Abi Dhi'b and said in it: (from Abu Shuraih). Yet, Al-Bukhari's action implies authenticating both modes, even if the narration from Abu Shuraih is more correct.
1. Narrated by Al-Bayhaqi in "Shu'ab Al-Iman" 6/ 342: Abu Abdullah Al-Hafiz informed us, Abu Said Amr bin Muhammad bin Mansur informed us, Muhammad bin Al-Harith in Baghdad told us, Hafs bin Umar told us, from Abdullah bin Muhammad, he said: Muhammad bin Ali bin Hussein told me, from his father, from his grandfather, raised (Marfu') with it.
2. "Al-Muntakhab min Ilal Al-Khallal" (34).
3. Narrated by At-Tabarani in "Al-Kabir" 19/ 418. He said: Abdan bin Ahmad told us, Salamah bin Shabib told us, Al-Jarud bin Yazid told us, from Bahz bin Hakim, from his father, from his grandfather raised (Marfu') with it.
4. "Tarikh Baghdad" 7/ 262, "Al-Kamil" by Ibn Adi 2/ 173.
5. "Masa'il Harb" p. 454.

book_title: The Comprehensive Collection of Imam Ahmad's Sciences - Hadith Defects
publisher: Dar Al-Falah for Scientific Research and Heritage Verification, Faiyum - Arab Republic of Egypt
text:
831 - What was reported regarding generosity (Karam), the Hadith of Ali bin Urwah Al-Qurashi: "A man's generosity is the goodness of his provision in travel" (1). Imam Ahmad said: Abdul-Rahman bin Yahya is a Levantine (Shami) who is not that [strong], and I do not know Ali bin Urwah nor do I know who he is (2).

832 - Chapter: What was reported regarding generosity (Sakha'), the Hadith of Aisha, may Allah be pleased with her: "The generous one is close to Allah, close to Paradise, close to people, far from the Fire; and the miser is far from Allah, far from Paradise, far from people, close to the Fire; and an ignorant generous person is more beloved to Allah, Mighty and Majestic, than a miserly scholar" (3).
foot_note:
1. = Benefit: Al-Jarud is Munkar in Hadith, and some accused him of lying. Al-Uqayli said 1/ 202: This Hadith has no basis from the Hadith of Bahz, nor from the Hadith of anyone else, and he is not followed up on it. Among those who challenged this Hadith are Ibn Hibban, Ibn Adi, Al-Bayhaqi, and Al-Khatib Al-Baghdadi.
1. I say: Ibn Kathir mentioned it in his "Tafsir" quoting from "Tafsir Waki'". He said: Ibrahim Al-Makki told us, from Ibn Abi Najih, from Mujahid, from Ibn Umar who said: "Indeed, part of a man's generosity is the goodness of his provision in travel." As for the path that Imam Ahmad mentioned, I did not find it, and it is from Hushaim, from Abdul-Rahman bin Yahya, from Ali bin Urwah Al-Qurashi raised (Marfu') with it.
2. "Al-Muntakhab" by Ibn Qudamah (22).
3. Narrated by At-Tabarani in "Al-Awsat" 3/ 84 - 85 (2384). He said: Ibrahim told us, he said: My father told me, Sa'id bin Muhammad Al-Warraq told us, from Yahya bin Sa'id, from Muhammad bin Al-Qasim, from his father, from Aisha, raised (Marfu') with it.

book_title: The Comprehensive Collection of Imam Ahmad's Sciences - Hadith Defects
publisher: Dar Al-Falah for Scientific Research and Heritage Verification, Faiyum - Arab Republic of Egypt
text:
Imam Ahmad said: This is a Munkar (denounced) Hadith (1).

833 - What was reported regarding the virtue of raising daughters, the Hadith of Anas number [sic], may Allah be pleased with him: "Any woman who dedicates herself to three daughters of hers will be with me in Paradise" (2). Imam Ahmad said: This is a Munkar (denounced) Hadith (3).
foot_note:
1. (1) "Ilal Al-Marwadhi" (279), "Tarikh Baghdad" 9/ 72, "Tahdhib Al-Kamal" 11/ 48, "Tahdhib At-Tahdhib" 2/ 330.
2. Narrated by Abdullah bin Ahmad in "Al-Ilal" (5951). He said: Abdullah bin Ahmad told us via it, Khalaf bin Hisham Al-Bazzar told us, he said: Ubais bin Maimun told us, from Thabit Al-Bunani, from Anas, raised (Marfu') with it. And Al-Uqayli narrated it in "Al-Du'afa" 3/ 418. He said: Abdullah bin Ahmad told us, with it.
3. "Al-Du'afa" by Al-Uqayli 3/ 418, "Al-Ilal" narration of Abdullah (5951), "Al-Muntakhab" by Ibn Qudamah (9), "Tahdhib Al-Kamal" 19/ 278. I say: What is authentic in this chapter is what Muslim narrated (2629) from the Hadith of Aisha, the wife of the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, who said: A woman came to me with her two daughters asking me [for charity], but she did not find anything with me except one date. So I gave it to her. She took it and divided it between her two daughters and did not eat anything from it. Then she got up and left with her daughters. Then the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, entered upon me, so I told him her story. So the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said: "Whoever is tested with anything of these daughters and treats them well, they will be a screen for him from the Fire."

book_title: The Comprehensive Collection of Imam Ahmad's Sciences - Hadith Defects
publisher: Dar Al-Falah for Scientific Research and Heritage Verification, Faiyum - Arab Republic of Egypt
text:
834 - The virtue of one who supports an orphan, the Hadith of Abdullah bin Abi Awfa, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: I was with the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, when a boy came to him and said: O Messenger of Allah, there is an orphan boy here who has a widowed mother and an orphan sister; feed us from what Allah the Exalted has fed you, may Allah give you from what is with Him until you are pleased... (1). Abdullah bin Imam Ahmad said: My father did not narrate this Hadith to us and he crossed it out in his book, because he was not pleased with the Hadith of Fa'id bin Abdul-Rahman or he was abandoned in Hadith (Matruk Al-Hadith) in his view (2).

835 - What was reported regarding the people of kindness (Ma'ruf), the Hadith of Salman, may Allah be pleased with him: "The people of kindness in the world are the people of kindness in the Hereafter" (3). Imam Ahmad said after mentioning this Hadith: Hisham bin Lahiq, I wrote Hadiths from him from Asim Al-Ahwal from Salman, which he raised (attributed to the Prophet) (4).
foot_note:
1. (1) Narrated by Ahmad 4/ 382. He said: Yazid bin Harun told us, Fa'id bin Abdul-Rahman informed us, he said: I heard Abdullah bin Abi Awfa raised (Marfu') with it.
2. "Musnad Ahmad" 4/ 382.
3. Narrated by At-Tabarani in "Al-Kabir" 6/ 246. He said: Abdullah bin Ahmad bin Hanbal told us, my father told me, Hisham bin Lahiq told us, Asim Al-Ahwal told us, from Abu Uthman An-Nahdi, from Salman, raised (Marfu') with it.
4. "Al-Du'afa" by Al-Uqayli 4/ 337.

book_title: The Comprehensive Collection of Imam Ahmad's Sciences - Hadith Defects
publisher: Dar Al-Falah for Scientific Research and Heritage Verification, Faiyum - Arab Republic of Egypt
text:
836 - What was reported regarding doing favors (San' al-Ma'ruf), the Hadith of Aisha, may Allah be pleased with her: "Favors do not prosper except with one of noble lineage or religion" (1). Imam Ahmad said: I see it as being from the Hadith of Abu Al-Bukhturi (2).

837 - What was reported regarding kindness to servants, the Hadith of Yazid bin Jariyah, may Allah be pleased with him: "Your slaves, your slaves, your slaves; feed them from what you eat and clothe them from what you wear. If they commit a sin that you do not wish to forgive, then sell the slaves of Allah and do not torment them" (3).
foot_note:
1. (1) Narrated by Al-Bayhaqi in "Shu'ab Al-Iman" 7/ 453 - 454. He said: Abu Al-Qasim Abdul-Khaliq bin Ali the Muezzin informed us, Abu Bakr bin Khanb Al-Baghdadi in Bukhara informed us, Abu Abdullah Muhammad bin Khalaf Al-Marwazi informed us, H. And Abu Hamid Ahmad bin Al-Walid Az-Zawzani informed us, Abu Bakr Muhammad bin Abdullah Ash-Shafi'i informed us, Muhammad bin Khalaf bin Abdus-Salam Al-Marwazi told us, Yahya bin Hashim told us, Hisham bin Urwah told us. And Abu Al-Hasan Al-Muqri Al-Isfarayini informed us therein, Al-Hasan bin Muhammad bin Ishaq informed us, Muhammad bin Sa'id bin Aban told us, Sahl bin Uthman told us, Al-Musayyib bin Sharik told us, from Hisham bin Urwah, from his father, from Aisha, who said: The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said: "A favor is not suitable except with one of noble lineage and religion, just as training is not suitable except with a noble camel" - the wording of Yahya's Hadith. And in the narration of Al-Musayyib: "Favors are of no benefit except with one of noble lineage or religion, just as training is of no benefit except with a noble camel."
2. "Tarikh Baghdad" 13/ 138.
3. Narrated by Ahmad 4/ 35 - 36. He said: Abdul-Rahman told us, he said: Sufyan told us from Asim bin Ubaidullah, from Abdul-Rahman bin Yazid, from his father that the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said during the Farewell Pilgrimage... so he mentioned it.

publisher: Dar Al-Falah for Scientific Research and Heritage Verification, Faiyum - Arab Republic of Egypt
text:
Imam Ahmad said: They differ concerning him. It was said to Ahmad: Does Yazid have companionship (Sahbah)? He said: I do not know if he has companionship; he is the brother of Mujamma' bin Jariyah; Mujamma' and Yazid are the sons of Jariyah (1).

838 - What was reported regarding seeking help through secrecy for needs, the Hadith of Mu'adh bin Jabal, may Allah be pleased with him: "Seek help in the success of needs through secrecy; for every possessor of a blessing is envied" (2). Imam Ahmad said: It is fabricated (Mawdu'), it has no basis (origin) (3).

839 - What was reported regarding social conduct with people, the Hadith of Abu Dharr, may Allah be pleased with him: "Fear Allah wherever you are, and follow up a bad deed with a good one to wipe it out, and treat the people with good character" (4). Imam Ahmad said: Waki' used to narrate it from Mu'adh, then he made it from Abu Dharr.
foot_note:
1. (1) "Masa'il Abi Dawud" (2028).
2. Narrated by At-Tabarani in "Al-Awsat" 3/ 116 (2476). He said: Abu Muslim told us, he said: Sa'id bin Salam Al-Attar told us, he said: Thawr bin Yazid told us, from Khalid bin Ma'dan, from Mu'adh bin Jabal, raised (Marfu') with it.
3. "Al-Mawdu'at" by Ibn Al-Jawzi 2/ 166, "Asna Al-Matalib" by Al-Bayruti (81), "Al-Muntakhab" (25). Benefit: Abu Hatim said in "Al-Ilal" (2258): This is a Munkar (denounced) Hadith.
4. Narrated by Ahmad 5/ 153. He said: Waki' told us, Sufyan told us, from Habib, from Maimun bin Abi Shabib, from Abu Dharr raised (Marfu') with it.

publisher: Dar Al-Falah for Scientific Research and Heritage Verification, Fayoum - Arab Republic of Egypt
text: Then Hadiths of Waki' were mentioned to Ahmad which he [Waki'] had retracted. He said: Something Al-Rabi' used to say, then he attributed it to Ibn al-Hanafiyyah (1). 840 - What has been reported regarding guarding the tongue. The Hadith of Abu Bakr, may Allah be pleased with him: "This has led me to the watering places (of destruction)." Indeed, the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said: "There is nothing in the body but that it complains to Allah about the tongue due to its sharpness." Imam Ahmad was asked about Al-Nadr bin Isma'il al-Qass? He said: He did not memorize the chain (Isnad). Isma'il narrated a Munkar (denounced) Hadith from him, from Qays (2): "I saw Abu Bakr holding his tongue..." and we narrate from him. This is actually the Hadith of Zaid (3) bin Aslam (4).
foot_note:
1. (1) "Su'alat Abi Dawud" (5), "Musnad Ahmad" 5/153-158, "Al-Ilal" narration of Abdullah (5086), (5087).
2. Recorded by Ahmad in "Ilal Abdullah" (5191), he said: Abu al-Mughirah al-Qass told us, he said: Isma'il told us, from Qays, who said: I saw Abu Bakr, may Allah be pleased with him... The Hadith.
3. Recorded by Ibn al-Sunni in "Amal al-Yawm wa al-Laylah" 5-6, he said: Abu Ya'la informed us, Muhammad bin Hayyan told us, Abd al-Samad bin Abd al-Warith informed us, from Abd al-Aziz bin Muhammad, from Zaid bin Aslam, from his father that Umar bin al-Khattab looked upon Abu Bakr al-Siddiq, may Allah be pleased with him, while he was pulling his tongue, so he said: What are you doing, O Caliph of the Messenger of Allah? He said... so he mentioned it.
4. "Al-Ilal" narration of Abdullah (5319), "Al-Kamil" by Ibn Adi 7/26, "Tarikh Baghdad" 13/43, "Al-Jarh wa al-Ta'dil" 8/474, "Al-Uqayli" 4/290, "Al-Tarikh al-Kabir" by Al-Bukhari 8/90, "Tahdhib al-Tahdhib" 5/620, "Tahdhib al-Kamal" 29/373.

publisher: Dar Al-Falah for Scientific Research and Heritage Verification, Fayoum - Arab Republic of Egypt
text: 841 - What has been reported regarding the excellence of a person's Islam. The Hadith of Abu Huraira, may Allah be pleased with him: "From the excellence of a person's Islam is his leaving what does not concern him" (1). Imam Ahmad said: It is not Sahih (authentic) except from Ali bin Al-Hussein (2) as Mursal (3). 842 - What has been reported regarding fulfilling trust and not betraying. The Hadith of Abu Huraira: "Render the trust to the one who entrusted you, and do not betray the one who betrayed you" (4). Imam Ahmad said: This is a Batil (false) Hadith; I do not know it from a Sahih path (5).
foot_note:
1. (1) Recorded by Al-Tirmidhi (2317), he said: Ahmad bin Nasr al-Naysaburi and more than one told us, they said: Abu Mushir told us, from Isma'il bin Abdullah bin Sama'ah, from Al-Awza'i, from Qurrah, from Al-Zuhri, from Abu Salamah, from Abu Huraira, in a Marfu' form with it.
2. Recorded by Al-Tirmidhi (2318), he said: Qutaibah told us, Malik bin Anas told us, from Al-Zuhri, from Ali bin Hussein, who said: The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said... The Hadith.
3. "Jami' al-Ulum wa al-Hikam" (97). Benefit: Among those who declared this Hadith defective are Al-Bukhari, Ibn Ma'in, Al-Daraqutni, and Al-Tirmidhi.
4. Recorded by Al-Tirmidhi (1264), he said: Abu Ghurayb told us, Talq bin Ghannam told us, from Sharik and Qays, from Abu Hasin, from Abu Salih, from Abu Huraira, in a Marfu' form with it.
5. "Al-Talkhis al-Habir" 3/97, "Asna al-Matalib" by Al-Bayruti p. 57 (94), "Al-Maqasid al-Hasanah" by Al-Sakhawi (31). Benefit: Al-Khattabi said in "Ma'alim al-Sunan" 3/143: This Hadith is considered outwardly contrary to the Hadith of Hind, meaning: when she complained to the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, that Abu Sufyan was a miserly man. The Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said to her: "There is no blame on you if you spend according to what is reasonable." There is no actual contradiction between them; =

publisher: Dar Al-Falah for Scientific Research and Heritage Verification, Fayoum - Arab Republic of Egypt
text: 843 - What has been reported regarding answering the caller. The Hadith of Ibn Umar, may Allah be pleased with them both, that a man called out to the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, so he said: "Labbaik" (I am at your service) (1). Imam Ahmad said: Munkar (2). 844 - What has been reported regarding one who takes something in jest. The Hadith of Yazid bin Al-Sa'ib, may Allah be pleased with them both: "None of you should take his brother's belongings playing (in jest) nor seriously" (3). It was said to Imam Ahmad: Do we know it from other than the Hadith of Ibn Abi Dhi'b? He said: No, and he is Ibn Yazid, the nephew of Nimr, and I do not know any other [Hadith] for him,
foot_note:
1. = for the traitor is one who takes what he has no right to take, unjustly and aggressively. As for the one who is permitted to take his right from the wealth of his opponent and retrieve his grievance from him, he is not a traitor. The meaning is: do not betray the one who betrayed you by meeting him with treachery like his treachery, while this one did not betray him; because he seizes his right for himself, whereas the first usurps a right belonging to another. Malik bin Anas used to say: If a man entrusts a man with a thousand dirhams and the trustee denies it, then the denier entrusts him with a thousand, it is not permissible for him to deny it.
1. Recorded by Ibn Hibban in "Al-Majruhin" 1/221: from the path of Jabarah bin Mughallis, from Hammad bin Zaid, from Ishaq bin Suwayd, from Yahya bin Ya'mar, from Ibn Umar.
2. "Al-Uqayli" 1/206, "Ilal Abdullah" (1090), "Al-Muntakhab min Ilal al-Khallal" by Ibn Qudamah (78), "Tahdhib al-Kamal" 5/121.
3. Recorded by Abu Dawud (5003), he said: Muhammad bin Bashar told us, Yahya told us from Ibn Abi Dhi'b H. And Sulayman bin Abd al-Rahman al-Dimashqi told us, Shu'ayb bin Ishaq told us, from Ibn Abi Dhi'b, from Abdullah bin al-Sa'ib bin Yazid, from his father, from his grandfather that he heard the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace... The Hadith.

publisher: Dar Al-Falah for Scientific Research and Heritage Verification, Fayoum - Arab Republic of Egypt
text: As for Al-Sa'ib, he saw the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace (1). 845 - What has been reported regarding the dislike of a Muslim shunning his brother. In it are two Hadiths: The First: The Hadith of Abu Ayyub al-Ansari, may Allah be pleased with him: "It is not lawful for a Muslim to shun his brother for more than three days; they meet, so this one turns away and that one turns away, and the better of them is the one who begins with the Salam" (2). Imam Ahmad said: Thus said Ibn Ulayyah from Sa'id bin Zaid, but it is actually 'Ata (3) bin Yazid (4). The Second: The Hadith of Aisha, may Allah be pleased with her: "It is not lawful for a Muslim to shun his brother for more than three days, except if he is one whose calamities (evils) cannot be trusted" (5).
foot_note:
1. (1) "Al-Talkhis al-Habir" 3/46, "Tahdhib al-Kamal" 14/556, "Tahdhib al-Tahdhib" 3/151.
2. Recorded by Ahmad in "Al-Ilal" narration of Abdullah (5537), he said: Isma'il bin Ibrahim told us, from Abd al-Rahman bin Ishaq, from Al-Zuhri, from Sa'id bin Zaid, from Abu Ayyub al-Ansari, in a Marfu' form with it.
3. Recorded by Al-Bukhari (6237), he said: Ali bin Abdullah told us, Sufyan told us, from Al-Zuhri, from 'Ata bin Yazid al-Laythi, from Abu Ayyub, in a Marfu' form with it.
4. "Al-Ilal" narration of Abdullah (5537).
5. Mentioned by Ibn al-Jawzi in "Al-Ilal Al-Mutanahiyah" 2/264, he said: Muhammad bin al-Hajjaj narrated, from Abd al-Aziz bin Muhammad al-Juhani, from Hisham bin Urwah, from his father, from Aisha, in a Marfu' form with it.

book_title: The Collection of Imam Ahmad's Sciences - Hadith Defects
publisher: Dar Al-Falah for Scientific Research and Heritage Verification, Fayoum - Arab Republic of Egypt
text: Imam Ahmad said: This is a lie, and I have abandoned the Hadith of Muhammad bin al-Hajjaj (1). 846 - What has been reported regarding being casual (or playful) with people. In it is a Hadith of Aisha, may Allah be pleased with her, and it has two paths: The First: The path of Muhammad bin Ibrahim from Aisha, and in it... The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, entered upon her while she was playing with dolls/girls and she had girls (friends) with her (2). Imam Ahmad said: Gharib (strange), we did not hear it from anyone other than Hushaim from Yahya bin Sa'id (3). And he said once: This Muhammad bin Ibrahim raises it (makes it Marfu'), but as for Hisham (4), I do not see him mentioning
foot_note:
1. (1) "Al-Ilal Al-Mutanahiyah" 2/264. I say: Imam Ahmad only denounced this last phrase (except if he is one whose calamities cannot be trusted) as in "Al-Kanz".
2. I did not find it from the path of Hushaim, from Yahya bin Sa'id, from Muhammad bin Ibrahim al-Timi, from Aisha... But Abu Dawud recorded it (2932), he said: Muhammad bin Awf told us, Sa'id bin Abi Maryam told us, Yahya bin Ayyub informed us, he said: Umarah bin Ghaziyyah told me that Muhammad bin Ibrahim told him from Abu Salamah bin Abd al-Rahman, from Aisha, may Allah be pleased with her, who said: The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, arrived from the expedition of Tabuk or Khaybar, and in her shelf/niche there was a curtain. The wind blew and uncovered the side of the curtain revealing girls (dolls) belonging to Aisha, toys. He said: "What is this, O Aisha?" She said: My daughters. And he saw among them a horse with two wings made of patches. He said: "What is this that I see in the middle of them?" She said: A horse. He said: "And what is this on it?" She said: Two wings. He said: "A horse with two wings?" She said: Have you not heard that Solomon had horses with wings? She said: He laughed until I saw his molar teeth.
3. "Al-Ilal" narration of Abdullah (2242).
4. Recorded by Al-Bukhari (6130), he said: Muhammad told us, Abu Mu'awiyah informed us, Hisham told us, from his father, from Aisha, may Allah be pleased with her, who said: I used to play with dolls in the presence of the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, and I had =

book_title: The Collection of Imam Ahmad's Sciences - Hadith Defects
publisher: Dar Al-Falah for Scientific Research and Heritage Verification, Fayoum - Arab Republic of Egypt
text: any speech in it; in the Hadith of Muhammad bin Ibrahim, the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, used to send them (the friends) to me (1). The Second: The path of Al-Zuhri from Aisha: I was gifted to the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, and my toys were with me (2). Imam Ahmad said: Gharib, I do not know it (3). 847 - What has been reported regarding that a man should not lie skin-to-skin (bashara) with a man, nor a woman with a woman. The Hadith of Ibn Abbas, may Allah be pleased with them both: "Let not a man lie skin-to-skin with a man, nor a woman with a woman" (4). Imam Ahmad said: Aswad did not raise it (make it Marfu'), and he narrated it to us from Hasan, from Simak, from Ikrimah as Mursal (5).
foot_note:
1. = friends who played with me. When the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, entered, they would hide from him, so he would send them to me, and they would play with me.
1. "Al-Wara'" (141).
2. Recorded by Al-Tabarani in "Al-Awsat" 9/157 (9410), he said: Al-Haytham bin Khalaf told us, Muhammad bin Aban al-Balkhi told us, Abu Usamah told us, from Abd al-Razzaq, from Ma'mar, from Al-Zuhri, from Urwah, from Aisha... The Hadith.
3. "Al-Wara'" (141).
4. Recorded by Ahmad 1/314, he said: Abd al-Razzaq and Khalaf bin al-Walid told us, they said: Isra'il told us, from Simak, from Ikrimah, from Ibn Abbas in a Marfu' form with it.
5. "Musnad Ahmad" 1/314.

text: 848 - What has been reported regarding women veiling themselves from men. The Hadith of Umm Salamah, may Allah be pleased with her: "Are you two blind? Do you not see him?" (1). Imam Ahmad said: Al-Waqidi used to attribute the Hadith of Yunus to Ma'mar; he would swap them, and he mentioned this Hadith among them (2). And he said once: We kept pushing away the matter of Al-Waqidi until he narrated this Hadith, bringing something for which there is no solution; for this is the Hadith of Yunus, no one else narrated it from Al-Zuhri (3). And he said once: Nabhan narrated a strange Hadith, and it is as if he indicated the weakness of his Hadith (4). And once: He said to Ali bin al-Madini: This is a Hadith in which Yunus was solitary, and how do you deem it permissible to narrate from a man who narrates the Hadith of Nabhan, the Mukatab (slave with a contract of freedom) of Umm Salamah, from Ma'mar (5).
foot_note:
1. (1) Recorded by Al-Tirmidhi 5/102 (2778), he said: Suwayd told us, Abdullah told us, Yunus ibn Yazid informed us, from Ibn Shihab, from Nabhan the freed slave of Umm Salamah, that he told him that Umm Salamah told him that she was with the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, and Maymunah. She said: While we were with him, Ibn Umm Maktum approached and entered upon him, and that was after we had been ordered to veil. The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said: "Veil yourselves from him." I said: O Messenger of Allah, is he not blind, unable to see us or recognize us? The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said: ...
2. "Al-Du'afa" by Al-Uqayli 4/107-108, "Al-Ilal" narration of Abdullah (5166), "Tahdhib al-Kamal" 26/182, "Tahdhib al-Tahdhib" 5/233, "Tarikh Baghdad" 3/17.
3. "Siyar A'lam al-Nubala" 9/455, "Tahdhib al-Tahdhib" 5/233, "Tarikh Baghdad" 3/16.
4. "Al-Mughni" by Ibn Qudamah 7/465.
5. "Tarikh Baghdad" 3/18, "Siyar A'lam al-Nubala" 9/456.

book_title: The Collection of Imam Ahmad's Sciences - Hadith Defects
publisher: Dar Al-Falah for Scientific Research and Heritage Verification, Fayoum - Arab Republic of Egypt
text: 849 - What has been reported regarding traveling alone at night. The Hadith of Ibn Umar, may Allah be pleased with them: "If people knew what I know about solitude, no rider would travel at night alone" (1). Imam Ahmad said: Mu'ammal narrated it to us another time but did not say "from Ibn Umar" (2). 850 - What has been reported regarding repelling harm. In it are two Hadiths: The First: The Hadith of Mukhariq bin Sulaym, may Allah be pleased with him, and in it: "Fight for your property until you are among the martyrs of the Hereafter" (3).
foot_note:
1. (1) Recorded by Ahmad 2/112, he said: Mu'ammal told us, Umar bin Muhammad bin Zaid bin Abdullah ibn Umar told us, from his father, from Ibn Umar in a Marfu' form with it.
2. "Musnad Ahmad" 2/112. I say: The text of the Hadith is established and authentic (Sahih), for Al-Bukhari recorded it (2998) from the Hadith of Ibn Umar, may Allah be pleased with them both.
3. Recorded by Al-Nasa'i 7/113-114, he said: Hannad bin al-Sari informed us in his Hadith, from Abu al-Ahwas, from Simak, from Qabus, from his father who said: A man came to the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace H. And Ali bin Muhammad bin Ali informed me, he said: Khalaf bin Tamim told us, he said: Abu al-Ahwas told us, he said: Simak bin Harb told us, from Qabus bin Mukhariq, from his father, who said: And I heard Sufyan al-Thawri narrating this Hadith, he said: A man came to the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, and said: A man comes to me wanting my property? He said: "Remind him of Allah." He said: If he does not remember? He said: "Then seek the help of those around you of the Muslims against him." He said: If there is no one of the Muslims around me? He said: "Then seek the help of the Sultan (authority) against him." He said: If the Sultan is far from me? He said: "Fight for your property until you are among the martyrs of the Hereafter or you protect it."

book_title: The Collection of Imam Ahmad's Sciences - Hadith Defects
publisher: Dar Al-Falah for Scientific Research and Heritage Verification, Fayoum - Arab Republic of Egypt
text: Imam Ahmad said: It is not established (1). The Second: The Hadith of Ibn Abbas, may Allah be pleased with them both: "Whoever is killed defending his neighbor is a martyr" (2). Imam Ahmad said: This is not Sahih (3); it is actually: "Whoever is killed defending his property" (4). 851 - What has been reported regarding the condemnation of singing. In it are three Hadiths: The First: The Hadith of Anas bin Malik, may Allah be pleased with him: "Whoever sits listening to a songstress, molten lead (al-anuk) will be poured into his ears on the Day of Resurrection" (5). Imam Ahmad said: This is a Batil (false) Hadith (6). The Second: The Hadith of Abu Umamah, may Allah be pleased with him, that the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, forbade buying female singers (7).
foot_note:
1. (1) "Al-Sunnah" by Al-Khallal 1/178.
2. Recorded by Al-Harith in "Zawa'id al-Haythami" 2/660, he said: Abd al-Wahhab bin Ata told us, Juwaybir informed us, from Al-Dahhak, from Ibn Abbas, in a Marfu' form with it.
3. "Al-Sunnah" by Al-Khallal 1/168-183.
4. Recorded by Al-Bukhari (2480), he said: Abdullah bin Yazid told us, Sa'id—he is Ibn Abi Ayyub—told us, he said: Abu al-Aswad told me, from Ikrimah, from Abdullah bin Amr, may Allah be pleased with them, who said: I heard the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, say: "Whoever is killed defending his property is a martyr."
5. Mentioned by Ibn al-Jawzi in "Al-Ilal Al-Mutanahiyah" 2/300 from the path of a man from the people of Aleppo, from Ibn al-Mubarak, from Malik, from Ibn al-Munkadir, from Anas in a Marfu' form with it.
6. "Ilal al-Marwazi" (255), "Al-Muntakhab" by Ibn Qudamah from "Ilal al-Khallal" (42), "Al-Ilal Al-Mutanahiyah" 2/300.
7. Recorded by Al-Tabarani in "Al-Kabir" 8/212, he said: Ahmad bin Rushdin told us, Sa'id bin =
