text: Imam Ahmad said, when asked about this Hadith: Yahya bin Ayyub is weak, and he used to err frequently (1). The Third: The Hadith of Ibn Umar, may Allah be pleased with them both: I saw the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, hear the sound of a shepherd's flute, so he did the like of this (2). It was said to Imam Ahmad: Is this Hadith not Munkar? He said: Sulayman bin Musa narrates it from Nafi' from Ibn Umar. Then he said: I dislike it (3).
foot_note:
1. = Abi Maryam, Yahya bin Ayyub informed us, from Ubaidullah bin Zahr, from Ali bin Yazid, from Al-Qasim, from Abu Umamah in a Marfu' form with it.
1. "Al-Muntakhab" by Ibn Qudamah (43).
2. Recorded by Abu Dawud (4924), he said: Ahmad bin Ubaidullah al-Ghudani told us, Al-Walid bin Muslim told us, Sa'id bin Abd al-Aziz told us, from Sulayman bin Musa, from Nafi' who said: Ibn Umar heard a flute, so he placed his fingers in his ears and moved away from the path, and said to me: O Nafi', do you hear anything? He said: So I said: No. He said: So he lifted his fingers from his ears and said... The Hadith.
3. "Al-Amr bi al-Ma'ruf wa al-Nahy 'an al-Munkar" by Al-Khallal (145). Benefit: Abu Dawud said in "Al-Sunan" 4/283: This is a Munkar Hadith. I say: Abu Dawud denounced it due to the solitary narration of Sulayman bin Musa from the trustworthy, firm companions of Nafi', such as Malik, Ayyub, and Ubaidullah. Sulayman bin Musa has Munkar narrations and is closer to weakness than to reliability; hence Abu Dawud denounced it. According to the method of Imam Ahmad, this Hadith would be Munkar, and Allah knows best.

book_title: The Collection of Imam Ahmad's Sciences - Hadith Defects
publisher: Dar Al-Falah for Scientific Research and Heritage Verification, Fayoum - Arab Republic of Egypt
text: 852 - What has been reported regarding 'There is no competition (prizes) except in camel, hoof, or wing'. The Hadith of Abu al-Bakhtari: "There is no competition except in camel (khuff), hoof (hafir), or wing (janah)" (1). Imam Ahmad said: No one narrated this except that liar Abu al-Bakhtari (2). 853 - What has been reported regarding the prohibition of cutting the Sidr tree (3). The Hadith of Abdullah bin Hubshi, may Allah be pleased with him: "Whoever cuts a Sidr tree, Allah will aim his head into the Fire" (4). Imam Ahmad said: There is no Sahih Hadith regarding it, yet he disliked cutting it after this (5).
foot_note:
1. (1) Al-Damiri mentioned this story in "Hayat al-Hayawan" 1/259. It is that Harun al-Rashid admired pigeons and playing with them. Pigeons were gifted to him while Abu al-Bakhtari Wahb the Judge was with him. So he narrated to him with his chain from Abu Huraira, may Allah be pleased with him, that the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said: "There is no competition except in camel, hoof, or wing," adding "or wing," which is a phrase he fabricated for Al-Rashid. So he gave him a splendid prize. When he left, Al-Rashid said: By Allah, I knew that he lied against the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace. He ordered the pigeons to be slaughtered. It was said to him: What is the fault of the pigeons? He said: Because of them, a lie was told against the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace.
2. "Tarikh Baghdad" 13/486.
3. Several Hadiths were reported in this chapter from the path of Jabir, Aisha, Ali, Abu Ja'far, and Mu'awiyah ibn Haydah.
4. Recorded by Abu Dawud in his "Sunan" (5239), he said: Nasr bin Ali told us, Abu Usamah informed us, from Ibn Jurayj, from Uthman bin Abi Sulayman, from Sa'id bin Muhammad bin Jubayr bin Mut'im, from Abdullah bin Hubshi, who said: The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said... The Hadith.
5. "Al-Ilal Al-Mutanahiyah" 2/167-168, "Al-Manar al-Munif" (127). Benefit: Al-Uqayli also said regarding cutting the Sidr: Nothing is authentic concerning it.

book_title: The Collection of Imam Ahmad's Sciences - Hadith Defects
publisher: Dar Al-Falah for Scientific Research and Heritage Verification, Fayoum - Arab Republic of Egypt
text: 854 - What has been reported regarding cursing the flea. The Hadith of Ali bin Abi Talib, may Allah be pleased with him: "Do not curse them, for they are an excellent creature; they woke you for the remembrance of Allah" (1). Imam Ahmad said—when asked about the supplication of the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, for fleas: Do you know it?—He said: No, and he was amazed by this statement (2). 855 - What has been reported regarding swings. The Hadith of Salih Abu al-Khalil, may Allah be pleased with him, that the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, ordered the cutting of swings (3). Imam Ahmad said: Hushaim did not hear anything from Ziyad bin Abi Umar (4).
foot_note:
1. (1) Recorded by Al-Tabarani in "Al-Awsat" 9/228, he said: Hashim bin Marthad told us, Adam told us, Abu Yusuf the Judge told us, from Sa'd bin Tarif, from Al-Asbagh bin Nabatah, from Ali bin Abi Talib who said: We stopped at a place and fleas annoyed us, so we cursed them. The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said... The Hadith.
2. "Al-Muntakhab" by Ibn Qudamah (27).
3. Recorded by Al-Bayhaqi in his "Sunan" 10/220, he said: Abu al-Hasan bin Bishran informed us in Baghdad, Al-Hussein bin Safwan informed us, Abu Bakr Abdullah bin Muhammad bin Abi al-Dunya told us, my father told me, Hushaim informed us, from Ziyad bin Abi Umar, from Salih Abu al-Khalil in a Marfu' form with it.
4. "Al-Ilal" by Abdullah bin Ahmad (2185).

book_title: The Collection of Imam Ahmad's Sciences - Hadith Defects
publisher: Dar Al-Falah for Scientific Research and Heritage Verification, Fayoum - Arab Republic of Egypt
text: 856 - What has been reported regarding naming oneself with the names of Prophets. The Hadith of Abu Huraira: "Name yourselves with my name but do not use my Kunya," and the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, used to dislike the Shikal (specific marking) in horses or Al-Ashkal (1). Imam Ahmad said: Shu'bah erred in this statement; it is actually Salm bin Abdullah bin Yazid bin Abd al-Rahman al-Nakha'i (2). 857 - What has been reported regarding the reward of one who leads a blind person. The Hadith of Anas, may Allah be pleased with him: "Whoever leads a blind person forty cubits, it will be equivalent to freeing a slave for him" (3). Imam Ahmad said: Al-Mu'alla bin Hilal, his Hadith is fabricated, a lie (4).
foot_note:
1. (1) "Musnad Ahmad" 2/457, he said: Muhammad bin Ja'far told us, he said: Shu'bah told us, he said: I heard Abdullah bin Yazid al-Nakha'i say: I heard Abu Zur'ah narrating from Abu Huraira in a Marfu' form with it.
2. "Musnad Ahmad" 2/457, "Masa'il Ibn Hani" (2376), "Al-Ilal" narration of Abdullah (5695), "Tahdhib al-Tahdhib" 3/301. I say: The text is established and authentic; Al-Bukhari recorded it (6188) without his saying: "He disliked the Shikal in horses," and Muslim recorded it (1875) from the same source, but regarding the second part, i.e., "The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, used to dislike the Shikal in horses."
3. Recorded by Ibn al-Jawzi in "Al-Mawdu'at" 2/175, he said: Abd al-Wahhab bin al-Mubarak al-Anmati and Abdullah bin Muhammad al-Baydawi informed us, they said: Ahmad bin Muhammad bin al-Naqqur informed us, Isa bin Ali the Vizier informed us, Al-Baghawi told us, Khalid told us, from Al-Mu'alla bin Hilal, from Sulayman al-Taymi, from Anas, in a Marfu' form with it.
4. "Al-Mawdu'at" by Ibn al-Jawzi 2/175.

book_title: The Collection of Imam Ahmad's Sciences - Hadith Defects
publisher: Dar Al-Falah for Scientific Research and Heritage Verification, Fayoum - Arab Republic of Egypt
text: 858 - Chapter on what is permissible regarding poetry. The Hadith of Ubayy bin Ka'b, may Allah be pleased with him: "Indeed, there is wisdom in poetry" (1). I say: Imam Ahmad mentioned the disagreement regarding Al-Zuhri, saying: Ibn al-Mubarak agreed with him—meaning: they agreed on Urwah (2), and they did not say: Abu Bakr. Rabah (3) opposed the narration of Ibn al-Mubarak and Abd al-Razzaq; because they said: From Urwah, while Rabah said: From Abu Bakr bin Abd al-Rahman (4). 859 - What has been reported regarding the condemnation of poetry and poets. The Hadith of Abu Huraira, may Allah be pleased with him: "Imru' al-Qais is the standard-bearer of the poets to the Fire" (5).
foot_note:
1. (1) Recorded by Ahmad 5/125, he said: Abd al-Razzaq told us, Ma'mar informed us, from Al-Zuhri, from Urwah, from Marwan bin al-Hakam, from Abd al-Rahman bin al-Aswad bin Abd Yaghuth, from Ubayy bin Ka'b, in a Marfu' form with it.
2. "Musnad Ahmad" 5/125.
3. "Musnad Ahmad" 5/125, he said: Ibrahim bin Khalid told us, Rabah told us, from Ma'mar, from Al-Zuhri, Abu Bakr bin Abd al-Rahman told me, from Marwan bin al-Hakam, from Abd al-Rahman ibn al-Aswad, from Ubayy bin Ka'b.
4. "Musnad Ahmad" 5/125. I say: It has a witness in Al-Bukhari (6145) from the path of Shu'ayb from Al-Zuhri, who said: Abu Bakr bin Abd al-Rahman informed me that Marwan bin al-Hakam informed him that Abd al-Rahman bin al-Aswad bin Abd Yaghuth informed him that Ubayy bin Ka'b informed him, in a Marfu' form with it.
5. Recorded by Ahmad 2/228, he said: Hushaim told us, Abu al-Jahm al-Wasiti told us, from Al-Zuhri, from Abu Salamah, from Abu Huraira in a Marfu' form with it.

book_title: The Collection of Imam Ahmad's Sciences - Hadith Defects
publisher: Dar Al-Falah for Scientific Research and Heritage Verification, Fayoum - Arab Republic of Egypt
text: Imam Ahmad said when asked about this Hadith: It was said: From Al-Zuhri from him—meaning from Abu Salamah. It was said: Who [narrated] from Al-Zuhri? He said: Abu al-Jahm. It was said to him: Who narrated it from Abu al-Jahm? He fell silent. I asked him again, so he said: O Allah, save us. And he fell silent (1). 860 - What has been reported regarding the midday nap (Qaylulah). The Hadith of Anas, may Allah be pleased with him: "Take a midday nap, for the devils do not nap" (2). Imam Ahmad said: I do not know it. This is only from Mansur, from Mujahid (3) from Umar (4).
foot_note:
1. (1) "Siyar A'lam al-Nubala" 13/549.
2. Recorded by Al-Tabarani in "Al-Awsat" 1/45, he said: Ahmad bin Abd al-Wahhab told us, he said: Ali bin Ayyash al-Homsi told us, he said: Mu'awiyah bin Yahya al-Tarabulsi told us, from Kathir bin Marwan, from Yazid Abu Khalid al-Dalani, from Ishaq bin Abdullah bin Abi Talha, from Anas in a Marfu' form with it.
3. Mentioned by Ibn Nasr in "Mukhtasar Qiyam al-Layl" (154): From Mujahid, may Allah have mercy on him, that it reached Umar, may Allah be pleased with him, that a worker of his did not take a midday nap, so he wrote to him: As for what follows, take a midday nap; for the devil does not nap.
4. "Al-Muntakhab" by Ibn Qudamah (26).

book_title: The Collection of Imam Ahmad's Sciences - Hadith Defects
publisher: Dar Al-Falah for Scientific Research and Heritage Verification, Fayoum - Arab Republic of Egypt
text: 861 - What has been reported regarding blessing the sneezer. The Hadith of Abu Huraira, may Allah be pleased with him: "When Allah created Adam, He blew the spirit into him, and he sneezed and said: 'Praise be to Allah,' praising Allah by His permission. His Lord said to him: 'May Allah have mercy on you, O Adam'" (1). Imam Ahmad said: Al-Layth bin Sa'd opposed him [narrating] from Ibn Ajlan, from Sa'id, from Abdullah bin Salam (2).
foot_note:
1. (1) Recorded by Al-Tirmidhi (3368), he said: Muhammad bin Bashar told us, Safwan bin Isa told us, Al-Harith bin Abd al-Rahman bin Abi Dhubab told us, from Sa'id bin Abi Sa'id al-Maqburi, from Abu Huraira who said: The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said... And in it: "Go to those angels, to a group of them sitting, and say: 'Al-Salamu Alaykum.' They said: 'Wa Alaykas-Salam wa Rahmatullah.' Then he returned to his Lord, and He said: 'This is your greeting and the greeting of your offspring among themselves.' Then Allah said to him—while His hands were closed—'Choose whichever of them you wish.' He said: 'I choose the right hand of my Lord, and both hands of my Lord are right and blessed.' Then He spread it out, and behold, within it were Adam and his offspring. He said: 'O Lord, who are these?' He said: 'These are your offspring.' Behold, every human has his lifespan written between his eyes. Among them was a man who was the most luminous of them, or among the most luminous. He said: 'O Lord, who is this?' He said: 'This is your son David; I have written for him a lifespan of forty years.' He said: 'O Lord, increase his lifespan.' He said: 'That is what I have written for him.' He said: 'O Lord, then I grant him sixty years from my lifespan.' He said: 'You and that.' He said: Then he dwelt in Paradise as long as Allah willed, then he was sent down from it. Adam used to count for himself. He said: Then the Angel of Death came to him, and he [Adam] said to him: 'You have hastened; one thousand years were written for me.' He said: 'Yes, but you gave your son David sixty years.' So he denied, and his offspring denied; and he forgot, and his offspring forgot. He said: So from that day, writing and witnesses were ordered."
2. "Al-Ilal" narration of Abdullah (2113).

text: Book of Asceticism (Zuhd) and Heart-Softeners (Raqa'iq) 862 - What has been reported regarding asceticism in the world. The Hadith of Uthman bin Affan, may Allah be pleased with him: "The son of Adam has no right to anything except these characteristics: a house to live in, a garment to cover his nakedness, and a crust of bread and water" (1). Imam Ahmad said, when asked about Harith bin Al-Sa'ib: He was okay, except that he narrated a Munkar Hadith from Uthman from the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, and it is not from the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace—meaning: this Hadith (2). And he said once, when asked: Who is Harith? He said: A Sheikh from Basra, he narrated a Munkar Hadith from Al-Hasan, from Humran, from Uthman—and he mentioned this Hadith. Al-Athram said: I said: Does Qatada oppose him? He said: Yes, Sa'id from Qatada, from Al-Hasan, from a man of the People of the Book. Ahmad said: Ruh told us, Sa'id told us, from Qatada with it (3).
foot_note:
1. (1) Recorded by Al-Tirmidhi (2341), he said: Abd bin Humayd told us, Abd al-Samad bin Abd al-Warith told us, Harith bin Al-Sa'ib told us, he said: I heard Al-Hasan say: Humran bin Aban told me, from Uthman bin Affan that the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said: ... The Hadith.
2. "Al-Muntakhab" by Ibn Qudamah from "Al-Ilal" by Al-Khallal (3), "Tahdhib al-Tahdhib" 1/463.
3. "Tahdhib al-Tahdhib" 1/463.

text: 863 - What has been reported regarding the condemnation of the world. The Hadith of Utbah bin Ghazwan, may Allah be pleased with him: "Indeed, the world has announced its departure and has turned away quickly, and nothing remains of it except dregs like the dregs of a vessel. You are in a dwelling from which you will move, so move with the best of what you have. I have seen myself as the seventh of seven with the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, and we had no food to eat except the leaves of trees until the corners of our mouths became ulcerated" (1). Imam Ahmad said: No one narrated this Hadith except Waki', meaning: it is Gharib (strange) (2). 864 - What has been reported regarding the insignificance of the world to Allah. In it are two Hadiths: The First: The Hadith of Ibn Abbas, may Allah be pleased with them both: "By the One in Whose Hand is my soul, the world is more insignificant to Allah than this is to its owners" (3).
foot_note:
1. (1) Recorded by Ahmad in "Al-Musnad" 5/61, he said: Waki' told us, Qurrah told us, from Humayd bin Hilal al-Adawi, from a man among them called Khalid bin Umayr. Abu Na'amah said: I heard it from Khalid bin Umayr who said: Utbah bin Ghazwan addressed us. Abu Na'amah said: on the pulpit—and Qurrah did not say it—so he said: ... The Hadith.
2. "Musnad Ahmad" 5/61. I say: The text of the Hadith is established and authentic; Muslim recorded it (2967) from the path of Sulayman bin al-Mughirah, from Humayd bin Hilal, from Khalid bin Umayr, who said: Utbah bin Ghazwan addressed us... The Hadith.
3. Recorded by Ahmad in "Al-Musnad" 1/329, he said: Muhammad bin Mus'ab told us, Al-Awza'i told us, from Al-Zuhri, from Ubaidullah, from Ibn Abbas: The Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, passed by a dead sheep that its owners had discarded, so he said: ... The Hadith.

book_title: The Collection of Imam Ahmad's Sciences - Hadith Defects
publisher: Dar Al-Falah for Scientific Research and Heritage Verification, Fayoum - Arab Republic of Egypt
text: Imam Ahmad said: To me, it is a mistake (1). The Second: The Hadith of Aisha, may Allah be pleased with her: "The world is the home of one who has no home, and for it gathers one who has no intellect" (2). Imam Ahmad said: This is a Munkar Hadith (3). 865 - What has been reported regarding attachment to the world. The Hadith of Anas, may Allah be pleased with him: "Whoever makes the world his concern and his desire, for it he travels and for it he toils, Allah Azza wa Jalla will scatter his affairs, make his poverty appear between his eyes, and nothing will come to him of it except what was written for him. And whoever makes the Hereafter his concern and his desire, for it he travels and for it he toils, Allah will place wealth in his heart, gather his affairs for him, and the world will come to him submissively" (4). Imam Ahmad said: He is a liar—meaning: Dawud bin Al-Muhabbir—then he mentioned this
foot_note:
1. (1) "Al-Muntakhab" by Ibn Qudamah from "Al-Ilal" by Al-Khallal (4). I say: Abu Hatim and Abu Zur'ah said in "Al-Ilal" regarding this Hadith (1897) similar to what Imam Ahmad said—meaning: it is a mistake—and they said: It is only that the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, passed by a dead sheep and said: "What would it have cost the people of this if they had utilized its hide?" I said to them—i.e., Ibn Abi Hatim—Who is the delusion from? They said: From Al-Qarqasani.
2. Recorded by Ahmad in "Al-Musnad" 6/71, he said: Hussein bin Muhammad told us, he said: Duwayd told us, from Abu Ishaq, from Zur'ah, from Aisha who said: The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said: ... The Hadith.
3. "Al-Muntakhab" by Ibn Qudamah from "Al-Ilal" by Al-Khallal (5).
4. Recorded by Ibn Hibban in "Al-Majruhin" 1/287, he said: Al-Hasan bin Sufyan told it to us, Muhammad bin Yahya bin Abd al-Karim al-Azdi told us, Dawud bin Al-Muhabbir told us, Hammam bin Yahya told us, from Qatada, from Anas, in a Marfu' form with it.

text: Hadith (1). 866 - What has been reported regarding asceticism in what is in the hands of people. The Hadith of Sahl bin Sa'd al-Sa'idi: "Renounce the world and Allah will love you, and renounce what is in the hands of people and the people will love you" (2). Imam Ahmad said—when asked about this Hadith: 'La ilaha illa Allah' in amazement—Who narrates this Hadith? It was said to him: Khalid bin Amr. He said: We have fallen into Khalid bin Amr, and he fell silent. Ibn Rajab said: His intention was to denounce whoever mentioned to him anything from the Hadith of this Khalid, for he does not concern himself with it (3). 867 - What has been reported regarding shortening hope. The Hadith of Abu Huraira, may Allah be pleased with him: "O children of Adam, give birth for the dust and build for ruin" (4).
foot_note:
1. (1) "Al-Majruhin" by Ibn Hibban 1/287.
2. Recorded by Ibn Majah (4102), he said: Abu Ubaidah bin Abi al-Safar told it to us, Shihab bin Abbad told us, Khalid bin Amr al-Qurashi told us, from Sufyan al-Thawri, from Abu Hazim, from Sahl bin Sa'd al-Sa'idi, who said: A man came to the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, and said: O Messenger of Allah, guide me to a deed which if I do, Allah will love me and the people will love me. The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said: ... The Hadith.
3. "Jami' al-Ulum wa al-Hikam" (253), "Al-Muntakhab" by Ibn Qudamah from "Al-Ilal" by Al-Khallal (1).

Imam Ahmad said: It has no basis (origin) (1).

868 - What was reported regarding his saying: "Protect yourselves from the Fire, even with half a date," the Hadith of Adi bin Hatim, may Allah be pleased with him: "Protect yourselves from the Fire, even with half a date" (2). Imam Ahmad said when Ibn Khalifa was mentioned to him: This is a Kufan. Yazid bin Harun used to say at one time: Muhallil, then he abandoned it. It was said to him: From whom? He said: From Shu'bah - meaning: he says from Shu'bah - from Muhallil bin Khalifa, from Adi bin Hatim, and he mentioned the Hadith (3).
foot_note:
1. = Rafi' - from Abu Huraira, who said: The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said: "A traveler at one of the gates of heaven says: Whoever lends today will find it tomorrow. And an angel at another gate says: O Allah, give the spender a replacement and give the withholder destruction. And an angel at another gate says: O people, come to your Lord, for what is little and sufficient is better than what is abundant and distracting. And an angel at another gate says: O Children of Adam, give birth for the dust and build for ruin."
1. "Asna Al-Matalib" by Al-Bayruti 1136.
2. Narrated by Ahmad 4/ 256. He said: Abdul-Rahman and Ibn Ja'far told us, they said: Shu'bah told us, from Muhallil bin Khalifa. Abdul-Rahman said: I heard Adi bin Hatim say... so he mentioned it raised (Marfu') with it.
3. "Masa'il Abi Dawud" (2013). I say: The text of the Hadith is established in the two Sahihs.

text:
869 - What was reported regarding the fear of Allah, Mighty and Majestic, the Hadith of Abu Umamah, may Allah be pleased with him: "If you were created for Paradise and it was created for you, that your life be long and your deeds be good is better for you; and if you were created for the Fire and the Fire was created for you, what are you rushing towards?" (1). Imam Ahmad said: Ali bin Yazid narrates wonders from him - meaning: Al-Qasim - and I do not see them coming from anyone except Al-Qasim. The narration of Ja'far bin Az-Zubayr has gone away; because his narration was only from Al-Qasim. Perhaps Bishr bin Numair narrated from Al-Qasim. Shu'bah said: Attach them to him (2).

870 - What was reported regarding reminding [people] of the Days of Allah, the Hadith of Ali or Az-Zubayr, may Allah be pleased with them both: The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, used to address us and remind us of the Days of Allah until we could recognize that in his face (3).
foot_note:
1. (1) Narrated by Al-Uqayli in "Al-Du'afa" 3/ 477. He said: Ahmad bin Dawud told us, Hisham bin Ammar told us, Amr bin Waqid told us, from Ali bin Yazid, from Al-Qasim, from Abu Umamah, who said: The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, came out to us and admonished us with an eloquent admonition, so Sa'd wept. He said: I wish I had not been created. So the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said: ... The Hadith.
2. "Al-Ilal Al-Mutanahiyah" 2/ 334.
3. Narrated by Ahmad 1/ 167. He said: Kathir bin Hisham told us, Hisham told us, from Abu Az-Zubayr, from Abdullah bin Salimah - or Salamah -. Kathir said: And my memorization is Salimah from Ali - or from Az-Zubayr - who said: The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, used to address us and remind us of the Days of Allah until we could recognize that in his face, as if he were a Warner to a people whom the matter would befall in the morning. And if he had recently met with Gabriel, he would not smile or laugh until he [Gabriel] ascended away from him.

text:
Imam Ahmad said: I do not think he is the Abdullah bin Salimah regarding whom Amr bin Murrah narrated; I think it belongs to another man (1).

871 - What was reported regarding repentance, the Hadith of Anas, may Allah be pleased with him: "All the sons of Adam are sinners, and the best of sinners are those who repent" (2). Imam Ahmad said: This is a Munkar (denounced) Hadith (3).

872 - What was reported regarding leaving sins, the Hadith of Aisha, may Allah be pleased with her: "Whoever is pleased to outstrip the diligent striver, let him refrain from sins" (4). Imam Ahmad said: I know it (5).
foot_note:
1. (1) "Al-Ilal" narration of Abdullah (5739).
2. Narrated by At-Tirmidhi (2504). He said: Ahmad bin Mani' told us, Zaid bin Hubab told us, Ali bin Mas'adah Al-Bahili told us, Qatadah told us, from Anas, raised (Marfu') with it.
3. "Al-Muntakhab" by Ibn Qudamah (37). I say: This Hadith is attested to by what Muslim narrated (2748) from Abu Ayyub that he said when death approached him: I concealed something from you that I heard from the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, saying: "If you did not sin, Allah would have created a creation that sins so He would forgive them."
4. Narrated by Abu Ya'la 4/ 297 (4929). He said: Suwayd bin Sa'id told us, Ali bin Mushir told us, from Yusuf bin Maimun, from Ata', from Aisha raised (Marfu') with it.
5. "Masa'il Al-Imam Ahmad" narration of Ibn Hani (2377).

text:
873 - What was reported regarding the virtue of poverty, the Hadith of Ibn Abbas, may Allah be pleased with them both: "Two believers met at the gate of Paradise; a rich believer and a poor believer who were in the world. The poor one was admitted into Paradise, and the rich one was detained for as long as Allah willed him to be detained" (1). Imam Ahmad said: This is a Munkar (denounced) Hadith (2).

874 - What was reported regarding austerity (Taqashshuf), the Hadith of Abu Umamah Al-Harithi, may Allah be pleased with him: "Shabbiness is part of Faith" (3). Imam Ahmad said: This is not Abu Umamah Al-Bahili; this, they say, is Abu Umamah bin Tha'labah Al-Ansari. And he said: Abbad told us, from Muhammad bin Amr, from Abdullah bin Abi Umamah Al-Ansari. He did not say: from his father (4).
foot_note:
1. (1) Narrated by Ahmad 1/ 304. He said: Hussein bin Muhammad told us, from Duwayd, from Salm bin Bashir, from Ikrimah, from Ibn Abbas, who said: The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said: "Two believers met at the gate of Paradise, a rich believer and a poor believer who were in the world. The poor one was admitted into Paradise, and the rich one was detained for as long as Allah willed him to be detained, then he was admitted into Paradise. The poor one met him and said: O my brother, what detained you? By Allah, you were detained until I was afraid. He says: O my brother, indeed I was detained after you in a terrible, hateful detention, and I did not reach you until sweat flowed from me such that if a thousand camels, all eating sour plants, were to drink from it, they would return from it quenched."
2. "Al-Muntakhab" by Ibn Qudamah from "Al-Ilal" by Al-Khallal (6).
3. Narrated by Ibn Majah (4118). He said: Kathir bin Ubaid Al-Himsi told us, Ayyub bin Suwayd told us, from Usamah bin Zaid, from Abdullah bin Abi Umamah Al-Harithi, from his father, raised (Marfu') with it.
4. "Su'alat Al-Athram li'l-Imam Ahmad" (78).

publisher: Dar Al-Falah for Scientific Research and Heritage Verification, Faiyum - Arab Republic of Egypt
text:
875 - What was reported regarding weeping from the fear of Allah, the Hadith of Al-Abbas bin Abdul-Muttalib, may Allah be pleased with him: "Two eyes will not be touched by the Fire: an eye that wept from the fear of Allah, and an eye that spent the night guarding in the path of Allah, Mighty and Majestic" (1). Imam Ahmad said: Munkar (denounced) (2).

876 - What was reported regarding Ihsan (kindness), the Hadith of Ibn Masoud, may Allah be pleased with him: "Hearts are naturally disposed to love those who are kind to them, and to hate those who treat them badly" (3).
foot_note:
1. (1) "Musnad Al-Shihab" 1/ 211. He said: Abu Ishaq bin Ali bin Abdullah bin Al-Ghazi informed us, Ahmad bin Ibrahim bin Al-Haddad told us, Ja'far bin Muhammad Al-Firyabi told us, Yahya bin Musa Al-Balkhi told us, Umar bin Harun told us, Uthman bin Ata' told us, from his father, from Ata', from Ibn Abbas, from Al-Abbas bin Abdul-Muttalib, who said: The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said: ... The Hadith.
2. "Masa'il Harb" p. 452.
3. Narrated by Al-Quda'i in "Musnad Al-Shihab" 1/ 350 (599). He said: Abu Bakr Muhammad bin Ahmad Al-Asbahani informed us, Abu Sa'id Al-Hasan bin Ali Al-Faqih and Abu Abbad Dhul-Nun bin Muhammad Al-Sa'igh informed, they said: Al-Hasan bin Abdullah bin Sa'id Al-Askari told us, Ahmad bin Ishaq Al-Tammar told me, Zaid bin Ahzam told us, Ibn Aisha told us, Muhammad bin Abdul-Rahman - a man from Quraysh - told us, he said: I was with Al-A'mash when it was said: Indeed Al-Hasan bin Umara has been appointed over the grievances (Al-Mazalim). So Al-A'mash said: How strange for an oppressor to be appointed over grievances! What does a weaver have to do with grievances? So I went out and came to Al-Hasan bin Umara and informed him. He said: Bring me a handkerchief and clothes. So he sent them to him. When it was the next day, I went early to Al-A'mash and said: Mention the Hadith before the people gather - meaning so I mentioned him. He said: Bakh Bakh (Bravo)! This Hasan bin Umara, the position adorned him and he did not adorn it. I said: Yesterday you said what you said, and today you say this? He said: Leave this aside, Khaythamah told me from Abdullah that the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said: ... so he mentioned it.

Imam Ahmad said: It has no basis (origin), and it is fabricated (Mawdu') (1).

877 - What was reported regarding the requirements for entering Paradise, the Hadith of Anas, may Allah be pleased with him: "Four things, whoever avoids them enters Paradise: Blood, Wealth, Drinks, and Private Parts" (2). Imam Ahmad said: This is a Munkar (denounced) Hadith (3).

878 - What was reported regarding one who is afflicted by poverty and refers it to the people, the Hadith of Abdullah bin Masoud, may Allah be pleased with him: "Whoever is afflicted by poverty and refers it to the people, it is likely that his need will not be satisfied; and whoever refers it to Allah, Mighty and Majestic, Allah will bring him immediate provision or a later death" (4). Imam Ahmad said: Bashir Abu Ismail did not hear from Sayyar Abu Al-Hakam; it is rather Sayyar Abu Hamza, and Sayyar Abu Al-Hakam did not narrate anything from Tariq bin Shihab (5).
foot_note:
1. (1) "Al-Muntakhab min Ilal Al-Khallal" by Ibn Qudamah (24).
2. Narrated by Ibn Adi in "Al-Kamil" 3/ 176. He said: Ahmad bin Al-Hussein Al-Sufi told us, Muhammad bin Abi Attab Abu Bakr Al-A'yan told us, Rawwad told us, Al-Thawri told me, from Az-Zubayr bin Adi, from Anas, raised (Marfu') with it.
3. "Al-Kamil" by Ibn Adi 3/ 176.
4. Narrated by Ahmad in "Al-Musnad" 1/ 442. He said: Waki' told us, Bashir bin Salman told us, from Sayyar Abu Al-Hakam, from Tariq, from Abdullah, raised (Marfu') with it.
5. "Musnad Ahmad" 1/ 442, "Al-Ilal" narration of Abdullah (588), (1373), "Jami' Al-Tahsil" (194), "Tahdhib At-Tahdhib" 2/ 468.

text: 879 - What was reported regarding good reliance on Allah, the Hadith of Abu Huraira, may Allah be pleased with him: "Indeed, if he had not lifted it, it would have kept grinding until the Day of Resurrection" (1). Imam Ahmad said: I do not know what this is; Abu Bakr is inconsistent regarding these [narrators] (2).
foot_note:
1. (1) Narrated by Ahmad 2/ 513. He said: Ibn Amir told us, Abu Bakr bin Ayyash told us, from Hisham, from Ibn Sirin, from Abu Huraira: That a man came to his house and saw his wife get up to the handmill and put it down, and to the oven and kindle it. Then she said: O Allah, provide for us. And she looked, and behold the bowl was full. And she went to the oven and found it full. When the husband came, he said: Did you get anything after I left? His wife said: Yes, from our Lord. He said: He went to the handmill and lifted it. So that was mentioned to the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, and he said: ... so he mentioned it.
2. "Al-Muntakhab" by Ibn Qudamah (101). I say: There is a witness for this Hadith with a different wording. Muslim narrated (2280): Salamah bin Shabib told me, Al-Hasan bin A'yan told us, Ma'qil told us, from Abu Az-Zubayr, from Jabir that Umm Malik used to send clarified butter to the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, in a small skin container of hers. Her sons would come to her asking for seasoning and they had nothing. So she would go to the one in which she used to send gifts to the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, and find clarified butter in it. It continued to provide seasoning for her household until she squeezed it. So she came to the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, and he said: "Did you squeeze it?" She said: Yes. He said: "If you had left it, it would have remained." Benefit: This witness is from the narration of Ma'qil from Abu Az-Zubayr, and Imam Ahmad weakened it and said: His Hadith resembles the Hadith of Ibn Lahi'ah.

book_title: The Comprehensive Collection of Imam Ahmad's Sciences - Hadith Defects
publisher: Dar Al-Falah for Scientific Research and Heritage Verification, Faiyum - Arab Republic of Egypt
text:
880 - What was reported regarding satiety (Shaba'), wherein are two Hadiths:
The First: The Hadith of Abu Juhayfah, may Allah be pleased with him: "The most satiated of you today will be the hungriest of you on the Day of Resurrection" (1). Imam Ahmad said: It is not authentic (Sahih). Muhanna said: I said to Ahmad: Is it narrated from other than this path? He said: Amr bin Marzuq used to narrate it from Malik bin Mighwal, from Ali bin Al-Aqmar, from Abu Juhayfah. Then he abandoned it later. Then I asked him about it later? He said: It is not authentic (2).
The Second: The Hadith of Imran bin Husain, may Allah be pleased with him: "The family of Muhammad never ate their fill of wheat bread" (3). Imam Ahmad said when he was asked about this Hadith: This is Amr bin Ubaid, strike it out. Abu Abdul-Rahman said: I asked my father about him? So he narrated it to me, and wrote on it: Sah Sah (Correct, Correct).
foot_note:
1. (1) Narrated by Al-Hakim in "Al-Mustadrak" 4/ 121. He said: Mukarram bin Ahmad the Judge informed us, Ja'far bin Muhammad bin Shakir told us, Abu Rabi'ah Fahd bin Awf told us, Fadl bin Abi Al-Fadl Al-Azdi told us, Umar bin Musa informed me, Ali bin Al-Aqmar informed me, from Abu Juhayfah, who said: I ate Tharid made of wheat bread and fatty meat, then I came to the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, and began to burp. He said: "Withhold this burp of yours, for indeed the people most satiated in the world will be the hungriest in the Hereafter."
2. "Al-Muntakhab" by Ibn Qudamah (7).
3. Narrated by Ahmad in "Al-Musnad" 4/ 441 - 442. He said: Yazid told us, a man informed us - and the man was named in the book of Abu Abdul-Rahman - Amr bin Ubaid, he said: Abu Raja' Al-Ataridi told us, from Imran bin Husain who said: ... so he mentioned it.

book_title: The Comprehensive Collection of Imam Ahmad's Sciences - Hadith Defects
publisher: Dar Al-Falah for Scientific Research and Heritage Verification, Faiyum - Arab Republic of Egypt
text: Sah Sah. Abu Abdul-Rahman said: Perhaps my father struck out this Hadith because he was not pleased with the man from whom Yazid narrated (1).
foot_note: 1. (1) "Musnad Ahmad" 4/ 442, "Al-Muntakhab" by Ibn Qudamah (8). I say: And Imam Ahmad's saying: (Sah Sah), Sheikh Tariq bin Awad Allah, may Allah preserve him, said: It means: Validating that this man who was referred to by Kunya is Amr bin Ubaid, and Allah knows best. Benefit: These Hadiths contradict what Al-Bukhari narrated (5381), for which he titled a chapter: Chapter of whoever ate until he was satisfied. He said: Ismail told us, he said Malik told me from Ishaq bin Abdullah bin Abi Talha that he heard Anas bin Malik saying: Abu Talha said to Umm Sulaim: I heard the voice of the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, being weak, in which I recognize hunger. Do you have anything? So she brought out barley loaves, then she took a veil of hers and wrapped the bread with part of it, then tucked it under my garment and covered me with part of it. Then she sent me to the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace. I went with it and found the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, in the mosque with people. I stood over them. The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said to me: "Did Abu Talha send you?" I said: Yes. He said: "With food?" He said: I said: Yes. So the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said to those with him: "Get up." He set off and I set off ahead of them until I came to Abu Talha. Abu Talha said: O Umm Sulaim, the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, has come with the people, and we do not have enough food to feed them. She said: Allah and His Messenger know best. He said: So Abu Talha went until he met the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace. Abu Talha and the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, approached until they entered. The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said: "Bring what you have, O Umm Sulaim." So she brought that bread. He ordered it and it was crumbled, and Umm Sulaim squeezed a small skin container of hers and seasoned it. Then the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said over it whatever Allah willed him to say. Then he said: "Give permission to ten." So he gave them permission and they ate until they were satisfied, then they left. Then he said: "Give permission to ten." So he gave them permission and they ate until they were satisfied, then they left. Then he said: "Give permission to ten." So he gave them permission and they ate until they were satisfied, then they left. Then he gave permission to ten, so all the people ate and were satisfied, and the people were eighty men.

The Book of Paradise and Hell

895 - What was reported regarding the description of Paradise, the Hadith of Abu Huraira, may Allah be pleased with him: "The first group to enter Paradise will be in the image of the moon..." (1). Imam Ahmad said: Muhammad bin Fudayl said, from Umara, from Abu Salih, from Abu Huraira. Ahmad said: And the correct version is contrary to this. Meaning from Abu Zur'ah (2) not from Abu Salih (3).
foot_note:
1. (1) Narrated by Ahmad in "Al-Musnad" 1/ 232 - 232. He said: Muhammad bin Fudayl told us, from Umara, from Abu Salih, from Abu Huraira, who said: The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said: "Indeed, the first group to enter Paradise will be in the image of the moon on the night of the full moon. Then those who follow them will be like the brightest shining planet in the sky in illumination. They do not urinate, nor defecate, nor spit, nor blow their noses. Their combs are gold, their perspiration is musk, their incense burners are aloeswood - the Anjuj is the incense stick - and their wives are the wide-eyed maidens (Hoor al-Ayn). They are of the creation of one man, in the image of their father Adam, sixty cubits tall."
2. Narrated by Al-Bukhari (3327). He said: Qutaibah bin Sa'id told us, Jarir told us, from Umara, from Abu Zur'ah, from Abu Huraira, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said: ... The Hadith.
3. "Sharh Ilal Al-Tirmidhi" by Ibn Rajab (390).

text: 896 - What was reported regarding the market of Paradise, the long Hadith of Abu Huraira, may Allah be pleased with him, regarding the market of Paradise (1).
foot_note: 1. (1) Narrated by At-Tirmidhi (2549). He said: Muhammad bin Ismail told us, Hisham bin Ammar told us, Abdul-Hamid bin Habib bin Abi Al-Ishrin told us, Al-Awza'i told us, Hassan bin Atiyah told us, from Sa'id bin Al-Musayyib that he met Abu Huraira and said: Abu Huraira, I ask Allah to gather me and you in the market of Paradise. So Sa'id said: Does it have a market? He said: Yes, the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, informed me: "That the people of Paradise, when they enter it, will settle in it according to the virtue of their deeds. Then permission is given for the duration of a Friday from the days of the world, so they visit their Lord. He reveals His Throne to them and appears to them in a garden from the gardens of Paradise. Pulpits of light, pulpits of pearls, pulpits of ruby, pulpits of chrysolite, pulpits of gold, and pulpits of silver are placed for them. The lowest of them - and there is no low one among them - sits on mounds of musk and camphor, and they do not see that the owners of the chairs are in a better seating position than them." Abu Huraira said: I said: O Messenger of Allah? And will we see our Lord? He said: "Yes. He said: Do you doubt in seeing the sun and the moon on the night of the full moon?" We said: No. He said: "Likewise, you will not doubt in seeing your Lord. And no man will remain in that gathering except that Allah will speak to him directly, until He says to a man among them: O so-and-so son of so-and-so, do you remember the day you said such and such? So He reminds him of some of his betrayals in the world. So he says: Yes, O Lord, did You not forgive me? He says: Yes, it is by the vastness of My forgiveness that you reached this station of yours. While they are like that, a cloud covers them from above and rains perfume on them, the likes of whose scent they have never found before. And our Lord, Blessed and Exalted, says: Rise to what I have prepared for you of honor and take what you desire. So we come to a market surrounded by angels; in it is what eyes have not looked upon the likes of, nor ears heard, nor has occurred to hearts. So what we desire is carried to us. There is no buying or selling in it. In that market, the people of Paradise meet one another. He said: A man of high status comes and meets one who is lower than him - and there is no low one among them - so he is impressed by the clothing he sees on him. His conversation does not end until he imagines that he has something better than it on him. That is because it is not befitting for anyone to grieve in it. Then we return to our dwellings, and our wives meet us and say: Welcome and hail, you have come and indeed you have more beauty than when you left us. So he says: Indeed, we sat today with our Lord, the Compeller, and we deserve to return as we have returned."

897 - What was reported regarding Paradise and Hell, the Hadith of Umm Salamah, may Allah be pleased with her: "I asked my Lord to show me Paradise and Hell" (2).
foot_note:
1. (1) "Masa'il Abi Dawud" (1874).
2. Mentioned by Ibn Al-Jawzi in "Al-Ilal Al-Mutanahiyah" 2/ 211 - 212. He said: Abu Bakr Al-Khallal narrated, he said: Ya'qub bin Sufyan told us, he said: Abu Al-Ma'afi Muhammad bin Wahb bin Umar bin Abi Karima Al-Harrani told us, he said: Zaid bin Abi Anisah told me, from Yazid bin Ruman, from A'idh, from Umar bin Abi Salamah, from Umm Salamah, from the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, who said: "I asked my Lord, Mighty and Majestic, to show me Paradise and Hell. So Gabriel and Michael came to me and took my hand. They passed me by Hell, and behold, in it are types of punishment. And behold, people are being thrown into it. When they are burned, they are taken out, their heads are crushed with rocks, then they are returned to it. And behold, a people are thrown into it; when they are burned, they are taken out and stabbed with spears, then returned to it. Then they proceeded with me and walked me to a valley; I have never seen a place softer than it nor better smelling. And behold, in it is a white house of silver, thirteen farsakhs [in size], and behold it is crowned with pearls and rubies. And behold, in its courtyard is a man, so I greeted him and he said: And upon you be peace, welcome to the unlettered Prophet; we were promised to see him but we did not see him until tonight. So I said: And who are you? He said: I am Solomon son of David. So I said: Whose house is this, O Gabriel? He said: It belongs to David. Then we ascended in the valley, and behold we were at the top of the valley at a red house of gold; it exceeds the other by a million times in what it contains. And behold, in its courtyard is a man sitting, so I greeted him and he said: And upon you be peace, welcome to the Prophet whom we were promised to see but we did not see until tonight. I said: Who are you? He said: I am David. I said: Whose house is this, O Gabriel? He said: This belongs to Abraham. And behold, we were with the clamor of children, and behold, half of the people were white and half of them were black, taking from the top of the house to what is at the bottom of the house. They fall into that water and become white. So I said: Who are these, O Gabriel? He said: These are the freed ones of the Most Merciful; they mixed a good deed with another bad one, so Allah pardoned them. As for the clamor, they are the offspring of the Muslims =

He heard about a thousand [Hadiths] from Sufyan, and we heard from him. Then he mentioned the Hadith "Looking at their Lord (Nadiratun ila Rabbiha Nazirah)" and said: I do not know what this is, what is this? So Al-Humaidi and the people of Mecca jumped on him and spoke harsh words to him. So he apologized afterwards, but it was not accepted from him, and people renounced him afterwards. When I came to Mecca the second time, he used to come to us but we would not write from him; he would try to be kind, but we would not write from him. 8 - And in "Al-Muntakhab min Ilal Al-Khallal" (59), "Tahdhib Al-Kamal" 31/ 426 and Al-Khatib said in "Tarikh Baghdad" 14/ 173: Abu Al-Haytham narrates from Sufyan bin Husain, from Ya'la bin Muslim, from Sa'id bin Jubayr, from Ibn Abbas, from Ubayy {For those who swear off their wives} [Al-Baqarah: 226]. Imam Ahmad said: Yahya bin Ismail, that Wasiti, has narrated it from Abbad and Sufyan bin Husain; Ubayy is not in it, he stopped it at Ibn Abbas. It was said to Imam Ahmad: But Al-Himmani narrates it? So he shook his hand with a strong shake and said: Ibn Al-Himmani, there is no analogy for him now; his matter is grave. Or something like that, except that he said: Ibn Al-Himmani, there is no analogy for him now. Then he said: Glory be to the One who veils whom He wills. And I saw him extremely angry with him. 9 - And in "Masa'il Abi Dawud" (1884) Ahmad said: Sufyan narrated the Hadith of Abu Al-Ahwas regarding major sins, from Abu Al-Ahwas, from Abdullah. Then Za'idah narrated it from Abu Al-Ahwas. He said: So Sufyan said to him: Did I neglect [something]? He said: You did not neglect. 10 - And in "Masa'il Ibn Hani" (2190) Imam Ahmad was asked about the Hadith of

text: Book of Pre-emption (Shuf'ah) 487 - What has been reported regarding pre-emption by neighborhood. The Hadith of Anas, may Allah be pleased with him: "The neighbor of the house has more right to the house" (1). Imam Ahmad said: It is nothing. It was said to him: Both are with him—meaning: with Isa bin Yunus—from Sa'id, from Qatada, from Al-Hasan, from Samurah (2) regarding pre-emption. And the Hadith of Isa bin Yunus, from Sa'id, from Qatada, from Anas is similar. Imam Ahmad did not pay attention to his combining the two Hadiths, and he denied the Hadith of Anas (3). And he said once: Isa bin Yunus erred in it (4). 488 - What has been reported regarding pre-emption for the absent person. The Hadith of Jabir bin Abdullah, may Allah be pleased with them both: "The neighbor has more right to his pre-emption; he is waited for even if
foot_note:
1. (1) Recorded by Ibn Hibban (5182), he said: Abdullah bin Muhammad al-Azdi informed us, Ishaq ibn Ibrahim al-Hanzali told us, from Isa bin Yunus, from Sa'id, from Qatada, from Anas, in a Marfu' form with it.
2. Recorded by Al-Tirmidhi (1368), he said: Ali bin Hajar told us, Isma'il bin Ulayyah told us, from Sa'id, from Qatada, from Al-Hasan, from Samurah, in a Marfu' form with it.
3. "Masa'il Abi Dawud" (1902).
4. "Al-Ilal" narration of Abdullah (1481).

text: he is absent, if their path is one" (1). Imam Ahmad said: This is a Munkar (denounced) Hadith (2). And he said once: It is not in the book of Ghundar (3). And he said once: Shu'bah said: Delay for the likes of this and destroy (4). 489 - What has been reported regarding pre-emption in what has not been divided. The Hadith of Jabir, may Allah be pleased with him: The Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, decreed pre-emption in everything that has not been divided. But when the boundaries are set and the paths are turned, then there is no pre-emption.
foot_note:
1. (1) Mentioned by Al-Tirmidhi (1369), he said: Waki' narrated from Shu'bah, from Abdul Malik bin Abi Sulayman, from Ata', from Jabir, in a Marfu' form with it.
2. "Al-Ilal" by Abdullah (2256), "Nasb al-Rayah" 4/174, "Sunan Al-Bayhaqi" 6/108, "Tarikh Baghdad" 10/395, "Mizan al-I'tidal" 3/370, "Tahdhib al-Kamal" 18/326, "Tahdhib al-Tahdhib" 3/498, "Tarikh Abi Zur'ah" (217), "Tanqih al-Tahqiq" 3/57, "Siyar A'lam al-Nubala" 6/108.
3. "Al-Ilal" by Abdullah (599). Issue: Al-Khattabi said in "Ma'alim al-Sunan" 3/133, adapted: People have differed on this issue. Most scholars hold that there is no pre-emption in what has been divided. This is the view of Umar bin Al-Khattab, Uthman bin Affan, and to it went the people of Medina, Sa'id bin al-Musayyib, Sulayman bin Yasar, Umar bin Abdul Aziz, Al-Zuhri, Rabi'ah bin Abi Abd al-Rahman, and Malik bin Anas. It is the school of Al-Awza'i, Al-Shafi'i, Ahmad bin Hanbal, Ishaq bin Rahwayh, and Abu Thawr. The scholars of opinion (Ahnaf) said: Pre-emption is obligatory for the neighbor even if divided, with a difference among them regarding the order of neighborhood.
4. "Masa'il Abi Dawud" (1943).

text: Imam Ahmad said: The narration of Ma'mar from Al-Zuhri (1) in the Hadith of pre-emption is good (Hasan) (2). And he said once: Ma'mar says: From Abu Salamah, from Jabir, from the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace. And Salih (3) bin Abi al-Akhdar says likewise. And Malik narrated it from Al-Zuhri, from Sa'id bin al-Musayyib (4), and Abu Salamah as Mursal. They said: The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, decreed... The Hadith (5). And he said once: Established. It was said to him: From what is the Hadith of Jabir regarding pre-emption established? He said: Salih bin Abi al-Akhdar narrated it—meaning: like the narration of Ma'mar. It was said to him: And is Salih used as proof? He said: He is used for evidence and consideration (6). And once he took from Malik that it is from a man from the Companions of the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace. Imam Ahmad said: Yahya bin Sa'id heard it from Malik as Mawquf (7).
foot_note:
1. (1) Recorded by Al-Bukhari (2257), he said: Musaddad told us, Abdul Wahid told us, Ma'mar told us, from Al-Zuhri, from Abu Salamah bin Abd al-Rahman, from Jabir, in a Marfu' form with it.
2. "Al-Tamhid" 7/45.
3. Recorded by Al-Bayhaqi 6/103, he said: Abu Bakr bin Fawrak told us, Abdullah bin Ja'far informed us, Yunus bin Habib told us, Abu Dawud al-Tayalisi told us, Salih bin Abi al-Akhdar told us, from Al-Zuhri, from Abu Salamah, from Jabir, in a Marfu' form with it.
4. "Al-Muwatta" p. 444, he said: Malik informed us, Ibn Shihab informed us, from Abu Salamah bin Abd al-Rahman that the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace... The Hadith.
5. "Masa'il Salih" (688), "Masa'il Abdullah" (1107), "Tarikh Abi Zur'ah" p. 220.
6. "Tahdhib al-Kamal" 13/12-13, "Tarikh Abi Zur'ah" p. 220. I say: Ibn Ma'in said in "Al-Tamhid" 7/45, "Tarikh Abi Zur'ah" p. 220: The narration of Malik is more beloved to me, and more correct in my view as Mursal from Sa'id and Abu Salamah.
7. "Tarikh Abi Zur'ah" p. 220.

text: 490 - What has been reported regarding one who does not see pre-emption in animals. The Hadith of Uthman bin Affan, may Allah be pleased with him: "There is no pre-emption in a well nor a male camel, and the boundaries (1) cut off every pre-emption" (2). It was said to Imam Ahmad: Does anyone say: 'And the boundaries', other than Ibn Idris? He said: Ibn Idris suffices you (3).

2. Recorded by Ibn Abi Shaybah 4/454, he said: Ibn Idris told us from Muhammad bin Umarah, from Abu Bakr bin Muhammad bin Amr bin Hazm, from Aban bin Uthman as Mawquf upon him.
3. "Masa'il Salih" (1276).

text: Book of Gifts 491 - What has been reported regarding a gift before asking for a need. The Hadith of Al-Zuhri: "What an excellent thing is a gift before a need" (1). Imam Ahmad said: They say it is Sulayman bin Arqam—meaning: the Sheikh who narrates from Al-Zuhri—and Sulayman's Hadith is not worth anything (2). 492 - What has been reported regarding one who is given a gift while people are with him. The Hadith of Ibn Abbas, may Allah be pleased with them both: "Whoever is given a gift while people are with him, they are partners in it" (3). Imam Ahmad said: I do not know where this Hadith came from, and to me, it is Munkar (4).
foot_note:
1. (1) Recorded by Al-Uqayli in "Al-Du'afa" 2/121-122, he said: Abdullah told me, my father told me, Abbad bin al-Awwam told us, a Sheikh told me from Al-Zuhri who said: The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said... so he mentioned it.
2. Al-Uqayli in "Al-Du'afa" 2/121-122, "Al-Ilal" narration of Abdullah (2756).
3. Recorded by Al-Bayhaqi 6/183, he said: Abu al-Hasan Muhammad bin al-Hussein al-Alawi informed us, Abdullah bin Muhammad bin al-Hasan al-Sharqi informed us, Muhammad bin Yahya told us, Muhammad bin al-Salt told us, Mandal bin Ali told us, from Ibn Jurayj, from Amr bin Dinar, from Ibn Abbas, in a Marfu' form with it.
4. "Al-Muntakhab min al-Ilal" by Al-Khallal p. 20.

text: 493 - What has been reported regarding recompense for a gift. The Hadith of Aisha, may Allah be pleased with her: The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, used to accept gifts and reward for them (1). Imam Ahmad said: Isa bin Yunus used to connect the Hadith of Aisha, while people narrate it as Mursal (2). 494 - What has been reported regarding one for whom gifts are not lawful. The Hadith of Abdullah bin Dawud: Indeed, gifts are not lawful for anyone after the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, nor for Abu Bakr and Umar, may Allah be pleased with them both (3). Imam Ahmad said: I do not know it, and he denied it. And he said: It was only narrated from Al-Dahhak: {And do not confer favor to acquire more} [Al-Muddaththir: 6] (4).
foot_note:
1. (1) Recorded by Al-Bukhari (2585), he said: Musaddad told us, Isa bin Yunus told us, from Hisham, from his father, from Aisha, may Allah be pleased with her, who said: ... The Hadith.
2. "Siyar A'lam al-Nubala" 8/491-492, "Sharh Ilal al-Tirmidhi" 2/487, "Bahr al-Dam" (809), "Tahdhib al-Kamal" 23/68, "Tahdhib al-Tahdhib" 2/371. I say: Al-Daraqutni criticized this Hadith in "Al-Tatabbu'" p. 198, and Ibn Ma'in, Abu Dawud, Al-Tirmidhi, and Al-Bazzar also declared it defective due to being Mursal.
3. I did not find it.
4. "Masa'il Salih" (206), "Bada'i' al-Fawa'id" by Ibn al-Qayyim 4/73.

text: Book of Manumission (Itq) 495 - What has been reported regarding manumission. The Hadith of Aisha, may Allah be pleased with her: There were three rulings in Barirah (1). Imam Ahmad said: Between Al-Qasim and Hisham bin Urwah is Abdul Rahman bin Al-Qasim (2). 496 - What has been reported regarding the striving (Si'ayah) of the slave. The Hadith of Abu Huraira, may Allah be pleased with him: "Whoever frees a share of his in a slave, his full freedom is upon him from his wealth if he has wealth. If he does not have wealth, the slave is made to strive (work) without being overburdened" (3).
foot_note:
1. (1) Recorded by Muslim (1504), he said: Zuhair bin Harb and Muhammad bin Al-Ala told us—and the wording is Zuhair's—they said: Abu Mu'awiyah told us, Hisham bin Urwah told us, from Abdul Rahman bin Al-Qasim, from his father, from Aisha who said there were three rulings in Barirah: Her people wanted to sell her and stipulate her loyalty (Wala') for themselves. I mentioned that to the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, and he said: "Buy her and free her; for the Wala' belongs to the one who frees." She said: So she was freed, and the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, gave her the choice, and she chose herself. She said: People used to give her charity and she would give us gifts. I mentioned that to the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, and he said: "It is charity for her and a gift for you, so eat it."
2. "Masa'il Al-Imam Ahmad" narration of Ibn Hani (2138), "Jami' al-Tahsil" 293.
3. Recorded by Al-Bukhari (2527), Muslim (1503), both from the path of Ibn Abi Arubah from Qatada, from Al-Nadr bin Anas, from Bashir bin Nahik, from Abu Huraira, in a Marfu' form with it.

publisher: Dar Al-Falah for Scientific Research and Heritage Verification, Fayoum - Arab Republic of Egypt
text: Imam Ahmad said: Ibn Abi Arubah narrates it mentioning striving (Istis'a), but as for Shu'bah (1) and Hammam, they did not mention it, and I do not hold to striving (2). And he said once: Ma'mar narrated it (3) and did not mention striving (4). And he said once: The Hadith of Sa'id is weak (5). And he said once: There is no established Hadith from the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, regarding striving (6). And once: I hold to the Hadith of Ibn Umar (7); it is stronger than this and more correct in meaning (8).
foot_note:
1. (1) Recorded by Muslim (1502), he said: Muhammad bin Al-Muthanna and Ibn Bashar told us—and the wording is Ibn Al-Muthanna's—they said: Muhammad bin Ja'far told us, Shu'bah told us from Qatada, from Al-Nadr bin Anas, from Bashir bin Nahik, from Abu Huraira, from the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said regarding a slave shared between two men and one of them frees him: "He guarantees (the price of the rest)."
2. "Masa'il Abi Dawud" (1402), "Masa'il Abdullah" (1427), "Sharh Ilal al-Tirmidhi" 1/418-419, "Al-Mughni" by Ibn Qudamah 14/359.
3. Recorded by Abu Dawud (3946), he said: Al-Hasan bin Ali told us, Abd al-Razzaq told us, Ma'mar informed us, from Al-Zuhri, from Salim, from Ibn Umar that the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said: "Whoever frees a share of his in a slave, whatever remains (of his price) is freed from his wealth if he has enough to reach the price of the slave."
4. "Al-Mughni" by Ibn Qudamah 14/359.
5. The previous source.
6. The previous source.
7. Recorded by Al-Bukhari (2523), he said: Ubaid bin Isma'il told us from Abu Usamah, from Ubaidullah, from Nafi', from Ibn Umar, may Allah be pleased with them both, who said: The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said: "Whoever frees a share of his in a slave, then his complete freedom is upon him, if he has wealth reaching his price. If he does not have wealth, a fair value is estimated for him, and whatever was freed is freed."
8. "Masa'il Abdullah" (1427).

book_title: The Collection of Imam Ahmad's Sciences - Hadith Defects
publisher: Dar Al-Falah for Scientific Research and Heritage Verification, Fayoum - Arab Republic of Egypt
text: The Hadith of Aisha, may Allah be pleased with her: The husband of Barirah was free, so when she was freed, the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, gave her the choice (1).
foot_note:
1. = I say: The mention of striving in this Hadith is disputed. Sa'id bin Abi Arubah, Jarir bin Hazim, Aban, Hajjaj bin Hajjaj, and Musa bin Khalaf narrated it from Qatada mentioning it. Shu'bah, Hisham, and Hammam narrated it from Qatada without mentioning it. In Hammam's narration, he separated the striving, making it from the speech of Qatada, not from the Hadith of Abu Huraira from the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace. It is known that the reliable companions of Qatada are Shu'bah, Sa'id bin Abi Arubah, Hisham, and Hammam. The narration of the companions is prioritized over those who oppose them. Al-Bardiji said in "Sharh Ilal al-Tirmidhi" by Ibn Rajab 2/504: If a Hadith of Sa'id bin Abi Arubah from Qatada from Anas is presented to you as Marfu', and Hisham and Shu'bah oppose him, judgment is for Shu'bah and Hisham over Sa'id. I say: It is known that Al-Bukhari, may Allah have mercy on him, accepts the addition from a reliable Hafiz from the Sheikh's companions even if he opposes the rest of the companions, provided the number of opponents is not large. Based on this rule, he used this Hadith as proof. Benefit: Al-Daraqutni criticized this Hadith, as did Ibn Abd al-Barr in Al-Tamhid, Abu Mas'ud al-Dimashqi, Al-Asili, Ibn al-Qassar, Al-Hakim in Ma'rifat Ulum al-Hadith, and others with what was previously explained like the words of Imam Ahmad, and it is the truth, Allah willing. Al-Hafiz defended the authenticity of the Hadith in "Al-Fath", as did Ibn al-Mawwaq, and the first view is more likely, and Allah knows best. I say: The meaning of striving in this Hadith: The slave is tasked with earning and seeking until he obtains the value of the other partner's share; once he pays it to him, he becomes free. This is how the majority of those who uphold striving interpreted it. Some said: It is that he serves his master who did not free him according to the proportion of slavery he still holds in him. Based on this, the Hadiths agree.
1. Recorded by Ahmad 6/42, he said: Abu Mu'awiyah told us, Al-A'mash told us, from Ibrahim, from Al-Aswad, from Aisha who said: The husband of Barirah was free, so when she was freed—and he said once: she became free—the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, gave her the choice, and she chose herself. She said: Her people wanted to sell her and stipulated the Wala'. She said: I mentioned that to the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, and he said: "Buy her and free her, for the Wala' belongs to the one who frees."

text: Imam Ahmad said: What is correct regarding the husband of Barirah is that he was a slave (1). 497 - What has been reported regarding veiling from the Mukatab (slave buying his freedom). The Hadith of Umm Salamah, may Allah be pleased with her: "If one of you has a Mukatab and he has enough to pay, she should veil herself from him" (2). Imam Ahmad said: Nabhan narrated a strange Hadith. Ibn Qudamah said: It is as if he indicated the weakness of his Hadith (3). 498 - What has been reported regarding the slave who escapes to the land of Polytheism. The Hadith of Jarir, may Allah be pleased with him: "If he escapes to the land of Polytheism, he has made himself lawful (his blood is lawful)" (4). Imam Ahmad said: Sharik might have raised it (made it Marfu') (5). Then he narrated it from the path of Isra'il (6) and said: And he did not raise it (7).
foot_note:
1. (1) "Masa'il Al-Kawsaj" (1312).
2. Recorded by Ibn Majah (2520), he said: Abu Bakr bin Abi Shaybah told us, Sufyan bin Uyaynah told us, from Al-Zuhri, from Nabhan the freed slave of Umm Salamah, from Umm Salamah that she reported from the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, that he said: ... The Hadith.
3. "Al-Mughni" by Ibn Qudamah 9/507.
4. Recorded by Ahmad 4/365, he said: Aswad bin Amir told us, Sharik told us, from Abu Ishaq, from Amir, from Jarir, as Mawquf upon him.
5. Musnad Ahmad 4/365.
6. "Musnad Ahmad" 4/365. Abu Ahmad al-Zubayri told us, he said: Isra'il told us, from Abu Ishaq, from Amir, from Jarir, as Mawquf upon him.
7. "Musnad Ahmad" 4/365. I say: The text of this Hadith is authentic; Muslim recorded it (69)

publisher: Dar Al-Falah for Scientific Research and Heritage Verification, Fayoum - Arab Republic of Egypt
text: 499 - What has been reported regarding "Whoever owns a Mahram relative, then he is free". The Hadith of Ibn Umar, may Allah be pleased with them both: "Whoever owns a Mahram relative, then he is free" (1). Imam Ahmad said: There is nothing of this; Damrah erred (2). And he said once: It has no basis (3). And once: He denied it and rejected it strongly and said: If a man were to say that this is a lie, he would not be mistaken (4). 500 - What has been reported regarding one who frees a share of his in a slave. The Hadith of Usamah bin Umayr, may Allah be pleased with him: That a man freed a share of his in a boy, so he mentioned that to the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, and he said: "Allah has no partner" (5). Imam Ahmad said: The correct narration is from Abu al-Malih from the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, as Mursal; it does not contain 'from his father' (6).
foot_note:
1. = He said: Abu Bakr bin Abi Shaybah told us, Hafs bin Ghiyath told us, from Dawud, from Al-Sha'bi, from Jarir who said: The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said: "Any slave who escapes, protection is absolved from him."
1. Recorded by Ibn Majah (2525), he said: Rashid bin Sa'id al-Ramli and Abdullah bin al-Jahm al-Anmati told us, they said: Damrah bin Rabi'ah told us, from Sufyan, from Abdullah bin Dinar, from Ibn Umar in a Marfu' form with it.

Book of Marriage

501 - What has been reported regarding the virtue of marriage and the encouragement of it. In it are two Hadiths:

The First: The Hadith of Uthman, may Allah be pleased with him: "Whoever among you possesses the means (Taul), let him marry, for it is more lowering to the gaze and more guarding of the private parts" (1).

Imam Ahmad said: I do not see it as anything but a delusion (Wahm) from Abu Ma'shar—meaning: regarding Uthman, it is a delusion. It is essentially from Ibrahim, from Alqamah, from Abdullah (2) that he said to Uthman: The Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said to us... And from Ibrahim, from Abdul Rahman bin Yazid, from Abdullah (3), from the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace (4).

The Second: The Hadith of Abu Huraira, may Allah be pleased with him: "O assembly of young men, whoever among you is capable of Ba'ah (marriage/intercourse), let him marry" (5).
foot_note:
1. (1) Recorded by Al-Nasa'i 6/56-57, he said: Amr bin Zurarah informed us, saying: Isma'il told us, saying: Yunus told us, from Abu Ma'shar, from Ibrahim, from Alqamah, who said: I was with Ibn Mas'ud while he was with Uthman, may Allah be pleased with him, so Uthman said: The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, came out to a group of youths and said... The Hadith.
2. Recorded by Al-Bukhari (5065), he said: Umar bin Hafs told us, my father told us, Al-A'mash told us, from Ibrahim, from Alqamah, who said: I was with Abdullah, and Uthman met him at Mina. Uthman said: What is past from you? Abdullah said: Since you have said that, indeed the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said to us: "O assembly of young men, whoever among you is capable of Ba'ah, let him marry."
3. Recorded by Al-Bukhari (5066), he said: Umar bin Hafs bin Ghiyath told us, my father told us, Al-A'mash told us, from Umarah, from Abdul Rahman bin Yazid, from Abdullah, raised (Marfu') to the Prophet.

502 - What has been reported regarding the consideration of compatibility (Kafa'ah) in marriage. In it are three Hadiths:

The First: The Hadith of Jabir bin Abdullah, may Allah be pleased with them both: "Do not marry women except to equals, and none should marry them except the guardians, and there is no dowry less than ten dirhams" (2).

Imam Ahmad said: The Hadiths of Mubashir bin Ubaid are fabricated lies (3).

And he said once: I heard Sufyan bin Uyaynah say: We did not find a basis for it—meaning: the ten (dirhams) in the dowry (4).

The Second: The Hadith of Ibn Umar, may Allah be pleased with them both: "Arabs are equals to one another, except a weaver or a cupper" (5).

Imam Ahmad said: It is very rejected (Munkar Jiddan) (3).

503 - What has been reported regarding the desirability of marrying a religious woman.

The Hadith of Jabir bin Abdullah, may Allah be pleased with them both: "A woman is married for her religion, her wealth, and her beauty, so cling to the one with religion, may your hands be dusted (with good)" (4).

Imam Ahmad denied it from the narration of Abdul Malik bin Abi Sulayman (5).

The Hadith of Anas, may Allah be pleased with him: "Smell her mouth area (Awaridh), and look at her ankles (Urqub)" (1). Imam Ahmad denounced it (2).

505 - What has been reported regarding singing and beating the Duff (drum) at a wedding.

The Hadith of Aisha, may Allah be pleased with her: "Did you send a girl with her to beat the Duff and sing?" (3).

506 - What has been reported regarding "No marriage except with a guardian (Wali)". In it are four Hadiths:

The First: The Hadith of Abu Musa Al-Ash'ari, may Allah be pleased with him: "No marriage except with a guardian" (2).

Imam Ahmad said: I do not know of anything authentic from the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace [on this specific chain]. They fluctuate in the Hadith of Abu Musa: Shu'bah says: from Abu Burda, and Isra'il says: from Abu Musa. It was said to him: Sufyan says it from Abu Burda? He said: Yes. So he did not authenticate it. He said: But it is narrated from Umar with an authentic chain, and from Ibn Abbas, that marriage is not valid except with a guardian (3). And he said once: Authentic (4).

The First: The path of Al-Zuhri from Urwa from her: "If a woman marries without the permission of her guardian, her marriage is void, her marriage is void, her marriage is void" (4).

Imam Ahmad said: This is not authentic; because Al-Zuhri was asked about it and he denied knowing it. And Aisha: she married off Hafsa (5) bint Abdul Rahman, her niece, and the Hadith is from her [Aisha], so this is not correct.

507 - What has been reported regarding a woman who appoints one of her relatives as her guardian in marriage.

The Hadith of Ibn Abbas, may Allah be pleased with them both: That Maymuna bint Al-Harith placed her affair in the hands of Al-Abbas, so he married her to the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace (3).

And the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, proposed to Abu Bakr, so he married (Aisha to him). And he said: Shu'bah said: Al-Hakam did not hear from Miqsam except four Hadiths, and this is not among them (4).

The Hadith of Ibn Umar, may Allah be pleased with them both: "Any slave who marries without the permission of his masters is a fornicator" (1).

Imam Ahmad said: This is a Munkar (denounced) Hadith (2).

509 - What has been reported regarding the stipulation of witnesses in marriage.

The Hadith of Aisha, may Allah be pleased with her: "No marriage except with a guardian and two just witnesses" (3).

Imam Ahmad said: Nothing is established from the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, regarding witnessing in marriage (4). And he said once: There is no authentic Hadith in it (5).

510 - What has been reported regarding what is permissible to be a dowry (Mahr).

The Hadith of Ali, may Allah be pleased with him: No dowry is less than ten dirhams (1).

Imam Ahmad said: Ghiyath bin Ibrahim prompted Dawud Al-Awdi, from Al-Sha'bi, from Ali: "No dowry is less than ten dirhams," so it became a Hadith (2).

511 - What has been reported regarding marriage for a Surah of the Quran.

The Hadith of Sahl bin Sa'd Al-Sa'idi, may Allah be pleased with him, and in it: "Go and search, even if it is an iron ring." So he went and searched, then came back and said: I found nothing, not even an iron ring. He said: Do you have anything of the Quran? He said: I have Surah such-and-such and Surah such-and-such. He said: "Go, for I have married you to her for what you have of the Quran" (3).

Imam Ahmad said, when asked about marriage for a Surah of the Quran: Leave this.

He did not answer her at all. Then she stood up and said: O Messenger of Allah, she has gifted herself to you, so consider your opinion regarding her. He did not answer her at all... The Hadith.

foot_note: 1. (1) "Al-Wara'" 119. Issue: Ibn Qudamah said in "Al-Mughni" 6/683 (adapted): As for teaching the Quran, the narration from Ahmad differs regarding making it a dowry. He said in one place: I dislike it. And he said in another place: There is no harm in marrying on the condition of teaching a Surah of the Quran, or for two sandals, and this is the school of Al-Shafi'i. Abu Bakr said: There are two sayings in the issue—meaning two narrations. He said: My choice is that it is not permissible, and it is the school of Malik, Al-Layth, Abu Hanifa, Makhul, and Ishaq. Those who permitted it argued with the Hadith of Sahl bin Sa'd Al-Sa'idi, and in it... "I have married you to her for what you have of the Quran," agreed upon. The basis of the other narration: Private parts are not made lawful except with wealth; due to His saying, Exalted be He: {that you seek with your wealth}, and His saying: {And whoever among you cannot [find] the means to marry free, believing women} and "Taul" means wealth. It has been narrated that the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, married a man for a Surah of the Quran, then said: "It shall not be a dowry for anyone after you," recorded by Al-Najjad with his chain. And because teaching the Quran is not permissible to occur except as an act of worship by the doer, so it is not valid to be a dowry like fasting, prayer, and teaching faith. And because teaching differs between the teacher and the student and can hardly be determined; so it resembled something unknown. As for the Hadith of gifting, it has been said: Its meaning is 'I married you to her due to what you have of the Quran', i.e., I married you to her because you are from the people of the Quran, just as he married Abu Talha for his Islam. Ibn Abd al-Barr narrated with his chain from Anas that Abu Talha married Umm Sulaym for his Islam. And there is no mention of teaching in the authentic Hadith. It is possible that it was specific to that man, evidenced by what Al-Najjad narrated. There is no branching on this narration. As for the other (permissive) one, what he teaches her must be specified, either a specific Surah, or Surahs, or specific verses, because Surahs differ and so do verses. I say: Perhaps Imam Ahmad intended the jurisprudential aspect in his statement on the Hadith, and Allah knows best.

512 - What has been reported regarding one who makes Islam the dowry.

The Hadith of Anas, may Allah be pleased with him: That Abu Talha, may Allah be pleased with him, proposed to Umm Sulaym, so she said: O Abu Talha, do you not know that your god whom you worship is a piece of wood that grew from the earth, carved by the Abyssinian of the tribe of so-and-so? If you become Muslim, I do not want from you any other dowry. He said: Let me look into my affair. He said: So he went and then came back and said: I bear witness that there is no god but Allah and I bear witness that Muhammad is the Messenger of Allah. She said: O Anas, marry Abu Talha (to me) (1).

It was said to Imam Ahmad: Ishaq bin Rahwayh raised it (Marfu'). He said: False (Batil), it is not Marfu' (2).

513 - What has been reported regarding conditions in marriage.

The Hadith of Samurah bin Jundub, may Allah be pleased with him: I will not marry except one who guarantees [care for] this son of mine (3).

1. (1) Recorded by Al-Hakim 2/179, he said: Ali bin Hamshadh the Just told us, Ali bin Abdul Aziz told us, Muslim bin Isma'il and Hajjaj bin Al-Minhal told us, they said: Hammad bin Salamah told us, from Thabit and Isma'il bin Abdullah bin Abi Talha, from Anas that Abu Talha... The Hadith.
2. "Masa'il Ibn Hani" (2218).
3. Recorded by Al-Tahawi in "Sharh Ma'ani Al-Athar" 3/219, he said: Ahmad bin Mas'ud Al-Hannat told us, saying: Muhammad bin Isa Al-Tabba' told us, saying: Hushaim told us from Abdul Hamid bin Ja'far, from his father, from Samurah bin Jundub that his mother was a beautiful woman from Banu Fazarah. She went with him to Medina while he was a boy, and her proposals increased, so she began saying: I will not marry except one who guarantees [care for] this son of mine. So a man married her on that condition. When the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, allocated shares for the youths of the Ansar and did not allocate for him, it was as if he considered him weak. So he said: O Messenger of Allah, you allocated for a boy and did not allocate for me, yet I can wrestle him down. He said: "Wrestle him." So I wrestled him down, and the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, allocated a share for him.

text:
Imam Ahmad said: The Hadith of Samurah, I heard it twice from Hushaim, saying: Indeed Samurah (1).

514 - What has been reported regarding the marriage of a coerced woman. In it are two Hadiths:

The First: The Hadith of Ibn Umar, may Allah be pleased with them both: That a man married off his virgin daughter, and she disliked that, so she came to the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, and he annulled her marriage (2).

Imam Ahmad said: False (Batil) (3).

The Second: The Hadith of Jabir bin Abdullah that a man married off his daughter while she was a virgin without her command, so she came to the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, and he separated them (4).

Imam Ahmad said: This is a Munkar (denounced) Hadith (5).
foot_note:
1. (1) "Al-Ilal" narration of Abdullah (5708).
2. Recorded by Al-Daraqutni 3/236, he said: Umar bin Muhammad bin Al-Qasim Al-Asbahani told me, Muhammad bin Ahmad bin Rashid told us, Musa bin Amir told us, Al-Walid told us, saying: Ibn Abi Dhi'b, Nafi' informed me, from Ibn Umar... The Hadith.
3. "Nasb al-Rayah" 3/351, "Al-Tahqiq" by Ibn al-Jawzi 7/132, "Tanqih Al-Tahqiq" by Ibn Abdul Hadi 3/154.
4. Recorded by Al-Bayhaqi in "Al-Sunan" 7/117, he said: Abu Tahir the Jurist and Abu Sa'id bin Abi Amr informed us, saying: Abu Al-Abbas Muhammad bin Yaqub told us, Muhammad bin Ishaq Al-Saghani told us, Al-Hakam bin Musa informed us, Shu'aib bin Ishaq told us, from Al-Awza'i, from Ata, from Jabir bin Abdullah, may Allah be pleased with them both... The Hadith.
5. "Sunan Al-Bayhaqi" 7/118, "Al-Tahqiq" by Ibn al-Jawzi 7/131, "Tanqih Al-Tahqiq" by Ibn Abdul Hadi 3/154.
